original: de'i phyir nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir sa bon dang myu gu dag dus mnyam pa de'i phyir gzhan nyid du ma grub bo zhes bya ba'i skyon yod par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir sa bon dang myu gu dag dus mnyam pa de'i phyir gzhan nyid du ma grub bo zhes bya ba'i skyon yod par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: This is to say, since the seed and sprout are simultaneous, the error of non-establishment as different does not arise.

original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the response to that, he says,

original: de lta na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de lta na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Even so, etc.

original: gal te gcig tshe yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te sa bon dang myu gu dag la dus gcig gi tshe na skye ba dang 'jig pa dus gcig pa'i sgo nas dus gcig pa nyid khas len na'o //
analyzed: gal te gcig tshe yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te sa bon dang myu gu dag la dus gcig gi tshe na skye ba dang 'jig pa dus gcig pa'i sgo nas dus gcig pa nyid khas len na'o //
translated: If they are at the same time, etc. means if you accept that the seed and sprout are simultaneous in terms of the simultaneity of their arising and disintegration.

original: de yod min zhes bya ba ni dus gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: de yod min zhes bya ba ni dus gcig pa nyid do //
translated: That does not exist means that simultaneity does not exist.

original: 'dir zhes bya ba ni sa bon dang myu gu'i gnas skabs na'o //
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba ni sa bon dang myu gu'i gnas skabs na'o //
translated: Here means in the context of the seed and sprout.

original: dus gcig med ces bya ba ni gang gi phyir sa bon dang myu gu dag dus mnyam pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus gcig med ces bya ba ni gang gi phyir sa bon dang myu gu dag dus mnyam pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Simultaneity does not exist means that because the seed and sprout are not simultaneous,

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says,

original: gal te srang gi dpes zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te go sla'o //
analyzed: gal te srang gi dpes zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te go sla'o //
translated: If you say, “By the example of the scale,” and so on, it is easy to understand.

original: dus gcig pa nyid mi rigs par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dus gcig pa nyid mi rigs par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that simultaneity is not tenable, he says,

original: ci ltar yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ci ltar yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “How could that which does not exist . . . ” and so on.

original: 'di'i don ni skye bzhin pa'i myu gu dang / 'gag bzhin pa'i sa bon dag dus mnyam pa nyid rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni skye bzhin pa'i myu gu dang / 'gag bzhin pa'i sa bon dag dus mnyam pa nyid rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: It is not tenable that the sprout that is in the process of arising and the seed that is in the process of ceasing are simultaneous.

original: gang gi phyir skye ba la mngon par phyogs pa la skye bzhin pa zhes brjod pa yin la gang du ma skyes pa ma 'ongs pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir skye ba la mngon par phyogs pa la skye bzhin pa zhes brjod pa yin la gang du ma skyes pa ma 'ongs pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This is because that which is about to arise is called “that which is in the process of arising,” and that which has not yet arisen is called “the future.”

original: 'gag pa la mngon par phyogs la 'gag bzhin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'gag pa la mngon par phyogs la 'gag bzhin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: That which is about to cease is called “that which is in the process of ceasing.”

original: gang du ma 'gags pa ste da ltar zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang du ma 'gags pa ste da ltar zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That which has not yet ceased is called “present.”

original: des na yod pa dang med pa'i da ltar ba dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus gcig pa nyid ci ltar yin zhes pa'o ;
analyzed: des na yod pa dang med pa'i da ltar ba dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus gcig pa nyid ci ltar yin zhes pa'o ;
translated: So how could the present and the future, which are existent and nonexistent, be simultaneous?

original: / des na srang gi dpe dang / mtshungs pa nyid du yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: / des na srang gi dpe dang / mtshungs pa nyid du yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it does not exist in the same way as the example of the scale.

original: gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to anticipate the qualms of others,🔽he says, “The two phenomena . . . ”

original: chos dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: chos dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: chos dag dus gcig pa nyid med mod kyi zhes bya ba ni 'gag bzhin pa dang skye bzhin pa'i sa bon dang / myu gu dag @136a * //
analyzed: chos dag dus gcig pa nyid med mod kyi zhes bya ba ni 'gag bzhin pa dang skye bzhin pa'i sa bon dang / myu gu dag @136a * //
translated: “The two phenomena do not exist at the same time” means that the seed and sprout that are in the process of ceasing and arising, respectively,

original: dus gcig pa nyid ma yin gyi /
analyzed: dus gcig pa nyid ma yin gyi /
translated: do not exist at the same time.

original: 'on kyang de'i bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang de'i bya ba ste /
translated: “However, their actions . . . ”

original: 'jig pa dang skye ba'i mtshan nyid dag la dus gcig yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig pa dang skye ba'i mtshan nyid dag la dus gcig yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: means that the characteristics of cessation and arising do not exist at the same time.

original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the response to that,

original: de yang mi rung ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de yang mi rung ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “That also is not tenable” and so on.

original: chos las tha dad pa zhes bya ba ni 'gag bzhin pa dang / skye bzhin pa'i sa bon dang myu gu dag las tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: chos las tha dad pa zhes bya ba ni 'gag bzhin pa dang / skye bzhin pa'i sa bon dang myu gu dag las tha dad pa'o //
translated: “Different from the phenomena” means different from the seed and sprout that are in the process of ceasing and arising, respectively.

original: de ltar bya ba srid par khas blangs te /
analyzed: de ltar bya ba srid par khas blangs te /
translated: Thus, having accepted the possibility of action,

original: skyon brjod nas /
analyzed: skyon brjod nas /
translated: he states the error:

original: da ni bya ba nyid kyang mi srid pa yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽de'i byed pa po myu gu ni zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir myu gu skye ba de'i phyir myu gu byed pa po yin te /
analyzed: da ni bya ba nyid kyang mi srid pa yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / de'i byed pa po myu gu ni zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir myu gu skye ba de'i phyir myu gu byed pa po yin te /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that even action is impossible, he says, Moreover, etc.

original: lha sbyin 'gro ba bzhin no //
analyzed: lha sbyin 'gro ba bzhin no //
translated: The sprout is the agent of that action means that because the sprout arises, therefore the sprout is the agent, like Devadatta walking.

original: de med na zhes bya ba ni myu gu med pa'o //
analyzed: de med na zhes bya ba ni myu gu med pa'o //
translated: If that does not exist means if the sprout does not exist.

original: rten med par zhes bya ba ni myu gu med par ro //
analyzed: rten med par zhes bya ba ni myu gu med par ro //
translated: Without a basis means without a sprout.

original: 'di yod pa ma yin la zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di yod pa ma yin la zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i bya ba'o //
translated: This does not exist means the action of arising.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rtsa ba'i shes rab kyi tshigs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rtsa ba'i shes rab kyi tshigs su bcad pa'o //
translated: If, etc. is a verse from the Mūla-prajñā.

original: gzhi mthun no zhes bya ba ni don gang dngos po'i sgras brjod pa de nyid de zhes bya ba'i tshig gis kyang brjod pa yin pas sgra'i brjod bya mtshungs pa nyid yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gzhi mthun no zhes bya ba ni don gang dngos po'i sgras brjod pa de nyid de zhes bya ba'i tshig gis kyang brjod pa yin pas sgra'i brjod bya mtshungs pa nyid yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: Common locus means that the referent expressed by the word thing is also expressed by the word that, so the referents of the words are the same.

original: med na zhes bya ba'i dngos po'i khyad par ro zhes bya ba'i byed pa po'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po med par gyur na'o //
analyzed: med na zhes bya ba'i dngos po'i khyad par ro zhes bya ba'i byed pa po'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po med par gyur na'o //
translated: “If it does not exist” is a particular thing that is a non-entity.

original: ci zhig gi sgra ni skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di dang sbyar bar bya ste zhes bya ba ni ci zhig skye bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ci zhig gi sgra ni skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di dang sbyar bar bya ste zhes bya ba ni ci zhig skye bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word “what” is to be connected with the word “arises.” The meaning is “what arises?”

original: don 'di nyid la lung dang 'gal ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don 'di nyid la lung dang 'gal ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that this very meaning contradicts scripture,

original: gal te srang mda'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te go sla'o //
analyzed: gal te srang mda'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te go sla'o //
translated: he says, “If it is like the tip of a scale,” and so on. This is easy to understand.

original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the response to that,

original: nye bar bkod pa ni bden mod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: nye bar bkod pa ni bden mod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “The response to that is: it is true,” and so on.

original: de gzhan las skye ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de gzhan las skye ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The meaning is that it is not in order to teach arising from another.

original: rnam par dpyad na gzhan las skye ba ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par dpyad na gzhan las skye ba ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because when analyzed, arising from another is not established.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi skye ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi skye ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach arising by way of its own characteristic,🔽he says, “The arising of things is accepted as it is seen by the world.”

original: yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don dam pa'i rang bzhin can gyi dngos po skye ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir yang ma yin te /
analyzed: yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don dam pa'i rang bzhin can gyi dngos po skye ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir yang ma yin te /
translated: Also, it is not so, because the meaning of “not so” is the ultimate nature of things that are produced.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu mi 'thad pa'i phyir don dam par dngos po med pas so //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu mi 'thad pa'i phyir don dam par dngos po med pas so //
translated: Because cause and effect are untenable, ultimately things do not exist.

original: ma brtags par zhes bya ba ni ci ltar sgyu ma'i glang po la sogs pa med du zin kyang 'jig rten pa la glang po la sogs par mngon @136b par zhen pa 'byung la /
analyzed: ma brtags par zhes bya ba ni ci ltar sgyu ma'i glang po la sogs pa med du zin kyang 'jig rten pa la glang po la sogs par mngon @136b par zhen pa 'byung la /
translated: Without analysis means that, just as illusory elephants and so on do not exist, still the world conceives of them as elephants and so on.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang sa bon dang myu gu dag gcig car skye ba med du zin kyang 'jig rten pa la rab tu grags pa'i yongs su ma brtags na nyams dga' ba cig car brten nas 'byung ba'i mngon par zhen pa la brten na s'a lu ljang
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang sa bon dang myu gu dag gcig car skye ba med du zin kyang 'jig rten pa la rab tu grags pa'i yongs su ma brtags na nyams dga' ba cig car brten nas 'byung ba'i mngon par zhen pa la brten na s'a lu ljang
translated: In the same way, here also, even though seeds and sprouts are not produced simultaneously, still, if one relies on the conception of simultaneous arising that is renowned in the world and is delightful when not analyzed, then one will be able to explain the meaning of the sutra.

original: pa'i mdo las sngar gyi dpe nye bar bkod pa yin pas skyon gang yang yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: pa'i mdo las sngar gyi dpe nye bar bkod pa yin pas skyon gang yang yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: The sutra cited above is the Rice Seedling Sutra, and therefore there is no fault.

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'phags pa klu sgrub zhabs kyis bstod pa las te /
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'phags pa klu sgrub zhabs kyis bstod pa las te /
translated: As it is said and so forth is from the praise by the noble Nagarjuna's feet.

original: sngar bstan pa'i rigs pas zhig pa dang ma zhig pa'i rgyu las 'bras bu dag mi 'byung ba'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi skye ba thams cad sgyu ma lta bur gsungs pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i rigs pas zhig pa dang ma zhig pa'i rgyu las 'bras bu dag mi 'byung ba'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi skye ba thams cad sgyu ma lta bur gsungs pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: By the reasoning taught above, since effects do not arise from a cause that has disintegrated or not disintegrated, it is said that all births of omniscience are like illusions.

original: da ni bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi dogs pa bsu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi dogs pa bsu ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to anticipate the doubts of the Vaibhasikas,

original: 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said Here it is said and so forth.

original: gang du cig car ba nyid yod pa zhes bya ba ni mig dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / tshor ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang du cig car ba nyid yod pa zhes bya ba ni mig dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / tshor ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Where simultaneity exists refers to the eye, eye consciousness, and feeling, and so on.

original: der gzhan nyid yod pa zhes bya ba ni dus mnyam pa nyid kyis gzhan nyid yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: der gzhan nyid yod pa zhes bya ba ni dus mnyam pa nyid kyis gzhan nyid yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: There, otherness exists means that by the very simultaneity, otherness does not exist.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach just that,

original: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: it is said For example and so forth.

original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the reply to that, he says,

original: de ni yod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ni yod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: That is not so, etc.

original: dus mnyam pa la gzhan las skye ba yod do zhes gang smras pa de ni yod pa ma yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dus mnyam pa la gzhan las skye ba yod do zhes gang smras pa de ni yod pa ma yin zhes pa'o //
translated: That which was said, “Origination from another exists in the case of simultaneous [factors],” is not so.

original: mig gi blo la zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la'o //
analyzed: mig gi blo la zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la'o //
translated: “In the case of visual cognition” means in the case of visual consciousness.

original: 'du shes la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni tshor ba la sogs pa gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'du shes la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni tshor ba la sogs pa gzung bar bya'o //
translated: “Discrimination, etc.” The word “etc.” should be taken to include feeling, etc.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba dang zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa'o //🔽gzhan nyid yod na zhes bya ba ni gal te mig gi rnam par shes pa la 'du shes la sogs pa dang / mig la sogs pa las gzhan nyid yod par 'gyur na'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba dang zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa'o // gzhan nyid yod na zhes bya ba ni gal te mig gi rnam par shes pa la 'du shes la sogs pa dang / mig la sogs pa las gzhan nyid yod par 'gyur na'o zhes pa'o //
translated: “Co-arisen” means that which occurs together with consciousness.🔽“If difference existed” means if difference existed in the case of visual consciousness from discrimination, etc., and from the eye, etc.

original: yod pa 'byung bas dgos pa ci zhig yod ces bya ba ni gal te mig gi rnam par shes pa mig la sogs pa las gzhan nyid yin na /
analyzed: yod pa 'byung bas dgos pa ci zhig yod ces bya ba ni gal te mig gi rnam par shes pa mig la sogs pa las gzhan nyid yin na /
translated: “What purpose would there be in the occurrence of that which exists?” means if visual consciousness were different from the eye, etc.,

original: de'i tshe gzhan nyid de yod pa nyid zin kyang gang yod par gyur pa de la skye ba dgos pa ci zhig yod ces so //
analyzed: de'i tshe gzhan nyid de yod pa nyid zin kyang gang yod par gyur pa de la skye ba dgos pa ci zhig yod ces so //
translated: At that time, even if that otherness exists, what need is there for that which exists to arise?

original: ci ste de med na zhes bya ba ni gal te skye ba med pa'i skyon spang ba'i phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa yod par khas mi len na'o //
analyzed: ci ste de med na zhes bya ba ni gal te skye ba med pa'i skyon spang ba'i phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa yod par khas mi len na'o //
translated: If it does not exist, then if you do not accept the existence of visual consciousness in order to avoid the error of non-arising,

original: 'di la nyes pa bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni mig gi @137a * //
analyzed: 'di la nyes pa bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni mig gi @137a * //
translated: The error in this has already been explained.

original: rnam par shes pa med na mig la sogs pa gzhan du ma grub pas gzhan las skye ba med do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa med na mig la sogs pa gzhan du ma grub pas gzhan las skye ba med do zhes pa'o //
translated: If visual consciousness does not exist, since eye, etc. are not established as other, there is no arising from other.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says:

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te go sla'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te go sla'o //
translated: If, etc. It is easy to understand.

original: mjug nye bar bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mjug nye bar bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the conclusion,

original: de'i phyir de ltar gzhan las zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar gzhan las zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says: Therefore, in this way, from other, etc.

original: de mi srid pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mi srid pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is impossible means because the effect is impossible.

original: gnyis ka mi srid cing zhes pa ni 'bras bu skye ba la mi ltos pa'i gzhan nyid ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka mi srid cing zhes pa ni 'bras bu skye ba la mi ltos pa'i gzhan nyid ma grub pa'o //
translated: “Neither is possible” means that otherness, which does not depend on the arising of the effect, is not established.

original: gnyis ka yang mi srid pas zhes bya ba ni gzhan nyid dang gzhan las skye ba yang mi srid pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gnyis ka yang mi srid pas zhes bya ba ni gzhan nyid dang gzhan las skye ba yang mi srid pa'i phyir te /
translated: “Neither is possible” means that otherness and arising from another are not possible.

original: 'di ltar gal te 'bras bu skyes par gyur na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te 'bras bu skyes par gyur na /
translated: Thus, if the effect were to arise,

original: de'i tshe 'bras bu la ltos pa'i rgyu gzhan nyid du yod par 'gyur ba yin pa las /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'bras bu la ltos pa'i rgyu gzhan nyid du yod par 'gyur ba yin pa las /
translated: at that time the cause that depends on the effect would exist as other.

original: 'bras bu la skye ba med pas rgyu gzhan nyid du gyur pas yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu la skye ba med pas rgyu gzhan nyid du gyur pas yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But since the effect does not arise, the cause does not exist as other.

original: de med pas gzhan la skye ba yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de med pas gzhan la skye ba yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: Since that does not exist, arising from another does not exist.

original: phyi rol gyi don yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gzhan las skye ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi don med pas so //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gzhan las skye ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi don med pas so //
translated: “Because external objects do not exist” means that objects that have the characteristic of arising from another do not exist.

original: phyi rol gyi don gyis stong pas zhes bya ba ni gzhan las skye ba yin no zhes bya ba'i sgra de gzhan las skye ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi don gyis stong pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don gyis stong pas zhes bya ba ni gzhan las skye ba yin no zhes bya ba'i sgra de gzhan las skye ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi don gyis stong pa'o //
translated: “Because it is empty of external objects” means that the sound “arises from another” is empty of an object that has the characteristic of arising from another.

original: sgra tsam 'ba' zhig lus par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni brtags shing dpyad na don gzhan gyis stong pa'i sgra tsam lus pa'o //
analyzed: sgra tsam 'ba' zhig lus par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni brtags shing dpyad na don gzhan gyis stong pa'i sgra tsam lus pa'o //
translated: “Only the mere sound remains” means that when one investigates and analyzes, only the mere sound remains, which is empty of an object that is different.

original: de ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu dag cig car yod pa ma yin pas gzhan nyid mi srid par bstan nas da ni 'bras bu med pa nyid kyi phyir 'bras bu rgyu'i du sa la ltos pa yod pa ma yin pa dang / rgyu yang 'bras bu'i dus la ltos pa med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu dag cig car yod pa ma yin pas gzhan nyid mi srid par bstan nas da ni 'bras bu med pa nyid kyi phyir 'bras bu rgyu'i du sa la ltos pa yod pa ma yin pa dang / rgyu yang 'bras bu'i dus la ltos pa med pa'i phyir //
translated: Thus, since cause and effect do not exist simultaneously, it has been shown that difference is impossible. Now, in order to demonstrate that because the effect does not exist, the effect does not rely on the cause, and because the cause does not rely on the time of the effect,

original: gzhan nyid yod pa ma yin no //🔽zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan nyid yod pa ma yin no // zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: difference does not exist,🔽he says,

original: da ni rgyu dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: da ni rgyu dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “Now, the cause and the effect,” and so on.

original: bskyed bya gzhan zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: bskyed bya gzhan zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'o //
translated: “The other, the thing that is to be produced” is the effect.

original: gzhan skyed par byed pa ma yin pa nyid du bstan par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan skyed par byed pa ma yin pa nyid du bstan par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is not to be shown that it is a producer of something else.

original: yod pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: yod pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “ Existence” and so on is stated.

original: 'dir 'bras bu yod pa zhig skyed dam /
analyzed: 'dir 'bras bu yod pa zhig skyed dam /
translated: Here, does it produce an existent effect?

original: 'on te med pa zhig gam /🔽'on te yod pa dang med pa'i bdag nyid can nam /
analyzed: 'on te med pa zhig gam / 'on te yod pa dang med pa'i bdag nyid can nam /
translated: Or does it produce a nonexistent effect?🔽Or does it produce an effect that has the nature of both existence and nonexistence?

original: 'on te yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin pa gnyis ka ma yin pa'i rang bzhin can zhig skyed par byed /
analyzed: 'on te yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin pa gnyis ka ma yin pa'i rang bzhin can zhig skyed par byed /
translated: Or does it produce an effect that has the nature of neither existence nor nonexistence?

original: de la yod pa ni skyed par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la yod pa ni skyed par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: An existent is not produced,

original: yod pa la skye ba don @137b med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa la skye ba don @137b med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because production of an existent is meaningless.

original: med pa yang skyed par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa yang skyed par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: A nonexistent is not produced,

original: ri bong gi rva bzhin du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ri bong gi rva bzhin du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is nonexistent, like the horn of a donkey.

original: gnyis ka'i rang bzhin can yang skyed par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gnyis ka'i rang bzhin can yang skyed par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: One that has the nature of both is not produced,

original: phyogs gnyis ka la bstan pa'i skyon yod par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: phyogs gnyis ka la bstan pa'i skyon yod par 'gyur bas so //
translated: because the error shown for both positions would ensue.

original: yod pa dang med pa gnyis ka ma yin pa yang skyed par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa gnyis ka ma yin pa yang skyed par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Nor does it produce that which is both existent and nonexistent,

original: de mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is impossible.

original: des na 'bras bu med pa'i phyir gnyis ka gnyis ka'i dus la ltos pa ma yin no zhes so //
analyzed: des na 'bras bu med pa'i phyir gnyis ka gnyis ka'i dus la ltos pa ma yin no zhes so //
translated: Therefore, because the effect does not exist, it does not rely on the time of both causes.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that,

original: re zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: re zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “First of all,” and so on.

original: ci ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bzhi brgya pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'o//
analyzed: ci ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bzhi brgya pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'o//
translated: “ How?” and so on is a verse from Aryadeva’s Four Hundred.

original: 'di'i don ni grangs can pa dang / bye brag tu smra ba dag rgyu'i gnas skabs na 'bras bu yod par smra ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni grangs can pa dang / bye brag tu smra ba dag rgyu'i gnas skabs na 'bras bu yod par smra ba yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows. The Samkhyas and Vaibhasikas maintain that the effect exists at the time of the cause.

original: grangs can pa'i gang yod pa de dus thams cad du yod pa kho na yin te med pa skye ba dang yod pa 'gag pa med do zhes pa ni 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: grangs can pa'i gang yod pa de dus thams cad du yod pa kho na yin te med pa skye ba dang yod pa 'gag pa med do zhes pa ni 'dod pa yin te /
translated: The Samkhyas maintain that whatever exists must exist at all times, and that it is impossible for the nonexistent to arise and for the existent to cease.

original: gang gi phyir med pa byed pa 'thad pa min phyir dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'bras bu yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir med pa byed pa 'thad pa min phyir dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'bras bu yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa yin te /
translated: Because it is untenable that a nonexistent is a product and so on, he accepts that effects exist.

original: 'bras bu med par skye ba khas len na ni thams cad las thams cad skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu med par skye ba khas len na ni thams cad las thams cad skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If one accepts that effects arise without existing, then it would follow that anything could arise from anything.

original: de ltar yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But that is not the case.

original: des na rgyu la 'bras bu yod pa kho na yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: des na rgyu la 'bras bu yod pa kho na yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore he says that effects exist in their causes.🔽Vaibhasikas imagine that things exist in the three times because they fear the consequence that nonthings would arise.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams ni dngos po med pa skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i 'jigs pas dngos po rnams dus gsum na yod pa yin no zhes rtog par byed de tshogs pa ni gnas skabs kyi 'bras bu can yin gyi /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams ni dngos po med pa skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i 'jigs pas dngos po rnams dus gsum na yod pa yin no zhes rtog par byed de tshogs pa ni gnas skabs kyi 'bras bu can yin gyi /
translated: They say that collections of causes and conditions possess temporary effects,

original: rdzas kyi 'bras bu can ni ma yin pas dus gsum na gnas pa'i rdzas la rgyu dang rkyen gyi tshogs pas da ltar gyi gnas skabs tsam du byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rdzas kyi 'bras bu can ni ma yin pas dus gsum na gnas pa'i rdzas la rgyu dang rkyen gyi tshogs pas da ltar gyi gnas skabs tsam du byed pa yin gyi /
translated: but they do not possess substantial effects. Therefore collections of causes and conditions make things that exist in the three times merely present.

original: sngar med pa'i rdzas skyed par byed pa ni ma yin no zhes 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: sngar med pa'i rdzas skyed par byed pa ni ma yin no zhes 'dod pa'o //
translated: But it does not produce a substance that did not previously exist.

original: bye brag pa dang / mdo sde pa dang / sems tsam pa rnams ni 'bras bu med par smra ba yin te /
analyzed: bye brag pa dang / mdo sde pa dang / sems tsam pa rnams ni 'bras bu med par smra ba yin te /
translated: Vaibhasikas, Sautrantikas, and Cittamatrins are proponents of the nonexistence of effects because

original: de rnams ni 'bras bu yod pa skye na skye ba don med pa yin no snyam du bsams nas 'bras bu med pa kho na yin no zhes khas len pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams ni 'bras bu yod pa skye na skye ba don med pa yin no snyam du bsams nas 'bras bu med pa kho na yin no zhes khas len pa'o //
translated: they believe that if an existent effect were to arise, its arising would be pointless.

original: de la bye brag pa rnams ni sa la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab las rdul phra rab gnyis pa la sogs pa'i yan lag can gyi rdzas skye ba yin no zhes 'dod pas 'bras bu med par skye ba khas len pa yin no //🔽mdo sde pa rnams kyang dge slong dag mig med pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / @138a * //
analyzed: de la bye brag pa rnams ni sa la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab las rdul phra rab gnyis pa la sogs pa'i yan lag can gyi rdzas skye ba yin no zhes 'dod pas 'bras bu med par skye ba khas len pa yin no // mdo sde pa rnams kyang dge slong dag mig med pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / @138a * //
translated: Vaibhasikas assert that substances such as the second subtle particle and so on arise from subtle particles such as earth and so on.🔽Sautrantikas accept that an effect arises from a cause that is nonexistent because a sutra declares:🔽Monks, the nonexistent eye arises.

original: yod pa ni 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i lung gis rgyu las 'bras bu med pa skye ba yin no zhes khas len no //
analyzed: yod pa ni 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i lung gis rgyu las 'bras bu med pa skye ba yin no zhes khas len no //
translated: The existent eye ceases.

original: sems tsam du smra ba rnams kyang dngos po thams cad skye ba'i rgyu bag chags kyi bye brag gi rten kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las bag chags yongs su smin pa'i rkyen nye bar gnas pa'i gang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa skye ba
analyzed: sems tsam du smra ba rnams kyang dngos po thams cad skye ba'i rgyu bag chags kyi bye brag gi rten kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las bag chags yongs su smin pa'i rkyen nye bar gnas pa'i gang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa skye ba
translated: Cittamātra also asserts that the cause of the arising of all things is the foundation consciousness, which is the basis of the various latent propensities. The result that arises is the consciousness that engages objects, which is the condition of the ripening of latent propensities.

original: de ni med pa skye ba yin no zhes khas len pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni med pa skye ba yin no zhes khas len pa yin no //
translated: They assert that this is the arising of what is nonexistent.

original: de ltar smra ba po rnams ni 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa'i skye ba nyid du smra ba las mi 'da' ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar smra ba po rnams ni 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa'i skye ba nyid du smra ba las mi 'da' ba yin no //
translated: Those who make such assertions cannot escape the position that the arising of results is both existent and nonexistent.

original: de ltar smra ba gnyis ka la yang /
analyzed: de ltar smra ba gnyis ka la yang /
translated: In both of these assertions,🔽the existence of a result is not tenable in the position of the proponents of existence.

original: khyim gyi don du gang ka ba dang sgo dang sgo skyes la sogs pa rnams la ri mo la sogs pa bkod pa'i khyad par can gyi bdag nyid can gyi bdag nyid can gyi rgyan de re zhig 'bras bu yod par smra ba'i phyogs la mi rigs te
analyzed: khyim gyi don du gang ka ba dang sgo dang sgo skyes la sogs pa rnams la ri mo la sogs pa bkod pa'i khyad par can gyi bdag nyid can gyi bdag nyid can gyi rgyan de re zhig 'bras bu yod par smra ba'i phyogs la mi rigs te
translated: The existence of a result is not tenable in the position of the proponents of nonexistence.

original: / de'i 'bras bur gyur pa'i khyim yod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: / de'i 'bras bur gyur pa'i khyim yod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because the house that is its effect exists.

original: rnam pa gzhan gyis khyim de bsgrub par bya ba nyid du khas len na 'bras bu med par khas len par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan gyis khyim de bsgrub par bya ba nyid du khas len na 'bras bu med par khas len par 'gyur bas so //
translated: If you accept that the house is to be established in some other way, then you accept that it is without an effect.

original: gang yang 'bras bu med par khas len pa de yang ji skad du bstan pa'i ka ba la sogs pa'i rgyan yang don med pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: gang yang 'bras bu med par khas len pa de yang ji skad du bstan pa'i ka ba la sogs pa'i rgyan yang don med pa kho na yin te /
translated: And whatever is accepted as being without an effect, the decoration of pillars and so on, as previously explained, is also meaningless.

original: 'bras bu med pa'i phyir dang / mo gsham gyi bu de gang gis kyang bskyed par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa'i phyir dang / mo gsham gyi bu de gang gis kyang bskyed par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is without an effect, and because no one can produce the son of a barren woman.

original: de bzhin du 'bras bu med par smra ba rnams la yang 'bras bur gyur pa'i khyim 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'bras bu med par smra ba rnams la yang 'bras bur gyur pa'i khyim 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, for those who maintain that it is without an effect, the house that is its effect would not be established.

original: gal te skyon de spang bar bya ba'i phyir 'bras bu rnam pa thams cad du med pa nyid du khas mi len na 'bras bu med par smra ba nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te skyon de spang bar bya ba'i phyir 'bras bu rnam pa thams cad du med pa nyid du khas mi len na 'bras bu med par smra ba nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: If, in order to avoid this error, you do not accept that it is without an effect in any way, then your claim that it is without an effect is undermined.

original: ci ltar khyim yod pa dang med pa bsgrub pa'i don du ka ba la sogs pa'i rgyan mi rigs pa de bzhin du phyi dang nang gi 'du byed dang / myu gu la sogs pa dngos po thams cad la yod pa dang med par brtags pas ma rig pa dang sa bon la sogs pa'i rgyu rnams don med pa nyid du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: ci ltar khyim yod pa dang med pa bsgrub pa'i don du ka ba la sogs pa'i rgyan mi rigs pa de bzhin du phyi dang nang gi 'du byed dang / myu gu la sogs pa dngos po thams cad la yod pa dang med par brtags pas ma rig pa dang sa bon la sogs pa'i rgyu rnams don med pa nyid du brjod par bya'o //
translated: Just as it is illogical to adorn a pillar, etc. for the sake of establishing the existence or non-existence of a house, so too, since all things, such as sprouts, etc. are investigated as to their existence or non-existence, it should be said that causes such as ignorance and seeds, etc. are meaningless.

original: dbu ma las zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba'i shes rab las so //
analyzed: dbu ma las zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba'i shes rab las so //
translated: “In the Madhyamaka” means in the Root Knowledge.

original: 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid yod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gal te rgyus 'bras bu skyed par byed na des 'bras bu yod pa zhig skyed dam 'on te med pa zhig skyed gnyis ka yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid yod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gal te rgyus 'bras bu skyed par byed na des 'bras bu yod pa zhig skyed dam 'on te med pa zhig skyed gnyis ka yang mi rigs te /
translated: If the nature of the effect exists, etc. If a cause generates an effect, does it generate an existent effect or a nonexistent effect? Both are illogical.

original: 'di ltar 'bras bu ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa de ni yang skye bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'bras bu ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa de ni yang skye bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, an effect that exists by its very nature would not arise again,

original: yod pa'i phyir bum pa yod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: yod pa'i phyir bum pa yod pa bzhin no //
translated: because it exists, like an existent pot.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis med pa'i 'bras bu de yang rgyus skyed @138b par mi byed de /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis med pa'i 'bras bu de yang rgyus skyed @138b par mi byed de /
translated: That effect which does not exist by its own intrinsic reality is not generated by a cause.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis med pa'i phyir bong bu'i rva bzhin no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis med pa'i phyir bong bu'i rva bzhin no //
translated: Because it does not exist by its own intrinsic reality, like the horn of an ass.

original: de la gzhan dag ni rgyus 'bras bu skyed pa'i bya ba byed par khas blangs na /
analyzed: de la gzhan dag ni rgyus 'bras bu skyed pa'i bya ba byed par khas blangs na /
translated: In response to that, others say: If you accept that a cause performs the action of generating an effect,

original: khyod kyis brjod pa'i skyon yod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: khyod kyis brjod pa'i skyon yod pa yin gyi /
translated: then the error that you have stated would exist.

original: 'on kyang 'bras bu skyed pa'i bya ba mi byed par rgyu'i ngo bo nyid du yod pa yin la /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'bras bu skyed pa'i bya ba mi byed par rgyu'i ngo bo nyid du yod pa yin la /
translated: However, a cause exists as the intrinsic reality of a cause without performing the action of generating an effect.

original: 'bras bu med na yang rgyu rgyu nyid du mi 'grub pa yin pas de'i phyir 'bras bu yang yod par 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu med na yang rgyu rgyu nyid du mi 'grub pa yin pas de'i phyir 'bras bu yang yod par 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
translated: And if an effect does not exist, a cause is not established as a cause. Therefore, an effect also would exist.

original: de la lan ni gal te skyed par byed pa ma yin pa rgyu nyid du 'grub na de rgyur 'gyur ba yin pa las skyed byed ma yin pa rgyu nyid du ci ltar rigs /
analyzed: de la lan ni gal te skyed par byed pa ma yin pa rgyu nyid du 'grub na de rgyur 'gyur ba yin pa las skyed byed ma yin pa rgyu nyid du ci ltar rigs /
translated: In response to that, if a non-generator were established as a cause, then it would be a cause. But how could a non-generator be established as a cause?

original: gal te rgyus 'bras bu bskyed pa'i bya ba mi byed du zin kyang de ltar yang 'bras bu yod pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te rgyus 'bras bu bskyed pa'i bya ba mi byed du zin kyang de ltar yang 'bras bu yod pa yin te /
translated: But even if the cause does not perform the action of producing the effect, the effect would still exist.

original: rgyu med na 'bras bu yang mi rigs pa'i phyir 'bras bu yod pas na rgyu yang yod par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu med na 'bras bu yang mi rigs pa'i phyir 'bras bu yod pas na rgyu yang yod par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Because it is illogical for an effect to exist without a cause, the cause would also exist because the effect exists.

original: de la lan brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la lan brjod par bya ste /
translated: We will respond to that.

original: gang gi tshe skyed par byed pa ma yin pa rgyu nyid du mi rigs pa brjod pa de'i tshe rgyu nyid med pas 'bras bu gang gi yin par 'gyur des na 'bras bu yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe skyed par byed pa ma yin pa rgyu nyid du mi rigs pa brjod pa de'i tshe rgyu nyid med pas 'bras bu gang gi yin par 'gyur des na 'bras bu yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: When it is illogical for something that does not produce to be a cause, then since it would not be a cause, what would an effect be? Therefore an effect also does not exist.🔽Even if it were both, in that case,

original: gnyis nyid yin na yang de la zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa nyid du gyur kyang ngo //
analyzed: gnyis nyid yin na yang de la zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa nyid du gyur kyang ngo //
translated: that is, even if the effect were both existent and nonexistent,

original: bshad zin pa'i nyes par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni yod pa'i phyogs dang med pa'i phyogs la skyon gang brjod pa de yod par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro /
analyzed: bshad zin pa'i nyes par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni yod pa'i phyogs dang med pa'i phyogs la skyon gang brjod pa de yod par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro /
translated: the previously explained errors would ensue, that is, the errors that were explained in the context of the position that it exists and the position that it does not exist would ensue.

original: gnyis kyi dngos po 'di gnyis nyid yin zhing zhes bya ba ni grangs tsam mo //
analyzed: gnyis kyi dngos po 'di gnyis nyid yin zhing zhes bya ba ni grangs tsam mo //
translated: The two things are “dual” in the sense of being two in number.

original: gnyis nyid la yod pa ni zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang med pa'i dngos po de la yod pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis nyid la yod pa ni zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang med pa'i dngos po de la yod pa'o //
translated: “ Existing in duality” means existing in the things that are existent and nonexistent.

original: de ltar yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs kyi dngos po khas blangs nas skyon brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: de ltar yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs kyi dngos po khas blangs nas skyon brjod pa yin la /
translated: Thus, having accepted the position that things are both existent and nonexistent, he is now accused of error.

original: de ni yod pa dang med pa'i rang bzhin can gyi dngos po yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni yod pa dang med pa'i rang bzhin can gyi dngos po yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that things that have the nature of both existence and nonexistence do not exist,

original: yod pa dang med pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “If something exists, etc.”

original: de'i rang bzhin can gyi zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang med pa'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin can gyi zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang med pa'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: “ Having that nature” means having the nature of both existence and nonexistence.

original: bstan bcos las zhes bya ba ni dbu ma rtsa ba'i shes rab las so //
analyzed: bstan bcos las zhes bya ba ni dbu ma rtsa ba'i shes rab las so //
translated: “ In the treatise” means in the Wisdom of the Middle Way.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phan tshun 'gal ba'i dngos po dang / dngos po med pa dag mya ngan las 'das pa gcig nyid la mi srid pas mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po dang dngos po med pa ci ltar yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phan tshun 'gal ba'i dngos po dang / dngos po med pa dag mya ngan las 'das pa gcig nyid la mi srid pas mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po dang dngos po med pa ci ltar yod par 'gyur te /
translated: “Nirvana” and so on. Since it is impossible for mutually exclusive things, such as existence and nonexistence, to be in the same single thing, how could nirvana be both an existent thing and a nonexistent thing?

original: yod par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: yod par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it could not be.

original: ci ltar zhe na /🔽snang ba dang ni mun pa @139a * //
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na / snang ba dang ni mun pa @139a * //
translated: How so?

original: bzhin // zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bzhin // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, “Like light and darkness.”

original: dper na khyim gcig gi nang du phan tshun 'gal ba snang ba dang mun pa dag dus gcig tu mi srid pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na khyim gcig gi nang du phan tshun 'gal ba snang ba dang mun pa dag dus gcig tu mi srid pa yin no //
translated: For example, it is impossible for mutually exclusive light and darkness to be present at the same time in the same place.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la byed pa por gyur pa'am ma gyur pa zhes bya ba ni gyur pa ni bya ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la byed pa por gyur pa'am ma gyur pa zhes bya ba ni gyur pa ni bya ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: “So too” and so on. The phrase “whether it is a real or unreal agent” means that a real agent is one who is engaged in action,

original: ma gyur pa ni bya ba dang mi ldan pa'o //
analyzed: ma gyur pa ni bya ba dang mi ldan pa'o //
translated: while an unreal agent is one who is not engaged in action.

original: de la byed pa por gyur pa dang ma gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de la byed pa por gyur pa dang ma gyur pa ste /
translated: Therein, a real or unreal agent

original: bskyed par bya ba'i rang bzhin can dang / bskyed par bya ba ma yin pa'i rang bzhin can gyi las mi byed de /
analyzed: bskyed par bya ba'i rang bzhin can dang / bskyed par bya ba ma yin pa'i rang bzhin can gyi las mi byed de /
translated: It does not perform the action of that which has the nature of being produced or that which has the nature of not being produced.

original: de zhes bya ba ni tshig las brjod pa yin pas so //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni tshig las brjod pa yin pas so //
translated: “ That” is expressed by the words.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: dngos po gcig la dus gcig tu bskyed par bya ba'i rang bzhin can dang / bskyed par bya ba ma yin pa'i rang bzhin can du mi rigs pas so //
analyzed: dngos po gcig la dus gcig tu bskyed par bya ba'i rang bzhin can dang / bskyed par bya ba ma yin pa'i rang bzhin can du mi rigs pas so //
translated: Because it is not logical that a single entity at one time has the nature of being produced and the nature of not being produced.

original: des na byed pa por gyur pa dang ma gyur pa'i las byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des na byed pa por gyur pa dang ma gyur pa'i las byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, one who is and is not an agent does not perform an action that is and is not already existent.

original: med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it does not exist.

original: 'dis ni phan tshun 'gal ba'i chos gnyis dngos po gcig la yod pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni phan tshun 'gal ba'i chos gnyis dngos po gcig la yod pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: This shows that two mutually exclusive properties do not exist in a single entity.

original: phyogs bzhi pa dgag par bya ba'i phyir gnyis ka dang bral ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te go sla'o //
analyzed: phyogs bzhi pa dgag par bya ba'i phyir gnyis ka dang bral ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te go sla'o //
translated: In order to refute the fourth possibility, he says, “It is neither,” and so on. The meaning is easy to understand.

original: yod pa ma yin pa'i rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa'i rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the reason for its nonexistence, he says,

original: yod pa dang med pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “Neither existent nor nonexistent” and so on.

original: de dag bkag pas zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang med pa dag bkag pas so //
analyzed: de dag bkag pas zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang med pa dag bkag pas so //
translated: “By their negation” means by the negation of existence and nonexistence.

original: cung zad kyang khyad par du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang med pa dag bkag pas khyad par du byas pa'i dngos po cung zad kyang med pas so //
analyzed: cung zad kyang khyad par du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang med pa dag bkag pas khyad par du byas pa'i dngos po cung zad kyang med pas so //
translated: “Nothing at all is distinguished” means that since there is no existent or nonexistent thing distinguished by the negation of existence and nonexistence,

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says,

original: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “When . . .” and so on.

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dbu ma rtsa ba'i shes rab las so //
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dbu ma rtsa ba'i shes rab las so //
translated: “As it is said” and so on is from the Wisdom: Fundamental Treatise on the Middle Way.

original: dngos min dngos po med min pa //
analyzed: dngos min dngos po med min pa //
translated: “Neither a thing nor a nonthing”

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: means

original: gal te dngos po zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig yod par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig yod par gyur na /
translated: if something called a “thing” existed,

original: de bkag pas mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po med ces brtag par mi rigs pa dang / gal te dngos po med pa 'ga' zhig grub na de bkag pas mya ngan las 'das pa dngos por grub par 'gyur ba las /
analyzed: de bkag pas mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po med ces brtag par mi rigs pa dang / gal te dngos po med pa 'ga' zhig grub na de bkag pas mya ngan las 'das pa dngos por grub par 'gyur ba las /
translated: It is not logical to analyze nirvana as a non-thing, because it is not a thing.🔽If some non-thing were established, then by refuting that, nirvana would be established as a thing.

original: gang gi tshe dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag ma grub pa de'i tshe de dag bkag pa yang med pas mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po dang / dngos po med pa yin no zhes brtag pa de rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag ma grub pa de'i tshe de dag bkag pa yang med pas mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po dang / dngos po med pa yin no zhes brtag pa de rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: But when things and non-things are not established, then since their refutations also do not exist, it is illogical to analyze and say that nirvana is a thing or a non-thing.

original: 'dis ni gnyis dang bral ba yang med pa yin no zhes @139b gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni gnyis dang bral ba yang med pa yin no zhes @139b gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This also shows that nirvana is not a non-existent that is a negation.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'jig rten pa'i sgo nas gzhan las skye ba sgrub par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'jig rten pa'i sgo nas gzhan las skye ba sgrub par byed pa yin te /
translated: The line “If it is said that nirvana is a thing or a non-thing” and so on proves arising from other from the perspective of the world.

original: rigs pa gang dang gang smras pa zhes bya ba ni nges pa mthong ba dang srang mda' la sogs pa'i dpes bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rigs pa gang dang gang smras pa zhes bya ba ni nges pa mthong ba dang srang mda' la sogs pa'i dpes bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: “Whatever reasonings are stated” refers to the demonstrations using the examples of seeing a definite object, a scale’s balance point, and so on.

original: skye ba rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir //
analyzed: skye ba rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to establish arising thoroughly.

original: zhes bya ba ni gzhan las skye ba sgrub pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzhan las skye ba sgrub pa'i don du'o //
translated: This is for the purpose of establishing arising from another.

original: de dang de ni zhes bya ba ni rigs pa'o //
analyzed: de dang de ni zhes bya ba ni rigs pa'o //
translated: That and that, he says, is reasoning.

original: khyod kyis zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pa'i'o //
analyzed: khyod kyis zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pa'i'o //
translated: Yours, he says, is the Madhyamaka.

original: blo'i mes zhes bya ba ni blo nyid me yin te /
analyzed: blo'i mes zhes bya ba ni blo nyid me yin te /
translated: The fire of intelligence, he says, is intelligence itself which is fire.

original: ci ltar sreg pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar sreg pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it a burner?

original: bud shing skam po mar gyis bran pa ltar //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bud shing skam po mar gyis bran pa ltar // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Like dry firewood anointed with ghee.

original: ji ltar bud shing skam po la mar gyis bran pa la mes sreg par byed pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar bud shing skam po la mar gyis bran pa la mes sreg par byed pa bzhin no //
translated: Just as dry firewood anointed with ghee is burned by fire.

original: khyod kyi shes rab kyi me spor ba lhur byed pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab 'phel bar byed pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: khyod kyi shes rab kyi me spor ba lhur byed pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab 'phel bar byed pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: Your effort to ignite the fire of wisdom, he says, is the increase of wisdom.

original: des na rigs pa'i bud shing nye bar bskul bas chog ste /
analyzed: des na rigs pa'i bud shing nye bar bskul bas chog ste /
translated: Therefore, it is enough to incite the firewood of reasoning.

original: rigs pa de bud shing dang 'dra ba yin te /
analyzed: rigs pa de bud shing dang 'dra ba yin te /
translated: That reasoning is like firewood.

original: dbu ma'i blo'i mes bsreg par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbu ma'i blo'i mes bsreg par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is to be burned by the fire of the Madhyamaka mind.

original: 'di'i don ni kho bo cag gzhan las skye ba rigs pas mi sgrub ste /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni kho bo cag gzhan las skye ba rigs pas mi sgrub ste /
translated: The meaning of this is that we do not establish arising from another through reasoning.

original: gang gi phyir gzhan las skye ba ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzhan las skye ba ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: Because there is no arising from another.

original: de la dbu ma pa'i dogs pa bsu bar bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de la dbu ma pa'i dogs pa bsu bar bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: In order to anticipate an objection from the Madhyamaka, he says,

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “If you say,” and so on.

original: brjod par 'dod pa'i don grub pa zhes bya ba ni brjod par 'dod pa'i don gzhan las skye ba grub pa'o //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa'i don grub pa zhes bya ba ni brjod par 'dod pa'i don gzhan las skye ba grub pa'o //
translated: “The intended meaning is established” means that the intended meaning of “arising from another” is established.

original: de la gzhan gyi lan ni de ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la gzhan gyi lan ni de ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Here the response of the other party is stated, “That is not so,” and so on.

original: brjod par 'dod pa'i don grub pa nyid yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa'i don grub pa nyid yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: “The intended meaning is established” means that the intended meaning of “arising from another” is established.

original: ji ltar grub pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar grub pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it established?

original: don gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: don gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He says, “The object,” and so on.

original: 'jig rten pa'i shes pas gzhan las skye ba grub pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i shes pas gzhan las skye ba grub pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: “Arising from another is established by worldly cognition.”

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says,

original: gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “By what,” and so on.

original: 'dir gzhan las skye ba sgrub pa la rigs pa brjod pas ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir gzhan las skye ba sgrub pa la rigs pa brjod pas ci zhig bya ste /
translated: Here, what need is there to state a reasoning to prove arising from other?

original: gang gi phyir 'jig rten pa rang gi lta ba la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'jig rten pa rang gi lta ba la gnas pa ste /
translated: Because worldly people abide in their own views,

original: bdag nyid kyi mngon sum la gnas pa tshad mar gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi mngon sum la gnas pa tshad mar gyur pa yin te /
translated: abiding in their own direct perception, they are authoritative.

original: rang gis nyams su myong ba dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten pa tshad ma yin no zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang gis nyams su myong ba dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten pa tshad ma yin no zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of this is that worldly people who have experience are authoritative.

original: 'jig rten las kyang rgyu gzhan las 'bras bu'i dngos po gzhan 'byung ba yin no zhes rtogs pas so //🔽des na gang gi phyir zhes bya bas ni 'jig rten pas gzhan las @140a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten las kyang rgyu gzhan las 'bras bu'i dngos po gzhan 'byung ba yin no zhes rtogs pas so // des na gang gi phyir zhes bya bas ni 'jig rten pas gzhan las @140a * //
translated: And because worldly people understand that from other causes, other effects arise.

original: skye ba mngon sum gyis grub pas gzhan las skye ba yod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: skye ba mngon sum gyis grub pas gzhan las skye ba yod pa kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, because of that, the phrase “since it is seen” indicates that arising from other is established by direct perception.🔽Therefore, since arising from other does exist, what need is there to state a reasoning to prove arising from other?

original: des na 'jig rten pa'i mngon sum gyis grub pa'i dngos po la rigs pas ci zhig bya zhes pa'o //
analyzed: des na 'jig rten pa'i mngon sum gyis grub pa'i dngos po la rigs pas ci zhig bya zhes pa'o //
translated: What need is there to state a reasoning to prove that things that are established by worldly direct perception exist?

original: de la 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, the Commentary says:

original: 'jig rten pa 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The response to that is stated in the lines beginning “The worldly perspective is not valid cognition.”

original: stobs dang ldan pa yin zhes bya ba ni mngon sum las brling ba'i tshad ma med pas des grub pa la rigs pa gzhan dgos pa med pa'o //
analyzed: stobs dang ldan pa yin zhes bya ba ni mngon sum las brling ba'i tshad ma med pas des grub pa la rigs pa gzhan dgos pa med pa'o //
translated: “Powerful” means that there is no valid cognition that is more powerful than direct perception, so there is no need for another reasoning to establish what is established by direct perception.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that very point, the root text says,

original: gzhan kho na las zhes bya ba gsungs te /🔽gal te rigs pa brjod par 'dod na dngos po mngon sum pa la 'am /
analyzed: gzhan kho na las zhes bya ba gsungs te / gal te rigs pa brjod par 'dod na dngos po mngon sum pa la 'am /
translated: “It is not from another.”

original: 'on te mngon sum ma yin pa la yin grang na /🔽de la phyogs dang po ni mi 'thad de /
analyzed: 'on te mngon sum ma yin pa la yin grang na / de la phyogs dang po ni mi 'thad de /
translated: If you wish to state a reasoning, is it from a directly perceptible thing or from something that is not directly perceptible?

original: mngon sum gyis grub pa la rigs pa bkod pa don med pas so //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis grub pa la rigs pa bkod pa don med pas so //
translated: In that regard, the first position is untenable because it is pointless to state a reasoning for something that is established by direct perception.

original: phyogs gnyis pa la rigs pa brjod pa 'os kyis /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa la rigs pa brjod pa 'os kyis /
translated: In the second position, it is appropriate to state a reasoning,

original: 'dir gzhan las skye bar mngon sum gyis grub par rigs pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: 'dir gzhan las skye bar mngon sum gyis grub par rigs pas ci zhig bya /
translated: but here what is the use of a reasoning to establish that arising from another is directly perceptible?

original: des na 'thad pa ma brjod kyang dngos po rnams las gzhan la skye ba rigs pa yin no zhes pa ni phyogs snga ma'o //
analyzed: des na 'thad pa ma brjod kyang dngos po rnams las gzhan la skye ba rigs pa yin no zhes pa ni phyogs snga ma'o //
translated: Therefore, although no reasoning is stated, it is reasonable that things arise from another. This is the opponent’s position.

original: de la lan gyi rim pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lan gyi rim pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the stages of the reply to that,

original: gang zhig bstan bcos kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang zhig bstan bcos kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “Someone who does not understand the meaning of the treatise . . .”

original: bstan bcos kyi don phyin ci ma log pa ma rtogs shing zhes bya ba ni gang gi dbu ma'i bstan bcos kyi don phyin ci ma log par khong du ma chud pa'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos kyi don phyin ci ma log pa ma rtogs shing zhes bya ba ni gang gi dbu ma'i bstan bcos kyi don phyin ci ma log par khong du ma chud pa'o //
translated: “ Does not understand the meaning of the treatise without error” means that someone has not comprehended the meaning of the treatise of the Middle Way without error.

original: thog ma med pa'i 'khor bar dngos po'i bag chags gzhag pa yongs su smin pa zhes bya ba ni thog ma med pa'i 'khor bar dngos po yod do snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i dngos po'i bag chags gzhag pa gang yin pa de yongs su smin pa ste
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i 'khor bar dngos po'i bag chags gzhag pa yongs su smin pa zhes bya ba ni thog ma med pa'i 'khor bar dngos po yod do snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i dngos po'i bag chags gzhag pa gang yin pa de yongs su smin pa ste
translated: “ The full ripening of the latent propensities for entities that have been deposited in beginningless cyclic existence” means that the latent propensities for entities that have been deposited in beginningless cyclic existence by the conception that thinks “entities exist” have fully ripened.

original: / 'bras bu bskyed pa'i gnas skabs mtha' ma thob pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: / 'bras bu bskyed pa'i gnas skabs mtha' ma thob pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That is to say, they have reached the final stage of producing a result.

original: dngos po la mngon par zhen pa'i mdza' bo dang bral ba thos pas yi mug par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba dngos po rnams la dngos po yod pa nyid yin no snyam pa'i mngon par zhen pa gang yin pa de mdza' bo yin te /
analyzed: dngos po la mngon par zhen pa'i mdza' bo dang bral ba thos pas yi mug par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba dngos po rnams la dngos po yod pa nyid yin no snyam pa'i mngon par zhen pa gang yin pa de mdza' bo yin te /
translated: The phrase “one is disheartened by the teaching that one will be separated from friends who are attached to real things” means that the attachment to the idea that things really exist is a friend.

original: thog ma med pa'i 'khor bar 'dris pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i 'khor bar 'dris pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it has been familiar to one since beginningless time in samsara.

original: de dang bral ba ste /🔽gzhan las skye ba bkag pas dngos po la mngon par zhen pa bzlog pas so //
analyzed: de dang bral ba ste / gzhan las skye ba bkag pas dngos po la mngon par zhen pa bzlog pas so //
translated: One is separated from that attachment🔽because the refutation of arising from another stops the attachment to real things.

original: de thos pas ni gzhan las skye ba bkag pa'i sgo nas dngos po la mngon par zhen pa bkag pa'o //
analyzed: de thos pas ni gzhan las skye ba bkag pa'i sgo nas dngos po la mngon par zhen pa bkag pa'o //
translated: One is disheartened by the teaching that stops the attachment to real things by refuting arising from another.

original: yi mug par @140b gyur pa ni lan brjod par mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: yi mug par @140b gyur pa ni lan brjod par mi nus pa'o //
translated: One is unable to respond to that teaching.

original: 'jig rten gyis gnod pa'i rdol thabs la brten pa 'di ni zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa la grags pa'i gzhan la skye bas gzhan la skye ba 'gog pa gnod pa de nyid rdol thabs te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyis gnod pa'i rdol thabs la brten pa 'di ni zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa la grags pa'i gzhan la skye bas gzhan la skye ba 'gog pa gnod pa de nyid rdol thabs te /
translated: The phrase “this is a mere babbling that is contradicted by the world” means that the refutation of arising from another is contradicted by the world, which is familiar with arising from another.

original: nga ro 'byin pa de la brten pa'o //
analyzed: nga ro 'byin pa de la brten pa'o //
translated: This is a mere babbling, a mere sound.

original: 'jig rten gyi byung tshul zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad do //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi byung tshul zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad do //
translated: The so-called “world” is the conventional world.

original: shin tu mang zhing rgya che ba ma bshad par zhes bya ba ni bden pa gnyis kyi rnam gzhag gi sgo nas so //
analyzed: shin tu mang zhing rgya che ba ma bshad par zhes bya ba ni bden pa gnyis kyi rnam gzhag gi sgo nas so //
translated: Without explaining it in great detail, means by way of the presentation of the two truths.

original: khyad par can zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa la grags pa nyid do //
analyzed: khyad par can zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa la grags pa nyid do //
translated: “ Distinctive” means that it is well known in the world.

original: bden pa gnyis kyi rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis kyi rnam par gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: bden pa gnyis kyi rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis kyi rnam par gzhag pa ste /
translated: The presentation of the two truths is the presentation of the two truths of the conventional and the ultimate.

original: de dag gi sgo nas 'jig rten gyi gnod pa'i yul khong du chud pas so //
analyzed: de dag gi sgo nas 'jig rten gyi gnod pa'i yul khong du chud pas so //
translated: By way of those, one should understand the domain of worldly harm.

original: de la yul gyi sgo nas kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i rnam par gzhag pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la yul gyi sgo nas kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i rnam par gzhag pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: There, in order to teach the presentation of the conventional and the ultimate by way of the domain,

original: dngos po kun zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dngos po kun zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “All things,” and so on.

original: dngos kun zhes bya ba ni phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid kyi dngos po rnams so //
analyzed: dngos kun zhes bya ba ni phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid kyi dngos po rnams so //
translated: “ All things” are things that have the nature of the inner and the outer.

original: yang dag brdzun pa mthong ba yis //
analyzed: yang dag brdzun pa mthong ba yis //
translated: By seeing the true and the false,

original: dngos rnyed ces bya ba ni yang dag par brdzun pa mthong ba ste /
analyzed: dngos rnyed ces bya ba ni yang dag par brdzun pa mthong ba ste /
translated: “The object found” is the perception of what is real and what is unreal.

original: dmigs pa des bdag nyid thob pa yin gyi /
analyzed: dmigs pa des bdag nyid thob pa yin gyi /
translated: By that perception, one obtains the self.

original: dngos su ni yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'i tha tshig go //🔽ngo bo gnyis ni 'dzin par 'gyur //
analyzed: dngos su ni yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'i tha tshig go // ngo bo gnyis ni 'dzin par 'gyur //
translated: The meaning is that it does not exist in reality.

original: zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob dang / don dam pa'i rang bzhin gnyis yod pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob dang / don dam pa'i rang bzhin gnyis yod pa'o //
translated: “It has two natures” means that it has two natures, the conventional and the ultimate.

original: yang dag mthong yul gang de de nyid de //
analyzed: yang dag mthong yul gang de de nyid de //
translated: “The object of the vision of reality is thatness.”

original: zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa phyin ci ma log pa dmigs pa gang la yod pa de ni yang dag par mthong ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa phyin ci ma log pa dmigs pa gang la yod pa de ni yang dag par mthong ba ste /
translated: The meaning is that the vision of reality is the vision of what is real, not unreal, and the object of that vision is the reality of things.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin phyin ci ma log par thugs su chud pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams so //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin phyin ci ma log par thugs su chud pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams so //
translated: The Bhagavat Buddhas are those who have realized the reality of things without error.

original: de rnams kyi yul gang yin pa de ni de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: de rnams kyi yul gang yin pa de ni de kho na nyid do //
translated: The object of those Buddhas is thatness.

original: de dag gi yul dang yul can gyi dngos po ni yul dang yul can mi dmigs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi yul dang yul can gyi dngos po ni yul dang yul can mi dmigs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The object and subject of that vision is the non-perception of object and subject.

original: mthong ba brdzun pa kun rdzob bden par gsungs //
analyzed: mthong ba brdzun pa kun rdzob bden par gsungs //
translated: False seeing is said to be conventional truth.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: mthong ba brdzun pa ni phyin ci ma log pa'i de kho na nyid ma rtogs pa dang / dngos po brdzun pa rnams la mngon par zhen pas so //
analyzed: mthong ba brdzun pa ni phyin ci ma log pa'i de kho na nyid ma rtogs pa dang / dngos po brdzun pa rnams la mngon par zhen pas so //
translated: False seeing is due to not understanding reality without error and to strong attachment to false things.

original: de rnams kyi yul gang yin pa de ni kun rdzob yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi yul gang yin pa de ni kun rdzob yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: The object of those is the conventional.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that,

original: 'di na bden pa gnyis kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di na bden pa gnyis kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “Here, the two truths . . .” and so on.

original: 'di na zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
analyzed: 'di na zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
translated: “Here” means in the context of the conventional and the ultimate.

original: @141a * // ye shes kyi khyad par gyi yul nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pa ni ye shes kyi khyad par yin la /
analyzed: @141a * // ye shes kyi khyad par gyi yul nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pa ni ye shes kyi khyad par yin la /
translated: “Due to the object of the special wisdom” means that the special wisdom is the abandonment of the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience together with their propensities.

original: de'i yul nyid kyi sgo nas bdag gi rang gi dngos po rnyed pa ste /
analyzed: de'i yul nyid kyi sgo nas bdag gi rang gi dngos po rnyed pa ste /
translated: The object of that is the discovery of the nature of reality.

original: gnyis mi dmigs pa'i sgo nas gang nyams su myong ba spros pa thams cad dang bral ba'i rang bzhin can yin no zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnyis mi dmigs pa'i sgo nas gang nyams su myong ba spros pa thams cad dang bral ba'i rang bzhin can yin no zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that whatever is experienced by the non-apprehension of the duality is of the nature of the absence of all conceptual elaborations.

original: de'i yul nyid kyis bdag gi ngo bo rnyed pa yin gyi zhes bya ba 'di yang gdul bya rnams kyis de ltar brtags pa yin pas de ltar brjod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i yul nyid kyis bdag gi ngo bo rnyed pa yin gyi zhes bya ba 'di yang gdul bya rnams kyis de ltar brtags pa yin pas de ltar brjod pa yin gyi /
translated: And this “own nature” of it is found by the object itself. This is what is said by the disciples, imagining it to be so.

original: don dam pa'i gnas skabs na ni yul dang yul can cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam pa'i gnas skabs na ni yul dang yul can cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But in the ultimate sense, there is not even the slightest existence of subject and object.

original: rang gi bdag nyid kyis grub pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni de'i yod pa dang / med pa dang gnyis ka dang gnyis ka ma yin pa'i ngo bor ma grub pas so //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid kyis grub pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni de'i yod pa dang / med pa dang gnyis ka dang gnyis ka ma yin pa'i ngo bor ma grub pas so //
translated: “Not by own nature” means that it is not established as having the nature of existence, non-existence, both, or neither.

original: 'di ni ngo bo nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i bden pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di ni ngo bo nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i bden pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: “This is its nature” means that it is the nature of ultimate truth.

original: gzhan ni zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
translated: “The other” means conventional truth.

original: ci lta ba de lta bu'i rang bzhin du rang gi ngo bos 'gyur ba'i ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ci ltar so so'i skye bo rnams kyis dngos po yod pa dang med pa la sogs par brtags pa yin gyi /
analyzed: ci lta ba de lta bu'i rang bzhin du rang gi ngo bos 'gyur ba'i ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ci ltar so so'i skye bo rnams kyis dngos po yod pa dang med pa la sogs par brtags pa yin gyi /
translated: It is not that things exist by way of their own nature as they are imagined to be by ordinary beings, as existent, nonexistent, and so on.

original: de lta bu'i rang bzhin ni med pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rang bzhin ni med pa yin te /
translated: That nature does not exist,

original: yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa rigs pas mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa rigs pas mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because existence, nonexistence, and so on are not tenable through reasoning.

original: /'dzin pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa'i sgo nas rang bzhin de dag yod pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: /'dzin pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa'i sgo nas rang bzhin de dag yod pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: “Apprehended” means that those natures exist from the perspective of realization.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid kyi'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid kyi'o //
translated: “Its” refers to reality.

original: rang gi ngo bo ni bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ni bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Its nature” will be explained.

original: rab rib mthu yis skra shad la sogs pa'i //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa de'i rang bzhin 'chad par 'gyur bas so ;🔽/ da ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i dbye ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rab rib mthu yis skra shad la sogs pa'i // zhes bya ba la sogs pa de'i rang bzhin 'chad par 'gyur bas so ; / da ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i dbye ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: “Through the power of eye disease, hairs and so on are seen” and so on.

original: de'i phyir de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Now, in order to teach the divisions of conventional truth, he says “Therefore, like that . . .” and so on.
