original: bden pa gnyis rnam par bzhag nas zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa dang / brdzun pa mthong ba'i yul gyi sgo nas bden pa gnyis su rnam par bzhag nas so //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis rnam par bzhag nas zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa dang / brdzun pa mthong ba'i yul gyi sgo nas bden pa gnyis su rnam par bzhag nas so //
translated: Having posited the two realities, i.e., having posited the two realities from the point of view of the perception of the real and the unreal,

original: mthong ba brdzun pa rnams la yang ;
analyzed: mthong ba brdzun pa rnams la yang ;
translated: even in the case of false seeing,

original: / zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa rnams la yang ngo //
analyzed: / zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa rnams la yang ngo //
translated: i.e., even in the case of worldly people.🔽From the point of view of real and false seeing,

original: mthong ba yang dag pa dang brdzun pa nyid las zhes bya ba ni go sla'o //
analyzed: mthong ba yang dag pa dang brdzun pa nyid las zhes bya ba ni go sla'o //
translated: i.e., it is easy to understand.

original: gal te mthong ba brdzun pa'i kun rdzob bden par gsungs zhes pa'i tshig des 'jig rten pa'i thams cad brdzun par mthong bar gsungs pas de rnams yang dag pa'i @141b mthong ba ci ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mthong ba brdzun pa'i kun rdzob bden par gsungs zhes pa'i tshig des 'jig rten pa'i thams cad brdzun par mthong bar gsungs pas de rnams yang dag pa'i @141b mthong ba ci ltar yin zhe na /
translated: If one says that the false seeing is said to be the conventional reality, then, since all of the worldly people are said to have false seeing, how can they have real seeing?

original: 'phags pa rnams la ltos nas thams cad brdzun par mthong ba yin pas so //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams la ltos nas thams cad brdzun par mthong ba yin pas so //
translated: Because, in relation to the noble ones, all of them have false seeing.

original: 'phags pa rnams la ltos nas brdzun par mthong ba yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams la ltos nas brdzun par mthong ba yin du zin kyang /
translated: Even though, in relation to the noble ones, they have false seeing,

original: 'jig rten pa rnams la rab rib la sogs pa'i rnam 'gyur gyi stobs dang / de dang bral bas brdzun par mthong ba dang / yang dag mthong ba dag yod de //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa rnams la rab rib la sogs pa'i rnam 'gyur gyi stobs dang / de dang bral bas brdzun par mthong ba dang / yang dag mthong ba dag yod de //
translated: For worldly people, there is the power of the transformation of cataracts, etc., and the seeing of falsity and the seeing of reality by those who are free from that.

original: bden pa dang bden pa ma yin par mngon par zhen pas so //
analyzed: bden pa dang bden pa ma yin par mngon par zhen pas so //
translated: Because of the adherence to truth and falsity.

original: 'phags pa rnams la ltos nas ma yin pas skyon yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams la ltos nas ma yin pas skyon yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the case that there is an error in relation to the noble ones, because they are not taken as the referent.

original: gnyis yod pas zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa dang / brdzun pa mthong ba yod pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis yod pas zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa dang / brdzun pa mthong ba yod pa'o //
translated: Because of the existence of the two, means because of the existence of the seeing of reality and the seeing of falsity.

original: des gzung bar bya ba'i don dang zhes bya ba ni yang dag par brdzun pas gzung bar bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des gzung bar bya ba'i don dang zhes bya ba ni yang dag par brdzun pas gzung bar bya ba'i don to //
translated: The object that is grasped by that, means the object that is grasped by the true and the false.

original: shes pa'i zhes bya ba ni 'dzin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa'i zhes bya ba ni 'dzin par byed pa'o //
translated: Knowledge, means the grasper.

original: gnyis nyid ces bya ba ni yang dag pa dang brdzun pa'i rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: gnyis nyid ces bya ba ni yang dag pa dang brdzun pa'i rang bzhin can no //
translated: The duality, means the nature of the true and the false.

original: gnyis 'dod de zhes bya ba la gnyis bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gnyis 'dod de zhes bya ba la gnyis bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The two are accepted, means the two are taught.

original: dbang po gsal dang dbang po skyon ldan no //
analyzed: dbang po gsal dang dbang po skyon ldan no //
translated: The clear sense faculty and the defective sense faculty.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The passage beginning with the words:🔽Therein, a clear sense faculty is one that is not impaired by internal cataracts, etc., or by external causes such as the rapid spinning of a firebrand, etc., and is a sense faculty of the mind that is not impaired by bad treatises, etc.🔽An impaired sense faculty is the opposite of that.🔽The cognition that depends on a clear sense faculty🔽is non-erroneous with regard to the object.

original: de la dbang po gsal ba ni nang gi rab rib la sogs pa dang / phyi'i mgal me myur du bskor ba la sogs pas ma bcos pa'i mig la sogs pa dang / bstan bcos ngan pa la sogs pas ma bcos pa'i yid kyi dbang po gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la dbang po gsal ba ni nang gi rab rib la sogs pa dang / phyi'i mgal me myur du bskor ba la sogs pas ma bcos pa'i mig la sogs pa dang / bstan bcos ngan pa la sogs pas ma bcos pa'i yid kyi dbang po gang yin pa'o //
translated: The cognition that depends on an impaired sense faculty🔽is erroneous with regard to the object.🔽Therein, a clear sense faculty is one that is not impaired by internal cataracts, etc., or by external causes such as the rapid spinning of a firebrand, etc., and is a sense faculty of the mind that is not impaired by bad treatises, etc.

original: dbang po skyon dang ldan pa ni de las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po skyon dang ldan pa ni de las bzlog pa'o //
translated: An impaired sense faculty is the opposite of that.🔽The cognition that depends on a clear sense faculty

original: dbang po legs gyur shes ltos la //
analyzed: dbang po legs gyur shes ltos la //
translated: is non-erroneous with regard to the object.🔽The cognition that depends on an impaired sense faculty🔽is erroneous with regard to the object.🔽Therein, a clear sense faculty is one that is not impaired by internal cataracts, etc., or by external causes such as the rapid spinning of a firebrand, etc., and is a sense faculty of the mind that is not impaired by bad treatises, etc.🔽An impaired sense faculty is the opposite of that.🔽The cognition that depends on a clear sense faculty🔽is non-erroneous with regard to the object.🔽The cognition that depends on an impaired sense faculty

original: zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i skyon dang bral ba'i shes pa la ltos nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i skyon dang bral ba'i shes pa la ltos nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: is erroneous with regard to the object.🔽Therein, a clear sense faculty is one that is not impaired by internal cataracts, etc., or by external causes such as the rapid spinning of a firebrand, etc., and is a sense faculty of the mind that is not impaired by bad treatises, etc.

original: de la dbang po gsal ba can ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nang gi 'khrul pa rgyu dang bral bar ston pa yin la /
analyzed: de la dbang po gsal ba can ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nang gi 'khrul pa rgyu dang bral bar ston pa yin la /
translated: An impaired sense faculty is the opposite of that.🔽The cognition that depends on a clear sense faculty🔽is non-erroneous with regard to the object.🔽The cognition that depends on an impaired sense faculty🔽is erroneous with regard to the object.🔽Therein, a clear sense faculty is one that is not impaired by internal cataracts, etc., or by external causes such as the rapid spinning of a firebrand, etc., and is a sense faculty of the mind that is not impaired by bad treatises, etc.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i phyi rol gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phyi rol gyi 'khrul pa'i rgyu dang bral bar ston pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i phyi rol gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phyi rol gyi 'khrul pa'i rgyu dang bral bar ston pa yin te /
translated: An impaired sense faculty is the opposite of that.🔽The cognition that depends on a

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i phyi rol gyi yul zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi dngos po ji ltar yod pa de bzhin du'o //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i phyi rol gyi yul zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi dngos po ji ltar yod pa de bzhin du'o //
translated: Such a form is called an external object, just as it exists as an external entity.

original: de las bzlog pa dag ni zhes bya ba ni nang dang phyi'i 'khrul pa'i rgyu dang ldan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa dag ni zhes bya ba ni nang dang phyi'i 'khrul pa'i rgyu dang ldan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The opposite of that is that which possesses the cause of internal and external error.

original: de bzhin du yul yang yin no zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa dang brdzun pa'i bdag nyid can gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yul yang yin no zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa dang brdzun pa'i bdag nyid can gang yin pa'o //
translated: Similarly, an object is also like that, which has the nature of the real and the false.

original: dbang po drug rnams kyi yang zhes bya ba ni mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi dbang po rnams kyi yang ngo //🔽'jig rten nyid las bden yin zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa rnams kyis bden @142a * //
analyzed: dbang po drug rnams kyi yang zhes bya ba ni mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi dbang po rnams kyi yang ngo // 'jig rten nyid las bden yin zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa rnams kyis bden @142a * //
translated: The six sense faculties are also like that, referring to the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mental faculties.

original: par mngon par zhen pas bden pa yin gyi /
analyzed: par mngon par zhen pas bden pa yin gyi /
translated: In the world, it is true means that it is true because worldly people are attached to it as true.

original: don dam par ni bden pa ma yin no zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: don dam par ni bden pa ma yin no zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: In the ultimate sense, it is not true. This is the meaning.

original: lhag ma ni zhes bya ba ni nye bar bcos pa'i dbang po drug gi gzung bar bya ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni zhes bya ba ni nye bar bcos pa'i dbang po drug gi gzung bar bya ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The rest is that which is to be grasped by the remaining six sense faculties that are to be corrected.

original: da du ra zos pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: da du ra zos pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Having eaten the fruit of the datura, etc.

original: da du ra ni thang phrom ste /
analyzed: da du ra ni thang phrom ste /
translated: Datura is a kind of fruit.

original: de'i 'bras bu zos na thams cad gser du snang ba'o //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu zos na thams cad gser du snang ba'o //
translated: Having eaten its fruit, everything appears to be gold.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni rims la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni rims la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The word “etc.” includes fever, etc.

original: dbang po la gnod pa'i rkyen phyi rol na yod pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dbang po la gnod pa'i rkyen phyi rol na yod pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the external conditions that harm the sense faculties,

original: til mar dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: til mar dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “oil, etc.”

original: de la til mar dang / chu dang / me long rnams kyi gzugs brnyan 'dzin pa'i rgyu yin la /🔽brag phug la sogs pa nas brjod pa'i sgra ni brag ca 'dzin pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de la til mar dang / chu dang / me long rnams kyi gzugs brnyan 'dzin pa'i rgyu yin la / brag phug la sogs pa nas brjod pa'i sgra ni brag ca 'dzin pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: There, oil, water, and a mirror are the causes for apprehending a reflection.🔽The sound that is expressed from a cave, etc. is the cause for apprehending an echo.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni lha khang dang / dpang sa mtho ba la sogs pa nas brjod pa'i sgra bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni lha khang dang / dpang sa mtho ba la sogs pa nas brjod pa'i sgra bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The word “etc.” includes the sound that is expressed from a temple, a high wall, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgra gnyis pas ni rnga brdung ba la sogs pa'i sgra bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgra gnyis pas ni rnga brdung ba la sogs pa'i sgra bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The two terms “etc.” include the sound of a drum being beaten, and so on.

original: yul dang / dus khyad par can dang nye bar gyur ba'i nyi ma'i 'od zer la sogs pa rnams ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yul dang / dus khyad par can dang nye bar gyur ba'i nyi ma'i 'od zer la sogs pa rnams ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: The light rays of the sun, etc., that are in a special place and time.

original: yul khyad par can ni mya ngan gyi thang la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yul khyad par can ni mya ngan gyi thang la sogs pa'o //
translated: A special place is a plain of misery, and so on.

original: dus khyad par can ni nyi ma gung la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dus khyad par can ni nyi ma gung la sogs pa'o //
translated: A special time is noon, and so on.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni sbrul la sogs par 'khrul pa'i rgyu mun nag la sogs par gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni sbrul la sogs par 'khrul pa'i rgyu mun nag la sogs par gzung bar bya'o //
translated: The term “etc.” includes darkness, and so on, which are the causes of error in a snake, and so on.

original: dbang po la gnod pa'i rkyen zhes bya ba ni de rnams kyi dngos su dbang po la rnam 'gyur med du zin kyang til mar la sogs pa'i dbang gis smig rgyu la sogs par snang ba 'byung ba'i phyir dbang po la rnam 'gyur byas pa lta bur gyur
analyzed: dbang po la gnod pa'i rkyen zhes bya ba ni de rnams kyi dngos su dbang po la rnam 'gyur med du zin kyang til mar la sogs pa'i dbang gis smig rgyu la sogs par snang ba 'byung ba'i phyir dbang po la rnam 'gyur byas pa lta bur gyur
translated: The condition that harms the sense faculty is that, even though there is no direct change in the sense faculty, because of the power of sesame oil, and so on, an appearance such as a mirage arises.

original: pa'i sgo nas dbang po la gnod pa'i rkyen no //
analyzed: pa'i sgo nas dbang po la gnod pa'i rkyen no //
translated: Therefore, it is a condition that harms the sense faculty by way of a change in the sense faculty.

original: de nyid kyi phyir ;
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ;
translated: For that very reason,

original: de dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //🔽sngags dang sman la sogs pa dag kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni nor bu la sogs pa gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // sngags dang sman la sogs pa dag kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni nor bu la sogs pa gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Those, etc.🔽And the words “and so on” in “mantra, medicine, etc.” should be understood to include gems, etc.

original: mig 'phrul mkhan la sogs pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni sngags mkhan bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: mig 'phrul mkhan la sogs pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni sngags mkhan bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: And the words “and so on” in “magicians, etc.” should be understood to include mantra-users.

original: de dag dang zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa'i dbang po la gnod pa'i rkyen rnams so //
analyzed: de dag dang zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa'i dbang po la gnod pa'i rkyen rnams so //
translated: Those, etc. refers to the conditions that harm the faculties as previously explained.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pas byas pa'i grub pa'i mtha' zhes bya ba ni mu stegs pas byas pa'i grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pas byas pa'i grub pa'i mtha' zhes bya ba ni mu stegs pas byas pa'i grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: The philosophy that is fabricated by the unreal is the philosophy fabricated by the tīrthikas.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni 'jigs pa la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni 'jigs pa la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The words “and so on” include fear, etc.

original: rjes su dpag pa ltar snang ba dag ste zhes bya ba ni @142b gson po'i lus 'di chos can dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ltar snang ba dag ste zhes bya ba ni @142b gson po'i lus 'di chos can dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: The apparent inferences are, for example, “This living body is the subject.

original: srog dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: srog dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: It has life because it has breath.”

original: rmi lam la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni 'khrul pa'i shes pa gzhan rnams bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: rmi lam la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni 'khrul pa'i shes pa gzhan rnams bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The phrase “in dreams, etc.” includes other erroneous cognitions.

original: rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Designation” means

original: bden pa dang brdzun pa'i rnam gzhag go //
analyzed: bden pa dang brdzun pa'i rnam gzhag go //
translated: the designation of truth and falsity.

original: 'chad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni ci ltar rmi lam zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni ci ltar rmi lam zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “Will be explained” means that it will be explained by “Just like a dream, etc.”

original: 'jig rten pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas bden pa dang brdzun pa'i rnam gzhag bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas bden pa dang brdzun pa'i rnam gzhag bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the designation of truth and falsity in accordance with the world,

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “Thus, etc.”

original: 'jig rten nyid la ltos nas log pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pas de la brdzun pa nyid du rtogs pas so //
analyzed: 'jig rten nyid la ltos nas log pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pas de la brdzun pa nyid du rtogs pas so //
translated: “False in relation to the world itself” means that the world understands it to be false.

original: bshad zin pa'i don zhes bya ba ni gzugs brnyan la sogs pa rnams 'jig rten pa nyid la ltos nas log pa yin no zhes bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bshad zin pa'i don zhes bya ba ni gzugs brnyan la sogs pa rnams 'jig rten pa nyid la ltos nas log pa yin no zhes bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: “The meaning that has been explained” refers to the teaching that reflections, etc. are false in relation to the world itself.

original: dpe bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dpe bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the example,🔽he says,

original: mi shes pa gnyid kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mi shes pa gnyid kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Ignorance is sleep, etc.

original: mi shes pa ni gti mug yin la /
analyzed: mi shes pa ni gti mug yin la /
translated: Ignorance is delusion.

original: de nyid gnyid yin te /
analyzed: de nyid gnyid yin te /
translated: That itself is sleep,

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin yongs su mi shes pas so //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin yongs su mi shes pas so //
translated: because the nature of entities is not fully understood.

original: skyod ces bya ba ni mi rigs pa'i g-yo bar byas pa'o //
analyzed: skyod ces bya ba ni mi rigs pa'i g-yo bar byas pa'o //
translated: “Agitation” is improper movement.

original: bdag nyid ji bzhin brtags pa dang // zhes bya ba ni gti mug gi stobs kyis yon tan gsum la sogs pa brtags pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid ji bzhin brtags pa dang // zhes bya ba ni gti mug gi stobs kyis yon tan gsum la sogs pa brtags pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: “Imagined just as it is” is what is imagined by the power of delusion, such as the three qualities, etc.

original: sgyu ma smig rgyu la sogs pa //
analyzed: sgyu ma smig rgyu la sogs pa //
translated: Illusions, mirages, etc.

original: zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma la glang po la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang / smig rgyu la chu'i rnam pa dang / sogs pa'i sgras thag pa la sogs pa'i sgras sbrul la sogs pa'i rnam pas brtags pa gang yin pa de rnams 'jig rten las kyang bden pa nyid du yod pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma la glang po la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang / smig rgyu la chu'i rnam pa dang / sogs pa'i sgras thag pa la sogs pa'i sgras sbrul la sogs pa'i rnam pas brtags pa gang yin pa de rnams 'jig rten las kyang bden pa nyid du yod pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: The forms of elephants, etc., in illusions, the forms of water in mirages, and the forms of snakes, etc., in ropes, etc., which are imagined by the word “etc.,” do not exist even in the world as real entities.

original: 'jig rten pas phyin ci log nyid du shes pa yin no zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'jig rten pas phyin ci log nyid du shes pa yin no zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that they are known to be erroneous even by worldly people.

original: 'di ltar gang mu stegs pa'i yongs su brtags pa'i dbang phyug la sogs pa'i dngos po gang yin pa de rnams brtags pa tsam yin gyi /🔽phyi'i dngos po nyid du ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang mu stegs pa'i yongs su brtags pa'i dbang phyug la sogs pa'i dngos po gang yin pa de rnams brtags pa tsam yin gyi / phyi'i dngos po nyid du ni ma yin te /
translated: Thus, whatever things are imagined by the tīrthikas, such as Īśvara, are mere conceptualizations.🔽They are not external things.

original: phyi'i dngos po nyid du mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi'i dngos po nyid du mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They do not appear as external things.

original: des na de rnams 'jig rten pa rnams la ltos nas kyang brdzun pa nyid yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: des na de rnams 'jig rten pa rnams la ltos nas kyang brdzun pa nyid yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, they are false even in relation to worldly people.

original: de nyid 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach just that, he says,

original: mu stegs can zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽de kho na nyid la 'jug par 'dod pas @143a * //
analyzed: mu stegs can zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / de kho na nyid la 'jug par 'dod pas @143a * //
translated: “The tīrthikas…” and so on.

original: zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid mngon du byed pa la 'jug par 'dod pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid mngon du byed pa la 'jug par 'dod pas so //
translated: “Desiring to engage with reality” means desiring to actualize reality.

original: skye bo ma byang ba zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos gang dang ma 'dris pa'o //
analyzed: skye bo ma byang ba zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos gang dang ma 'dris pa'o //
translated: “Uneducated people” are those who are not familiar with any treatises.

original: gnag rdzi dang bud med la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni byis pa la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnag rdzi dang bud med la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni byis pa la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: “Cowherds, women, and so on” and so on means that children and so on are included.

original: de rnams la rab tu grags pa'i dngos po ni sa bon dang myu gu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams la rab tu grags pa'i dngos po ni sa bon dang myu gu la sogs pa'o //
translated: The things that are well known to them are seeds, sprouts, and so on.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni dngos po'i ngo bo bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni dngos po'i ngo bo bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: “Arising, ceasing, and so on” should be understood to include the nature of things.

original: nges par ma bzung ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nges par ma bzung ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Not definitely apprehended” means

original: med pa skye ba yod min zhing //
analyzed: med pa skye ba yod min zhing //
translated: that non-existent things do not arise,

original: yod pa 'jig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa 'jig pa ma yin no //
translated: and existent things do not cease.

original: zhes bya bas rang bzhin gyis khug mi'i nang nas 'byung ba dang 'jug pa'i sgo nas skye ba dang / 'jig par brjod pas skye ba dang / 'jig par nges par ma brjod pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya bas rang bzhin gyis khug mi'i nang nas 'byung ba dang 'jug pa'i sgo nas skye ba dang / 'jig par brjod pas skye ba dang / 'jig par nges par ma brjod pa'o //
translated: Thus, arising and ceasing are not definitely stated in terms of arising and ceasing through the door of emergence and entry by the power of intrinsic nature, but are stated in terms of arising and ceasing through the door of emergence and entry by the power of conditions.

original: gzugs la sogs pa las tha dad du gyur pa'i yan lag can du brtags pa'i phyir dngos po ngo bo nges par ma bzung ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa las tha dad du gyur pa'i yan lag can du brtags pa'i phyir dngos po ngo bo nges par ma bzung ba'o //
translated: The nature of things is not definitely apprehended because it is imagined to have parts that are different from form and so on.

original: phul du byung bar 'gro bar 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid rtogs pas 'jig rten pa thams cad las phul du byung bas 'gro bar 'dod pas so //
analyzed: phul du byung bar 'gro bar 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid rtogs pas 'jig rten pa thams cad las phul du byung bas 'gro bar 'dod pas so //
translated: “Desiring to go to excellence” means desiring to go to excellence over all worldly beings through realizing reality.

original: yal ga snga ma btang bas zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten la grags pa'i ji ltar gnas pa'i kun rdzob kyi bden pa yongs su dor nas so //
analyzed: yal ga snga ma btang bas zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten la grags pa'i ji ltar gnas pa'i kun rdzob kyi bden pa yongs su dor nas so //
translated: The phrase having abandoned the former branch refers to the fact that one has completely rejected the conventional truth as it is known in the world.

original: yal ga phyi ma bzung ba ltar zhes bya ba ni yal ga phyi ma don dam pa'i bden pa ma bzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yal ga phyi ma bzung ba ltar zhes bya ba ni yal ga phyi ma don dam pa'i bden pa ma bzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase having seized the latter branch refers to the fact that one has not seized the latter branch, which is the truth of ultimate reality.

original: lta ba ngan pa'i ri sul dag tu ltung bar 'gyur zhing zhes bya ba ni lta ba ngan pa'i yon tan gsum la sogs pa yod par lta ba'o //
analyzed: lta ba ngan pa'i ri sul dag tu ltung bar 'gyur zhing zhes bya ba ni lta ba ngan pa'i yon tan gsum la sogs pa yod par lta ba'o //
translated: One will fall into the crevasse of bad views refers to the bad views that are the three qualities, etc.

original: de nyid ri ste gzhig par dka' bas so //
analyzed: de nyid ri ste gzhig par dka' bas so //
translated: That is a mountain because it is difficult to destroy.

original: sul ni lta ba ngan pa'i phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: sul ni lta ba ngan pa'i phyogs gcig go //
translated: A crevasse is a part of a bad view.

original: ltung ba ni lta ba ngan pa'i phyogs gcig po de la zhen pa'o //
analyzed: ltung ba ni lta ba ngan pa'i phyogs gcig po de la zhen pa'o //
translated: Falling is the attachment to that part of a bad view.

original: 'bras bu mi thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid khong du chud pa'i rang bzhin can gyi 'bras bu mi thob pas so //
analyzed: 'bras bu mi thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid khong du chud pa'i rang bzhin can gyi 'bras bu mi thob pas so //
translated: One will not obtain the fruit refers to the fact that one will not obtain the fruit that has the nature of the realization of reality.

original: 'di'i don ni ci ltar shing thog don du gnyer ba'i skyes bu shing thog thob par bya ba'i ched du shing thog dang bcas pa'i sdong po la 'dzeg cing yal ga snga ma btang nas yal ga phyi ma ma bzung na shing thog ma thob par g-yang sa
analyzed: 'di'i don ni ci ltar shing thog don du gnyer ba'i skyes bu shing thog thob par bya ba'i ched du shing thog dang bcas pa'i sdong po la 'dzeg cing yal ga snga ma btang nas yal ga phyi ma ma bzung na shing thog ma thob par g-yang sa
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: Suppose a person who wants fruit climbs a tree with fruit in order to get the fruit. If he lets go of the earlier branch but does not hold on to the next branch, he will not get the fruit, and will fall into the abyss below.🔽

original: chen por lhung bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du mu stegs pa rnams so zhes pa'o //
analyzed: chen por lhung bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du mu stegs pa rnams so zhes pa'o //
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: Just as a person who is seeking fruit climbs a tree that has fruit in order to obtain the fruit, but if he lets go of the former branch without taking hold of the next one, he will not obtain the fruit and will fall into the great abyss below, so it is with the tīrthikas.

original: yon tan gsum la sogs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yon tan gsum la sogs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The three qualities, etc.

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / btang snyoms @143b kyi mtshan nyid can gyi rdul dang / mun pa dang / snying stobs gsum ni yon tan no //
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / btang snyoms @143b kyi mtshan nyid can gyi rdul dang / mun pa dang / snying stobs gsum ni yon tan no //
translated: The three qualities are the three: rajas, tamas, and sattva, which have the characteristics of pain, pleasure, and indifference.

original: de rnams cha mnyam pa la rang bzhin zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de rnams cha mnyam pa la rang bzhin zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Their equality is called “nature.”

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni dbang phyug la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni dbang phyug la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The word “etc.” includes Īśvara, etc.

original: de dag ni 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob tu yang yod pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni ji ltar mu stegs pa rnams kyis brtags pa de bzhin du 'jig rten pa rnams la mi snang ba'i phyir brtags pa tsam du yod pa ma yin pas
analyzed: de dag ni 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob tu yang yod pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni ji ltar mu stegs pa rnams kyis brtags pa de bzhin du 'jig rten pa rnams la mi snang ba'i phyir brtags pa tsam du yod pa ma yin pas
translated: They do not exist even in the conventional sense of the world. This is because they do not exist as mere conceptual imputations, since they do not appear to worldly people in the way that they are imagined by the tīrthikas.

original: so // de ltar 'jig rten pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i dbye ba'i rnam gzhag byas nas 'jig rten gyi mngon sum gzhan las skye ba 'gog pa la gnod byed ma yin no zhes bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: so // de ltar 'jig rten pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i dbye ba'i rnam gzhag byas nas 'jig rten gyi mngon sum gzhan las skye ba 'gog pa la gnod byed ma yin no zhes bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus, having followed the worldly perspective in positing the divisions of conventional truth, he says that this does not undermine the refutation of arising from other as it is perceived by the worldly perspective.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: To explain this, Bhāviveka says, “Therefore, . . .”

original: phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir 'phags pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i dbang du byas nas don dam pa dang / kun rdzob kyi rnam gzhag byas nas so //
analyzed: phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir 'phags pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i dbang du byas nas don dam pa dang / kun rdzob kyi rnam gzhag byas nas so //
translated: “Therefore” means that, having posited ultimate and conventional truth from the perspective of the noble ones and worldly people, respectively, . . .

original: 'dir zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa'i rnam gzhag gi skabs su'o //
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa'i rnam gzhag gi skabs su'o //
translated: “Here” refers to the context of positing conventional and ultimate truth.

original: ji ltar rab rib can gyi dmigs pa yis //
analyzed: ji ltar rab rib can gyi dmigs pa yis //
translated: Just as the object of one with diseased vision

original: zhes bya ba ni dbang po skyon dang bcas pa rnams kyi shes pa skra shad la sogs pa snang ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dbang po skyon dang bcas pa rnams kyi shes pa skra shad la sogs pa snang ba'o //
translated: This is the consciousness of those with defective faculties, such as the appearance of floating hairs and so on.

original: rab rib med shes la gnod min //
analyzed: rab rib med shes la gnod min //
translated: The stainless consciousness is not harmed.

original: zhes bya ba ni dbang po skyon dang mi ldan pa'i shes pa skra shad la sogs pa mi snang ba la mi gnod pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dbang po skyon dang mi ldan pa'i shes pa skra shad la sogs pa mi snang ba la mi gnod pa ste /
translated: This is the consciousness of those with unimpaired faculties, such as the nonappearance of floating hairs and so on. It is not harmed.

original: 'jig rten pa la de ltar ma grags so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa la de ltar ma grags so //
translated: This is not renowned in the world.

original: de bzhin du dri med ye shes spangs pa'i blo ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du dri med ye shes spangs pa'i blo ste /
translated: Likewise, the mind that is devoid of stainless wisdom

original: dri ma med pa ni zag pa med pa yin la /
analyzed: dri ma med pa ni zag pa med pa yin la /
translated: is stainless, that is, uncontaminated.

original: de spangs pa'i blo gang la yod pa ste /
analyzed: de spangs pa'i blo gang la yod pa ste /
translated: The mind that is devoid of that

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten pas zhes pa'o //🔽de rnams kyi shes pas dri med blo la ste /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten pas zhes pa'o // de rnams kyi shes pas dri med blo la ste /
translated: is contaminated, that is, mundane.🔽The consciousness of those🔽does not harm the stainless mind.

original: zag pa med pa'i ye shes la gnod pa yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i ye shes la gnod pa yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: That is, it does not harm stainless wisdom.

original: des na 'jig rten pa'i mngon sum gyis gzhan la skye ba grub pas 'phags pa'i spyod yul du gyur pa'i gzhan las skye ba med pa la gnod pa yod par 'gyur pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: des na 'jig rten pa'i mngon sum gyis gzhan la skye ba grub pas 'phags pa'i spyod yul du gyur pa'i gzhan las skye ba med pa la gnod pa yod par 'gyur pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, since arising from another is established by the direct perception of the world, it is not the case that there is any contradiction in the arising from another that is the domain of the āryas.🔽This is the meaning.

original: de nyid 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach just this, the Commentary says:

original: gzhan las skye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan las skye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Arising from another” and so on.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyis gzigs pa khas blangs nas yin no zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa rnams kyis gzhan las skye ba bden pa nyid du ma gzigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyis gzigs pa khas blangs nas yin no zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa rnams kyis gzhan las skye ba bden pa nyid du ma gzigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Because the āryas have seen it” means that because the āryas have seen arising from another as not being true,

original: skye ba dgag pa 'di @144a * //
analyzed: skye ba dgag pa 'di @144a * //
translated: this refutation of arising

original: khyad par du yin pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khyad par du yin pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: is “in particular.”

original: skye ba dgag pa ni 'phags pa rnams la ltos nas brjod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: skye ba dgag pa ni 'phags pa rnams la ltos nas brjod pa yin gyi /
translated: This refutation of arising is stated in reliance on the āryas,

original: 'jig rten pa la ltos nas ni brjod pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa la ltos nas ni brjod pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: but it is not stated in reliance on the worldly.

original: de lta bu'i yul la zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i skye bo rnams kyi spyod yul lo //
analyzed: de lta bu'i yul la zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i skye bo rnams kyi spyod yul lo //
translated: “Such an object” is the domain of experience of the noble ones.

original: gzhan la skye bo brjod pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i shes pas gzhan la skye ba grub pa yin no zhes brjod pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la skye bo brjod pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i shes pas gzhan la skye ba grub pa yin no zhes brjod pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: “The arising of other things” is the establishment of the arising of other things by mundane cognition.

original: de ltar kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi dbye ba brjod pa'i sgo nas 'jig rten pa'i shes pas gnod pa ni gnod pa nyid ma yin no zhes bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi dbye ba brjod pa'i sgo nas 'jig rten pa'i shes pas gnod pa ni gnod pa nyid ma yin no zhes bstan nas /
translated: Having thus shown that the refutation by mundane cognition is not a refutation at all from the perspective of the distinction between the natures of conventional and ultimate truths,

original: da ni kun rdzob kyi nges tshig bstan pa'i sgo nas kun rdzob la 'jig rten pa dang / 'phags pa la ltos nas dbye ba'i rnam gzhag bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni kun rdzob kyi nges tshig bstan pa'i sgo nas kun rdzob la 'jig rten pa dang / 'phags pa la ltos nas dbye ba'i rnam gzhag bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to demonstrate the presentation of the conventional in terms of the mundane and the noble by way of teaching the etymology of “conventional,”

original: de'i phyir 'dis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says “Therefore, this . . .” and so on.

original: gti mug kun rdzob ste zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gti mug kun rdzob ste zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: “Ignorance is the conventional.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sgrib pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sgrib pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, “because it obscures.”

original: gti mug gi stobs kyis yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'i de kho na nyid mi snang ba dang / med pa'i rang bzhin can yod pa dang / med pa la sogs par sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gti mug gi stobs kyis yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'i de kho na nyid mi snang ba dang / med pa'i rang bzhin can yod pa dang / med pa la sogs par sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the power of delusion, reality, which is free from existence, nonexistence, and so on, does not appear, and one superimposes existence and nonexistence and so on onto what is essentially nonexistent.

original: des bya ba ni gti mug gi rang bzhin can gyi kun rdzob kyis so //
analyzed: des bya ba ni gti mug gi rang bzhin can gyi kun rdzob kyis so //
translated: The function of that is by means of the conventional that has the nature of delusion.

original: gang bcos ma zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i dngos po gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gang bcos ma zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i dngos po gang yin pa'o //
translated: That which is called “fabricated” is any dependently arisen thing.

original: bden par snang zhes bya ba ni bden pa'i rang bzhin du zhen pa'o //
analyzed: bden par snang zhes bya ba ni bden pa'i rang bzhin du zhen pa'o //
translated: “Appears as true” means clinging to the nature of true existence.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni bden pa'i rang bzhin du zhen pa'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni bden pa'i rang bzhin du zhen pa'i dngos po'o //
translated: “That” refers to the thing that is clung to as having the nature of true existence.

original: kun rdzob bden zhes thub pa des gsungs te //
analyzed: kun rdzob bden zhes thub pa des gsungs te //
translated: The Sage taught that to be a conventional truth.

original: zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis dngos po de ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis dngos po de ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: The Bhagavān taught that thing to be a conventional truth,

original: 'jig rten pa de ltar zhen pas so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa de ltar zhen pas so //
translated: because worldly people cling to it in that way.

original: bcos mar gyur pa'i dngos po ni kun rdzob tu'o zhes pa ni gang kun rdzob tu rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gzugs brnyan dang brag ca la sogs pa nyon mongs pa can gyi gti mug gis dang / de bzhin du snang ba dang bcas pa'i spyod yul can gyi 'phags pa rnams la shes bya'i sgrib pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i gti mug gi phung po la sogs pa gang snang ba de kun rdzob yin no zhes thub pas gsungs
analyzed: bcos mar gyur pa'i dngos po ni kun rdzob tu'o zhes pa ni gang kun rdzob tu rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gzugs brnyan dang brag ca la sogs pa nyon mongs pa can gyi gti mug gis dang / de bzhin du snang ba dang bcas pa'i spyod yul can gyi 'phags pa rnams la shes bya'i sgrib pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i gti mug gi phung po la sogs pa gang snang ba de kun rdzob yin no zhes thub pas gsungs
translated: The passage “An artificial thing is a concealer” means that the Sage taught that whatever arises dependently in the conventional, such as reflections and echoes, is a concealer, because of afflicted ignorance, and that whatever appears to āryas whose objects of activity are endowed with appearance, such as the aggregates of afflicted ignorance characterized by the obscurations to knowledge, is a concealer.

original: kyi / kun rdzob kyi bden par ni ma yin te /
analyzed: kyi / kun rdzob kyi bden par ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not a concealer truth.

original: 'jig rten dang 'phags pa rnams la ci ltar @144b rigs par de dag la bden par zhen pa med pas so //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'phags pa rnams la ci ltar @144b rigs par de dag la bden par zhen pa med pas so //
translated: Because it is not tenable that those who are attached to the truth of those are attached to the truth of those in the world and in the āryas.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de kun rdzob tsam yin gyi kun rdzob kyi bden pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de kun rdzob tsam yin gyi kun rdzob kyi bden pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore it is a mere concealer, but it is not a concealer truth.

original: 'di'i don ni kun rdzob kyi dbye ba ni gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni kun rdzob kyi dbye ba ni gnyis te /
translated: The divisions of concealer are two.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang / kun rdzob tsam mo //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang / kun rdzob tsam mo //
translated: conventional truth, and mere conventionality.

original: kun rdzob tsam la yang gnyis te /
analyzed: kun rdzob tsam la yang gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of mere conventionality:

original: 'jig rten pa la ltos pa'i kun rdzob dang / 'phags pa la ltos pa'i kun rdzob bo //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa la ltos pa'i kun rdzob dang / 'phags pa la ltos pa'i kun rdzob bo //
translated: conventionality in dependence on the world, and conventionality in dependence on the āryas.

original: de la 'jig rten pa la ltos pa'i kun rdzob tsam ni dper na brag ca la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de la 'jig rten pa la ltos pa'i kun rdzob tsam ni dper na brag ca la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Conventionality in dependence on the world is, for example, like an echo.

original: 'phags pa la ltos pa'i kun rdzob tsam ni snang ba dang bcas pa'i 'phags pa rnams la snang ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa la ltos pa'i kun rdzob tsam ni snang ba dang bcas pa'i 'phags pa rnams la snang ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: Conventionality in dependence on the āryas is that which appears to the āryas who have appearances.

original: de nyid 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽de la 'dis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir / de la 'dis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach just that, he says,🔽“In that regard, this . . .”

original: de la zhes bya ba ni tshigs su bcad pas gti mug la sogs pa brjod pa la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni tshigs su bcad pas gti mug la sogs pa brjod pa la'o //
translated: “In that regard” refers to the verse that mentions delusion, etc.

original: ji ltar gnas pa'i dngos po lta ba la zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi dngos po mthong ba la'o //
analyzed: ji ltar gnas pa'i dngos po lta ba la zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi dngos po mthong ba la'o //
translated: “The view of things as they are” means the seeing of the thing that is emptiness.

original: dngos po ni rang gi ngo bo yod pa ma yin pa sgro 'dogs par byed pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dngos po ni rang gi ngo bo yod pa ma yin pa sgro 'dogs par byed pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “A thing that does not exist by way of its own nature is imputed” means

original: rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo yod pa ma yin pa sgro 'dogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo yod pa ma yin pa sgro 'dogs par byed pa'o //
translated: that a thing’s own nature that is permanent, impermanent, happy, suffering, and so on does not exist but is imputed.

original: rang bzhin mthong ba la sgrib pa'i bdag nyid can zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'i rang bzhin ni de kho na nyid yin la /
analyzed: rang bzhin mthong ba la sgrib pa'i bdag nyid can zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'i rang bzhin ni de kho na nyid yin la /
translated: “It has the nature of obscuring the seeing of the nature” means that the nature that is free from existence, nonexistence, and so on is thatness.

original: mi dmigs pa'i sbyor bas mthong ba gang yin pa de la sgrib par byed pa ste /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i sbyor bas mthong ba gang yin pa de la sgrib par byed pa ste /
translated: It obscures the seeing of thatness that occurs through the application of nonobservation.

original: gti mug yod na de kho na nyid mthong bar mi 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gti mug yod na de kho na nyid mthong bar mi 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that if there is delusion, one will not see thatness.

original: kun rdzob des zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can gyi gti mug gis zhes pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob des zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can gyi gti mug gis zhes pa'o //
translated: “By that obscuration” means by afflicted delusion.

original: bden par snang zhing zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid med pa la yod pa dang / rtag pa la sogs pa'i ngo bor snang ba yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: bden par snang zhing zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid med pa la yod pa dang / rtag pa la sogs pa'i ngo bor snang ba yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: “Appearing as true” means that what is essenceless appears to exist and to have the nature of permanence, etc.

original: 'jig rten phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i ling thog gis phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i ling thog gis phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i zhes pa'o //
translated: “The world, which is in error” means that it is in error due to the cataract of ignorance.

original: kun rdzob tu bden pas zhes bya ba ni gti mug gi bden pa yin gyi /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu bden pas zhes bya ba ni gti mug gi bden pa yin gyi /
translated: “It is true in terms of the conventional” means that it is true in terms of the confused.

original: ngo bo nyid kyi bden pa ni ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi bden pa ni ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: It is not true in terms of the essence.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob kyi bden pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob kyi bden pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: “That” refers to the conventional truth of the world.

original: de ni 'jig rten pa la phyin ci log tu snang ba dang / don dam pa'i bden pa dag kun rdzob kyi bden pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽brten @145a * //
analyzed: de ni 'jig rten pa la phyin ci log tu snang ba dang / don dam pa'i bden pa dag kun rdzob kyi bden pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir / brten @145a * //
translated: In order to demonstrate that the conventional truth is an erroneous appearance for the world and that the ultimate truth is not the conventional truth, he says:

original: nas byung ba gzugs brnyan dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: nas byung ba gzugs brnyan dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Arisen from dependence, like a reflection,” and so on.

original: gzugs dang / sems dang / tshor ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzugs dang / sems dang / tshor ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Form, mind, feeling, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni 'du shes la sogs pa gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni 'du shes la sogs pa gzung bar bya'o //
translated: The word “etc.” includes perception, etc.

original: rang bzhin ni zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'i de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'i de kho na nyid do //
translated: “ Nature” is reality free from existence, nonexistence, etc.

original: ma rig pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i gti mug dang ldan pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i gti mug dang ldan pa rnams la'o //
translated: “ Those who are ignorant” are those who have afflicted and unafflicted delusion.

original: mi snang ngo zhes bya ba ni gegs su gyur pa'i kun du rmongs pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi snang ngo zhes bya ba ni gegs su gyur pa'i kun du rmongs pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “ Do not appear” means that they do not appear because of the confusion that is an obstruction.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni kun rdzob kyi yang ma yin la kun rdzob kyi bden pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni kun rdzob kyi yang ma yin la kun rdzob kyi bden pa yang ma yin te /
translated: “ The conventional truth does not exist” means that the nature is not conventional and is not the conventional truth.

original: gti mug gi stobs kyis mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gti mug gi stobs kyis mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It does not appear because of the power of delusion.

original: gang zhig kun rdzob tu yang brdzun pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs brnyan dang brag ca la sogs pa rnams ni kun rdzob kyi bden par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang zhig kun rdzob tu yang brdzun pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs brnyan dang brag ca la sogs pa rnams ni kun rdzob kyi bden par mi 'gyur te /
translated: What is called “false even conventionally” are reflections, echoes, etc., which are not conventional truths,

original: bden par zhen pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden par zhen pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no adherence to them as real.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa yang ma yin te /
translated: They are not ultimate truths,

original: gti mug gi dbang gis snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gti mug gi dbang gis snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they appear through the power of delusion.

original: des na kun rdzob tsam yin no //
analyzed: des na kun rdzob tsam yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are mere conventionalities.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi ma rig pa'i dbang gis kun rdzob tsam gyi rnam gzhag bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi ma rig pa'i dbang gis kun rdzob tsam gyi rnam gzhag bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The teaching of the arrangement of mere conventionalities through the power of afflicted ignorance is the teaching of the conclusion.

original: de ltar re zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Thus, in the first place, etc.

original: srid pa'i yan lag gis yongs su bsdus pa zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgo nas srid pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis gang brjod pa de ni ma rig pa'i nang nas nyon mongs pa can gyi ma
analyzed: srid pa'i yan lag gis yongs su bsdus pa zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgo nas srid pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis gang brjod pa de ni ma rig pa'i nang nas nyon mongs pa can gyi ma
translated: The phrase “subsumed by the members of existence” refers to the twelve members of existence that are stated in the passage beginning “With ignorance as condition, there are the karmic predispositions,” etc. The afflicted ignorance that is mentioned among them is the ignorance that is the first member of existence.

original: rig pa srid pa'i yan lag tu gang gsungs pa de'i sgo nas kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i rnam gzhag byas nas /
analyzed: rig pa srid pa'i yan lag tu gang gsungs pa de'i sgo nas kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i rnam gzhag byas nas /
translated: Having presented the conventional truth from the perspective of that consciousness which is a member of cyclic existence,

original: da ni srid pa'i yan lag tu ma gyur pa'i nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i ma rig pa'i dbang du byas nas kun rdzob tsam gyi rnam gzhag bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni srid pa'i yan lag tu ma gyur pa'i nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i ma rig pa'i dbang du byas nas kun rdzob tsam gyi rnam gzhag bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to teach the presentation of mere conventionality from the perspective of non-afflicted ignorance, which is not a member of cyclic existence,

original: de yang nyan thos dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de yang nyan thos dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “Moreover, the Sravakas . . . ”

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang / tshor ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang / tshor ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Moreover refers to form, feeling, and so on.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi ma rig pa spangs pa zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i ma rig pa med pas so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi ma rig pa spangs pa zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i ma rig pa med pas so //
translated: Having abandoned afflicted ignorance means that since there is no ignorance which is the cause of cyclic existence,

original: de yang 'du byed thams cad gzugs brnyan la sogs pa dang 'dra bar gzigs pas so //
analyzed: de yang 'du byed thams cad gzugs brnyan la sogs pa dang 'dra bar gzigs pas so //
translated: they see all compositional activity as being like a reflection and so on.

original: gzugs brnyan @145b la sogs pa'i yod pa nyid ji ltar 'jig rten pa rnams kyis bden par mngon par zhen pa med pas brdzun par 'dod la de dang 'dra ba'i gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa'i 'du byed rnams kyang gzigs pa yin pas so //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan @145b la sogs pa'i yod pa nyid ji ltar 'jig rten pa rnams kyis bden par mngon par zhen pa med pas brdzun par 'dod la de dang 'dra ba'i gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa'i 'du byed rnams kyang gzigs pa yin pas so //
translated: Just as the existence of reflections, etc. is considered false by worldly people because they do not conceive them to be real, so also the perception of form, feeling, etc. is like that.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For this very reason,🔽because there is no attachment to the notion of “I” and “mine,” it is not the motivating factor of the mass of afflictions such as passion, and so it is not the cause of samsara.

original: bdag dang bdag gi'o zhes bya ba'i mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i tshogs rnams kyi kun nas slong bar byed pa ma yin pas 'khor ba'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i ma rig pa
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi'o zhes bya ba'i mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i tshogs rnams kyi kun nas slong bar byed pa ma yin pas 'khor ba'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i ma rig pa
translated: Therefore it is called “non-afflicted nescience.”

original: zhes bya'o // bcos ma'i rang bzhin can yin gyi //
analyzed: zhes bya'o // bcos ma'i rang bzhin can yin gyi //
translated: It is of a fabricated nature.

original: zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This means it is dependently originated.

original: bden pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni brdzun pa nyid du rtogs pas kun rdzob tsam yin gyi bden pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bden pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni brdzun pa nyid du rtogs pas kun rdzob tsam yin gyi bden pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not true, that is, it is understood to be false. The meaning is that it is merely conventional, it is not true.

original: kun rdzob tsam du bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: kun rdzob tsam du bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to prove that it is merely conventional,

original: byis pa rnams la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: byis pa rnams la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “For the childish, etc.”

original: gal te kun rdzob tsam yin na //
analyzed: gal te kun rdzob tsam yin na //
translated: If it is merely conventional,

original: byis pa rnams la bden par mngon par zhen pa ji ltar 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: byis pa rnams la bden par mngon par zhen pa ji ltar 'byung zhe na /
translated: how does the adherence to the reality of the conventional arise for the childish?

original: byis pa rnams la ni slu bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: byis pa rnams la ni slu bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He says, “For the childish, it is deceptive, etc.”

original: gang gi phyir kun rdzob 'dis byis pa rnams la bden pa ma yin pa la bden par zhen pas slu bar byed pa yin gyi don dam par bden pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir kun rdzob 'dis byis pa rnams la bden pa ma yin pa la bden par zhen pas slu bar byed pa yin gyi don dam par bden pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Because this conventional reality deceives the childish by causing them to adhere to the unreal as real, it is not ultimately real,

original: sngar bstan pa'i rnam pas rgyu dang 'bras bu dag mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i rnam pas rgyu dang 'bras bu dag mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because, as previously demonstrated, cause and effect are untenable.

original: des na byis pa rnams la ni kun rdzob tsam pa yin no //
analyzed: des na byis pa rnams la ni kun rdzob tsam pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is merely conventional for the childish.

original: de las gzhan pa rnams la ni kun rdzob tsam du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa rnams la ni kun rdzob tsam du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The others are only conventional.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says:

original: de las gzhan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te ;
analyzed: de las gzhan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te ;
translated: Other than that, etc.

original: de las gzhan pa zhes pa ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ni sgyu ma la sogs pa ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid du snang bas kun rdzob tsam du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa zhes pa ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ni sgyu ma la sogs pa ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid du snang bas kun rdzob tsam du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Other than that refers to the Sravakas, Pratyekabuddhas, and Bodhisattvas, for whom dependent origination appears as mere illusion, etc. , and thus is only conventional.

original: gal te nyon mongs pa can gyi ma rig pa log pa yin na de'i tshe sgyu ma la sogs pa ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams ci ltar snang zhe na /
analyzed: gal te nyon mongs pa can gyi ma rig pa log pa yin na de'i tshe sgyu ma la sogs pa ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams ci ltar snang zhe na /
translated: If afflicted ignorance is eliminated, then how do dependent originations appear as mere illusion, etc. ?

original: de la lan ni de yang shes bya'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la lan ni de yang shes bya'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The answer to that is he says: That also is due to the knowledge of the knowable, etc.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma la sogs pa ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid du snang ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma la sogs pa ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid du snang ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: That also refers to the appearance of dependent origination as mere illusion, etc.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa'i mtshan nyid can ma @146a * //
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa'i mtshan nyid can ma @146a * //
translated: Because the mere ignorance that is the characteristic of the obscuration to that which is to be known is active.

original: rig pa tsam kun du spyod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'i de kho na nyid ni shes bya yin la /
analyzed: rig pa tsam kun du spyod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'i de kho na nyid ni shes bya yin la /
translated: The reality free from existence, nonexistence, etc. is that which is to be known.

original: de'i sgrib pa ni gang gis de mi snang bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i sgrib pa ni gang gis de mi snang bar byed pa'o //
translated: The obscuration to that is that which causes it not to appear.

original: de'i mtshan nyid can gyi ma rig pa gang yin pa de tsam zhig kun du spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid can gyi ma rig pa gang yin pa de tsam zhig kun du spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mere ignorance that is the characteristic of that is active.

original: 'di'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows:

original: ma rig pa la rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: ma rig pa la rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Ignorance is twofold:

original: nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
translated: afflicted and unafflicted.

original: de la nyon mongs pa can ni mi shes pa gang bdag dang bdag gi'o snyam pa'i mngon par zhen pa skyed pa'i sgo nas 'khor ba'i rgyur gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa can ni mi shes pa gang bdag dang bdag gi'o snyam pa'i mngon par zhen pa skyed pa'i sgo nas 'khor ba'i rgyur gyur pa'o //
translated: Among these, the afflicted is the ignorance that is the cause of cyclic existence, in that it generates the manifest clinging to “I” and “mine.”

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ni gang gzugs la sogs pa rnams snang ba tsam gyi rgyu yin gyi bden par mngon par zhen pa'i rgyu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ni gang gzugs la sogs pa rnams snang ba tsam gyi rgyu yin gyi bden par mngon par zhen pa'i rgyu ni ma yin no //
translated: Non-afflicted means that it is the cause of the mere appearance of form, etc., but it is not the cause of the adherence to their truth.

original: bden par zhen pa med pa nyid kyis 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams skyed par mi byed pas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bden par zhen pa med pa nyid kyis 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams skyed par mi byed pas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it is not the adherence to their truth, it does not generate the afflictions such as passion, and so it is called non-afflicted.

original: des na nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i ma rig pa tsam kun du spyod pa'i phyir nyan thos la sogs pa rnams la sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams kun rdzob tsam du snang ba yin no //
analyzed: des na nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i ma rig pa tsam kun du spyod pa'i phyir nyan thos la sogs pa rnams la sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams kun rdzob tsam du snang ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, because they experience only the non-afflicted nescience, the śrāvakas, etc., perceive dependent origination as a mere superficial reality, like a magical creation, etc.

original: snang ba dang bcas pa'i spyod yul can gyi zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa nyams su myong ba rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: snang ba dang bcas pa'i spyod yul can gyi zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa nyams su myong ba rnams kyi'o //
translated: The phrase “those who have a domain that is accompanied by appearance” refers to those who experience consciousness as accompanied by the aspects of blue, etc.

original: snang ba med pa'i spyod yul mnga' ba rnams la ni zhes pa ni sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa nyams su myong ba mi mnga' ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la ni kun rdzob tsam snang ba med pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba med pa'i spyod yul mnga' ba rnams la ni zhes pa ni sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa nyams su myong ba mi mnga' ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la ni kun rdzob tsam snang ba med pa'o //
translated: For those who have the domain of non-appearance means that for the Bhagavān Buddhas, who do not experience consciousness with aspects such as blue, the mere relative does not appear.

original: gal te sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la kun rdzob tsam du snang ba mi mnga' ba ci zhig snang zhe na /
analyzed: gal te sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la kun rdzob tsam du snang ba mi mnga' ba ci zhig snang zhe na /
translated: If the mere relative does not appear to the Bhagavān Buddhas, what does appear?

original: de la lan ni sangs rgyas la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la lan ni sangs rgyas la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The answer to that is stated by “For the Buddhas, etc.”

original: chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang / med pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'i rnam pa thams cad kyi phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched kyi chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang / med pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'i rnam pa thams cad kyi phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched kyi chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa ste /
translated: Because all phenomena are fully enlightened in all aspects means that all phenomena of aggregates, constituents, and sense spheres are fully enlightened in all aspects free from existence, nonexistence, and so on.

original: ci yang thugs su chud pa med pa'i sgo nas byang chub pa'i phyir sems dang sems las byung ba'i rgyu ba gtan log par 'dod pa yin te nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi sems dang tshor ba @146b la sogs pa sems las byung ba rnams kyi🔽kun du spyod pa ste 'jug pa log par 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: ci yang thugs su chud pa med pa'i sgo nas byang chub pa'i phyir sems dang sems las byung ba'i rgyu ba gtan log par 'dod pa yin te nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi sems dang tshor ba @146b la sogs pa sems las byung ba rnams kyi kun du spyod pa ste 'jug pa log par 'dod pa yin te /
translated: The movement of mind and mental functions is completely reversed, i.e., the mind which has the characteristic of experience and the mental functions such as feeling, etc.🔽are not operative.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams 'jug pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams 'jug pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: The mind and mental functions do not operate.

original: des na ci yang snang ba med pa yin no zhes pa'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: des na ci yang snang ba med pa yin no zhes pa'i tha tshig ste /
translated: Therefore, it is said that nothing appears at all.

original: rnam par rtog pa thams cad 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa thams cad 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all conceptualization has ceased.

original: 'di'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows:

original: 'dir sgrib pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'dir sgrib pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Here, obscuration is twofold:

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin par ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin par ma rig pa'o //
translated: afflicted and unafflicted nescience.

original: de la nyon mongs pa can gyi ma rig pa ni 'khor ba'i rgyun 'jug pa'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa can gyi ma rig pa ni 'khor ba'i rgyun 'jug pa'i rgyu yin la /
translated: Among them, afflicted nescience is the cause of the continuation of cyclic existence.

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i ma rig pa ni gzugs la sogs pa snang ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i ma rig pa ni gzugs la sogs pa snang ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Non-afflicted ignorance is the cause of the appearance of form and so on.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnams la ni sgrib pa gnyis ka mi mnga' bas rgyu med pas 'bras bu med pa'i phyir 'khor ba dang gzugs la sogs pa dag snang ba med pa'i phyir ji ltar kun rdzob tsam snang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnams la ni sgrib pa gnyis ka mi mnga' bas rgyu med pas 'bras bu med pa'i phyir 'khor ba dang gzugs la sogs pa dag snang ba med pa'i phyir ji ltar kun rdzob tsam snang bar 'gyur /
translated: Since the Bhagavans do not have either of the two obscurations, there is no cause, and since there is no effect, samsara and form and so on do not appear. So how could mere conventionalities appear?

original: des na sems dang sems byung log par 'dod pa yin te ;
analyzed: des na sems dang sems byung log par 'dod pa yin te ;
translated: Therefore it is asserted that mind and mental factors are stopped.

original: de ltar spyod pa la 'jug pa las /
analyzed: de ltar spyod pa la 'jug pa las /
translated: Thus it is said in the Avatara:

original: stong nyid bag chags goms pa ni //
analyzed: stong nyid bag chags goms pa ni //
translated: By cultivating the habitual tendency to emptiness

original: dngos po'i bag chags spong 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: dngos po'i bag chags spong 'gyur zhing //
translated: The habitual tendency to entities is eliminated.

original: ci yang med ces goms pas na //
analyzed: ci yang med ces goms pas na //
translated: By cultivating the idea that nothing exists at all

original: de yang phyi nas grol bar 'gyur //🔽gang tshe gang zhig med do zhes //
analyzed: de yang phyi nas grol bar 'gyur // gang tshe gang zhig med do zhes //
translated: That too is later freed.🔽When one does not observe the entity

original: brtag bya'i dngos po mi dmigs pa //🔽de tshe dngos med rten bral ba //
analyzed: brtag bya'i dngos po mi dmigs pa // de tshe dngos med rten bral ba //
translated: That is to be investigated as nonexistent,🔽At that time, how can the nonentity,

original: blo yi mdun na ji ltar gnas //
analyzed: blo yi mdun na ji ltar gnas //
translated: Which is devoid of a basis, remain before the mind?

original: gang tshe dngos dang dngos med dag / blo yi mdun na mi gnas pa //
analyzed: gang tshe dngos dang dngos med dag / blo yi mdun na mi gnas pa //
translated: Do not stand before the mind,

original: de tshe dmigs pa gzhan med pas //🔽dmigs pa med par rab tu zhi //
analyzed: de tshe dmigs pa gzhan med pas // dmigs pa med par rab tu zhi //
translated: Then, since there is no other object,

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is pacified in the absence of an object.

original: gal te bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sems dang sems byung log par 'dod na sku gsum dang sems can gyi don gyi rnam gzhag byed pa mi 'thad de /
analyzed: gal te bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sems dang sems byung log par 'dod na sku gsum dang sems can gyi don gyi rnam gzhag byed pa mi 'thad de /
translated: If you maintain that the mind and mental factors of the transcendent aryas are stopped, then it is untenable to posit the three buddha bodies and the benefit of sentient beings.

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis rnam pa thams cad du sems dang sems las byung ba'i rgyu ba log pas lhag ma 'ga' zhig kyang med pas chos kyis mi 'thad de /
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis rnam pa thams cad du sems dang sems las byung ba'i rgyu ba log pas lhag ma 'ga' zhig kyang med pas chos kyis mi 'thad de /
translated: In this way, since the buddhas have completely stopped the movement of mind and mental factors, they have no remainder.

original: de la chos ni stobs dang ; mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams yin la /
analyzed: de la chos ni stobs dang ; mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams yin la /
translated: Dharma refers to the qualities of the powers, fearlessnesses, and so on.

original: sku ni rang bzhin te /
analyzed: sku ni rang bzhin te /
translated: Body refers to the nature.

original: stong pa nyid yin pas chos med pas rang bzhin med pa'i phyir chos sku yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid yin pas chos med pas rang bzhin med pa'i phyir chos sku yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since the dharmakāya is devoid of dharma, it is devoid of nature, and therefore the dharmakāya does not exist.

original: de bzhin du sems dang sems las byung ba dag log pas rgyun ma chad par chos kyi bdud rtsi la longs spyod @147a * //🔽pa med pas longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku yang mi rigs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems dang sems las byung ba dag log pas rgyun ma chad par chos kyi bdud rtsi la longs spyod @147a * // pa med pas longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku yang mi rigs so //
translated: Likewise, since mind and mental factors have ceased, there is no uninterrupted enjoyment of the nectar of Dharma, and so the enjoyment body would be illogical.

original: de bzhin du sems dang sems las byung ba log pas sprul pa med pa'i phyir sprul pa'i sku yang ji ltar rigs /
analyzed: de bzhin du sems dang sems las byung ba log pas sprul pa med pa'i phyir sprul pa'i sku yang ji ltar rigs /
translated: Likewise, since mind and mental factors have ceased, how could the emanation body be logical, since there would be no emanations?

original: de bzhin du chos ston pa'i rgyu ye shes med pa'i phyir sems can gyi don gyi rnam gzhag kyang med pas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sems dang sems las byung ba'i rgyu ba log pa ci ltar 'dod ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos ston pa'i rgyu ye shes med pa'i phyir sems can gyi don gyi rnam gzhag kyang med pas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sems dang sems las byung ba'i rgyu ba log pa ci ltar 'dod ce na /
translated: Likewise, since there would be no gnosis that is the cause of teaching the Dharma, there would be no arrangement of the benefit of sentient beings. Therefore, how could it be asserted that the movement of mind and mental factors has ceased in the buddhas?

original: de la lan ni sangs rgyas kyi sar bcom ldan 'das la sku gsum gyi bstod pa'i gnas skabs su slob dpon rang nyid kyis 'chad par 'gyur bas 'dir ma brjod do //
analyzed: de la lan ni sangs rgyas kyi sar bcom ldan 'das la sku gsum gyi bstod pa'i gnas skabs su slob dpon rang nyid kyis 'chad par 'gyur bas 'dir ma brjod do //
translated: The reply to that is that since it will be explained by the master himself in the context of the praise of the three bodies of the Bhagavān at the stage of buddhahood, it will not be mentioned here.

original: mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the summary, it is said:

original: de ltar na re zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Thus, “in that case,” etc.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa zhes bya ba ni bden par zhen pa'i 'jig rten pa la ltos nas so //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa zhes bya ba ni bden par zhen pa'i 'jig rten pa la ltos nas so //
translated: “Conventional truth” is in terms of the world that is attached to true existence.

original: kun rdzob tsam du gsungs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i 'khrul pa'i shes pa dang / snang ba dang bcas pa'i 'phags pa'i gang zag rnams la ltos nas so //
analyzed: kun rdzob tsam du gsungs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i 'khrul pa'i shes pa dang / snang ba dang bcas pa'i 'phags pa'i gang zag rnams la ltos nas so //
translated: “It is said to be mere convention” is in terms of the mistaken consciousnesses of the world and the noble beings who have appearances.

original: da ni don dam pa la yang ltos pa'i dbang gis rnam gzhag bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni don dam pa la yang ltos pa'i dbang gis rnam gzhag bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the presentation in terms of the power of also relying on the ultimate,

original: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “In that case,” etc. is stated.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i gnas skabs la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i gnas skabs la'o //
translated: “In that case” is in the context of the conventional and the ultimate.

original: don dam pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni de rnams la bden par zhen pa yod pas brdzun par snang ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni de rnams la bden par zhen pa yod pas brdzun par snang ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: “What is the ultimate?” is because, since they have attachment to true existence, false appearances do not exist for them.

original: de'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tsam de'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tsam de'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: The emptiness that is its nature is the emptiness that is the nature of that mere conventional reality.

original: de rnams kyi don dam pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa rnams la snang ba ma log pas so //
