analyzed: de rnams kyi don dam pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa rnams la snang ba ma log pas so //
translated: That is the ultimate of those, because it does not appear falsely to the āryas.

original: don dam pa ni rang bzhin nyid yin zhing zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid yin no zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: don dam pa ni rang bzhin nyid yin zhing zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid yin no zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: The ultimate is its very nature, means it is emptiness.

original: de rnams la snang ba 'jug pa med pas so //
analyzed: de rnams la snang ba 'jug pa med pas so //
translated: Because its appearance does not operate for them.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'o //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'o //
translated: That also, means the ultimate.

original: slu ba med pa nyid ces bya ba ni ji ltar rtogs pa de ltar yod pas so //
analyzed: slu ba med pa nyid ces bya ba ni ji ltar rtogs pa de ltar yod pas so //
translated: It is nondeceptive, means it exists as it is realized.

original: de'i phyir don dam pa'i bden pa yin la zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir don dam pa'i bden pa yin la zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is the ultimate truth, means

original: dam pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes yin la /
analyzed: dam pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes yin la /
translated: the highest is supramundane wisdom.

original: don ni de'i yul yin pa'i phyir don dam pa yin la /
analyzed: don ni de'i yul yin pa'i phyir don dam pa yin la /
translated: The object is its object, so it is the ultimate.

original: de yang bden pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de yang bden pa nyid yin te /
translated: And it is a truth,

original: mi slu ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi slu ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is nondeceptive.

original: yang na mchog tu gyur pa'i don ni don dam pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na mchog tu gyur pa'i don ni don dam pa yin te /
translated: Or, the meaning of supreme is ultimate,

original: de yang stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de yang stong pa nyid do //
translated: and that is emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid las lhag pa'i dngos po mchog tu gyur @147b pa med pas so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid las lhag pa'i dngos po mchog tu gyur @147b pa med pas so //
translated: Because there is no entity that is superior to emptiness.

original: bden pa ni sngar bzhin du'o //
analyzed: bden pa ni sngar bzhin du'o //
translated: Truth is as before.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: That is, of the ultimate truth.

original: de rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis so //
analyzed: de rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis so //
translated: Of those, by the Blessed One.

original: so so rang gis rig par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba dmigs pa med pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: so so rang gis rig par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba dmigs pa med pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: It is to be known by each one for himself, by way of non-apprehension.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pas mngon par zhen pa'i yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa ni 'jig rten pa'i shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir rnam par dpyad na mi rigs pas so //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pas mngon par zhen pa'i yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa ni 'jig rten pa'i shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir rnam par dpyad na mi rigs pas so //
translated: It is not the ultimate truth, because the aspects of existence and non-existence, etc., as conceived by the world, are the objects of worldly cognition, and are not reasonable when analyzed.

original: da ni don dam pa'i bden pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni don dam pa'i bden pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the ultimate truth,

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: thus, etc. is stated.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa brjod nas zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i gti mug gi stobs kyis bden pa gnyis su brjod nas so //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa brjod nas zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i gti mug gi stobs kyis bden pa gnyis su brjod nas so //
translated: Having stated the conventional truth, means having stated the two truths by the power of worldly delusion.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: That means the ultimate truth.

original: brjod du med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sgra thams cad kyi yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sgra thams cad kyi yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is inexpressible means because it is not the object of all words.

original: shes pa'i yul ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir te'o //
analyzed: shes pa'i yul ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir te'o //
translated: Because it is not the object of consciousness means because it is not the object of conceptual consciousness.

original: de rnams yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i yul la 'jug pas so //
analyzed: de rnams yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i yul la 'jug pas so //
translated: Because it engages objects such as existence and nonexistence.

original: dngos su bstan par mi nus pas zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa dang sgra med par gzhan la bstan par mi nus pas so //
analyzed: dngos su bstan par mi nus pas zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa dang sgra med par gzhan la bstan par mi nus pas so //
translated: Because it cannot be directly indicated means because it cannot be indicated to others without words and concepts.

original: rang gis myong ba nyid du zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa rang gis nyams su myong ba'i dpe'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: rang gis myong ba nyid du zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa rang gis nyams su myong ba'i dpe'i sgo nas so //
translated: By one's own experience means by the example of one's own worldly experience.

original: nyan par 'dod pa rnams la zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid nyan par 'dod pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: nyan par 'dod pa rnams la zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid nyan par 'dod pa rnams la'o //
translated: Those who desire to hear means those who desire to hear reality.

original: de'i rang bzhin gsal bar bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin gsal bar bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to make its nature clear,

original: zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i rang bzhin gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i rang bzhin gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: means in order to make the nature of the ultimate clear.

original: 'di'i don ni don dam pa'i bden pa ni sgra dang rnam par rtog pa'i yul ma yin pa nyid kyis dngos su bstan par nus pa ma yin du zin kyang dpe'i sgo nas bstan par bya ba yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'di'i don ni don dam pa'i bden pa ni sgra dang rnam par rtog pa'i yul ma yin pa nyid kyis dngos su bstan par nus pa ma yin du zin kyang dpe'i sgo nas bstan par bya ba yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of this is that although the ultimate truth is not able to be directly taught because it is not the domain of words and concepts, it is to be taught by way of an example.

original: rab rib mthu yis zhes bya ba la sogs pa rab rib mthus gang snang ba'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rab rib mthu yis zhes bya ba la sogs pa rab rib mthus gang snang ba'o zhes pa'o //
translated: By the power of cataracts and so on means what appears by the power of cataracts.

original: skra shad la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni sbrang bu la sogs pa gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: skra shad la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni sbrang bu la sogs pa gzung bar bya'o //
translated: With the word and so on in hairs and so on, flies and so on are to be taken.

original: ngo bo log pa gang zhes bya ba ni phyis kyi dus su brdzun pa nyid du rtogs pas so //
analyzed: ngo bo log pa gang zhes bya ba ni phyis kyi dus su brdzun pa nyid du rtogs pas so //
translated: The wrong nature means that later on it is realized to be false.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni skra shad la sogs pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni skra shad la sogs pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: “That itself” refers to the nature of the floating hair, etc.

original: bdag nyid gang gis zhes bya ba ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang bral ba'i bdag nyid kyis so //
analyzed: bdag nyid gang gis zhes bya ba ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang bral ba'i bdag nyid kyis so //
translated: “By means of which self” refers to the self that is free from entity and non-entity.

original: mig dag pas @148a * //
analyzed: mig dag pas @148a * //
translated: “With pure eyes”

original: zhes bya ba ni rab rib la sogs pas nye bar ma bcom pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rab rib la sogs pas nye bar ma bcom pa'o //
translated: refers to eyes that are not destroyed by cataracts, etc.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni skra shad la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni skra shad la sogs pa'o //
translated: “That itself” refers to the floating hair, etc.

original: de bzhin 'dir shes kyis zhes bya ba ni don la sbyar ba yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin 'dir shes kyis zhes bya ba ni don la sbyar ba yin te /
translated: “Likewise, here, by knowledge” means that the meaning is applied.

original: ci ltar rab rib can la snang ba'i skra shad la sogs pa'i de kho na nyid mig dag pas mthong ba yin la /
analyzed: ci ltar rab rib can la snang ba'i skra shad la sogs pa'i de kho na nyid mig dag pas mthong ba yin la /
translated: Just as the reality of the floating hair, etc. that appears to one with cataracts is seen by those with pure eyes,

original: de bzhin du 'jig rten pa la snang ba'i kun rdzob kyi bden pa de spyan dag pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis bdag nyid gang gis gzigs pa de kho na yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'jig rten pa la snang ba'i kun rdzob kyi bden pa de spyan dag pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis bdag nyid gang gis gzigs pa de kho na yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: in the same way, the reality of the conventional truth that appears to the world is seen by the pure eyes of the Bhagavān Buddhas by means of that very self. This is the meaning.

original: de nyid 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach just that, the commentary says:

original: rab rib kyi mthus zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rab rib kyi mthus zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The phrase “due to the power of the eye disease” should be supplied.

original: rab rib med pas rab rib can gyi tshogs thob par rigs te /
analyzed: rab rib med pas rab rib can gyi tshogs thob par rigs te /
translated: It is reasonable to say that the person without eye disease has obtained a group of people with eye disease,

original: skra shad kyi rnam pa de dag mi dmigs pa yin no zhes pa'i tha tshig sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: skra shad kyi rnam pa de dag mi dmigs pa yin no zhes pa'i tha tshig sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: because the forms of the hairs are not perceived.

original: bse ru la sogs pa'i snod kyi nang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni dngul dang gser la sogs pa'i snod bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: bse ru la sogs pa'i snod kyi nang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni dngul dang gser la sogs pa'i snod bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The phrase “in the vessel of the rhinoceros horn” should be supplied. The phrase “and so on” includes vessels made of silver, gold, and so on.

original: des bsal bar 'dod nas zhes bya ba ni skra shad kyi tshogs bsal bar 'dod nas so //
analyzed: des bsal bar 'dod nas zhes bya ba ni skra shad kyi tshogs bsal bar 'dod nas so //
translated: “Desiring to remove” means desiring to remove the group of hairs.

original: snod de la zhes bya ba ni skra shad kyi tshogs kyi snod la'o //
analyzed: snod de la zhes bya ba ni skra shad kyi tshogs kyi snod la'o //
translated: “In that vessel” means in the vessel of the group of hairs.

original: 'dre ldog byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni kha sbub pas bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: 'dre ldog byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni kha sbub pas bzlog pa'o //
translated: “Turning it over” means turning it over so that it is face down.

original: de ci byed pa zhig snyam nas zhes bya ba ni rab rib can 'di snod 'dre ldog byed pa 'di ci zhig yin snyam nas so //
analyzed: de ci byed pa zhig snyam nas zhes bya ba ni rab rib can 'di snod 'dre ldog byed pa 'di ci zhig yin snyam nas so //
translated: “Wondering what it is doing” means wondering what this person with eye disease is doing by turning over the vessel.

original: de'i gan du phyin nas zhes bya ba ni rab rib can gyi'o //
analyzed: de'i gan du phyin nas zhes bya ba ni rab rib can gyi'o //
translated: “Approaching him” means approaching the person with eye disease.

original: skra shad kyi yul der mig gtad kyang zhes bya ba ni snod kyi nang na yod pa'i skra shad kyi yul la mig gtad kyang ngo //
analyzed: skra shad kyi yul der mig gtad kyang zhes bya ba ni snod kyi nang na yod pa'i skra shad kyi yul la mig gtad kyang ngo //
translated: “Even though the eyes are directed toward the object of the hair” means that the eyes are directed toward the object of the hair that is in the bowl.

original: rnam pa de dag ces bya ba ni rab rib can la snang ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa de dag ces bya ba ni rab rib can la snang ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: “Those aspects” are those that appear to one with diseased vision.

original: skra shad de'i rten can zhes bya ba ni skra shad la dmigs nas skyes pa'o //
analyzed: skra shad de'i rten can zhes bya ba ni skra shad la dmigs nas skyes pa'o //
translated: “Having that hair as its basis” means that it arises in dependence on the object of the hair.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang zhes bya ba ni skra shad la sogs pa'i tshogs 'di dngos po'am dngos po med pa yin snyam pa'i spyi'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang zhes bya ba ni skra shad la sogs pa'i tshogs 'di dngos po'am dngos po med pa yin snyam pa'i spyi'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: “Entity and nonentity” is the general conception that this collection of hairs, etc. is either an entity or a nonentity.

original: skra shad dang skra shad ma yin pa dang zhes bya ba ni bye brag gi rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: skra shad dang skra shad ma yin pa dang zhes bya ba ni bye brag gi rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: “Hair and non-hair” is the specific conception.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni nag po bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni nag po bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The word “etc.” includes black.

original: de'i rnam par rtog pa bsal bar 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni skra shad kyi rten can dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa bsal bar 'dod pas so //
analyzed: de'i rnam par rtog pa bsal bar 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni skra shad kyi rten can dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa bsal bar 'dod pas so //
translated: “One who wishes to dispel the conception of that” means one who wishes to dispel the conception of existence, nonexistence, etc., in regard to the basis of the appearance of falling hair.

original: rab rib can gyis dmigs pa'i dor byas nas zhes bya ba ni rab rib can la skra shad du snang ba gang @148b yin pa de la brten nas te /
analyzed: rab rib can gyis dmigs pa'i dor byas nas zhes bya ba ni rab rib can la skra shad du snang ba gang @148b yin pa de la brten nas te /
translated: “Having rejected the object of perception of one who has myodesopsia” means that one who has myodesopsia perceives falling hair, and in dependence on that,

original: rab rib med pa rang bzhin nyid kyi skra shad la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir rab rib can gyi rjes su 'brangs nas de'i rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i ched du rab rib med pa 'di la skra shad dag yod pa ma yin pas 'di na skra
analyzed: rab rib med pa rang bzhin nyid kyi skra shad la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir rab rib can gyi rjes su 'brangs nas de'i rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i ched du rab rib med pa 'di la skra shad dag yod pa ma yin pas 'di na skra
translated: because one who does not have myodesopsia does not perceive falling hair, etc., by nature, one who has myodesopsia follows the one who does not have myodesopsia, and for the sake of dispelling his conception, one who does not have myodesopsia says, “There is no falling hair here,”

original: shad la sogs pa dag yod pa ma yin no zhes dgag pa lhur byed pa'i tshig gi tha snyad dag brjod pa yin pas so //
analyzed: shad la sogs pa dag yod pa ma yin no zhes dgag pa lhur byed pa'i tshig gi tha snyad dag brjod pa yin pas so //
translated: and “There is no falling hair, etc., here,” and so on, and he makes a great effort to utter words and conventional terms.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni rab rib med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni rab rib med pa'o //
translated: “Here” means for one who does not have myodesopsia.

original: de la skur pa 'debs pa zhes bya ba ni skra shad la sogs pa las te /
analyzed: de la skur pa 'debs pa zhes bya ba ni skra shad la sogs pa las te /
translated: Now, denies means in regard to the hair-tuft, etc.

original: rang nyid kyis skra shad dmigs nas skra shad dag yod pa ma yin no zhes skur pa 'debs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang nyid kyis skra shad dmigs nas skra shad dag yod pa ma yin no zhes skur pa 'debs pa ma yin no //
translated: For, having perceived the hair-tuft, one does not deny the existence of the hair-tuft, saying, The hair-tuft does not exist!

original: skra shad dag gi de kho na nyid ces bya ba ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang / skra shad dang / skra shad ma yin pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: skra shad dag gi de kho na nyid ces bya ba ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang / skra shad dang / skra shad ma yin pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: The so-called reality of the hair-tuft is free from entity and non-entity, from hair-tuft and non-hair-tuft, etc.

original: cig shos ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rab rib can gyis te /
analyzed: cig shos ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rab rib can gyis te /
translated: The other is not, means the one with eye disease.

original: de la rab rib kyi stobs kyis skra shad la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa kun du dpyod pas so ;
analyzed: de la rab rib kyi stobs kyis skra shad la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa kun du dpyod pas so ;
translated: For, by the power of the eye disease, the conceptualization of the hair-tuft, etc. is investigated.

original: / de ltar dpe bstan nas don la sbyar bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: / de ltar dpe bstan nas don la sbyar bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Having thus taught the example, in order to apply it to the meaning, he says:

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Thus, etc.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni rab rib can gyi dpe'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni rab rib can gyi dpe'i tshul gyis so //
translated: Thus means in the manner of the example of the one with eye disease.

original: ma rig pa'i rab rib kyis zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa nyid rab rib yin te /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rab rib kyis zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa nyid rab rib yin te /
translated: The phrase “due to the cataracts of ignorance” means that ignorance itself is a cataract.

original: ci lta ba bzhin du gnas pa'i dngos po'i de kho na nyid mi shes pas so //
analyzed: ci lta ba bzhin du gnas pa'i dngos po'i de kho na nyid mi shes pas so //
translated: Because it does not understand the reality of things as they are,

original: de'i blo'i mig la gnod pa byas pas so //
analyzed: de'i blo'i mig la gnod pa byas pas so //
translated: it injures the eye of the mind.

original: de kho na nyid ma mthong ba dag gis zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid ma mthong ba'i phyir dngos po'i rang bzhin phyin ci log tu sgro 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid ma mthong ba dag gis zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid ma mthong ba'i phyir dngos po'i rang bzhin phyin ci log tu sgro 'dogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase “those who do not see reality” means that because they do not see reality, they superimpose an unreal essence on things.

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa zhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa zhes bya ba la ;
translated: The phrase “aggregates, elements, sense bases, etc.”

original: phung po ni gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po ste lnga'o //
analyzed: phung po ni gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po ste lnga'o //
translated: The aggregates are the five aggregates of form, feeling, conception, volitional factors, and consciousness.

original: khams ni mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi khams dang / de bzhin du mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i khams drug dang ; de bzhin du de'i yul gzugs la sogs pa'i khams drug yin pas bco brgyad do //
analyzed: khams ni mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi khams dang / de bzhin du mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i khams drug dang ; de bzhin du de'i yul gzugs la sogs pa'i khams drug yin pas bco brgyad do //
translated: The elements are the elements of the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind, and likewise the six elements of eye-consciousness, etc., and likewise the six elements of their objects, form, etc.

original: skye mched ni mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi skye mched drug dang / de bzhin du de rnams kyi yul gzugs la sogs pa'i skye mched drug yin pas skye @149a * //
analyzed: skye mched ni mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi skye mched drug dang / de bzhin du de rnams kyi yul gzugs la sogs pa'i skye mched drug yin pas skye @149a * //
translated: The sense bases are the six sense bases of the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind, and likewise the six sense bases of their objects, form, etc.

original: mched bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: mched bcu gnyis so //
translated: Thus there are twelve sense bases.

original: de la khams kyi rnam gzhag byas pa'i skabs su mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa khams drug dang / yid kyi khams te bdun gang bstan pa de skye mched kyi rnam gzhag byed pa'i gnas skabs su yid kyi skye mched kyis bsdus pa'i phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams la sogs pa rnams skye mched kyi nang du mi 'dus pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la khams kyi rnam gzhag byas pa'i skabs su mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa khams drug dang / yid kyi khams te bdun gang bstan pa de skye mched kyi rnam gzhag byed pa'i gnas skabs su yid kyi skye mched kyis bsdus pa'i phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams la sogs pa rnams skye mched kyi nang du mi 'dus pa ni ma yin no //
translated: When the presentation of the bases is made, the elements such as eye consciousness are not excluded from the bases because they are included in the mental base.

original: de la phung po'i don ni spungs pa'i don yin te /
analyzed: de la phung po'i don ni spungs pa'i don yin te /
translated: The meaning of aggregate is the meaning of heap.

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa la sogs pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i tshogs la gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa'i ming btags pa yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa la sogs pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i tshogs la gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa'i ming btags pa yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that a collection of forms and so on of the past, future and so forth is designated with the name the form aggregate and so on.

original: khams kyi don ni rigs kyi don yin te /
analyzed: khams kyi don ni rigs kyi don yin te /
translated: The meaning of element is the meaning of lineage.

original: dper na rigs cig la zangs dang / dngul la sogs pa'i rigs du ma yod pa de bzhin du rgyud gcig la sems dang sems las byung ba'i rigs bco brgyad yod pa yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: dper na rigs cig la zangs dang / dngul la sogs pa'i rigs du ma yod pa de bzhin du rgyud gcig la sems dang sems las byung ba'i rigs bco brgyad yod pa yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Just as there are many types of copper, silver, etc., in one class, so there are eighteen types of mind and mental activities in one continuum.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba dag rgyas par byed pa'i phyir skye mched do //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba dag rgyas par byed pa'i phyir skye mched do //
translated: The bases are so called because they cause the mind and mental activities to grow.

original: rgyas par ni mngon pa las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyas par ni mngon pa las shes par bya'o //
translated: They should be understood in detail from the Abhidharma.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni gang zag la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni gang zag la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The words “etc.” include the person, etc.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la sogs par snang ba'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la sogs par snang ba'o //
translated: “That” refers to the appearance of the aggregates, elements, bases, etc.

original: de dag gi zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de dag gi zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams kyi'o //
translated: “Of those” refers to things.

original: ngo bo kun rdzob pa'i zhes bya ba ni gti mug gi stobs kyis byung ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo kun rdzob pa'i zhes bya ba ni gti mug gi stobs kyis byung ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: “The nature of the superficial” refers to that which arises through the power of delusion.

original: phung po la sogs pa de dag nyid ces bya ba ni ma rig pa'i rab rib kyis bcom pa'i blo dang ldan pa rnams la snang ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa de dag nyid ces bya ba ni ma rig pa'i rab rib kyis bcom pa'i blo dang ldan pa rnams la snang ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: “Those very aggregates, etc.” refers to that which appears to those whose minds are overcome by the cataract of ignorance.

original: rang bzhin gang gis bya ba ni phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / yod pa dang / med pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'i rang bzhin nyid kyis te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gang gis bya ba ni phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / yod pa dang / med pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'i rang bzhin nyid kyis te /
translated: The nature of the activity is the nature devoid of aggregates, elements, media, existence, nonexistence, etc.

original: de rnams snang ba'i rgyu ma rig pa med pas so //
analyzed: de rnams snang ba'i rgyu ma rig pa med pas so //
translated: It is due to the absence of ignorance, the cause of their appearance.

original: ma rig pa'i bag chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i bag chags med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i bag chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i bag chags med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “free from the instinct for nescience” means that there is no instinct, either afflicted or unafflicted.

original: de dag gi zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de dag gi zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams kyi'o //
translated: “Their” refers to the things.

original: 'di'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows:

original: 'dir skyes bu 'ga' zhig la rab rib kyi mthus snod kyi nang na gnas pa'i skra shad la sogs pa snang ba de la rab rib med pa'i skyes bu 'ga' 'ongs nas 'di na skra shad med do zhes rigs pa'i sgo nas ji srid @149b du ma brjod
analyzed: 'dir skyes bu 'ga' zhig la rab rib kyi mthus snod kyi nang na gnas pa'i skra shad la sogs pa snang ba de la rab rib med pa'i skyes bu 'ga' 'ongs nas 'di na skra shad med do zhes rigs pa'i sgo nas ji srid @149b du ma brjod
translated: Here, some person, by the power of an eye disease, sees such things as falling hairs, etc., in the visual field. Another person, free from eye disease, comes along, and by means of reasoning, does not speak to him for a long time, saying, “There are no falling hairs here.”

original: pa de srid du skra shad la bden par mngon par zhen par byed la gang gi tshe rab rib med pa'i rigs pa'i tshig gis skra shad la sogs pa bden pa ma yin pa nyid du rtogs pa de'i tshe yang des skra shad la sogs pa'i don dam
analyzed: pa de srid du skra shad la bden par mngon par zhen par byed la gang gi tshe rab rib med pa'i rigs pa'i tshig gis skra shad la sogs pa bden pa ma yin pa nyid du rtogs pa de'i tshe yang des skra shad la sogs pa'i don dam
translated: As long as one is attached to the true existence of the floating hair, one does not understand the meaning of the floating hair.

original: pa rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: pa rtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: When one understands by the words of reasoning free from eye disease that the floating hair is not true, at that time, one does not understand the ultimate meaning of the floating hair.

original: rab rib kyi mthus skra shad la sogs pa 'khrul ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab rib kyi mthus skra shad la sogs pa 'khrul ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the error of the floating hair exists by the power of eye disease.

original: 'on kyang bden pa tsam du zhen pa log pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang bden pa tsam du zhen pa log pa'o //
translated: However, the mere attachment to truth is reversed.

original: gang gi tshe rab rib la sogs pas skra shad la sogs par snang ba log pa de'i tshe skra shad la sogs pa ni gdod ma nas skye ba med pa yin no zhes rtogs pa yin la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rab rib la sogs pas skra shad la sogs par snang ba log pa de'i tshe skra shad la sogs pa ni gdod ma nas skye ba med pa yin no zhes rtogs pa yin la /
translated: When the appearance of the floating hair, etc. is reversed by eye disease, etc., at that time, one understands that the floating hair, etc. are primordially non-arisen.

original: de'i yul can gyi yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad kun du spyod pa med pa de'i tshe skra shad la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yang dag par rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i yul can gyi yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad kun du spyod pa med pa de'i tshe skra shad la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yang dag par rtogs pa yin no //
translated: When one does not engage in all conceptual thoughts of existence, nonexistence, etc. of the subject, at that time, one understands the nature of the floating hair, etc.

original: de bzhin du ma rig pa'i rab rib kyis bsgribs pa'i mig can so so'i skye bo rnams la ma rig pa'i mthus phung po la sogs pa rnams snang ba yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du ma rig pa'i rab rib kyis bsgribs pa'i mig can so so'i skye bo rnams la ma rig pa'i mthus phung po la sogs pa rnams snang ba yin la /
translated: Likewise, to ordinary beings whose eyes are obscured by the cataracts of ignorance, the aggregates and so on appear by the power of ignorance.

original: de rnams la ma rig pa'i rab rib dang bral ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis rig pa'i sgo nas phung po la sogs pa 'di rnams ni yod pa ma yin no zhes ji srid du ma gsungs pa de srid du de rnams la bden par zhen
analyzed: de rnams la ma rig pa'i rab rib dang bral ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis rig pa'i sgo nas phung po la sogs pa 'di rnams ni yod pa ma yin no zhes ji srid du ma gsungs pa de srid du de rnams la bden par zhen
translated: Until the transcendent conquerors, who are free of the cataracts of ignorance, declare, “By means of wisdom, these aggregates and so on do not exist,”

original: pa yod pa yin la /
analyzed: pa yod pa yin la /
translated: those beings will have attachment to true existence.

original: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis phung po la sogs pa 'di rnams ni 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin pa'o zhes gsungs pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis phung po la sogs pa 'di rnams ni 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin pa'o zhes gsungs pa de'i tshe /
translated: When the transcendent conquerors declare, “None of these aggregates and so on exist,”

original: rnam pa du ma dang / thabs du ma dang / dus yun ring por stong pa nyid goms pa las thog ma med pa nas goms pa'i bden par mngon par zhen pa ldog pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rnam pa du ma dang / thabs du ma dang / dus yun ring por stong pa nyid goms pa las thog ma med pa nas goms pa'i bden par mngon par zhen pa ldog pa yin gyi /
translated: then through cultivating emptiness for a long time in many ways and with many methods, the attachment to true existence that has been cultivated since beginningless time will be overcome.

original: brdzun par snang ba ni ldog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: brdzun par snang ba ni ldog pa ma yin no //
translated: False appearances are not reversed.

original: de'i tshe yang phung po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yongs su shes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe yang phung po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yongs su shes pa ma yin te /
translated: Even then, the nature of the aggregates and so on is not fully understood,

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i ma rig pas phung po la sogs pa snang ba'i 'khrul pa yod pas so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i ma rig pas phung po la sogs pa snang ba'i 'khrul pa yod pas so //
translated: because the error of the appearance of the aggregates and so on exists due to nonafflictive ignorance.

original: 'on kyang bden par zhen pa las log pa tsam yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang bden par zhen pa las log pa tsam yin no //
translated: However, it is merely the reversal of the conception of true existence.

original: gang gi tshe nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i ma rig pa rnam pa thams cad du log pas phung po la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad du mi snang ba de'i tshe phung po la sogs pa de rnams kyi rang bzhin rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i ma rig pa rnam pa thams cad du log pas phung po la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad du mi snang ba de'i tshe phung po la sogs pa de rnams kyi rang bzhin rtogs pa yin te /
translated: When afflictive and nonafflictive ignorance are completely reversed, the aggregates and so on do not appear in any way. At that time, the nature of those aggregates and so on is realized,

original: gdod ma nas skye ba med pa khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //🔽de'i tshe rnam par rtog pa thams cad log pas phung po la sogs pa rnams kyi rang @150a * //
analyzed: gdod ma nas skye ba med pa khong du chud pa'i phyir ro // de'i tshe rnam par rtog pa thams cad log pas phung po la sogs pa rnams kyi rang @150a * //
translated: because their primordially being unborn is comprehended.

original: bzhin rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: bzhin rtogs pa yin no //
translated: At that time, because all conceptuality is reversed, the nature of the aggregates and so on is realized.

original: de'i dus na phung po la sogs pa rnams kyi rang bzhin ci ltar snang ba de'i don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dus na phung po la sogs pa rnams kyi rang bzhin ci ltar snang ba de'i don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: At that time, the nature of the aggregates and so forth is the ultimate truth, just as it appears.

original: de yang kun rdzob kyi tha snyad kyi dbang de byas nas sems dang sems las byung ba'i rgyu ba gtan log pa'i mtshan nyid can du brjod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de yang kun rdzob kyi tha snyad kyi dbang de byas nas sems dang sems las byung ba'i rgyu ba gtan log pa'i mtshan nyid can du brjod pa yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, this is expressed as having the characteristic of the complete cessation of the movement of mind and mental factors from the perspective of conventional designation.

original: don dam pa'i dbang du byas nas sems dang sems las byung ba'i rgyu ba gtan log pa'i mtshan nyid can ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam pa'i dbang du byas nas sems dang sems las byung ba'i rgyu ba gtan log pa'i mtshan nyid can ni ma yin te /
translated: However, from the perspective of the ultimate, it does not have the characteristic of the complete cessation of the movement of mind and mental factors.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba nyid gdod ma nas skye ba med pa'i phyir zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba nyid gdod ma nas skye ba med pa'i phyir zhes pa'o //
translated: This is because mind and mental factors themselves are primordially unborn.

original: gal te sems dang sems las byung ba gtan log pa'i mtshan nyid can yin na /
analyzed: gal te sems dang sems las byung ba gtan log pa'i mtshan nyid can yin na /
translated: If mind and mental factors have the characteristic of complete cessation,

original: de ci ltar mthong zhe na ;
analyzed: de ci ltar mthong zhe na ;
translated: how is that seen?

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach just that,

original: gal te rnam pa de lta bu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te rnam pa de lta bu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, If it is like that... and so forth.

original: mthong ba med pa nyid ces bya ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba med pa'i phyir phung po la sogs pa dang bral ba'i de kho na nyid mthong ba las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba med pa nyid ces bya ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba med pa'i phyir phung po la sogs pa dang bral ba'i de kho na nyid mthong ba las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Non-seeing” is because of the absence of mind and mental factors, and because of transcending the seeing of reality free from the aggregates, etc.

original: de dag gis zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas rnams kyis so //
analyzed: de dag gis zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas rnams kyis so //
translated: “By them” means by the Buddhas.

original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the reply to that,

original: bden mod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bden mod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “That is true,” etc.

original: mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis dmigs pa bsgrub pa'i don du mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis dmigs pa bsgrub pa'i don du mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to prove the object of non-apprehension by way of the method of non-apprehension, he teaches the source of the sutra,

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: saying, “As it is said,” etc.

original: don dam par na zhes bya ba khyad par smos pa ni kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du brjod pa yin pas so //
analyzed: don dam par na zhes bya ba khyad par smos pa ni kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du brjod pa yin pas so //
translated: The qualification “ultimately” is mentioned because it is expressed conventionally.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi yul gyi rang bzhin du 'gyur na zhes bya ba ni lus kyis reg par bya ba nyid dang / ngag gis brjod par bya ba nyid dang / yid kyis dmigs par bya ba nyid kyi spyod yul du gyur na'o //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi yul gyi rang bzhin du 'gyur na zhes bya ba ni lus kyis reg par bya ba nyid dang / ngag gis brjod par bya ba nyid dang / yid kyis dmigs par bya ba nyid kyi spyod yul du gyur na'o //
translated: If it were the domain of body, speech, and mind, it would be the domain of what is to be touched by the body, what is to be expressed by speech, and what is to be observed by the mind.🔽It would not be counted as the ultimate truth, because it is not tenable that it is the object of the domain of the body, etc.

original: de don dam pa'i bden pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su mi 'gro ste zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po mi rigs pas yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'i de kho na nyid la yul gyi rang bzhin du 'gyur ba mi
analyzed: de don dam pa'i bden pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su mi 'gro ste zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po mi rigs pas yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'i de kho na nyid la yul gyi rang bzhin du 'gyur ba mi
translated: Since the state of being cause and effect is not tenable, it is not tenable that reality, which is free from existence, nonexistence, etc., is the domain of the object.

original: rigs pa'i phyir de 'dzin par byed pa yang mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs pa'i phyir de 'dzin par byed pa yang mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And since it is not tenable that it is the domain of the object, it is not tenable that it is apprehended.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i stobs kyis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po nyid du snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i stobs kyis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po nyid du snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It would be a conventional truth, because it appears as the state of being the object of the domain of the body, etc., through the power of ignorance.

original: tha snyad thams cad las 'das pa'i zhes bya ba ni don dam par na de kho na nyid dang / don dam pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' zhes bya ba'i tshig rnams kyi tha @150b snyad kyi yul ma yin pas so //
analyzed: tha snyad thams cad las 'das pa'i zhes bya ba ni don dam par na de kho na nyid dang / don dam pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' zhes bya ba'i tshig rnams kyi tha @150b snyad kyi yul ma yin pas so //
translated: The phrase beyond all conventional expressions means that in the ultimate sense, it is not the domain of conventional expressions such as reality, ultimate truth, emptiness, and the perfect end.

original: bye brag med par zhes bya ba ni sngon po dang / ser po dang / rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i khyad par dang mi ldan pas so //
analyzed: bye brag med par zhes bya ba ni sngon po dang / ser po dang / rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i khyad par dang mi ldan pas so //
translated: The phrase without distinction means that it is not qualified by distinctions such as blue, yellow, permanent, and impermanent.

original: ma skyes pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba med pas so //
analyzed: ma skyes pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba med pas so //
translated: The phrase unborn means that it is not produced.

original: de nyid kyi phyir ma 'gags pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ma 'gags pa'o //
translated: For the same reason, it is also unceased.

original: tha snyad gnyis las 'das pa nyid kyi rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: tha snyad gnyis las 'das pa nyid kyi rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the reason why it is beyond the two conventional expressions, it says:

original: smra bar bya ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: smra bar bya ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is not an object of speech, and so on.

original: sgra dang rnam par rtog pa dag gi spyod yul ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sgra dang rnam par rtog pa dag gi spyod yul ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that it is not the domain of words and concepts.

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi yul gyi bar las 'das pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi yul gyi bar las 'das pa yin te /
translated: It is beyond the object of omniscient wisdom that possesses the supreme of all aspects, up to the object of omniscient wisdom.

original: stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi yul dang bral ba yin te /
analyzed: stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi yul dang bral ba yin te /
translated: It is free from the object of omniscient wisdom that possesses the qualities of the powers, fearlessnesses, and so on.

original: mu bzhi dang bral ba la yul gyi dngos po mi rigs pa dang / gdul bya rnams kyis thams cad mkhyen pas de kho na nyid thugs su chud pa yin no zhes yul gyi dngos po brtags pa yin pas so //
analyzed: mu bzhi dang bral ba la yul gyi dngos po mi rigs pa dang / gdul bya rnams kyis thams cad mkhyen pas de kho na nyid thugs su chud pa yin no zhes yul gyi dngos po brtags pa yin pas so //
translated: Since the four possibilities are excluded, it is illogical for it to be an object, and since trainees impute the object of omniscience, thinking, “The Omniscient One comprehends suchness,”🔽it is not as it is said, “It is the ultimate truth.”

original: ci ltar don dam pa'i bden pa'o zhes brjod pa ltar ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid dang yang dag pa'i mtha' dang don dam pa'i sgras ji ltar brjod pa de ltar ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ci ltar don dam pa'i bden pa'o zhes brjod pa ltar ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid dang yang dag pa'i mtha' dang don dam pa'i sgras ji ltar brjod pa de ltar ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not as it is said by the terms suchness, the perfect limit, and ultimate,

original: de kho na nyid kyi sgra dang rnam par rtog pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi sgra dang rnam par rtog pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not the object of terms and conceptuality.

original: gal te stong pa nyid kyi chos thams cad dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te stong pa nyid kyi chos thams cad dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not different from the phenomena of emptiness.

original: chos thams cad de kho na nyid yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: chos thams cad de kho na nyid yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that all phenomena are reality,

original: de la lan ni chos thams cad ni brdzun te slu ba'i chos so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la lan ni chos thams cad ni brdzun te slu ba'i chos so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: the reply is that all phenomena are false, deceptive phenomena, and so on.

original: chos thams cad ni zhes bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni zhes bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: All phenomena refers to the aggregates and so on.

original: brdzun te zhes bya ba ni bden pa ma yin pa'o ;
analyzed: brdzun te zhes bya ba ni bden pa ma yin pa'o ;
translated: False means not true.

original: / slu ba'i chos so zhes bya ba ni slu bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: / slu ba'i chos so zhes bya ba ni slu bar byed pa ste /
translated: Deceptive phenomena refers to that which deceives.

original: gang gi phyir chos thams cad slu bar byed pa de'i phyir brdzun pa yin pas don dam pa'i bden pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos thams cad slu bar byed pa de'i phyir brdzun pa yin pas don dam pa'i bden pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: Because all phenomena deceive, they are false and not ultimate truth.

original: de nyid kyi phyir don dam pa'i bden pa ni gcig dang tha dad pa nyid du brjod du med pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir don dam pa'i bden pa ni gcig dang tha dad pa nyid du brjod du med pa'o //
translated: For that very reason, ultimate truth is inexpressible as either the same as or different from all phenomena.

original: smra bar bya ba dang smra ba dang zhes bya ba'i tshig de rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: smra bar bya ba dang smra ba dang zhes bya ba'i tshig de rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain in detail the words “that which is to be expressed, the expression” and so on,🔽the root text says:

original: lha'i bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽gang gi ston pa dang zhes bya ba ni ston pa'o //🔽ci ston pa dang zhes bya ba ni sgra dang rnam par rtog pa dag gi yul gang yin pa'o //🔽gang la ston pa zhes bya ba ni nyan pa po gang la'o //🔽rab tu ma skyes @151a * //🔽pa'o zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //🔽de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rab tu ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //🔽ther zug dang zhes bya ba ni rgyun chad pa ma yin pas so //🔽rtag pa dang zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du rang bzhin de nyid yod pas so //
analyzed: lha'i bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / gang gi ston pa dang zhes bya ba ni ston pa'o // ci ston pa dang zhes bya ba ni sgra dang rnam par rtog pa dag gi yul gang yin pa'o // gang la ston pa zhes bya ba ni nyan pa po gang la'o // rab tu ma skyes @151a * // pa'o zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro // de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rab tu ma skyes pa'i phyir ro // ther zug dang zhes bya ba ni rgyun chad pa ma yin pas so // rtag pa dang zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du rang bzhin de nyid yod pas so //
translated: The expression “divine sons” and so on.🔽“What is taught” refers to the teaching.🔽“What is taught” refers to the object of words and thoughts.🔽“To whom is it taught” refers to the listener.🔽“It is not produced” means that the state of cause and effect is not tenable.🔽“Therefore” means because it is not produced.🔽“It is not annihilated” means that it is not interrupted.🔽“It is not permanent” means that it always exists with that very nature.🔽

original: mi rtag pa dang zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma so so la 'jig pa'i rang bzhin can yin pas so //🔽stong pa dang zhes bya ba ni bdag gi ba dang bral bas so //
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma so so la 'jig pa'i rang bzhin can yin pas so //🔽stong pa dang zhes bya ba ni bdag gi ba dang bral bas so //

as a Dharma that is the water element, as a Dharma

original: mi stong pa dang zhes bya ba ni bdag gi ba nyid kyis so //
analyzed: mi stong pa dang zhes bya ba ni bdag gi ba nyid kyis so //
translated: “Not empty” means not empty of self.

original: mtshan nyid dang mtshan gzhi dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang mtshan gzhi dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Characteristic and characterized” means

original: dper na kha dog dang dbyibs kyi bdag nyid can gyi sar snang ba ni mtshan gzhi yin la /
analyzed: dper na kha dog dang dbyibs kyi bdag nyid can gyi sar snang ba ni mtshan gzhi yin la /
translated: for example, the appearance of earth in the aspect of color and shape is the characterized,

original: sra ba nyid ni mtshan nyid yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: sra ba nyid ni mtshan nyid yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: and hardness is the characteristic.

original: skye ba dang 'gag pa la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'gag pa la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: “Arising and ceasing, etc.” The word “etc.” includes going and coming, etc.

original: srid pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni go sla'o //
analyzed: srid pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni go sla'o //
translated: “It is not possible” is easy to understand.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de rang gi ngo bo ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de rang gi ngo bo ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: He says, “Because its own nature is not perceived.”

original: rigs pa'i sgo nas dngos po med pa dag mi 'thad pa'i phyir de'i rang gi ngo bo ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs pa'i sgo nas dngos po med pa dag mi 'thad pa'i phyir de'i rang gi ngo bo ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because things that are non-existent are not tenable from the perspective of reasoning, its own nature is not perceived.

original: de kho na nyid bsam pa las 'phags pa rnams kho na tshad ma yin gyi zhes bya ba ni de rnams kyi mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gzigs pa'i phyir ro //🔽'phags pa ma yin pa dag ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo rnams ni tshad ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid bsam pa las 'phags pa rnams kho na tshad ma yin gyi zhes bya ba ni de rnams kyi mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gzigs pa'i phyir ro // 'phags pa ma yin pa dag ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo rnams ni tshad ma yin pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the verse is this: Only those who are superior to the world are valid with regard to the contemplation of reality, because they see it by way of non-apprehension.🔽Those who are not superior to the world are not valid with regard to the contemplation of reality, because they see it by way of apprehension.

original: des na de kho na nyid bsam pa las 'phags pa rnams kho na tshad ma yin pa'i phyir de rnams kyi spyod yul la 'jig rten pas gnod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: des na de kho na nyid bsam pa las 'phags pa rnams kho na tshad ma yin pa'i phyir de rnams kyi spyod yul la 'jig rten pas gnod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, since only those who are superior to the world are valid with regard to the contemplation of reality, the world cannot invalidate the domain of those who are superior to the world.

original: gal te yul de kho na nyid la 'jig rten gyi gnod pa brjod par 'dod pas 'jig rten gyi tshad mkhas len na /
analyzed: gal te yul de kho na nyid la 'jig rten gyi gnod pa brjod par 'dod pas 'jig rten gyi tshad mkhas len na /
translated: If you, wishing to invalidate the domain of reality, accept the world as valid,

original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: we will reply to that.

original: de ltar yin dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ltar yin dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The verse says, “If that were so,” etc.

original: gal te yul de kho na nyid la 'jig rten tshad ma nyid du khas len na de'i tshe 'jig rten pas de kho na nyid mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yul de kho na nyid la 'jig rten tshad ma nyid du khas len na de'i tshe 'jig rten pas de kho na nyid mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you accept that the world itself is a valid cognition with respect to reality, then the world would see reality.

original: 'di'i don ni 'dir mi slu ba nyid yin par 'gyur na tshad ma nyid du 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni 'dir mi slu ba nyid yin par 'gyur na tshad ma nyid du 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: The meaning here is that if it were nondeceptive, then it would be a valid cognition.

original: mi slu ba nyid kyang dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du gnas pa yongs su shes pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin la /
analyzed: mi slu ba nyid kyang dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du gnas pa yongs su shes pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin la /
translated: And nondeceptiveness is the reason for the thorough knowledge of things just as they are.

original: yongs su shes pa de yang yod pa dang med pa dang bral ba'i dngos po yongs su shes pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su shes pa de yang yod pa dang med pa dang bral ba'i dngos po yongs su shes pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: And that thorough knowledge is the thorough knowledge of things that are free from existence and nonexistence.

original: des na 'jig rten pas de kho na nyid mthong @151b bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: des na 'jig rten pas de kho na nyid mthong @151b bar 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, the world would see reality.

original: de'i phyir ma rig pa spangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma rig pa spangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: And therefore, ignorance would be eliminated.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach just that,

original: blun po tshad mar rigs pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: blun po tshad mar rigs pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: it is not reasonable for fools to be valid cognitions.

original: dngos po ci lta ba bzhin du gnas pa yongs su ma shes pa dang / yod pa dang med pa nyid la sogs pa'i phyin ci log gi dngos por sgro btags pa la blun po zhes bya la /
analyzed: dngos po ci lta ba bzhin du gnas pa yongs su ma shes pa dang / yod pa dang med pa nyid la sogs pa'i phyin ci log gi dngos por sgro btags pa la blun po zhes bya la /
translated: The fool is one who does not understand things as they are and who superimposes the entities of error such as existence and nonexistence.

original: de ci ltar na tshad ma ste mi slu bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de ci ltar na tshad ma ste mi slu bar 'gyur /
translated: How can that be a valid cognition, i.e., nondeceptive?

original: dngos po phyin ci ma log par yongs su shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po phyin ci ma log par yongs su shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no nonerroneous understanding of things.

original: de'i phyir tshad ma nyid du khas len na ma rig pa spangs pa yin par nges par khas blangs bar bya dgos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshad ma nyid du khas len na ma rig pa spangs pa yin par nges par khas blangs bar bya dgos so //
translated: Therefore, if you accept that it is a valid cognition, you must definitely accept that it abandons ignorance.

original: des na 'jig rten las gzhan du gyur pa'i lam ston par byed pa'i 'phags pa rnams kyis dgos pa ci zhig yod de /
analyzed: des na 'jig rten las gzhan du gyur pa'i lam ston par byed pa'i 'phags pa rnams kyis dgos pa ci zhig yod de /
translated: What purpose is there in teaching a path that is different from the worldly?

original: 'jig rten nyid lam ston par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten nyid lam ston par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the worldly themselves teach the path.

original: gzhan yang 'phags pa'i lam gyis kyang dgos pa ci zhig yod de /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'phags pa'i lam gyis kyang dgos pa ci zhig yod de /
translated: Moreover, what purpose is there in the ārya path?

original: 'jig rten pa'i mig nyid kyis de kho na nyid mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i mig nyid kyis de kho na nyid mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the truth is seen by the worldly eye itself.

original: gal te 'jig rten gyi mig nyid kyis de kho na nyid mthong bar ma gyur na de'i tshe 'phags pa'i lam dgos pa yod pa yin la /
analyzed: gal te 'jig rten gyi mig nyid kyis de kho na nyid mthong bar ma gyur na de'i tshe 'phags pa'i lam dgos pa yod pa yin la /
translated: If the world itself did not see reality, then the noble path would have a purpose.

original: 'on kyang 'jig rten gyi mig nyid kyis de kho na nyid mthong bas 'phags pa'i lam gyis ci zhig bya zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'jig rten gyi mig nyid kyis de kho na nyid mthong bas 'phags pa'i lam gyis ci zhig bya zhes pa'o //
translated: But since the world itself sees reality, what would the noble path do?

original: de nyid 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says:🔽The world itself is valid cognition,

original: 'jig rten tshad ma nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'jig rten tshad ma nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: with regard to the world.

original: gang la zhes bya ba ni skyes bu la'o //
analyzed: gang la zhes bya ba ni skyes bu la'o //
translated: With regard to what? To a person.

original: gang gi yul can gyi zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i rang bzhin can gyi yul can no //
analyzed: gang gi yul can gyi zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i rang bzhin can gyi yul can no //
translated: Whose object? The object of one who has the nature of an entity.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni skyes bu'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni skyes bu'o //
translated: That is, the person.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i rang bzhin can la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i rang bzhin can la'o //
translated: With regard to that, the object of one who has the nature of an entity.

original: nor bu rin po che la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni ras yug la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: nor bu rin po che la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni ras yug la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The words “a precious jewel” and so on include cloth and so on.

original: 'phags pa'i lam khong du chud par zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam khong du chud par zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “In order to penetrate the noble path” means in order to penetrate the path of seeing.🔽“Morality, learning, reflection, meditation, etc.”

original: tshul khrims dang / thos pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang / thos pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: means

original: tshul gnas thos dang bsam ldan pas //
analyzed: tshul gnas thos dang bsam ldan pas //
translated: One who abides in morality, who is endowed with learning,🔽and who is endowed with reflection

original: bsgom pa la ni rab tu sbyor //🔽zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: bsgom pa la ni rab tu sbyor // zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis so //
translated: is well-applied to meditation.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni sbyin pa la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni sbyin pa la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The word “etc.” includes generosity and so on.

original: de ni de ltar yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa rnams kyis de nyid mthong bas 'phags pa'i lam dgos pa med pa ni ma yin no //🔽de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten 'di kho na nyid @152a * //
analyzed: de ni de ltar yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa rnams kyis de nyid mthong bas 'phags pa'i lam dgos pa med pa ni ma yin no // de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten 'di kho na nyid @152a * //
translated: It is not like that, because the noble path is not purposeless, since it sees reality through the eyes, etc.

original: mthong ba ma yin pas so //
analyzed: mthong ba ma yin pas so //
translated: “Therefore” means because this world does not see reality.

original: de nyid skabs su zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid kyi gnas skabs na ste /
analyzed: de nyid skabs su zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid kyi gnas skabs na ste /
translated: “In the context of reality” means in the context of reality.

original: spyod yul ma yin pa la tshad ma nyid du mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyod yul ma yin pa la tshad ma nyid du mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not reasonable that it be a valid cognition with regard to what is not its object-field.

original: de'i phyir de kho na nyid kyi skabs su 'jig rten gyi yul ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir 'jig rten gyi gnod pa yod par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de kho na nyid kyi skabs su 'jig rten gyi yul ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir 'jig rten gyi gnod pa yod par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, since the object of the world is not reality, the objection of the world does not exist in the context of reality.

original: rab rib can gyis rab rib med pa'i shes pa la mi gnod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rab rib can gyis rab rib med pa'i shes pa la mi gnod pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, the consciousness of one with cataracts does not invalidate the consciousness of one without cataracts.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i tshul 'di las na zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa rnams kyi dgos pa med pa dang / mig la sogs pa'i de kho na nyid mthong bas 'phags pa'i lam dgos pa med pa nyid du bstan pa'i tshul las so //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i tshul 'di las na zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa rnams kyi dgos pa med pa dang / mig la sogs pa'i de kho na nyid mthong bas 'phags pa'i lam dgos pa med pa nyid du bstan pa'i tshul las so //
translated: “From this method of explanation” means from the method of teaching that the noble ones have no purpose and that the noble path is purposeless because of seeing the reality of the eye and so on.

original: de ltar de kho na nyid kyi skabs su 'jig rten tshad ma ma yin pas 'jig rten gyi gnod pa yod par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar de kho na nyid kyi skabs su 'jig rten tshad ma ma yin pas 'jig rten gyi gnod pa yod par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught that since the world is not a valid cognition in the context of reality, the objection of the world does not exist,

original: 'jig rten gyi gnod pa'i yul gyi khyad par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi gnod pa'i yul gyi khyad par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach the specific object of the objection of the world,

original: 'o na ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says “But how?” and so on.

original: gal te de kho na nyid kyi skabs su 'jig rten gyis gnod par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te de kho na nyid kyi skabs su 'jig rten gyis gnod par mi 'gyur na /
translated: If the world does not invalidate in the context of reality,

original: 'o na gang la 'jig rten gyis gnod par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gang la 'jig rten gyis gnod par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: then with respect to what will the world invalidate?

original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the reply to that,

original: bshad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bshad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says “the world’s meaning,” and so on.

original: 'jig rten don ni zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pas rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten don ni zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pas rtogs pa'o //
translated: The world’s meaning is the world’s understanding.

original: 'jig rten grags pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten la grags pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: 'jig rten grags pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten la grags pa'i don gyis so //
translated: By the world’s renown means by the meaning renowned in the world.

original: de nyid la dpe bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid la dpe bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate an example for that,

original: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says “for example,” and so on.

original: 'dir yang 'jig rten gyis rtogs pa'i don ni gnyid sad pa'i mthong ba'i bum pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang 'jig rten gyis rtogs pa'i don ni gnyid sad pa'i mthong ba'i bum pa'o //
translated: Here also, the meaning understood by the world is a pot seen by one who is awake.

original: de rmi lam gyi shes pa'i yul du gyur pa'i bum pa dang / dper byas nas gang gi tshe sad pa'i gnas skabs kyi bum pa yod pa ma yin no zhes sun 'byin par byed pa de'i tshe 'jig rten gyis gnod par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: de rmi lam gyi shes pa'i yul du gyur pa'i bum pa dang / dper byas nas gang gi tshe sad pa'i gnas skabs kyi bum pa yod pa ma yin no zhes sun 'byin par byed pa de'i tshe 'jig rten gyis gnod par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: When you use the example of a pot that is an object of a dream consciousness and then refute the existence of a pot in the waking state, you are contradicted by the world.

original: gang gi phyir sad pa'i gnas skabs na mthong ba'i bum pa 'jig rten gyis bden pa nyid du rtogs la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sad pa'i gnas skabs na mthong ba'i bum pa 'jig rten gyis bden pa nyid du rtogs la /
translated: This is because the pot seen in the waking state is understood by the world to be real.

original: rmi lam gyi gnas skabs na mi bden pa nyid du mthong ba des sad pa'i gnas skabs na mthong ba la bden pa ma yin no zhes ji ltar rjod par byed de /🔽dper na rab rib med pa la bse ru la sogs pa'i snod skra shad dang mi ldan par mthong la /
analyzed: rmi lam gyi gnas skabs na mi bden pa nyid du mthong ba des sad pa'i gnas skabs na mthong ba la bden pa ma yin no zhes ji ltar rjod par byed de / dper na rab rib med pa la bse ru la sogs pa'i snod skra shad dang mi ldan par mthong la /
translated: And because the pot seen in the dream state is seen to be unreal, how can you say that the pot seen in the waking state is not real?🔽For example, someone without cataracts sees a rhinoceros-hide vessel as not having hairs.

original: rab rib can gyis bse ru la sogs pa'i snod skra shad dang @152b ldan par mthong bas mi gnod kyi /
analyzed: rab rib can gyis bse ru la sogs pa'i snod skra shad dang @152b ldan par mthong bas mi gnod kyi /
translated: Someone with cataracts sees a rhinoceros-hide vessel as having hairs.

original: 'on kyang bden par rtogs pas gnod pa de bzhin du 'dir yang ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang bden par rtogs pas gnod pa de bzhin du 'dir yang ngo //
translated: But the former is not undermined by the latter, because the former understands the vessel to be real, whereas the latter does not.

original: des na sad pa'i gnas skabs na bum pa bden par rtogs pas bum pa med pa nyid sel ba yin pas 'jig rten gyis gnod par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: des na sad pa'i gnas skabs na bum pa bden par rtogs pas bum pa med pa nyid sel ba yin pas 'jig rten gyis gnod par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Therefore, since a pot is realized to be real in the waking state, the nonexistence of a pot is eliminated. Thus, the worldly perspective contradicts you.

original: de lta bu la sogs pa'i yul zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni gser 'di rdzas ma yin te gzhal bya yin pa'i phyir rmi lam gyi gser bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa'i yul zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni gser 'di rdzas ma yin te gzhal bya yin pa'i phyir rmi lam gyi gser bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: “Such objects” and so on. The phrase “and so on” includes such statements as, “This gold is not a substance because it is an object of knowledge, like gold in a dream.”

original: gang gi tshe 'phags pa'i gzigs pa la gnas te zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i gzigs pa khas len na ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'phags pa'i gzigs pa la gnas te zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i gzigs pa khas len na ste /
translated: “When one abides in the perspective of the āryas” means when one accepts the perspective of the āryas.

original: 'phags pa'i gzigs pa la ltos nas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i gzigs pa la ltos nas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that one should rely on the perspective of the āryas.

original: skye bo mkhas pa tshad mar byed pa de'i tshe ni zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i skye bo tshad mar khas len pa de'i tshe'o //
analyzed: skye bo mkhas pa tshad mar byed pa de'i tshe ni zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i skye bo tshad mar khas len pa de'i tshe'o //
translated: “When the wise take the āryas as valid” means when one accepts the āryas as valid.

original: 'jig rten gyi gnod pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rab rib med pas mthong ba la rab rib can gyis mthong ba de bzhin du 'jig rten pa'i gnod pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi gnod pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rab rib med pas mthong ba la rab rib can gyis mthong ba de bzhin du 'jig rten pa'i gnod pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The world does not invalidate us, just as the person without eye disease does not invalidate the person with eye disease.

original: phyogs 'dis zhes bya ba ni gzhan las skye ba 'gog pa la 'jig rten gyis gnod pa yod par mi 'gyur ba'i rigs pas so //
analyzed: phyogs 'dis zhes bya ba ni gzhan las skye ba 'gog pa la 'jig rten gyis gnod pa yod par mi 'gyur ba'i rigs pas so //
translated: By this method, the world does not invalidate the refutation of arising from another.🔽We can also analyze the matter further.

original: gzhan yang dpyad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ba des gzhan yang mi mthong ste /🔽dper na bum pa bzhin mig gis kyang gzugs mi mthong ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang dpyad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ba des gzhan yang mi mthong ste / dper na bum pa bzhin mig gis kyang gzugs mi mthong ba ste /
translated: The eye does not see itself, and therefore it does not see other things either.🔽For example, like a pot.

original: rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The eye does not see material form because it does not see itself.

original: de la gzhan dag na re mig gis gzhan mthong bar 'jig rten la grags pa'i phyir 'jig rten la grags pa'i gzhan mthong bas mig gis gzhan mthong ba 'gegs pa de sel bar byed pa yin no zer na /
analyzed: de la gzhan dag na re mig gis gzhan mthong bar 'jig rten la grags pa'i phyir 'jig rten la grags pa'i gzhan mthong bas mig gis gzhan mthong ba 'gegs pa de sel bar byed pa yin no zer na /
translated: In response to this, some say that the eye sees other things because it is commonly thought that the eye sees other things.

original: de la sngar bstan pa bzhin du lan brjod par bya ste ;
analyzed: de la sngar bstan pa bzhin du lan brjod par bya ste ;
translated: The response to that should be stated as follows:

original: gang mig gis gzhan mthong ba'i 'gog pa de ni 'phags pa rnams kyi gzigs pa la ltos nas yin la /
analyzed: gang mig gis gzhan mthong ba'i 'gog pa de ni 'phags pa rnams kyi gzigs pa la ltos nas yin la /
translated: The cessation of what is seen by the eye in dependence on the vision of the āryas

original: de la yang sngar bstan pa'i tshul gyis 'jig rten la grags pa'i gnod pa med pa'i phyir 'jig rten gyi gnod pa yod par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de la yang sngar bstan pa'i tshul gyis 'jig rten la grags pa'i gnod pa med pa'i phyir 'jig rten gyi gnod pa yod par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: is not undermined by what is renowned in the world, as was explained earlier. Therefore it should be understood that the world does not undermine it.

original: de ltar 'jig rten la grags pas gzhan las skye ba khas blangs nas 'jig rten gyi gnod pa spang ba bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten la grags pas gzhan las skye ba khas blangs nas 'jig rten gyi gnod pa spang ba bstan nas /
translated: Having accepted arising from other in terms of what is renowned in the world, the response to the refutation of arising from other🔽in terms of what is renowned in the world

original: da ni 'jig rten pa'i grags pas kyang gzhan las skye ba yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽de'i lta ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni 'jig rten pa'i grags pas kyang gzhan las skye ba yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir / de'i lta ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that arising from other does not exist even in terms of what is renowned in the world, he says:

original: de'i lta ba la gnas nas kyang @153a * //
analyzed: de'i lta ba la gnas nas kyang @153a * //
translated: Even in terms of the views of the world🔽.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i mthong ba la brten nas kyang ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i mthong ba la brten nas kyang ngo //
translated: Even in terms of the views of the world means even in dependence on worldly seeing.

original: sa bon tsam zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nur nur po la sogs pa skyed par byed pa'i mi gtsang ba tsam mo //
analyzed: sa bon tsam zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nur nur po la sogs pa skyed par byed pa'i mi gtsang ba tsam mo //
translated: The phrase “just the seed, etc.” refers to the mere impurity that produces the embryo, etc.

original: bdag gis bu 'di bskyed ces smra byed cing //
analyzed: bdag gis bu 'di bskyed ces smra byed cing //
translated: “This son was born by me”🔽means that when one sees the child born from the mother’s womb, endowed with the faculties, one says, “This son was born by me.”

original: zhes bya ba ni ma'i mngal nas btsas pa'i dbang po dang ldan pa mthong nas bu 'di bdag gis bskyed pa yin no zhes rjod par byed pa dang / de bzhin du aa mra la sogs pa'i sa bon tsam btsugs nas aa mra skyes pa na aa mra gang gis btsugs pa yin zhes brjod pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ma'i mngal nas btsas pa'i dbang po dang ldan pa mthong nas bu 'di bdag gis bskyed pa yin no zhes rjod par byed pa dang / de bzhin du aa mra la sogs pa'i sa bon tsam btsugs nas aa mra skyes pa na aa mra gang gis btsugs pa yin zhes brjod pa'o //
translated: Similarly, when one plants just the seed of a mango, etc., and when the mango is born, one says, “The mango was planted by me.”

original: gang gi phyir mi gtsang ba dang / bu dag dang / sa bon dang / aa mra'i rgyu dang / 'bras bu dag la 'jig rten gyis gcig nyid du nges pa de'i phyir 'jig rten gyi rtogs pas gzhan la skye bar mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mi gtsang ba dang / bu dag dang / sa bon dang / aa mra'i rgyu dang / 'bras bu dag la 'jig rten gyis gcig nyid du nges pa de'i phyir 'jig rten gyi rtogs pas gzhan la skye bar mi 'grub ste /
translated: Since the world ascertains that the cause and effect are the same in the case of impurity, the son, the seed, the mango, and so on, therefore, since the world’s understanding is not established as arising from another,

original: gcig tu rtogs pa dang / gzhan nyid du rtogs pa la 'gal bas so //
analyzed: gcig tu rtogs pa dang / gzhan nyid du rtogs pa la 'gal bas so //
translated: it is contradictory to understand them as the same and to understand them as different.

original: gzhan las skye ba 'jig rten las kyang med do zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir 'jig rten pas skyed par byed pa dang bskyed par bya ba dag gcig nyid du nges pa de'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i sgo nas gzhan las skye ba grub pa ma yin no
analyzed: gzhan las skye ba 'jig rten las kyang med do zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir 'jig rten pas skyed par byed pa dang bskyed par bya ba dag gcig nyid du nges pa de'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i sgo nas gzhan las skye ba grub pa ma yin no
translated: The statement arising from other does not exist even in the world is because worldly people definitely ascertain that the producer and the produced are not the same thing. Therefore, arising from other is not established from the worldly perspective.

original: zhes pa'o // de nyid 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // de nyid 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach just that, the Autocommentary says:

original: pho'i dbang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: pho'i dbang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The male faculty, etc.

original: 'di rnam pa 'di lta bu zhig ces bya ba'i pho'i dbang pos mngon par gsal bar byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di rnam pa 'di lta bu zhig ces bya ba'i pho'i dbang pos mngon par gsal bar byas pa'o //
translated: The male faculty makes it manifest in this way.

original: de'i sa bon du gyur pa zhes bya ba ni bu'i sa bon du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de'i sa bon du gyur pa zhes bya ba ni bu'i sa bon du gyur pa'o //
translated: The seed of that is the seed of the son.

original: gzhan nyid yin na ni gang zag gzhan ltar de yang nye bar ston par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gal te 'jig rten pas sa bon dang myu gu dag gzhan nyid du rtogs par 'gyur na ni ci ltar sa bon de la rang gi bu gzhan
analyzed: gzhan nyid yin na ni gang zag gzhan ltar de yang nye bar ston par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gal te 'jig rten pas sa bon dang myu gu dag gzhan nyid du rtogs par 'gyur na ni ci ltar sa bon de la rang gi bu gzhan
translated: If they were different, it would not be presented in that way, just like another person. If worldly people understood that seeds and sprouts are different, then just like that person, the seed would not produce the sprout.

original: nyid yin pa de bzhin du rang gi bu las gang zag gzhan yang rang gi sa bon las gzhan yin la /
analyzed: nyid yin pa de bzhin du rang gi bu las gang zag gzhan yang rang gi sa bon las gzhan yin la /
translated: Just as the son is not different from himself, in the same way, another person is not different from his own seed.
