original: des na gzhan nyid yin du zin kyang ci ltar gang zag gzhan rang gi bu nyid du mi ston pa de bzhin du gzhan nyid khyad par med pa'i phyir rang gi bu yang bu 'di phas bskyed pa yin no zhes ston par byed par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: des na gzhan nyid yin du zin kyang ci ltar gang zag gzhan rang gi bu nyid du mi ston pa de bzhin du gzhan nyid khyad par med pa'i phyir rang gi bu yang bu 'di phas bskyed pa yin no zhes ston par byed par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Therefore, even though he is different, just as another person is not shown to be his own son, in the same way, because there is no difference in being different, one would not show that “this son was generated by his father,” because he is his own son.🔽The same should be applied to seeds and trees.

original: de bzhin du sa bon dang ljon shing dag la yang sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang zhig ljon shing nye bar ston zhing ljon shing 'di'i sa bon btsugs pa yin no zhes brjod la /
analyzed: de bzhin du sa bon dang ljon shing dag la yang sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang zhig ljon shing nye bar ston zhing ljon shing 'di'i sa bon btsugs pa yin no zhes brjod la /
translated: One says, “I planted this tree,” showing the tree,

original: ljon shing de btsugs pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: ljon shing de btsugs pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: but the tree was not planted.

original: 'on kyang de'i sa bon tsam mo //
analyzed: 'on kyang de'i sa bon tsam mo //
translated: However, only its seed was planted.

original: des na gcig nyid yin no //
analyzed: des na gcig nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are the same.

original: @153b gzhan nyid yin na ni ljon shing de gzhan bzhin du de yang nye bar ston par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: @153b gzhan nyid yin na ni ljon shing de gzhan bzhin du de yang nye bar ston par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: If they were different, then like a different tree, it would not manifest.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i tshul la zhes bya ba ni rang dang / gzhan las skye ba bkag pa'i rigs pa las so //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i tshul la zhes bya ba ni rang dang / gzhan las skye ba bkag pa'i rigs pa las so //
translated: “In the manner that has been explained” means by the reasoning that refutes arising from self and from another.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rtag pa dang chad pa med par grub pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni 'dir gzhan las skye ba yin na sa bon dang / myu gu dag gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rtag pa dang chad pa med par grub pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni 'dir gzhan las skye ba yin na sa bon dang / myu gu dag gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: “By way of establishing dependent origination as free from permanence and annihilation” means that if arising from another, then the seed and the sprout would be different.

original: gzhan las skye ba med pas gzhan nyid ma grub pa'i phyir myu gu bzhin du sa bon yang chad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan las skye ba med pas gzhan nyid ma grub pa'i phyir myu gu bzhin du sa bon yang chad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But because there is no arising from another, since difference is not established, like the sprout, the seed would not be annihilated.

original: de ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba chad pa med pa'i chos nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba chad pa med pa'i chos nyid do //
translated: Thus dependent origination has the nature of being free from annihilation.

original: de bzhin du rang las skye bar gyur na sa bon dang myu gu dag gzhan ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur la /
analyzed: de bzhin du rang las skye bar gyur na sa bon dang myu gu dag gzhan ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur la /
translated: In the same way, if there were arising from self, then the seed and the sprout would not be different.

original: de med pas rang bzhin med pa'i phyir sa bon gang yin pa de nyid myu gu ma yin pas sa bon 'jig pa med pa bkag pa'i phyir rtag pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de med pas rang bzhin med pa'i phyir sa bon gang yin pa de nyid myu gu ma yin pas sa bon 'jig pa med pa bkag pa'i phyir rtag pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since that does not exist, because it is essenceless, the seed itself is not the sprout. Therefore, since the non-cessation of the seed is refuted, it is not permanent.

original: de ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rtag pa ma yin pa'i chos nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rtag pa ma yin pa'i chos nyid do //
translated: Thus dependent origination is not a permanent reality.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽gang phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir / gang phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says:

original: de'i phyir myug tshe sa bon zhig pa med //
analyzed: de'i phyir myug tshe sa bon zhig pa med //
translated: Because of that, at the time of the sprout, the seed does not cease.

original: ces bya ba ni gzhan nyid med pas myu gu yod pa nyid sa bon yod pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni gzhan nyid med pas myu gu yod pa nyid sa bon yod pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since they are not different, the existence of the sprout is the existence of the seed.

original: myug tshe sa bon yod ces brjod mi bya //
analyzed: myug tshe sa bon yod ces brjod mi bya //
translated: At the time of the sprout, one should not say that the seed exists.

original: zhes bya ba ni gcig nyid ma yin pas myu gu skye na sa bon zhig pa srid pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gcig nyid ma yin pas myu gu skye na sa bon zhig pa srid pas so //
translated: Since they are not identical, when the sprout arises, the cessation of the seed is possible.

original: 'di'i don ni gal te sa bon dang myu gu dag la rang bzhin yod par gyur na de'i tshe gcig pa nyid dang tha dad pa nyid rigs pa las 'on kyang rang gzhan las skye ba bkag pa'i rang bzhin bkag pa yin pas gcig dang bdag nyid ga
analyzed: 'di'i don ni gal te sa bon dang myu gu dag la rang bzhin yod par gyur na de'i tshe gcig pa nyid dang tha dad pa nyid rigs pa las 'on kyang rang gzhan las skye ba bkag pa'i rang bzhin bkag pa yin pas gcig dang bdag nyid ga
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: If seed and sprout had intrinsic reality, then sameness and difference would be logical. However, since intrinsic reality is refuted by the refutation of self-arising and arising from another, sameness and difference

original: la srid / de med pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni rtag pa dang chad pa med pa'i chos nyid do //
analyzed: la srid / de med pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni rtag pa dang chad pa med pa'i chos nyid do //
translated: are impossible. Since those do not exist, dependent arising is the reality free from permanence and annihilation.

original: de nyid 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽gal te myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir / gal te myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach just that, the Commentary states:🔽If the sprout existed, the seed would be annihilated.

original: myu gu yod bzhin du yang sa bon rgyun chad par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni sa bon zhig nas myu gu skye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: myu gu yod bzhin du yang sa bon rgyun chad par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni sa bon zhig nas myu gu skye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the sprout existed, the seed would be annihilated means that the sprout arises after the seed has disintegrated.

original: de la dpe bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la dpe bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the example of that,

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te go sla'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te go sla'o //
translated: the Commentary states:🔽Because the sprout arises from the seed,

original: sa bon yod na myu gu 'byung 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: sa bon yod na myu gu 'byung 'gyur zhing //
translated: and the seed is not perceived after the sprout arises,🔽therefore, the seed is not annihilated.

original: zhes bya ba ni sa bon yod na myu gu 'byung ba gang yin pa de chos can no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sa bon yod na myu gu 'byung ba gang yin pa de chos can no //
translated: This is the subject, i.e., the arising of the sprout when the seed exists.

original: sa bon gang yin myu gu de nyid min //
analyzed: sa bon gang yin myu gu de nyid min //
translated: The seed is not the sprout.

original: zhes bya ba ni sa bon @154a * //🔽dang myu gu dag gzhan ma yin pa de nyid ma yin no zhes bsgrub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sa bon @154a * // dang myu gu dag gzhan ma yin pa de nyid ma yin no zhes bsgrub par bya ba'o //
translated: This is the thesis.

original: de las gzhan min de yang ma yin phyir //
analyzed: de las gzhan min de yang ma yin phyir //
translated: The seed is not the sprout, because the seed and the sprout are not identical.🔽The seed is not different from the sprout, because the intrinsic nature is not established.

original: zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin ma grub pa'i phyir de nyid dam gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gtan tshigs bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin ma grub pa'i phyir de nyid dam gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gtan tshigs bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the reason.

original: de ltar phyogs gnyis char yang zhes bya ba ni gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyi phyogs dag go //
analyzed: de ltar phyogs gnyis char yang zhes bya ba ni gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyi phyogs dag go //
translated: Thus, in both cases, i.e., in the positions of identity and difference,

original: de na 'di nyid ces bya ba ni gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa mi rigs pa'i phyir don de nyid do //
analyzed: de na 'di nyid ces bya ba ni gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa mi rigs pa'i phyir don de nyid do //
translated: this is the same, i.e., the same point, because identity and difference are not tenable.

original: 'du byed rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'du byed de dag nyid du yod min zhes bya ba ni rang dang gzhan las skye ba med pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: 'du byed rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'du byed de dag nyid du yod min zhes bya ba ni rang dang gzhan las skye ba med pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: “The formations” and so on. “Those very formations do not exist” because they are not produced from self or other.

original: / g-yo ba dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni bya ba dang mi ldan pa ste /
analyzed: / g-yo ba dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni bya ba dang mi ldan pa ste /
translated: “Devoid of movement” means they are not endowed with activity.

original: ma rig pa yang ngas 'du byed bskyed par bya'o snyam du sems pa med pa dang / 'du byed kyang ni ma rig pas bskyed do snyam pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa yang ngas 'du byed bskyed par bya'o snyam du sems pa med pa dang / 'du byed kyang ni ma rig pas bskyed do snyam pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Ignorance does not think, “I will produce the formations,” and the formations do not think, “We are produced by ignorance.”

original: bshad pa zhes bya ba ni mdo las so //
analyzed: bshad pa zhes bya ba ni mdo las so //
translated: “It is explained” in the sutra.

original: bstan bcos las kyang zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba'i shes rab kyi 'jig rten pa'i de kho na nyid kyi mtshan nyid ston pa'i gnas skabs las so //🔽gang la brten te gang 'byung ba //
analyzed: bstan bcos las kyang zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba'i shes rab kyi 'jig rten pa'i de kho na nyid kyi mtshan nyid ston pa'i gnas skabs las so // gang la brten te gang 'byung ba //
translated: “In the treatise” means in the Fundamental Treatise on the Middle Way, in the context of teaching the characteristics of mundane reality.

original: zhes bya ba ni rgyu gang la brten nas 'bras bu gang 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rgyu gang la brten nas 'bras bu gang 'byung ba ste /
translated: “Whatever arises in dependence on something” means whatever result arises in dependence on whatever cause.

original: dper na s'a lu'i sa bon la brten nas s'a lu'i myu gu skye ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na s'a lu'i sa bon la brten nas s'a lu'i myu gu skye ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, a rice sprout arises in dependence on a rice seed.

original: de nyid re zhig de nyid min //
analyzed: de nyid re zhig de nyid min //
translated: That itself is not that itself.

original: zhes bya ba ni sa bon gang yin pa de nyid myu gu ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sa bon gang yin pa de nyid myu gu ma yin te /
translated: That which is a seed is not that itself, i.e., not the sprout,

original: bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa dag gcig nyid du thal bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa dag gcig nyid du thal bar 'gyur la /
translated: because it follows that that which is to be produced and that which produces it are the same.

original: de ni pha dang bu dag kyang gcig nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni pha dang bu dag kyang gcig nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: And that would make father and son the same.

original: gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir myu gu'i gnas skabs na myu gu bzhin du sa bon yang dmigs par 'gyur ba dang / sa bon bzhin du myu gu yang dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir myu gu'i gnas skabs na myu gu bzhin du sa bon yang dmigs par 'gyur ba dang / sa bon bzhin du myu gu yang dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it is not different, like the sprout in the state of the sprout, the seed would also be observed, and like the seed, the sprout would not be observed.

original: de ltar na sa bon rtag par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na sa bon rtag par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, it follows that the seed would be permanent,

original: mi 'jig par khas blangs pas so //
analyzed: mi 'jig par khas blangs pas so //
translated: because it is accepted as indestructible.

original: des na skyon chen po rtag par thal bar 'gyur ba dang / las kyi 'bras bu la sogs pa med par thal bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: des na skyon chen po rtag par thal bar 'gyur ba dang / las kyi 'bras bu la sogs pa med par thal bar 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, the great fault of the consequence of permanence and the consequence of the nonexistence of the effect of action and so on would ensue.

original: de ltar re zhig sa bon gang yin pa de nyid myu gu yin par rigs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig sa bon gang yin pa de nyid myu gu yin par rigs pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is reasonable that the seed itself is the sprout.

original: de las gzhan pa yang ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni sa bon las myu gu gzhan pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa yang ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni sa bon las myu gu gzhan pa yang ma yin te /
translated: “ It is not different from that” means that the sprout is not different from the seed,

original: sa bon med par myu gu skye bar 'gyur ba dang / myu gu'i gnas skabs na yang sa bon yod par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: sa bon med par myu gu skye bar 'gyur ba dang / myu gu'i gnas skabs na yang sa bon yod par 'gyur bas so //
translated: because the sprout would arise without a seed, and the seed would exist even at the time of the sprout.

original: des na 'tshol ba'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na 'tshol ba'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the error of nihilism would follow.🔽Therefore, it is said:

original: des na / de'i phyir rtag min chad @154b pa'ang min //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: des na / de'i phyir rtag min chad @154b pa'ang min // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is not permanent and not annihilated.

original: gang gi phyir rgyu gang la brten nas 'bras bu gang skye ba'i rgyu nyid 'bras bu ma yin pa dang / rgyu de las 'bras bu de gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgyu gang la brten nas 'bras bu gang skye ba'i rgyu nyid 'bras bu ma yin pa dang / rgyu de las 'bras bu de gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the cause itself is not the effect and the effect is not different from the cause,

original: des na rgyu de chad pa dang rtag pa nyid du rnam par gzhag par mi nus so //
analyzed: des na rgyu de chad pa dang rtag pa nyid du rnam par gzhag par mi nus so //
translated: therefore, it is not possible to posit the cause as annihilated or permanent.

original: da ni skye ba med pa gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya ba yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni skye ba med pa gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya ba yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that the nonexistence of arising must be accepted without doubt,🔽he says:

original: ci ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ci ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The verse beginning How could it be? continues.

original: de lta ma yin te zhes bya ba ni don dam par dngos po'i rang bzhin skye bar khas len na'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin te zhes bya ba ni don dam par dngos po'i rang bzhin skye bar khas len na'o //
translated: If it were not so, that is, if one accepted that the nature of things arises ultimately, then the verse beginning If the nature of things continues.

original: gal te rang gi mtshan nyid brten gyur na //
analyzed: gal te rang gi mtshan nyid brten gyur na //
translated: If the nature of things were dependent,

original: zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen la brten nas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen la brten nas so //
translated: dependent means dependent on causes and conditions.

original: de la skur ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i rang bzhin la skur ba btab pas so //
analyzed: de la skur ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i rang bzhin la skur ba btab pas so //
translated: There, denial means the denial of the nature of things.

original: dngos po 'jig pa'i phyir /🔽stong pa nyid dngos po 'jig pa'i rgyur gyur na zhes bya ba ni don dam par rang bzhin skyes pa la stong pa nyid kyi dngos po'i rang bzhin bkag pas so //
analyzed: dngos po 'jig pa'i phyir / stong pa nyid dngos po 'jig pa'i rgyur gyur na zhes bya ba ni don dam par rang bzhin skyes pa la stong pa nyid kyi dngos po'i rang bzhin bkag pas so //
translated: Because it destroys things,🔽if emptiness were the cause of the destruction of things means that if the nature of things were to arise ultimately, emptiness would be the cause of the destruction of the nature of things.

original: de ni rigs min zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i rang bzhin yod par gyur na stong pa nyid kyi dngos po stong pa nyid du bya bar mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni rigs min zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i rang bzhin yod par gyur na stong pa nyid kyi dngos po stong pa nyid du bya bar mi rigs te /
translated: That is illogical, that is, if the nature of things existed, it would be illogical for emptiness to make the nature of things empty.

original: me yod par gyur na de'i rang bzhin tsha ba nyid gzhan du bya bar mi nus pas so zhes pas so //
analyzed: me yod par gyur na de'i rang bzhin tsha ba nyid gzhan du bya bar mi nus pas so zhes pas so //
translated: If fire exists, its nature of heat cannot be made otherwise.

original: de nyid 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach just that,

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “If one says, ‘form is empty,’ etc.”

original: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni 'du shes la sogs pa gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni 'du shes la sogs pa gzung bar bya'o //
translated: The phrase “form, feeling, etc.” should be taken to include perception and so on.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid de rang gi ngo bo dang rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni gong ma gong ma 'og ma 'og mas bshad par bya //🔽ci ltar skyes pa'i rang bzhin la skur ba btab pas stong pa nyid rtogs par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni dngos po rang gi rgyu las skyes pa la stong pa nyid du mthong bas skur ba stong pa nyid du btab pa'i sgo nas stong pa nyid du
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid de rang gi ngo bo dang rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni gong ma gong ma 'og ma 'og mas bshad par bya // ci ltar skyes pa'i rang bzhin la skur ba btab pas stong pa nyid rtogs par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni dngos po rang gi rgyu las skyes pa la stong pa nyid du mthong bas skur ba stong pa nyid du btab pa'i sgo nas stong pa nyid du
translated: “ Own characteristic” means own nature and own essence.🔽How does one come to understand emptiness by way of the denial of the nature that is produced?

original: rtogs par 'gyur ba'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs par 'gyur ba'o zhes pa'o //
translated: The phrase “by way of the denial of the nature that is produced” means that by seeing that things are empty of being produced from themselves, one comes to understand emptiness by way of the denial of emptiness.

original: de ni rung ba yang ma yin te zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin stong pa nyid du bya bar mi rigs pa dang / stong pa nyid du mthong ba log pa'i shes par thal bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: de ni rung ba yang ma yin te zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin stong pa nyid du bya bar mi rigs pa dang / stong pa nyid du mthong ba log pa'i shes par thal bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: That is not correct, because it is not correct to make emptiness into a nature, and because it would follow that the perception of emptiness is a mistaken consciousness.

original: thams cad kyi tshe skye bas khas blangs par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni gdod pa nas skye ba med par khas blang bar bya dgos te /
analyzed: thams cad kyi tshe skye bas khas blangs par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni gdod pa nas skye ba med par khas blang bar bya dgos te /
translated: One should not accept arising at all times, because one must accept that there is no arising from the beginning.

original: bcos ma ma yin pa'i dngos po la skye ba nyid med pas so //🔽dbu ma'i lam zhes bya ba ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa @155a * //
analyzed: bcos ma ma yin pa'i dngos po la skye ba nyid med pas so // dbu ma'i lam zhes bya ba ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa @155a * //
translated: Since there is no arising in an unfabricated thing.

original: dang bral ba'i lam gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dang bral ba'i lam gang yin pa'o //
translated: The middle way is the path free from the conceptualization of things and non-things, etc.

original: de'i bshad pa ni yang dag par so sor rtog pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni yang dag par so sor rtog pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The explanation of that is “correct discrimination,” etc.

original: dngos po ci lta ba bzhin du yang dag par yongs su shes pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po ci lta ba bzhin du yang dag par yongs su shes pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the correct understanding of things as they are.

original: yang dag par so sor rtog pa ni zhes bya ba de nyid rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir ;
analyzed: yang dag par so sor rtog pa ni zhes bya ba de nyid rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir ;
translated: In order to teach that in detail, he says:🔽That which is empty of duality

original: gang stong pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽'dir sems tsam pa rnams kyis kun brtags dang gzhan dbang yongs su grub pa ste /
analyzed: gang stong pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / 'dir sems tsam pa rnams kyis kun brtags dang gzhan dbang yongs su grub pa ste /
translated: is the imagined nature.

original: ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum brjod la /🔽de la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las sngon po la sogs par snang ba'i shes pa skye ba gang yin pa de ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo ste /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum brjod la / de la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las sngon po la sogs par snang ba'i shes pa skye ba gang yin pa de ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo ste /
translated: Here, the Cittamātra state that there are three natures: the imagined, the dependent, and the consummate.

original: rkyen gyi dbang gis 'jug pa'i phyir ro //🔽de nyid don dam par gnyis su med pa yin pa la gnyis kyi dngos por brtags pa gang yin pa de ni kun brtags kyi ngo bo yin te /
analyzed: rkyen gyi dbang gis 'jug pa'i phyir ro // de nyid don dam par gnyis su med pa yin pa la gnyis kyi dngos por brtags pa gang yin pa de ni kun brtags kyi ngo bo yin te /
translated: The consciousness that arises from the foundation consciousness as the appearance of blue and so on is the dependent nature because it arises under the influence of conditions.

original: brtags pa tsam du yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtags pa tsam du yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That very [dependent nature] is ultimately nondual, but the imputation of it as a thing that is dual is the imagined nature because it exists as mere imputation.

original: sngon po la sogs pa snang ba'i shes pa de nyid la dus thams cad du gzung ba dang 'dzin pas stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa snang ba'i shes pa de nyid la dus thams cad du gzung ba dang 'dzin pas stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
translated: The emptiness of the object of appearance and the subject of appearance at all times in the consciousness to which blue and so on appear is the consummate nature.

original: dus thams cad du de bzhin du gnas pas so //
analyzed: dus thams cad du de bzhin du gnas pas so //
translated: It is so because it abides just so at all times.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /🔽gang zhig snang ba 'di gzhan dbang //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir / gang zhig snang ba 'di gzhan dbang //
translated: For that reason,🔽The dependent is what appears.

original: ci ltar snang ba 'di kun brtags //
analyzed: ci ltar snang ba 'di kun brtags //
translated: How it appears is the imagined.

original: rkyen gyi dbang du 'jug phyir dang // brtags pa tsam du yod phyir ro //
analyzed: rkyen gyi dbang du 'jug phyir dang // brtags pa tsam du yod phyir ro //
translated: Because it is governed by conditions and because it exists as mere imagination.

original: snang ba de la ji lta bar //
analyzed: snang ba de la ji lta bar //
translated: In that appearance,

original: snang bzhin rtag tu med nyid gang //
analyzed: snang bzhin rtag tu med nyid gang //
translated: The way it appears is always nonexistent.

original: de ni yongs grub ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: de ni yongs grub ngo bo nyid //
translated: That is the consummate nature.

original: shes bya gzhan du mi 'gyur phyir //
analyzed: shes bya gzhan du mi 'gyur phyir //
translated: Because the object of knowledge does not change into something else.

original: zhes gsungs pas so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de la sems tsam pa rnams kyis sngon po la sogs pa'i snang ba'i gzhan gyi dbang yongs su brtags pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pas stong pa nyid kyis stong par byed la /
analyzed: de la sems tsam pa rnams kyis sngon po la sogs pa'i snang ba'i gzhan gyi dbang yongs su brtags pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pas stong pa nyid kyis stong par byed la /
translated: Cittamātra refutes the emptiness of the dependent nature, which is the appearance of blue and so on, by the emptiness of the imagined nature, which is the object of appearance and the subject of appearance.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas gang stong pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas gang stong pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In this regard, it is said, “By means of emptiness, etc.”

original: stong pa nyid kyis te stong pa nyid chos thams cad kyis stong pa yin no zhes stong pa nyid kyi rnam pas bsgoms pa las byung ba'i sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid can stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyis te stong pa nyid chos thams cad kyis stong pa yin no zhes stong pa nyid kyi rnam pas bsgoms pa las byung ba'i sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid can stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis so //
translated: By means of emptiness, i.e., by the meditative development of the emptiness of all things, i.e., the emptiness of the emptiness of all things, which is characterized by the one-pointed concentration of mind that arises from meditative development, i.e., the emptiness meditative concentration.

original: chos rnams te gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo'i chos can no //
analyzed: chos rnams te gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo'i chos can no //
translated: The dharmas are the dharmas that have the essential nature of the other-dependent.

original: stong par mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: stong par mi byed pa ste /
translated: They are not made empty.

original: stong pa nyid kyi chos dang ldan par byed pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid kyi chos kho na gdod ma nas @155b skye ba med pa'i phyir stong pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi chos dang ldan par byed pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid kyi chos kho na gdod ma nas @155b skye ba med pa'i phyir stong pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They are not made to possess the quality of emptiness; rather, they are the other-dependent characteristic dharmas themselves that are empty because they are devoid of origination from the beginning.

original: mtshan ma med pa zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' bzhin du mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba'i stong pa nyid de de nyid spros pa thams cad dang bral ba las zhi ba'i rnam par bsgoms pa las byung ba'i mtshan ma'i rnam pa dang bral ba'i sems rtse
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' bzhin du mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba'i stong pa nyid de de nyid spros pa thams cad dang bral ba las zhi ba'i rnam par bsgoms pa las byung ba'i mtshan ma'i rnam pa dang bral ba'i sems rtse
translated: Signlessness is emptiness free from all signs, like space.

original: gcig pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis chos rnams mtshan ma dang bral bar byed pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gcig pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis chos rnams mtshan ma dang bral bar byed pa ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not that the signless concentration, which has the characteristic of a one-pointed mind free from the aspect of signs that arises from meditating on peace free from all elaborations, makes phenomena free from signs.

original: 'on kyang chos rnams kyi rang bzhin skye ba med pa'i phyir gdod ma nas chos rnams mtshan ma dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang chos rnams kyi rang bzhin skye ba med pa'i phyir gdod ma nas chos rnams mtshan ma dang bral ba'o //
translated: However, because the nature of phenomena is non-arising, phenomena are primordially free from signs.🔽It is not that the absence of wishes makes phenomena without wishes.

original: gang smon pa med pas chos rnams smon pa med par mi byed de zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa dngos po med pa'i rnam par mthong nas chos thams cad la mi mthun pa'i 'du shes nye bar bskyed nas de la shin tu smon par rab tu gnas
analyzed: gang smon pa med pas chos rnams smon pa med par mi byed de zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa dngos po med pa'i rnam par mthong nas chos thams cad la mi mthun pa'i 'du shes nye bar bskyed nas de la shin tu smon par rab tu gnas
translated: Having seen the three realms as unreal, one generates the perception of aversion towards all phenomena and abides in intense aspiration for that.

original: par mi bya'o zhes bsgoms pa las byung ba'i sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid can smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis chos 'di rnams la smon pa dang bral bar mi byed kyi /
analyzed: par mi bya'o zhes bsgoms pa las byung ba'i sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid can smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis chos 'di rnams la smon pa dang bral bar mi byed kyi /
translated: The concentration of wishlessness is the one-pointed mind that arises from the meditation on “I will not create” and is the absence of wishing for these phenomena.

original: 'on kyang chos rnams nyid ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes pa'i phyir smon pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang chos rnams nyid ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes pa'i phyir smon pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: However, since phenomena themselves are not produced by their own intrinsic reality, they are free from wishing.

original: gang mngon par 'du bya ba med pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la mngon par 'du bya ba'i stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med par rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: gang mngon par 'du bya ba med pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la mngon par 'du bya ba'i stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med par rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The emptiness of creation and so on refers to the concepts of the emptiness of creation, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo skye ba med pa'i phyir stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med par rnam par rtog pa'i yul du chos thams cad 'gyur ba ma yin no snyam du rtogs pa las byung ba'i sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid can mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin la des chos rnams mngon par 'du bya
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo skye ba med pa'i phyir stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med par rnam par rtog pa'i yul du chos thams cad 'gyur ba ma yin no snyam du rtogs pa las byung ba'i sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid can mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin la des chos rnams mngon par 'du bya
translated: The concentration of non-application has the characteristic of a one-pointed mind that arises from the realization that all phenomena are not objects of the concepts of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness because the entity of conceptuality is non-arisen.

original: ba med par mi byed kyi //
analyzed: ba med par mi byed kyi //
translated: By that, phenomena are not made non-arisen.

original: 'on kyang rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo skye ba med pa'i phyir chos rnams mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo skye ba med pa'i phyir chos rnams mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'o //
translated: However, because the entity of conceptuality is non-arisen, phenomena are non-arisen.

original: 'dir 'ga' zhig na re skye bas dngos po skyed par byed pas skye ba med na dngos po rnams skye ba ma yin no zhes brjod pa de'i dbang du byas nas gang ma skyes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir 'ga' zhig na re skye bas dngos po skyed par byed pas skye ba med na dngos po rnams skye ba ma yin no zhes brjod pa de'i dbang du byas nas gang ma skyes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Here, some say that since arising gives rise to things, if there is no arising, things do not arise. In response to that, this is said:

original: dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because things do not intrinsically exist.

original: 'ga' zhig na re skye ba'i stobs kyis dngos po rnams skye ba ma yin gyi 'on kyang rgyu'i stobs kyis 'byung ba yin la /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig na re skye ba'i stobs kyis dngos po rnams skye ba ma yin gyi 'on kyang rgyu'i stobs kyis 'byung ba yin la /
translated: Some say: Things do not arise due to the power of arising, but they do arise due to the power of causes.

original: ma byung bas de rnams mi 'byung @156a * //
analyzed: ma byung bas de rnams mi 'byung @156a * //
translated: Since they do not arise, they do not arise due to the power of nonarising.

original: bar byed pa yin no zhes brjod pa de rnams kyi dbang du byas nas gang ma byung bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: bar byed pa yin no zhes brjod pa de rnams kyi dbang du byas nas gang ma byung bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di gsungs pa yin te /
translated: This is stated from their perspective in the lines “What does not exist” and so on.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis ma byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis ma byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not intrinsically arise.🔽Thus, from the perspective of the Mādhyamikas, emptiness and so on do not make things empty.

original: de ltar dbu ma pa rnams kyi dbang du byas nas stong pa nyid la sogs pas chos rnams stong pa nyid du byed pa ma yin gyi sems tsam pa'i dbang du byas nas ni stong pa nyid kyi chos rnams stong par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bstan par
analyzed: de ltar dbu ma pa rnams kyi dbang du byas nas stong pa nyid la sogs pas chos rnams stong pa nyid du byed pa ma yin gyi sems tsam pa'i dbang du byas nas ni stong pa nyid kyi chos rnams stong par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bstan par
translated: However, from the perspective of the Cittamātra, things that are empty become empty.

original: bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bya ba'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate this, the text says:

original: gang zhig gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: gang zhig gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te sngar bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of the above has already been explained.

original: de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin par zhes bya ba ni gal te gzhan gyi dbang las stong pa nyid gzhan yin par 'gyur na de'i tshe tha dad pa'i stong pa nyid rtogs pa gzhan gyi dbang gi gzung ba dang rnam par rtog
analyzed: de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin par zhes bya ba ni gal te gzhan gyi dbang las stong pa nyid gzhan yin par 'gyur na de'i tshe tha dad pa'i stong pa nyid rtogs pa gzhan gyi dbang gi gzung ba dang rnam par rtog
translated: “It is not to be described as the same or different” means that if emptiness were different from the dependent, then emptiness would be a different thing, and the realization of that emptiness would not reverse the dependent’s apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: pa mi ldog pa'i phyir grol ba med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa mi ldog pa'i phyir grol ba med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore it would follow that there would be no liberation.

original: gal te gzhan nyid ma yin par gyur na ni de'i tshe dus thams cad du grol bar thal bar 'gyur ba dang / stong pa nyid dngos po nyid du thal ba dang / gzhan gyi dbang stong pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te gzhan nyid ma yin par gyur na ni de'i tshe dus thams cad du grol bar thal bar 'gyur ba dang / stong pa nyid dngos po nyid du thal ba dang / gzhan gyi dbang stong pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not different, then it would follow that there would be liberation at all times, and it would follow that emptiness would be an entity and that the dependent would be emptiness.

original: des na de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: des na de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore it is said that it is not to be described as the same or different.

original: mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras byas pa la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras byas pa la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: “Like impermanence, etc.” The term “etc.” includes the produced, etc.

original: de la gal te chos thams cad las mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa tha dad pa yin na chos can de rtag par thal bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de la gal te chos thams cad las mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa tha dad pa yin na chos can de rtag par thal bar 'gyur la /
translated: If impermanence, etc. were different from all things, then it would follow that the subject would be permanent.

original: tha mi dad pa yin na chos can dang chos dag gi dbye ba med pa dang / mi rtag pa nyid mngon sum gyis grub par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa yin na chos can dang chos dag gi dbye ba med pa dang / mi rtag pa nyid mngon sum gyis grub par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If they were not different, then there would be no distinction between the subject and the attributes, and it would follow, absurdly, that impermanence would be established by direct perception.

original: des na de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: des na de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: Therefore, they are not to be described as either the same or different.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni sems tsam pa la'o //🔽stong pa nyid kho nas zhes bya ba ni chos kyi ngo bo gzung ba dang 'dzin pa stong pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni sems tsam pa la'o // stong pa nyid kho nas zhes bya ba ni chos kyi ngo bo gzung ba dang 'dzin pa stong pa nyid kyis so //
translated: “In this regard” means in the Cittamatra.🔽“By emptiness alone” means by the emptiness of the apprehended object and the apprehending subject, which is the nature of phenomena.

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid yin gyi zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid can gyi chos rnams stong pa nyid dang 'brel pas stong pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid yin gyi zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid can gyi chos rnams stong pa nyid dang 'brel pas stong pa'o //
translated: “All phenomena are empty” means that all phenomena, which are characterized as being dependent, are empty because they are related to emptiness.

original: rang bzhin nyid kyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan dbang yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin nyid kyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan dbang yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not by its intrinsic reality, because the dependent is accepted as existent.🔽In the Catuh-s-t, it says,

original: bzhi brgya pa las zhes bya ba la sogs pa la mya ngan las 'das pa la bdag gir gyur cig snyam nas stong pa nyid ma yin @156b pa'i dngos po stong pa dang ldan par mthong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: bzhi brgya pa las zhes bya ba la sogs pa la mya ngan las 'das pa la bdag gir gyur cig snyam nas stong pa nyid ma yin @156b pa'i dngos po stong pa dang ldan par mthong ba ma yin te /
translated: “One does not see a non-empty thing as empty, thinking, ‘May nirvana be mine.’

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: log par lta bas mya ngan las mi 'da' bar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis gsungs te /
analyzed: log par lta bas mya ngan las mi 'da' bar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis gsungs te /
translated: The Tathagatas have said that one does not attain nirvana through wrong views.

original: gzhan du gnas pa'i dngos po gzhan du mthong ba gang yin pa de ni phyin ci log tu mthong ba yin la /
analyzed: gzhan du gnas pa'i dngos po gzhan du mthong ba gang yin pa de ni phyin ci log tu mthong ba yin la /
translated: Whatever is seen as a thing existing in one way and seen in another way is a wrong view.

original: gal te rang bzhin gyis stong pa ma yin pa'i dngos po rnams rang bzhin gyis stong pa yin no snyam du mthong bar gyur na de'i tshe log par lta ba nyid kyis mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ba las log par lta ba dang ldan pa'i
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin gyis stong pa ma yin pa'i dngos po rnams rang bzhin gyis stong pa yin no snyam du mthong bar gyur na de'i tshe log par lta ba nyid kyis mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ba las log par lta ba dang ldan pa'i
translated: If you see things that are not empty of intrinsic reality as being empty of intrinsic reality, then at that time you would attain nirvana through wrong view.

original: gang zag rnams la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa rnam gzhag mdzad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zag rnams la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa rnam gzhag mdzad pa ma yin te /
translated: But the transcendent buddhas do not posit the attainment of nirvana for those who possess wrong view.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba sngon du 'gro ba can nyid kyis mya ngan las 'das pa thob par rnam gzhag mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba sngon du 'gro ba can nyid kyis mya ngan las 'das pa thob par rnam gzhag mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they posit the attainment of nirvana as preceded by right view.

original: des na sgyu ma bzhin du rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa kho na chos thams cad stong pa yin te /
analyzed: des na sgyu ma bzhin du rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa kho na chos thams cad stong pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, because they are dependently arisen like an illusion, all phenomena are empty of intrinsic reality alone.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pas stong pa ma yin pa stong pa nyid du byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pas stong pa ma yin pa stong pa nyid du byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Because they are empty of intrinsic reality.

original: dper na mtshan mo dge tshul btung bar bya ba ma yin pa'i don du mi go ba bzhin du ste /
analyzed: dper na mtshan mo dge tshul btung bar bya ba ma yin pa'i don du mi go ba bzhin du ste /
translated: For example, a novice monk did not understand the meaning of “not to be drunk at night.”🔽A certain novice monk was repeatedly sent by his preceptor to get something not to be drunk at night.🔽He said to him, “Since this is not suitable for monks, why do you ask for it?”

original: dge tshul 'ga' zhig slob dpon gyis mtshan mo btung bar bya ba ma yin pa'i don du yang dang yang du mngags pa dang / des de la 'di dge slong rnams la mi 'os pas khyed ci ltar gsol zhes smras pa dang / des smras pa 'di chu yin no snyam du bsams nas kho bos 'thung ba yin no zhes smras pa dang /
analyzed: dge tshul 'ga' zhig slob dpon gyis mtshan mo btung bar bya ba ma yin pa'i don du yang dang yang du mngags pa dang / des de la 'di dge slong rnams la mi 'os pas khyed ci ltar gsol zhes smras pa dang / des smras pa 'di chu yin no snyam du bsams nas kho bos 'thung ba yin no zhes smras pa dang /
translated: He said, “Thinking it was water, I drank it.”

original: des kyang ti ma gzhan la chu nyid khyer te 'ongs so //
analyzed: des kyang ti ma gzhan la chu nyid khyer te 'ongs so //
translated: He also brought back another gourd full of water.

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He said,

original: ci'i phyir khyod kyis gzhan nyid khyer te 'ongs /
analyzed: ci'i phyir khyod kyis gzhan nyid khyer te 'ongs /
translated: “Why did you bring back another one?”

original: dge tshul gyis smras pa /
analyzed: dge tshul gyis smras pa /
translated: The novice monk said,🔽“

original: gang gi tshe khyer gyis chu yin ni snyam du bsams nas gsol na de dag la khyad par ci zhig yod /
analyzed: gang gi tshe khyer gyis chu yin ni snyam du bsams nas gsol na de dag la khyad par ci zhig yod /
translated: If they drink it thinking it is water, what difference does it make?

original: ci ltar 'dir chu'i sgo nas chang gi sred pa mi log pa de bzhin du log par lta bas kyang mya ngan las 'das pa thob par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽bstan bcos kyang zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba'i shes rab las so //
analyzed: ci ltar 'dir chu'i sgo nas chang gi sred pa mi log pa de bzhin du log par lta bas kyang mya ngan las 'das pa thob par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // bstan bcos kyang zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba'i shes rab las so //
translated: Just as in this case, the craving for beer is not eliminated by means of water, so too, one does not attain nirvana by means of the view of annihilation.🔽The treatise says, “The view of annihilation is also not tenable,” and so on.

original: stong pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa la lta ba thams cad ces bya ba ni mngon par zhen pa thams cad do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa la lta ba thams cad ces bya ba ni mngon par zhen pa thams cad do //
translated: “All views” means all attachments.

original: nges par 'byin pa zhes bya ba ni mi 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: nges par 'byin pa zhes bya ba ni mi 'jug pa ste /
translated: “Elimination” means non-engagement.

original: log pa gang yin pa de nyid stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: log pa gang yin pa de nyid stong pa nyid do //
translated: What is false is emptiness.

original: lta ba thams cad log pa tsam ni dngos po ma yin gyi /
analyzed: lta ba thams cad log pa tsam ni dngos po ma yin gyi /
translated: The mere cessation of all views is not a thing.

original: gang stong pa nyid @157a * //
analyzed: gang stong pa nyid @157a * //
translated: What is emptiness?

original: la yang dngos por zhen par byed pa de dag la kho bo cag gis cung zad kyang brjod du med pas kho bo cag gi gdams ngag las rtog pa thams cad log pas ci'i phyir de rnams thar pa thob par 'gyur te mi 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don
analyzed: la yang dngos por zhen par byed pa de dag la kho bo cag gis cung zad kyang brjod du med pas kho bo cag gi gdams ngag las rtog pa thams cad log pas ci'i phyir de rnams thar pa thob par 'gyur te mi 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don
translated: Since we say nothing to those who cling to things as real, how could those who have turned away from all thought through our instructions attain liberation? They could not!

original: to // gang dag khyod ci yang ma yin pa zhig rin du sbyin no zhes brjod pa na ci yang ma yin pa ni de kho bo la byin cig ces brjod par gyur na de la thabs gang gi sgo nas ci yang ma yin pa'i dngos po rin du sbyin
analyzed: to // gang dag khyod ci yang ma yin pa zhig rin du sbyin no zhes brjod pa na ci yang ma yin pa ni de kho bo la byin cig ces brjod par gyur na de la thabs gang gi sgo nas ci yang ma yin pa'i dngos po rin du sbyin
translated: When you say, “I will give you nothing,” if someone replies, “Give me that nothing,” how could you give that person nothing as a price?

original: par nus / de bzhin du gang dag la ltos pa nyid la dngos por mngon par zhen pa yod pa de dag la thabs gang gis dngos po la mngon par zhen pa 'gog par byed /
analyzed: par nus / de bzhin du gang dag la ltos pa nyid la dngos por mngon par zhen pa yod pa de dag la thabs gang gis dngos po la mngon par zhen pa 'gog par byed /
translated: In the same way, how could you stop the conception of things as real in those who cling to things as real in dependence on that very thing?

original: des na sman chen po yin du zin kyang skyon gyi 'du shes kyis mchog tu gyur pa'i 'tsho mdzad sman pa'i rgyal po chen po de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis dor ba yin no //
analyzed: des na sman chen po yin du zin kyang skyon gyi 'du shes kyis mchog tu gyur pa'i 'tsho mdzad sman pa'i rgyal po chen po de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis dor ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, even if it is a great medicine, it is rejected by the great physician, the Tathāgata, the king of physicians, who is supreme, because of the idea that it is a fault.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa'i mdo las /
translated: For this very reason, the Ratnakūṭa Sūtra says,

original: 'od srungs ri rab tsam gyi gang zag gi bdag tu lta ba la brten pa bla'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang ldan pas stong pa nyid du lta ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'od srungs ri rab tsam gyi gang zag gi bdag tu lta ba la brten pa bla'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang ldan pas stong pa nyid du lta ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Kāśyapa, it is better to rely on the view of a self that is the size of Mount Meru than to rely on the view of emptiness with an inflated mind.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'od srungs lta ba'i rnam pa thams cad kyi nges par 'byin pa ni stong pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'od srungs lta ba'i rnam pa thams cad kyi nges par 'byin pa ni stong pa nyid yin la /
translated: Kāśyapa, emptiness is the deliverance from all views.

original: gang la stong pa nyid kho nar lta bar gyur pa de gso bar bya ba ma yin no zhes nga smra'o //
analyzed: gang la stong pa nyid kho nar lta bar gyur pa de gso bar bya ba ma yin no zhes nga smra'o //
translated: I say that it is not to be cured when emptiness itself becomes a view.

original: 'od srungs dper na skyes bu nad par gyur pa la de sman pas sman byin na /
analyzed: 'od srungs dper na skyes bu nad par gyur pa la de sman pas sman byin na /
translated: Kāśyapa, for example, if a doctor gives medicine to a sick person

original: de la sman des nad thams cad nye bar bsal nas sman nyid khong du zhen nas 'byung bar ma gyur na /
analyzed: de la sman des nad thams cad nye bar bsal nas sman nyid khong du zhen nas 'byung bar ma gyur na /
translated: If that medicine were to completely eliminate all the illnesses, but the medicine itself remained in the stomach and was not expelled,

original: 'od srungs de ci snyam du sems /
analyzed: 'od srungs de ci snyam du sems /
translated: Kāśyapa, what do you think?

original: skyes bu de nad las grol bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: skyes bu de nad las grol bar 'gyur ram /
translated: Would that person be free from illness?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so //
translated: He replied, “Bhagavān, he would not.”

original: gang la nad thams cad sel bar byed pa'i sman de nyid khong du lus nas phyir ma byung na skyes bu de la nad shin tu lci bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang la nad thams cad sel bar byed pa'i sman de nyid khong du lus nas phyir ma byung na skyes bu de la nad shin tu lci bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “The medicine that eliminates all illnesses would itself remain in the stomach and not be expelled, and that person would have a very serious illness.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said,

original: 'od srungs de bzhin du lta ba'i rnam pa thams cad ni stong pa nyid kyis nges par 'byin par byed la /
analyzed: 'od srungs de bzhin du lta ba'i rnam pa thams cad ni stong pa nyid kyis nges par 'byin par byed la /
translated: “Kāśyapa, in the same way, all views are eliminated by emptiness.

original: gang stong pa nyid kho nar lta bar gyur pa de kho bos gso par bya ba ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang stong pa nyid kho nar lta bar gyur pa de kho bos gso par bya ba ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: But if someone were to view emptiness alone, I say that person cannot be cured.”

original: de ltar don dam par gzhan las skye ba med par bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar don dam par gzhan las skye ba med par bstan nas /
translated: Thus it is shown that ultimately there is no arising from other.

original: kun rdzob tu yang skye ba yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir phyogs snga ma 'god pa ni /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yang skye ba yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir phyogs snga ma 'god pa ni /
translated: In order to demonstrate that arising does not exist even conventionally, the prior position is set forth:

original: 'dir smras pa @157b zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa @157b zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Here, some say:

original: 'dir zhes bya ba ni skye ba med pa'i skabs su'o //
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba ni skye ba med pa'i skabs su'o //
translated: Here means in the context of no arising.

original: gzhan dag gis smras pa ni don dam par bdag dang gzhan las skye ba med par 'dod pa nyid do zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis smras pa ni don dam par bdag dang gzhan las skye ba med par 'dod pa nyid do zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: Others say means those who assert that ultimately there is no arising from self or other.

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gis dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni de la dngos su shes pa skyed par rung ba rnams ni mngon sum gyis dmigs pa yin la /
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gis dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni de la dngos su shes pa skyed par rung ba rnams ni mngon sum gyis dmigs pa yin la /
translated: That which is perceived by direct perception and inference means that which is directly suitable to generate cognition is perceived by direct perception.

original: dngos su shes pa skyed par rung ba ma yin pa gzhan gyi sgo nas rtogs par bya ba rnams ni rjes dpag gis dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos su shes pa skyed par rung ba ma yin pa gzhan gyi sgo nas rtogs par bya ba rnams ni rjes dpag gis dmigs pa yin no //
translated: That which is not directly suitable to generate cognition, but is to be understood by means of another, is perceived by inference.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa rang gi rgyud du gtogs pa rnams ni mngon sum gyis dmigs pa yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa rang gi rgyud du gtogs pa rnams ni mngon sum gyis dmigs pa yin la /
translated: Similarly, those that are in one's own continuum, such as feelings, are perceived by direct perception.

original: gzhan gyi rgyud du gtogs pa rnams ni rjes su dpag pas dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rgyud du gtogs pa rnams ni rjes su dpag pas dmigs pa yin no //
translated: Those that belong to the mental continuum of another are perceived by inference.

original: gdon mi za bar gzhan las skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i mngon sum la sogs pas gzhan las skye bar rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar gzhan las skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i mngon sum la sogs pas gzhan las skye bar rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “ It is certain that there is production from another” means that production from another is understood by the direct perception, etc., of the world.

original: ci ste de ltar mi 'dod na ni zhes bya ba ni gal te gzhan las skye bar mi 'dod na'o //
analyzed: ci ste de ltar mi 'dod na ni zhes bya ba ni gal te gzhan las skye bar mi 'dod na'o //
translated: “ If you do not accept that, ” means if you do not accept that there is production from another.

original: bden pa gnyis ci ste brjod de zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu gzhan las skye ba med pas gdod ma nas skye ba med pa'i rang bzhin can stong pa nyid kho na lus pa'i phyir bden pa gnyis mi 'thad pas don dam pa'i bden pa gcig kho🔽nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis ci ste brjod de zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu gzhan las skye ba med pas gdod ma nas skye ba med pa'i rang bzhin can stong pa nyid kho na lus pa'i phyir bden pa gnyis mi 'thad pas don dam pa'i bden pa gcig kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: “ Why do you speak of two truths? ” means that because there is no production from another even conventionally, only emptiness, which is the nature of non-production from the beginning, remains. Therefore, since the two truths are not tenable, only ultimate truth would exist.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir bden pa gcig kho na ma yin pa de'i phyir gzhan las skye ba yod pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir bden pa gcig kho na ma yin pa de'i phyir gzhan las skye ba yod pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma'o //
translated: “ Therefore” means that because there is not only one truth, therefore production from another does exist. This is the opponent’s position.

original: 'di la bshad par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan no //
analyzed: 'di la bshad par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan no //
translated: The response begins with “This is to be explained. ”

original: 'di ni bden mod kyi zhes bya ba ni bden pa gnyis ci ste brjod ces bya ba de'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bden mod kyi zhes bya ba ni bden pa gnyis ci ste brjod ces bya ba de'o //
translated: “This is true” refers to the question, “Why are two truths taught?”

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says,

original: don dam par ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: don dam par ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “ultimately, however, . . .”

original: rigs pas dpyad na rang dang gzhan las skye ba ma grub pa'i phyir skye ba med pa'i rang bzhin can stong pa nyid kho nar gnas pas don dam par bden pa gnyis yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rigs pas dpyad na rang dang gzhan las skye ba ma grub pa'i phyir skye ba med pa'i rang bzhin can stong pa nyid kho nar gnas pas don dam par bden pa gnyis yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: When analyzed with reasoning, since arising from self and other is not established, the nature of non-arising is emptiness alone. Therefore, ultimately, the two truths do not exist. This is the meaning.

original: de nyid la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the scriptural source for that, he says,

original: dge slong dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dge slong dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Monks, . . . ”

original: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa thams cad zhi ba'i mtshan nyid can stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa thams cad zhi ba'i mtshan nyid can stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: “Nirvāṇa” has the nature of emptiness, characterized by the pacification of all conceptual thought.

original: 'du byed thams cad ces bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad ces bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: “All formations” refers to the aggregates, etc.

original: brdzun pa zhes bya ba ni med pa la yod par snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brdzun pa zhes bya ba ni med pa la yod par snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “False” means that what is non-existent appears as existent.

original: @158a * // des na slu ba'i chos can no //
analyzed: @158a * // des na slu ba'i chos can no //
translated: Therefore, they are deceptive phenomena.

original: gal te don dam pa'i bden pa gcig kho na yin na /
analyzed: gal te don dam pa'i bden pa gcig kho na yin na /
translated: If the ultimate truth is the only truth,

original: 'o na bden pa gcig kho na brjod par rigs kyi bden pa gnyis zhes ci ltar brjod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na bden pa gcig kho na brjod par rigs kyi bden pa gnyis zhes ci ltar brjod ce na /
translated: then it is proper to speak of only one truth, but how can one speak of two truths?

original: lan ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: lan ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The answer is stated: “For that reason, etc.”

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni brtags shing dpyad na don dam pa'i bden pa gcig tu grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni brtags shing dpyad na don dam pa'i bden pa gcig tu grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “For that reason” means that when it is investigated and analyzed, the ultimate truth is established as one.

original: don dam pa la 'jug pa'i thabs yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i shes pa dang / shes bya dang / brjod par bya ba dang / rjod par byed pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi kun rdzob kyi bden pa khas ma blangs na don dam pa'i bden pa bstan par mi nus la /
analyzed: don dam pa la 'jug pa'i thabs yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i shes pa dang / shes bya dang / brjod par bya ba dang / rjod par byed pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi kun rdzob kyi bden pa khas ma blangs na don dam pa'i bden pa bstan par mi nus la /
translated: If one does not accept the conventional truth, which is characterized by mundane knowledge, the object of knowledge, the expressible, and the expression, one cannot teach the ultimate truth.

original: ma bstan na rtogs par mi nus pas kun rdzob kyi bden pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa rtogs pa'i thabs yin no //
analyzed: ma bstan na rtogs par mi nus pas kun rdzob kyi bden pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa rtogs pa'i thabs yin no //
translated: And if it is not taught, one cannot understand it. Therefore, the conventional truth is the means of understanding the ultimate truth.

original: 'jig rten pa'i lugs kyis zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad kyis so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lugs kyis zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad kyis so //
translated: By the mundane way means by mundane convention.

original: bdag dang gzhan las skye ba ma dpyad par khas len par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni dpyad par gyur na bdag dang gzhan las skye ba mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan las skye ba ma dpyad par khas len par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni dpyad par gyur na bdag dang gzhan las skye ba mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One accepts arising from self and other without analysis means that if one analyzes, arising from self and other is not established.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach just that, he says

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Thus, etc.

original: gang gi phyir dngos po ste gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa rnams dpyad na ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po ste gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa rnams dpyad na ste /
translated: Because, when things, such as form and feeling, are analyzed,

original: ci bdag las skye'am 'on te gzhan las skye zhes dpyad par gyur na de nyid bdag can dngos po las skye ste skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i mtshan nyid can don dam pa'i rang bzhin las gzhan du gyur pa'i phyogs la gnas pa rnyed pa ma yin
analyzed: ci bdag las skye'am 'on te gzhan las skye zhes dpyad par gyur na de nyid bdag can dngos po las skye ste skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i mtshan nyid can don dam pa'i rang bzhin las gzhan du gyur pa'i phyogs la gnas pa rnyed pa ma yin
translated: that is, when it is analyzed whether they arise from self or from another, one does not find a position that is other than the ultimate nature, which is characterized by the absence of arising and cessation.

original: pa don dam pa'i rang bzhin kho na gnas pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa don dam pa'i rang bzhin kho na gnas pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because that ultimate nature alone is what abides.

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad bden pa la ste 'di yod na 'di 'byung ngo zhes 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad tsam du kun rdzob tu don bden pa la bden pa zhes brjod pas rnam par dpyad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad bden pa la ste 'di yod na 'di 'byung ngo zhes 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad tsam du kun rdzob tu don bden pa la bden pa zhes brjod pas rnam par dpyad par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not analyze the conventional truth of the world, for when this exists, that arises. It is merely the conventional, the superficial truth of the world, that is called truth.

original: de nyid 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach just that, he says,

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Thus, etc.”

original: tshu rol te gzhan du gyur pa'i cha zhes bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i dngos po la'o //
analyzed: tshu rol te gzhan du gyur pa'i cha zhes bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i dngos po la'o //
translated: The phrase “the other side, the other part” refers to the entities of conventional truth, which have the nature of arising, etc.

original: gzhan la rag las pa'i zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan la rag las pa'i zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase “dependent on others” means

original: 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad kyi rjes su 'brangs nas so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad kyi rjes su 'brangs nas so //
translated: following mundane conventions.

original: 'phags pa'i lhas zhes bya ba ni bzhi brgya pa las so //🔽ci ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'di ltar kla klo rnams kyis skad gzhan mi go bas rang gi skad kyis ston par byed pa de bzhin @158b du 'jig rten pa la yang 'jig rten pa'i dngos po'i rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo nas de kho na
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lhas zhes bya ba ni bzhi brgya pa las so // ci ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'di ltar kla klo rnams kyis skad gzhan mi go bas rang gi skad kyis ston par byed pa de bzhin @158b du 'jig rten pa la yang 'jig rten pa'i dngos po'i rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo nas de kho na
translated: The phrase “Āryadeva says” refers to the Four Hundred.

original: nyid bstan par nus kyi /
analyzed: nyid bstan par nus kyi /
translated: The phrase “just as” and so on means that just as barbarians cannot understand another language and so they teach using their own language, in the same way, worldly people can only be taught the suchness of things by means of the presentation of worldly things.

original: mkhas pa 'ga' zhig 'jig rten pa'i kun rdzob la ma zhugs par bdag dang chos dag la sgyu ma lta bu nyid don dam pa'i rang bzhin brjod du med par rtogs pa skyed mi nus so //
analyzed: mkhas pa 'ga' zhig 'jig rten pa'i kun rdzob la ma zhugs par bdag dang chos dag la sgyu ma lta bu nyid don dam pa'i rang bzhin brjod du med par rtogs pa skyed mi nus so //
translated: The wise cannot generate the understanding that the self and phenomena are like illusions, which is the inexpressible ultimate nature, without engaging with the conventional truth of the world.

original: 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob la ji lta ba bzhin du zhugs par gyur na ni sgyu ma lta bu nyid du rtogs pa skyed nus pa yin la /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob la ji lta ba bzhin du zhugs par gyur na ni sgyu ma lta bu nyid du rtogs pa skyed nus pa yin la /
translated: If one enters into the conventional reality of the world just as it is, then one is able to generate the realization of illusion-like.

original: sgyu ma lta bu la zhugs par gyur na don dam pa shin tu brjod pa med pa'i chos gzung bar bya bar nus pa'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu la zhugs par gyur na don dam pa shin tu brjod pa med pa'i chos gzung bar bya bar nus pa'o //
translated: If one enters into the illusion-like, then one is able to apprehend the ultimate reality which is utterly inexpressible.

original: des na ji ltar bstan pa'i 'jug pa'i rim pa nges par bya dgos te /
analyzed: des na ji ltar bstan pa'i 'jug pa'i rim pa nges par bya dgos te /
translated: Therefore, one must ascertain the stages of engagement as they have been taught.

original: byis pa brda la ma byang ba rnams bzhin no //
analyzed: byis pa brda la ma byang ba rnams bzhin no //
translated: Like children who are not trained in language.

original: dper na byis pa chung ba rnams skad gzhan gyis go bar mi nus pa de bzhin du 'jig rten so so'i skye bo rnams kyang ngo //
analyzed: dper na byis pa chung ba rnams skad gzhan gyis go bar mi nus pa de bzhin du 'jig rten so so'i skye bo rnams kyang ngo //
translated: Just as small children are unable to understand through other languages, so also worldly ordinary beings are.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'jig rten 'jug pa'i thabs yin pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis yod pa dang med pa nyid du bka' stsal pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'jig rten 'jug pa'i thabs yin pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis yod pa dang med pa nyid du bka' stsal pa yin no //
translated: For that very reason, the Transcendent Conqueror has said that things exist and do not exist because it is a method for engaging the world.

original: 'dis ni don dam pa'i bden par bden pa gcig kho na yin la /
analyzed: 'dis ni don dam pa'i bden par bden pa gcig kho na yin la /
translated: By this, it is shown that in terms of ultimate reality, there is only one truth.

original: ma dpyad par 'jig rten 'jug pa'i thabs yin pa'i phyir kun rdzob kyi bden pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ma dpyad par 'jig rten 'jug pa'i thabs yin pa'i phyir kun rdzob kyi bden pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: Because it is the method for engaging in the world without analysis, the relative truth is taught.

original: don 'di nyid la rtsa ba'i shes rab kyi khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir bstan bcos las kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: don 'di nyid la rtsa ba'i shes rab kyi khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir bstan bcos las kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the source of this very meaning in the Fundamental Treatise on the Middle Way, the text says, “Also, the Treatise says…”

original: gal te don dam pa spros pa med pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: gal te don dam pa spros pa med pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
translated: If the ultimate is the nature free from elaborations,

original: de nyid yod du chug phung po dang khams dang skye mched dang 'phags pa'i bden pa dang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la sogs pa don dam pa ma yin pa bstan pa la dgos pa ci zhig yod de /
analyzed: de nyid yod du chug phung po dang khams dang skye mched dang 'phags pa'i bden pa dang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la sogs pa don dam pa ma yin pa bstan pa la dgos pa ci zhig yod de /
translated: why is it necessary to teach the aggregates, constituents, sense spheres, noble truths, dependent arising, and so on, which are not the ultimate?

original: de kho na nyid ma yin pa ni dor bar bya ba yin pa dor bar bya ba gang yin pa de bstan pa la dgos pa ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: de kho na nyid ma yin pa ni dor bar bya ba yin pa dor bar bya ba gang yin pa de bstan pa la dgos pa ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: If they are not suchness, they are to be abandoned. What is the point of teaching what is to be abandoned?

original: bshad par bya ste bden mod kyi 'on kyang brjod par byed pa dang / brjod par bya ba dang / shes pa dang / shes bya la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can 'jig rten pa'i don dam pa'i khas ma blangs na don dam pa'i bden pa bstan par mi nus la /
analyzed: bshad par bya ste bden mod kyi 'on kyang brjod par byed pa dang / brjod par bya ba dang / shes pa dang / shes bya la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can 'jig rten pa'i don dam pa'i khas ma blangs na don dam pa'i bden pa bstan par mi nus la /
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: That is true, but if one does not accept the conventional, which is characterized by the expression, the expressed, cognition, the object of cognition, and so on, one cannot teach ultimate truth.

original: ma bstan na khong du chud par ma nus la /🔽don dam pa khong du ma chud ni mya ngan las 'das pa thob par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ma bstan na khong du chud par ma nus la / don dam pa khong du ma chud ni mya ngan las 'das pa thob par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: If it is not taught, one cannot understand it.🔽If one does not understand the ultimate, one will not attain nirvāṇa.

original: tha snyad la ni ma brten par //
analyzed: tha snyad la ni ma brten par //
translated: In order to teach this, he says, Without relying on conventions,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽mya ngan las 'das pa mngon du bya ba'i thabs yin @159a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / mya ngan las 'das pa mngon du bya ba'i thabs yin @159a * //
translated: and so on.

original: pa'i phyir ci lta ba bzhin du gnas pa'i kun rdzob dang po nyid du khas blang bar bya dgos te /
analyzed: pa'i phyir ci lta ba bzhin du gnas pa'i kun rdzob dang po nyid du khas blang bar bya dgos te /
translated: Because it is the method for manifesting nirvāṇa, one must accept the conventional that is the way things are from the very beginning.

original: dper na chu don du gnyer bas snod bzhin du'o //
analyzed: dper na chu don du gnyer bas snod bzhin du'o //
translated: This is like, for example, a vessel for one who seeks water.

original: de nyid kyi phyir kun rdzob la ma ltos pa'i stong pa nyid kyis ni legs par ma bzung ba'i sbrul bzhin du'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir kun rdzob la ma ltos pa'i stong pa nyid kyis ni legs par ma bzung ba'i sbrul bzhin du'o //
translated: Therefore, emptiness that does not depend on the conventional is like a rope that is not well grasped as a snake.

original: rnam par dpyad na 'jig rten gyi tha snyad 'jig par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: rnam par dpyad na 'jig rten gyi tha snyad 'jig par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: If one analyzes, the conventions of the world will be destroyed,

original: rnam par dpyad na 'jig rten gyi tha snyad mi grub pas so //
analyzed: rnam par dpyad na 'jig rten gyi tha snyad mi grub pas so //
translated: because the conventions of the world are not established if one analyzes.

original: de nyid mdo'i khungs kyis bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid mdo'i khungs kyis bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach just that with a source from the scriptures,

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “As it is said,” and so on.

original: rgyud ces bya ba ni sbreng bar bya ba'i srad bu'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: rgyud ces bya ba ni sbreng bar bya ba'i srad bu'i khyad par ro //
translated: A “string” is a particular thread that is strung.

original: shing zhes bya ba ni gang la srad bu 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: shing zhes bya ba ni gang la srad bu 'brel ba'o //
translated: A “wood” is that on which the string is strung.

original: gsum tshogs na zhes bya ba ni shing dang rgyud dang lag pas btsal ba'o //
analyzed: gsum tshogs na zhes bya ba ni shing dang rgyud dang lag pas btsal ba'o //
translated: “When the three are assembled” is the wood, the string, and the hand that searches.

original: sgrogs byed pi wang gling bu la sogs las //
analyzed: sgrogs byed pi wang gling bu la sogs las //
translated: From the sound-producing instruments such as the lute and flute,

original: zhes bya ba ni rgyud gsum pa la sogs pas rol mo'i cha rkyen las so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rgyud gsum pa la sogs pas rol mo'i cha rkyen las so //
translated: the “three-stringed instrument” and so on are the conditions of the music.

original: de dag las skyes zhes bya ba ni rgyud gsum pa la sogs pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de dag las skyes zhes bya ba ni rgyud gsum pa la sogs pa las byung ba'o //
translated: “Arisen from them” means arisen from the three continuums, etc.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni sgra byung ba'i de ma thag tu'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni sgra byung ba'i de ma thag tu'o //
translated: “Then” means immediately after the sound has arisen.

original: mkhas pa las zhes bya ba ni blo dang ldan pa 'ga' zhig gis so //
analyzed: mkhas pa las zhes bya ba ni blo dang ldan pa 'ga' zhig gis so //
translated: “By the wise” means by some intelligent person.

original: phyogs dang zhes bya ba ni shar la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs dang zhes bya ba ni shar la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Directions” means east, etc.

original: phyogs mtshams zhes bya ba ni shar lho la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs mtshams zhes bya ba ni shar lho la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Interiors” means southeast, etc.

original: gang nas 'ongs la gang song zhes bya ba ni phyogs dang phyogs mtshams gang nas 'ongs shing phyogs dang phyogs mtshams gar song snyam du brtags nas so //
analyzed: gang nas 'ongs la gang song zhes bya ba ni phyogs dang phyogs mtshams gang nas 'ongs shing phyogs dang phyogs mtshams gar song snyam du brtags nas so //
translated: “Where it came from and where it went” means that having examined where the sound came from and where it went, in the directions and interiors,

original: 'ong ba 'am 'gro ba rnyed mi 'gyur //
analyzed: 'ong ba 'am 'gro ba rnyed mi 'gyur //
translated: “one does not find its coming or going.”

original: zhes bya ba ni phyogs dang phyogs mtshams rnams su sgra'i 'ong ba'am 'gro ba rnyed par mi 'gyur te ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phyogs dang phyogs mtshams rnams su sgra'i 'ong ba'am 'gro ba rnyed par mi 'gyur te ;
translated: This means that one does not find the coming or going of the sound in the directions and interiors,

original: de ltar ma dmigs pas so //
analyzed: de ltar ma dmigs pas so //
translated: because it is not perceived in that way.
