translated: and confused about what to do🔽cling to the view of the transitory collection.🔽When all possessions are completely severed,🔽those who are

original: de nyid kyi phyir tha snyad kyi bden pa la mngon par zhen pa ste kun rdzob kyi bden pa la mngon par zhen pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir tha snyad kyi bden pa la mngon par zhen pa ste kun rdzob kyi bden pa la mngon par zhen pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, it is “attachment to the conventional truth,” that is, attachment to the conventional truth.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu rdzas su yod par smra ba'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu rdzas su yod par smra ba'o //
translated: “ This” refers to the assertion of substantial existence in the conventional.

original: gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa ni dper na sems tsam pa rnams kyis ji ltar rdzas su yod pa'i rnam par shes pa skye bar 'dod pa'i rnam par shes pa de nyid la gzung ba dang 'dzin par zhen pa yod na kun nas nyon mongs pa
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa ni dper na sems tsam pa rnams kyis ji ltar rdzas su yod pa'i rnam par shes pa skye bar 'dod pa'i rnam par shes pa de nyid la gzung ba dang 'dzin par zhen pa yod na kun nas nyon mongs pa
translated: “ Whoever” and so on refers to the Cittamātra assertion that consciousness, which is substantially real, is produced. If there is the conception of object and apprehender in that very consciousness, there is affliction.

original: yin la / gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dag log na rnam par byang ba yin no zhes brjod pa ste phyogs snga ma'o //🔽de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yin la / gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dag log na rnam par byang ba yin no zhes brjod pa ste phyogs snga ma'o // de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: If object and apprehender are reversed, there is purification.

original: de ltar na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach the response to that, [the root text] states, “Even so,” and so on.

original: de ltar na yang zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob rdzas su yod pa la skye bar rtog na'o //
analyzed: de ltar na yang zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob rdzas su yod pa la skye bar rtog na'o //
translated: “ Even so” means that if one conceives of production in the conventional that is substantially real,

original: tshig tsam zhes bya ba @160a * //
analyzed: tshig tsam zhes bya ba @160a * //
translated: The words merely

original: ni kun rdzob rdzas su yod la skye ba ma grub pa'i phyir don gyis stong pa'i tshig tsam yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ni kun rdzob rdzas su yod la skye ba ma grub pa'i phyir don gyis stong pa'i tshig tsam yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: means that since arising is not established in conventional substantial existence, it is merely words that are empty of meaning.

original: de skad du smra ba la zhes bya ba'i rdzas su yod pa skye bar brjod pa la'o //
analyzed: de skad du smra ba la zhes bya ba'i rdzas su yod pa skye bar brjod pa la'o //
translated: This is the meaning of the statement to one who speaks thus.

original: de nyid rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that in detail,

original: ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te ;
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te ;
translated: he says, Why is that? and so on.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni tshig tsam yin pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni tshig tsam yin pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that? means Why is it merely words?

original: de nyid skabs su zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i skabs su'o //
analyzed: de nyid skabs su zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i skabs su'o //
translated: In the context of reality means in the context of ultimate reality.

original: rigs pa gang zhig gis /
analyzed: rigs pa gang zhig gis /
translated: What is the reasoning?

original: bdag dang gzhan las skye ba rigs min pa'i //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan las skye ba rigs min pa'i //
translated: It is that arising from self and other is illogical.

original: zhes bya ba ni skyes par gyur pa slar yang skye bar rigs pa'ang ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / gzhan la brten nas gal te gzhan zhig 'byung bar 'gyur na ni 'on me lce las kyang mun pa stug po 'byung bar 'gyur zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rigs pas ci ltar don dam par bdag dang gzhan las skye bar mi rigs pa'i rigs pa de
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni skyes par gyur pa slar yang skye bar rigs pa'ang ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / gzhan la brten nas gal te gzhan zhig 'byung bar 'gyur na ni 'on me lce las kyang mun pa stug po 'byung bar 'gyur zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rigs pas ci ltar don dam par bdag dang gzhan las skye bar mi rigs pa'i rigs pa de
translated: The reasoning that shows how it is not reasonable for arising to occur ultimately in terms of self or other🔽is the same reasoning that shows how it is not reasonable for arising to occur even conventionally in terms of self or other.

original: nyid kyis tha snyad kun rdzob tu yang skye bar mi rigs pas khyod kyi phyogs la skye ba gang gis 'grub par 'gyur te rigs pa med pas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nyid kyis tha snyad kun rdzob tu yang skye bar mi rigs pas khyod kyi phyogs la skye ba gang gis 'grub par 'gyur te rigs pa med pas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, how could arising be established in your system? It could not be, because there is no reasoning to support it.

original: de 'brel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'brel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach this by way of an analogy,

original: ci ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ci ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “Just as . . .” and so on.

original: de'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid kyi skye bas bden pa gnyis kar du yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir bdag dang gzhan las skye ba ma grub pa de'i phyir dngos po'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi skye ba ni bden pa gnyis🔽kar la yang 'grub pa ma yin no //🔽de nyid kyi phyir gang dag bdag las ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa slob dpon klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyis gzung ba dang 'dzin par brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gang yin pa de kho na bkag pa yin gyi sngon por snang ba la
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid kyi skye bas bden pa gnyis kar du yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir bdag dang gzhan las skye ba ma grub pa de'i phyir dngos po'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi skye ba ni bden pa gnyis kar la yang 'grub pa ma yin no // de nyid kyi phyir gang dag bdag las ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa slob dpon klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyis gzung ba dang 'dzin par brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gang yin pa de kho na bkag pa yin gyi sngon por snang ba la
translated: Since arising from self and from other are not established, therefore arising by virtue of intrinsic characteristic of things is not established in either of the two truths.

original: sogs pa'i shes pa'i mtshan nyid can gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo ni bkag pa ma yin no snyam pa de yang mi rigs so zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sogs pa'i shes pa'i mtshan nyid can gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo ni bkag pa ma yin no snyam pa de yang mi rigs so zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that the master Nāgārjuna’s statement “Not from self, not from other” and so on refutes only that which is imagined to be the nature of the object and the apprehender but does not refute the dependent nature, which is the consciousness that appears as blue and so on.

original: gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: To demonstrate this, Nāgārjuna’s Precious Garland says:

original: de dag gis zhes bya ba ni brtags pa la skye ba med par smras pa dag go //
analyzed: de dag gis zhes bya ba ni brtags pa la skye ba med par smras pa dag go //
translated: “By them” refers to those who say that there is no arising in the imagined.

original: 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni brtags pa la skye ba bkag par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni brtags pa la skye ba bkag par 'dod pa'o //
translated: “ Desire” means that they desire to refute arising in the imagined.

original: 'di yang gtan tshigs med par mi 'grub pas zhes bya ba ni rgyu mtshan med par mi 'grub pas so //
analyzed: 'di yang gtan tshigs med par mi 'grub pas zhes bya ba ni rgyu mtshan med par mi 'grub pas so //
translated: “ This is not established without a reason” means that it is not established without a cause.

original: 'di'i don ni gal te rigs pa la brtags pa 'gog pa'i nus pa yod pa @160b bzhin du gzhan dbang 'gegs pa'i nus pa med par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni gal te rigs pa la brtags pa 'gog pa'i nus pa yod pa @160b bzhin du gzhan dbang 'gegs pa'i nus pa med par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: If there were a capacity to refute arising in the imagined, but no capacity to refute the relative,

original: slob dpon klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas /
analyzed: slob dpon klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas /
translated: then the master Nāgārjuna would not have refuted it with arguments such as:

original: bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //
analyzed: bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //
translated: Not from self, not from other,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rigs pas khyad par brten nas bkag pa mdzad pa ma yin na de'i tshe rigs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rigs pas khyad par brten nas bkag pa mdzad pa ma yin na de'i tshe rigs pa yin gyi /
translated: etc., and would not have relied on the distinction.

original: 'on kyang rigs pa la brtags pa 'gog pa'i nus pa yod pa bzhin du gzhan dbang 'gog pa la nus pa yod pa'i phyir dang / bdag las ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rigs pas dngos po spyi'i dbang du byas nas skye ba bkag pa yin gyi bye brag gi dbang du byas nas ma yin pas slob dpon klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyis brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid bkag pa
analyzed: 'on kyang rigs pa la brtags pa 'gog pa'i nus pa yod pa bzhin du gzhan dbang 'gog pa la nus pa yod pa'i phyir dang / bdag las ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rigs pas dngos po spyi'i dbang du byas nas skye ba bkag pa yin gyi bye brag gi dbang du byas nas ma yin pas slob dpon klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyis brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid bkag pa
translated: However, just as the power to refute the investigation of reason exists, so too the power to refute the dependent exists.

original: yin zhes ci ltar brjod /
analyzed: yin zhes ci ltar brjod /
translated: And since the reasoning of “not from self” and so on refutes arising in general, not in particular, how could it be said that the master Nāgārjuna refuted the imagined nature?

original: des na brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid bkag par 'dod pa de dag ni rgyu mtshan med pa yin no zhes pa'o //🔽da ni gzhan dag gi dogs pa bsu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: des na brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid bkag par 'dod pa de dag ni rgyu mtshan med pa yin no zhes pa'o // da ni gzhan dag gi dogs pa bsu ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore those who assert that the imagined nature is refuted are without justification.

original: 'o na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'o na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, in order to anticipate the qualms of others, he says, “Well then, if things do not arise . . .” and so on.

original: gal te skye ba med na ngo bo nyid med pa ci ltar dmigs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te skye ba med na ngo bo nyid med pa ci ltar dmigs par 'gyur te /
translated: If there is no arising, how could the absence of intrinsic existence be observed,

original: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa rnams la skye ba med pas ngo bo mi dmigs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa rnams la skye ba med pas ngo bo mi dmigs pa bzhin no //
translated: just as the horns of a rabbit and so on do not arise and are not observed?

original: des na ngo bo nyid dmigs pa'i phyir skye ba yod pa yin no zhe na'o //
analyzed: des na ngo bo nyid dmigs pa'i phyir skye ba yod pa yin no zhe na'o //
translated: Therefore, since the entity itself is observed, arising exists.

original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the reply to that,

original: bshad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bshad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “The explanation,” and so on.

original: gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras sgra brnyan la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras sgra brnyan la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The words “reflection,” and so on, should be understood to include echoes, and so on.

original: tshogs la ltos nas ma grags pa yang min //
analyzed: tshogs la ltos nas ma grags pa yang min //
translated: It is not the case that it is not renowned in dependence on the collection.

original: zhes bya ba ni gdong dang me long la sogs pa'i tshogs la ltos nas gzugs brnyan la sogs pa'i tshogs 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gdong dang me long la sogs pa'i tshogs la ltos nas gzugs brnyan la sogs pa'i tshogs 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: Since the collection of reflections and so on arises in dependence on the collection of the face, mirror, and so on,

original: tshogs pa la ltos par grags pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tshogs pa la ltos par grags pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: it is renowned as dependent on the collection. This is what it means.

original: da ni ma brtags ma dpyad par 'jig rten gyi tha snyad la brten nas brjod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: da ni ma brtags ma dpyad par 'jig rten gyi tha snyad la brten nas brjod pa yin gyi /
translated: Now, this is said in dependence on the conventions of the world, without analysis or examination.

original: rigs pa'i sgo nas ma yin te sngar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs pa'i sgo nas ma yin te sngar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not from the perspective of reasoning, because this has been taught previously.

original: ci ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ci ltar gzugs brnyan la sogs pa stong pa las gzugs brnyan gyi rnam pa can gyi shes pa skye bar 'gyur ba bzhin du'o //
analyzed: ci ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ci ltar gzugs brnyan la sogs pa stong pa las gzugs brnyan gyi rnam pa can gyi shes pa skye bar 'gyur ba bzhin du'o //
translated: As to “just as,” etc., it is just as an image, etc., arises from an empty reflection, in the aspect of a reflection.

original: 'dis ni rang gi skye ba med pa la yang ngo bo nyid dmigs pa'i dpe bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dis ni rang gi skye ba med pa la yang ngo bo nyid dmigs pa'i dpe bstan pa yin la /
translated: This shows the example of the non-existence of self-production, and the observation of an entity.

original: don bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the meaning,

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “Just so,” etc.

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni @161a * //
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni @161a * //
translated: “Just so” means

original: dpe de bzhin du'o //
analyzed: dpe de bzhin du'o //
translated: just like that example.

original: dngos po thams cad stong na yang //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad stong na yang //
translated: “Even though all things are empty,”

original: zhes bya ba ni rigs pas skye ba ma grub pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams stong pa nyid yin yang ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rigs pas skye ba ma grub pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams stong pa nyid yin yang ngo //
translated: means that even though things such as consciousness are empty, because production is not established by reasoning,

original: stong nyid dag las rab tu skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: stong nyid dag las rab tu skye bar 'gyur //
translated: “they arise from emptiness.”

original: zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa las skye bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa las skye bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: This means that they arise from form, etc.

original: des na dmigs pa tsam las rang gi mtshan nyid kyi skye ba mi 'thad pas so //
analyzed: des na dmigs pa tsam las rang gi mtshan nyid kyi skye ba mi 'thad pas so //
translated: Therefore, since arising by virtue of intrinsic characteristic is untenable,

original: gal te skye ba med pa rnams kyang snang bar 'gyur na ri bong gi rva la sogs pa rnams ci'i phyir mi snang zhe na /
analyzed: gal te skye ba med pa rnams kyang snang bar 'gyur na ri bong gi rva la sogs pa rnams ci'i phyir mi snang zhe na /
translated: if things that do not exist were to appear, why would rabbit horns and so on not appear?

original: 'di ni khyod la yang mtshungs te /
analyzed: 'di ni khyod la yang mtshungs te /
translated: This is the same for you as well.

original: ci ltar gzugs brnyan la sogs pa rnams rang gi mtshan nyid kyi skye ba med kyang snang la /
analyzed: ci ltar gzugs brnyan la sogs pa rnams rang gi mtshan nyid kyi skye ba med kyang snang la /
translated: Just as reflections and so on do not arise by virtue of intrinsic characteristic,

original: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa rnams ci'i phyir mi snang /
analyzed: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa rnams ci'i phyir mi snang /
translated: why would rabbit horns and so on not appear?

original: khyod kyis lan ci ltar brjod pa de bzhin du kho bos kyang brjod par bya ba yin pas skyon ci zhig yod ces pa'o //
analyzed: khyod kyis lan ci ltar brjod pa de bzhin du kho bos kyang brjod par bya ba yin pas skyon ci zhig yod ces pa'o //
translated: Since I can respond in the same way that you have responded, what fault is there?

original: de nyid 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach just that, the Commentary says:

original: dngos po thams cad las zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad las zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “From all things” and so on.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag las tha dad pa med par gnas pa yin la zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag las tha dad pa med par gnas pa yin la zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid du gnas pa'o //
translated: “They exist without being different from causes and effects” means that they exist as the nature of causes and effects.

original: dngos po thams cad ces bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams te /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad ces bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams te /
translated: “All things” refers to form and so on,

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa dngos po med pas so //
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa dngos po med pas so //
translated: because space and so on are not things.

original: gzugs brnyan rang bzhin med pa'i rnam par gzhag pa yang zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i rgyur gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan rang bzhin med pa'i rnam par gzhag pa yang zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i rgyur gyur pa'o //
translated: “The presentation of the essencelessness of reflections” is the cause of cognition.

original: de la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the source of the sūtra,

original: ci skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ci skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says “as it is said” and so on.

original: dngos po thams cad kyi gzugs brnyan stong pa me long shin tu yongs su dag pa'i nang du mthong ba yin la ;
analyzed: dngos po thams cad kyi gzugs brnyan stong pa me long shin tu yongs su dag pa'i nang du mthong ba yin la ;
translated: The empty reflections of all things are seen in a very clear mirror,

original: de bzhin du rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos rnams shes pa'i spyod yul du 'gyur ba yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos rnams shes pa'i spyod yul du 'gyur ba yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: and in the same way, dependently arisen phenomena become the domain of cognition.

original: de ni bden pa gnyis kar yang chad pa dang rtag pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni bden pa gnyis kar yang chad pa dang rtag pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that it is neither annihilated nor eternal in either of the two truths,

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “For that reason…”

original: gal te dngos po rnams la yang rang bzhin yod par gyur na de dus ji srid du gnas nas phyis 'jig par 'gyur na chad par 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: gal te dngos po rnams la yang rang bzhin yod par gyur na de dus ji srid du gnas nas phyis 'jig par 'gyur na chad par 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: If things had essences, they would endure for as long as they existed and would later be destroyed.

original: de bzhin du dngos po'i rang bzhin dus thams cad du gnas par gyur na rtag pa nyid du 'gyur pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du dngos po'i rang bzhin dus thams cad du gnas par gyur na rtag pa nyid du 'gyur pa yin gyi /
translated: If things’ essences endured at all times, they would be eternal.

original: 'on kyang phyogs gnyis ka la yang skye ba ma grub pa'i phyir rang bzhin med pa rtag pa @161b dang chad par lta ba dag ga la yod /
analyzed: 'on kyang phyogs gnyis ka la yang skye ba ma grub pa'i phyir rang bzhin med pa rtag pa @161b dang chad par lta ba dag ga la yod /
translated: However, since arising is not established in either case, how could there be the views of eternalism and nihilism with respect to essencelessness?

original: ji skad du bstan bcos las zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba'i shes rab las so //
analyzed: ji skad du bstan bcos las zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba'i shes rab las so //
translated: “As it is said in the treatise” refers to Fundamental Wisdom.

original: gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa la gang zhig ngo bo nyid kyis yod par brjod na /
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa la gang zhig ngo bo nyid kyis yod par brjod na /
translated: With respect to the line “Whatever is essentially non-arisen…”

original: ngo bo nyid nam gyi tshe yang med par mi 'gyur bas ngo bo nyid yod par khas len na rtag par lta bar 'gyur la ;
analyzed: ngo bo nyid nam gyi tshe yang med par mi 'gyur bas ngo bo nyid yod par khas len na rtag par lta bar 'gyur la ;
translated: Since the nature of things never becomes nonexistent, if one accepts that the nature of things exists, one will have the view of eternalism.

original: sngon gyi gnas skabs na dngos po'i rang bzhin khas blangs nas /
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas skabs na dngos po'i rang bzhin khas blangs nas /
translated: If one accepts that the nature of things exists at a former time

original: da ltar ba'i dus na de zhig pa'i phyir yod pa ma yin no zhes phyis de ltar khas len na chad pa'i lta bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: da ltar ba'i dus na de zhig pa'i phyir yod pa ma yin no zhes phyis de ltar khas len na chad pa'i lta bar 'gyur la /
translated: and later accepts that it does not exist because it has been destroyed at the present time, one will have the view of nihilism.

original: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid mi rigs pa'i phyogs de la rtag pa dang chad par 'gyur ba'i skyon yod par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid mi rigs pa'i phyogs de la rtag pa dang chad par 'gyur ba'i skyon yod par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: However, in the position that the nature of things is not tenable, the error of eternalism or nihilism does not occur.

original: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the nature of things is not observed.

original: gal te dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin yod pa ma yin no zhes khas len na dngos po ma dmigs pa'i phyir rtag par lta bar mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gal te dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin yod pa ma yin no zhes khas len na dngos po ma dmigs pa'i phyir rtag par lta bar mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: If one accepts that the nature of things does not exist, one will not have the view of eternalism because things are not observed.

original: nges par chad par lta bar 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: nges par chad par lta bar 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
translated: However, one will definitely have the view of nihilism.

original: de ltar ma yin te gang sngar dngos po'i rang bzhin khas blangs nas phyis de zhig pa las dmigs na de la sngar skyes pa'i dngos po la skur pa btab pa'i phyir chad par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin te gang sngar dngos po'i rang bzhin khas blangs nas phyis de zhig pa las dmigs na de la sngar skyes pa'i dngos po la skur pa btab pa'i phyir chad par 'gyur la /
translated: It is not so. If one first accepts the intrinsic reality of things and later observes their disintegration, then because one has repudiated the previously arisen thing, one would have a view of annihilation.

original: gang zhig rab rib can gyis dmigs pa'i skra shad la sogs pa rnams rab rib med pas cung zad kyang mi dmigs la /
analyzed: gang zhig rab rib can gyis dmigs pa'i skra shad la sogs pa rnams rab rib med pas cung zad kyang mi dmigs la /
translated: Those with eye disease observe floating hairs and so on, but those without eye disease do not observe them at all.

original: de med do zhes brjod pa ni ci zhig med par brjod de ;
analyzed: de med do zhes brjod pa ni ci zhig med par brjod de ;
translated: When it is said that they do not exist, what is it that does not exist?

original: dgag par bya ba cung zad kyang med pas so //
analyzed: dgag par bya ba cung zad kyang med pas so //
translated: Because there is not the slightest thing to be refuted.

original: phyin ci log tu gyur pa rnams la log par zhugs pa bsal ba'i don du rab rib med par brjod par byed pa bzhin du kho bo cag gis dngos po thams cad yod pa ma yin no zhes brjod par bya ba yin pas kho bo cag de ltar
analyzed: phyin ci log tu gyur pa rnams la log par zhugs pa bsal ba'i don du rab rib med par brjod par byed pa bzhin du kho bo cag gis dngos po thams cad yod pa ma yin no zhes brjod par bya ba yin pas kho bo cag de ltar
translated: Just as those without eye disease say to those with eye disease, “The object that appears to you is not a real object,” in order to dispel the false engagement of those with eye disease, we say, “All things do not exist.”

original: brjod pa la chad par lta bar 'gyur ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: brjod pa la chad par lta bar 'gyur ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, we do not have the view of annihilation.

original: de ltar yang mdo las /
analyzed: de ltar yang mdo las /
translated: A sūtra says:

original: bcom ldan 'das gang zhig gis dngos po thams cad khas blangs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang zhig gis dngos po thams cad khas blangs te /
translated: “If someone accepts all things,

original: phyis 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug las byung ba'i dngos po rnams ni yod pa ma yin no zhes brjod na de'i chad par smra bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: phyis 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug las byung ba'i dngos po rnams ni yod pa ma yin no zhes brjod na de'i chad par smra bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: and later says that things arisen from attachment, aversion, and delusion do not exist, he would be a nihilist.”

original: gang gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i dngos po tsam khas blangs nas kun tu brtags pa'i dngos po rnams med pas yod par lta ba yongs su spong ba yin la /🔽kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byed ba'i rgyu mtshan du @162a * //
analyzed: gang gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i dngos po tsam khas blangs nas kun tu brtags pa'i dngos po rnams med pas yod par lta ba yongs su spong ba yin la / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byed ba'i rgyu mtshan du @162a * //
translated: If one accepts mere things that are mind and mental factors that are dependent on other factors, then one abandons the view of existence because imputed things do not exist.

original: gyur pa gzhan gyi dbang gi dngos po tsam yod pa'i phyir med par lta ba yongs su spong ba yin no zhes brjod pa de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: gyur pa gzhan gyi dbang gi dngos po tsam yod pa'i phyir med par lta ba yongs su spong ba yin no zhes brjod pa de yang mi rigs te /
translated: And because mere things that are dependent on other factors exist as the causal basis of the afflictions and the distinctions, one abandons the view of nonexistence.🔽This is illogical.

original: 'di ltar de'i kun tu brtags pa med pa'i phyir dang / gzhan dbang yod pa'i phyir yod pa dang / med pa'i lta ba gnyis nye bar gnas pas ci ltar mtha' gnyis yongs su spong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ltar de'i kun tu brtags pa med pa'i phyir dang / gzhan dbang yod pa'i phyir yod pa dang / med pa'i lta ba gnyis nye bar gnas pas ci ltar mtha' gnyis yongs su spong bar 'gyur /
translated: Thus, because its imagined nature does not exist and because its relative nature exists, the two views of existence and nonexistence are present. How can one avoid the two extremes?

original: rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin mi rigs pa'i phyir bshad pa'i don mi 'thad pa kho na'o zhes pa'o //🔽des na dbu ma pa'i lta ba kho na la yod pa dang / med pa nyid kyi lta bar thal bar mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin mi rigs pa'i phyir bshad pa'i don mi 'thad pa kho na'o zhes pa'o // des na dbu ma pa'i lta ba kho na la yod pa dang / med pa nyid kyi lta bar thal bar mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: Because the nature of things produced by causes and conditions is illogical, the meaning of the above explanation is untenable.🔽Therefore, only the Madhyamaka view is free from the views of existence and nonexistence.

original: sems tsam pa la sogs pa'i lta ba la ni ma yin no zhes khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: sems tsam pa la sogs pa'i lta ba la ni ma yin no zhes khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the Cittamātra view and so on are not free from the views of existence and nonexistence.

original: de lta bu'i gdul bya'i skye bo dang rjes su bstun pa'i phyir dang / don dam pa'i bden pa mthong ba'i thabs yin pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis thugs rje chen po'i dbang gis drang ba'i don nyid du sems tsam gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i gdul bya'i skye bo dang rjes su bstun pa'i phyir dang / don dam pa'i bden pa mthong ba'i thabs yin pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis thugs rje chen po'i dbang gis drang ba'i don nyid du sems tsam gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Because it is in accordance with the disciples, and because it is the method for seeing the ultimate truth, the Bhagavat taught mind only with a thought behind it, out of great compassion.

original: mang pos bkur ba la sogs pa gang zag gsungs pa bzhin du nges pa'i don ni ma yin no zhes khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: mang pos bkur ba la sogs pa gang zag gsungs pa bzhin du nges pa'i don ni ma yin no zhes khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Just as the person was taught in the Sammitīya, and so on, it should be understood that this is not the ultimate meaning.

original: ji skad du 'phags pa ting nge 'dzin rgyal po'i mdo las /
analyzed: ji skad du 'phags pa ting nge 'dzin rgyal po'i mdo las /
translated: As it says in the Ārya-samādhirāja-sūtra:

original: gang du bde bar gshegs pas stong nyid gsungs pa yi //
analyzed: gang du bde bar gshegs pas stong nyid gsungs pa yi //
translated: “Where the Sugata taught emptiness,

original: mdo sde nges pa'i don gyi khyad par yin shes kyis //
analyzed: mdo sde nges pa'i don gyi khyad par yin shes kyis //
translated: know that the sūtra is of definitive meaning.

original: gang du gang zag sems can skyes bu rnams bstan pa'i //
analyzed: gang du gang zag sems can skyes bu rnams bstan pa'i //
translated: Where the person, sentient being, and human are taught,

original: chos de thams cad drang ba'i don du shes par gyis //🔽zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: chos de thams cad drang ba'i don du shes par gyis // zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: know that the dharma is of provisional meaning.”

original: yang dbu ma'i bstan bcos kyi khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yang dbu ma'i bstan bcos kyi khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to show the source of the treatise, it says:

original: ji skad du bstan bcos las zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽dngos po rnams skye ba med par shes bar 'dod dgos te gzhan du gang ma brtags na nyams dga' ba'i dngos po'i rnam gzhag las gal te dngos por lta ba khas len na ni de la nges par lung dang shin tu 'gal pa'i rtag pa dang chad par
analyzed: ji skad du bstan bcos las zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / dngos po rnams skye ba med par shes bar 'dod dgos te gzhan du gang ma brtags na nyams dga' ba'i dngos po'i rnam gzhag las gal te dngos por lta ba khas len na ni de la nges par lung dang shin tu 'gal pa'i rtag pa dang chad par
translated: As it is said in the treatise, etc.

original: lta bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lta bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One must understand that things are not produced. Otherwise, if one accepts the view of things, which is delightful when not examined, one will definitely fall into the views of eternalism and nihilism, which are in complete contradiction with scripture.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: gang gi phyir yongs su brtag par bya ba'i dngos po de rtag par 'gyur ba zhig gam /🔽'on te mi rtag pa zhig / gal te rtag pa yin na ni de'i tshe rtag par smra bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir yongs su brtag par bya ba'i dngos po de rtag par 'gyur ba zhig gam / 'on te mi rtag pa zhig / gal te rtag pa yin na ni de'i tshe rtag par smra bar 'gyur la /
translated: Because if one examines things, are they permanent or impermanent?🔽If they are permanent, then one will be an advocate of eternalism.

original: gal te mi rtag na ni de'i tshe chad par smra bar nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te mi rtag na ni de'i tshe chad par smra bar nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they are impermanent, then one will definitely be an advocate of nihilism.

original: de ltar rtag pa dang chad pa dang bral ba'i bden pa gnyis bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar rtag pa dang chad pa dang bral ba'i bden pa gnyis bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the two truths free from eternalism and nihilism,

original: da ni stong pa'i dngos @162b po las stong pa skye ba la dbu ma'i bstan bcos kyi khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni stong pa'i dngos @162b po las stong pa skye ba la dbu ma'i bstan bcos kyi khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the source in the Treatise on the Middle Way for the arising of emptiness from an empty thing,

original: ci ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ci ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [Nāgārjuna] states the reason beginning with “just as . . .”

original: dpe 'di'i sgo nas rang bzhin med pa rnams la 'bras bu skyed par byed pa nyid nges pa yin te /
analyzed: dpe 'di'i sgo nas rang bzhin med pa rnams la 'bras bu skyed par byed pa nyid nges pa yin te /
translated: By means of this example, it is ascertained that those lacking intrinsic existence are producers of effects.

original: dper na ston pa ste /
analyzed: dper na ston pa ste /
translated: For example, the Teacher,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rdzu 'phrul phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rdzu 'phrul phun sum tshogs pa ste /
translated: the Bhagavān Buddha, is endowed with perfect miraculous powers.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi mthus sprul pa sprul na byed pa'i sprul pa po de stong pa nyid de rang bzhin med pa'o /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi mthus sprul pa sprul na byed pa'i sprul pa po de stong pa nyid de rang bzhin med pa'o /
translated: When he emanates emanations through the power of his miraculous abilities, that emanator, who is empty, that is, lacks intrinsic existence,

original: pa gzhan sprul par byed de /
analyzed: pa gzhan sprul par byed de /
translated: emanates another emanation.

original: de la gang sprul pa gzhan sprul par byed pa'i sprul pa po de stong pa nyid de rang bzhin med pa'o //
analyzed: de la gang sprul pa gzhan sprul par byed pa'i sprul pa po de stong pa nyid de rang bzhin med pa'o //
translated: That emanator, who emanates another emanation, is empty, that is, lacks intrinsic existence.

original: gang sprul pa pos sprul pa'i sprul pa gzhan de yang stong pa nyid de de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba nyid yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gang sprul pa pos sprul pa'i sprul pa gzhan de yang stong pa nyid de de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba nyid yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the emanation of the emanator is also empty, and is devoid of the nature of the Tathāgata.

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ci ltar 'dir rang bzhin med pa rnams la rang bzhin med pa'i bya ba dang byed pa nyid dang / las dang byed pa por brjod par 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'dir las kyi byed pa po ni sprul pa'i rnam pa can yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ci ltar 'dir rang bzhin med pa rnams la rang bzhin med pa'i bya ba dang byed pa nyid dang / las dang byed pa por brjod par 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'dir las kyi byed pa po ni sprul pa'i rnam pa can yin te /
translated: As for “just like that,” etc., just as here, the activity and agent of those who are essenceless are said to be essenceless, and the action and the agent are described, in the same way, here, the agent of the action is of the form of an emanation.

original: rang bzhin stong pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa'o //
translated: The nature is empty.

original: rang bzhin stong pa'i byed pa po des las gang byed pa de yang ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa'i byed pa po des las gang byed pa de yang ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa yin te /
translated: The action that is performed by that agent whose nature is empty is also empty of essence.

original: dper na sprul pa pos sprul pa gzhan sprul pa de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dper na sprul pa pos sprul pa gzhan sprul pa de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: For example, it should be understood that just as the emanator emanates another emanation,🔽so too, the agent of the action is of the form of an emanation.

original: de'i phyir gnyis su med par smra ba'i dbu ma pa rnams la log par lta ba ga la yod ces pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyis su med par smra ba'i dbu ma pa rnams la log par lta ba ga la yod ces pa'o //
translated: Therefore, how could the Mādhyamikas, who propound non-duality, have wrong views?

original: sprul pa'i dpe 'ba' zhig gis rang bzhin med par lta bar rig par ma zad kyi gzhan yang dpe 'di rnams kyi sgo nas kyang dngos po rnams rang bzhin med pa yin no zhes gsal bar khong du chud par gyis zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sprul pa'i dpe 'ba' zhig gis rang bzhin med par lta bar rig par ma zad kyi gzhan yang dpe 'di rnams kyi sgo nas kyang dngos po rnams rang bzhin med pa yin no zhes gsal bar khong du chud par gyis zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach this, he says,

original: nyon mongs las dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: nyon mongs las dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Afflictions, karma, and so on,

original: de la nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa ste /
translated: Afflictions are such things as attachment.

original: sems can gyi sems kyi rgyud nyon mongs par byed pas so //
analyzed: sems can gyi sems kyi rgyud nyon mongs par byed pas so //
translated: They afflict the mental continuum of sentient beings.

original: las ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / mi g-yo ba'i las so //
analyzed: las ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / mi g-yo ba'i las so //
translated: Karma is virtuous, nonvirtuous, and stable karma.

original: byed pa po ni sems dang lus so //
analyzed: byed pa po ni sems dang lus so //
translated: The agent is the mind and the body.

original: 'bras bu ni rnam par smin pa dang / rgyu mthun dang / bdag po'i 'bras bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni rnam par smin pa dang / rgyu mthun dang / bdag po'i 'bras bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: The effects are the ripened effect, the effect similar to the cause, the environmental effect, and so on.

original: nyon mongs pa la sogs pa 'di rnams dri za'i grong khyer gyi rnam pa la sogs pa bzhin du rang bzhin med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa la sogs pa 'di rnams dri za'i grong khyer gyi rnam pa la sogs pa bzhin du rang bzhin med par rig par bya'o //
translated: These afflictions and so on should be understood to be essenceless, like the form of a city of gandharvas and so on.

original: de'i phyir dbu ma pa rnams kho nas dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin khas ma blangs pa'i phyir rtag pa dang chad par lta bar thal bar 'gyur ba yod pa ma @163a * //🔽yin no zhes khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dbu ma pa rnams kho nas dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin khas ma blangs pa'i phyir rtag pa dang chad par lta bar thal bar 'gyur ba yod pa ma @163a * // yin no zhes khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, only the Centrists do not accept the intrinsic reality of things, and so it should be understood that the consequence of eternalism and nihilism does not apply to them.

original: de ltar rtag pa dang chad par lta ba spangs nas rang bzhin med pa nyid la dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel par rigs pa yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar rtag pa dang chad par lta ba spangs nas rang bzhin med pa nyid la dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel par rigs pa yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Having thus rejected the views of eternalism and nihilism, in order to demonstrate that it is reasonable for the absence of intrinsic reality to be the connection between virtuous and nonvirtuous karma and their effects, he says,

original: de'i phyir de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i las zhes bya ba la dge ba'i las ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa las ldog pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i las zhes bya ba la dge ba'i las ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa las ldog pa'o //
translated: Therefore, in this way, etc.🔽As for the phrase virtuous and nonvirtuous karma, virtuous karma is to turn away from killing, etc.

original: mi dge ba'i las ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i las ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Nonvirtuous karma is killing, etc.

original: 'bras bu'i 'brel pa ni dge ba'i las kyis bde 'gror yid du 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / mi dge ba'i las ni ngan song du yid du mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i 'brel pa ni dge ba'i las kyis bde 'gror yid du 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / mi dge ba'i las ni ngan song du yid du mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang 'brel pa'o //
translated: The relation of effect is that a virtuous action is related to a pleasant effect in a happy rebirth, and a nonvirtuous action is related to an unpleasant effect in an unfortunate rebirth.

original: 'gags nas yun ring du lon nas zhes bya ba ni skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i las rnams kyi 'bras bu dus gzhan du nyams su myong bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: 'gags nas yun ring du lon nas zhes bya ba ni skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i las rnams kyi 'bras bu dus gzhan du nyams su myong bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: “Having ceased long ago” means that the effect of actions experienced after rebirth and so on is experienced at another time.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rgyun dang chud mi za ba dang thob pa la sogs pa yongs su rtogs pa med pa yang 'thad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rgyun med du zin yang 'bras bu 'thad pa yin te /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rgyun dang chud mi za ba dang thob pa la sogs pa yongs su rtogs pa med pa yang 'thad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rgyun med du zin yang 'bras bu 'thad pa yin te /
translated: “It is also tenable that there is no understanding of the continuum of the foundation consciousness, the nonexpiration of actions, and obtainment” means that even if the continuum of the foundation consciousness did not exist, the effect would be tenable.

original: ji ltar bag chags kyis bsgos pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rgyun skye ba dag las dus gzhan du 'bras bu skye bar gzhan gyis brtags pa de ltar ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar bag chags kyis bsgos pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rgyun skye ba dag las dus gzhan du 'bras bu skye bar gzhan gyis brtags pa de ltar ni ma yin no //
translated: The effect does not arise at another time from the continuum of the foundation consciousness that is imbued with the latent ten dencies, as imagined by others.

original: de bzhin du chud mi za ba'i chos med pas kyang 'bras bu skye ba yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du chud mi za ba'i chos med pas kyang 'bras bu skye ba yin te /
translated: So too, the effect arises from the nonexpiration of karma,

original: gzhan gyis ji ltar brtags pa bzhin du ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis ji ltar brtags pa bzhin du ni ma yin te /
translated: but not as others imagine it.

original: gzhan dag na re dge ba'i las ni skyes pa'i de ma thag tu chud za ba yin na de 'gags pas 'bras bu med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re dge ba'i las ni skyes pa'i de ma thag tu chud za ba yin na de 'gags pas 'bras bu med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Others say: If virtuous karma expires immediately upon arising, then it would follow that it would have no effect.

original: des na gang gi tshe las de byas pa'i dus de nyid du las de las chud mi za bar zhes bya ba'i chos ldan pa ma yin pa zhig byed pa po'i rgyud la bu lon gyi yi ge lta bu zhig skye bar 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: des na gang gi tshe las de byas pa'i dus de nyid du las de las chud mi za bar zhes bya ba'i chos ldan pa ma yin pa zhig byed pa po'i rgyud la bu lon gyi yi ge lta bu zhig skye bar 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: Therefore, when that karma is created, at that time, a phenomenon called the nonexpiration of karma arises in the mindstream of the agent, like a promissory note.

original: de ltar na yi ga bzhin du chud mi za bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na yi ga bzhin du chud mi za bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus nonexpiration should be understood to be like a promissory note.

original: gang las chud mi za ba'i chos skye ba'i las de bu lon bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang las chud mi za ba'i chos skye ba'i las de bu lon bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The karma from which the phenomenon of nonexpiration arises should be understood to be like a promissory note.

original: ji ltar bu lon gyi yi ge yod pas bu lon de spyad du zin kyang nor gyi bdag po'i nor chud za bar mi 'gyur bar skyed dang bcas pa'i nor gyi tshogs dang ldan pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar bu lon gyi yi ge yod pas bu lon de spyad du zin kyang nor gyi bdag po'i nor chud za bar mi 'gyur bar skyed dang bcas pa'i nor gyi tshogs dang ldan pa kho na yin no //
translated: Just as, when a promissory note exists, the debt is not lost even though the money has been spent, and the creditor still has the ability to take back the money together with the interest.

original: de bzhin du las zad du zin kyang chud mi za ba zhes bya ba'i chos gzhan yod pa ba de'i sgo nas 'bras bu dang byed pa po dag 'brel pa yin no//
analyzed: de bzhin du las zad du zin kyang chud mi za ba zhes bya ba'i chos gzhan yod pa ba de'i sgo nas 'bras bu dang byed pa po dag 'brel pa yin no//
translated: In the same way, even though the action has been exhausted, there is a factor called “non-expiration” that exists, and it is through this that the effect and the agent are connected.

original: @163b gang gi tshe bu lon gyi yi ge sa nor khugs te longs spyad nas phyis yod dam med kyang rung nor 'ong ba'i nus pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: @163b gang gi tshe bu lon gyi yi ge sa nor khugs te longs spyad nas phyis yod dam med kyang rung nor 'ong ba'i nus pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: When the promissory note is spent, the money is lost, and later, whether it exists or not, it has no power to bring back the money.

original: de bzhin du chud mi za ba yang rnam par smin pa nyams su myong bar byas nas yod dam med kyang rung nor spyad pa'i yi ge bzhin du yang rnam par smin pa 'byin par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du chud mi za ba yang rnam par smin pa nyams su myong bar byas nas yod dam med kyang rung nor spyad pa'i yi ge bzhin du yang rnam par smin pa 'byin par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, once the effect of the action has been experienced, whether the non-expiration exists or not, it has no power to bring about another effect, just like the promissory note that has been spent.

original: thob pa med du zin kyang 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: thob pa med du zin kyang 'thad pa yin no //
translated: Even though there is no acquisition, it is still tenable.

original: gzhan dag gis dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las rnams kyi thob pa zhes bya ba'i ldan pa ma yin pa'i chos zhig yod pa la /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las rnams kyi thob pa zhes bya ba'i ldan pa ma yin pa'i chos zhig yod pa la /
translated: Others say that there is a non-associated factor called “possession” of virtuous and non-virtuous actions.

original: gang thob pa las zhig tu zin kyang dge ba dang mi dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyang ldan par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: gang thob pa las zhig tu zin kyang dge ba dang mi dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyang ldan par brjod pa yin no //
translated: Even though the possession has disintegrated, one is said to possess virtuous and non-virtuous actions.

original: de las dus gzhan du 'bras bu skye bar 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa de lta ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de las dus gzhan du 'bras bu skye bar 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa de lta ma yin pa'o //
translated: But it is not the case that the effect arises at another time from that.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni las kyi bag chags bsgos pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa bsdu bar bya ste /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni las kyi bag chags bsgos pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa bsdu bar bya ste /
translated: The words “and so on” include the mental consciousness that is imbued with the latent propensities of actions.

original: des kyang dus gzhan du 'bras bu 'byin pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: des kyang dus gzhan du 'bras bu 'byin pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: It is not the case that it also produces an effect at another time.

original: ji ltar zhe na zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa med na las dang 'bras bu 'brel par ci ltar 'gyur zhe na'o //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa med na las dang 'bras bu 'brel par ci ltar 'gyur zhe na'o //
translated: How is it that the connection between actions and effects is possible if there is no foundation consciousness and so on?

original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the answer to that, he says:🔽Because of the existence of the mind,

original: gang gi phyir las de rang bzhin gyis mi 'gag ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir las de rang bzhin gyis mi 'gag ste /
translated: Because that karma does not intrinsically cease.

original: las de ni thag ma nas skye ba med pa'i phyir rang bzhin med pa la las de 'jig pa med pas las de las 'bras bu 'byung ba 'ongs pa yin no //
analyzed: las de ni thag ma nas skye ba med pa'i phyir rang bzhin med pa la las de 'jig pa med pas las de las 'bras bu 'byung ba 'ongs pa yin no //
translated: Since that karma does not intrinsically arise, it is essenceless. Since that karma does not disintegrate, the effect arises from that karma.🔽The meaning of this is as follows: Just as an effect arises from that karma even though it is essenceless at the time when it is present, in the same way, since karma is essenceless, who could

original: 'di'i don ni dper na da ltar ba'i gnas skabs na de la rang bzhin med du zin kyang de las 'bras bu 'byung ba de bzhin du las la rang bzhin med pa'i phyir 'jig pa med pa las ma zhig pa las 'bras bu skye ba su zhig gis🔽'gog / de'i phyir 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis 'gags nas yun ring por lon pa las kyang mi'i 'gro ba la sogs pa la lar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa med du zin kyang 'di nus pa ste /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni dper na da ltar ba'i gnas skabs na de la rang bzhin med du zin kyang de las 'bras bu 'byung ba de bzhin du las la rang bzhin med pa'i phyir 'jig pa med pa las ma zhig pa las 'bras bu skye ba su zhig gis 'gog / de'i phyir 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis 'gags nas yun ring por lon pa las kyang mi'i 'gro ba la sogs pa la lar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa med du zin kyang 'di nus pa ste /
translated: refute the arising of an effect from karma that does not disintegrate, since it does not disintegrate?

original: mthus bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin can gyi 'bras bu 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mthus bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin can gyi 'bras bu 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, even though the continuum of the foundation consciousness does not exist in the continuum of a human being and so on, for a long time after the karma has ceased, one should understand that the effect, which is of the nature of pleasure or pain, arises through the power of that potential.

original: de nyid 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir gang gi ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir gang gi ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says, “According to those who say that the nature of karma ceases,” and so on.

original: gang gi zhes bya ba ni las kyi rang bzhin 'gag par smra ba rnams so //
analyzed: gang gi zhes bya ba ni las kyi rang bzhin 'gag par smra ba rnams so //
translated: “ Those who say” refers to those who say that the nature of karma ceases.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni las 'gag par smra ba la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni las 'gag par smra ba la'o //
translated: “ In that regard” refers to the assertion that karma ceases.

original: 'gags zin pa'i las kyi nus pa gzhag par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'gags zin pa'i las kyi nus pa ste /
analyzed: 'gags zin pa'i las kyi nus pa gzhag par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'gags zin pa'i las kyi nus pa ste /
translated: “ In order to posit the potency of a karma that has already ceased” means that the potency of a karma that has already ceased

original: mthu @164a * //
analyzed: mthu @164a * //
translated: is posited.

original: gnas par bya ba'i don du ste de lta ma yin na dus gzhan du 'bras bu skye ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas par bya ba'i don du ste de lta ma yin na dus gzhan du 'bras bu skye ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to do that, it is necessary to posit the potency of a karma that has already ceased, because otherwise it would be impossible for the effect to arise at another time.

original: lhag ma go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: ji skad du bstan bcos las zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba'i shes rab las so //
analyzed: ji skad du bstan bcos las zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba'i shes rab las so //
translated: “ As it says in the treatise” refers to Fundamental Wisdom.

original: gang phyir las ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ci'i phyir las skye ba med ce na /
analyzed: gang phyir las ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ci'i phyir las skye ba med ce na /
translated: Why is it that karma does not arise?

original: slob dpon gyis smras pa /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis smras pa /
translated: The master says:

original: gang gi phyir rang bzhin med pa'i phyir skye ba med pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang bzhin med pa'i phyir skye ba med pa'o //
translated: Because it has no intrinsic reality, it does not arise.

original: gal te rang bzhin med pa'i phyir skye ba med pa yin na ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis /🔽las rnams bskal pa brgyar yang ni //
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin med pa'i phyir skye ba med pa yin na ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis / las rnams bskal pa brgyar yang ni //
translated: If things do not arise because they lack intrinsic existence, why did the Transcendent Lord say:

original: 'jig par 'gyur ba ma yin te //
analyzed: 'jig par 'gyur ba ma yin te //
translated: Karmas do not perish even in one hundred eons.

original: tshogs shing dus la bab pa na //
analyzed: tshogs shing dus la bab pa na //
translated: When the assemblage and the time are right,

original: lus can rnams la 'bras bur smin //
analyzed: lus can rnams la 'bras bur smin //
translated: They will bear fruit for embodied beings.

original: zhes ji ltar gsungs she na brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes ji ltar gsungs she na brjod par bya ste /
translated: We respond:

original: gang phyir de ni ma skyes pa //
analyzed: gang phyir de ni ma skyes pa //
translated: Because it is unarisen,

original: de phyir chud zar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de phyir chud zar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It does not perish.

original: zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs pa yin pa'i phyir khyod de skad zer bas kho bo cag la gnod pa ni ma yin la /
analyzed: zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs pa yin pa'i phyir khyod de skad zer bas kho bo cag la gnod pa ni ma yin la /
translated: Since this is the intention of the Transcendent Lord, your statement does not undermine our position.

original: las la rang bzhin yod na las kyi rang bzhin de nges par gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir rtag par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: las la rang bzhin yod na las kyi rang bzhin de nges par gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir rtag par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If karma had intrinsic existence, then because the intrinsic nature of karma would definitely not transform into something else, it would follow that it is permanent.

original: nam mkha'i rang bzhin can bzhin du mi 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: nam mkha'i rang bzhin can bzhin du mi 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: It would be like the intrinsic nature of space, which does not change.

original: des na las de ma byas kyang yod pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na las de ma byas kyang yod pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, even if one did not perform karma, it would exist.

original: gang gi phyir rtag pa zhes bya ba ni yod par 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rtag pa zhes bya ba ni yod par 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: Because that which is called “permanent” is existent.

original: gang yod pa de ni bya bar mi rigs pas rgyu la ltos pa ma yin pa'i phyir dge mi dge'i las ma byas su zin kyang 'jig rten pa la rnam par smin pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin pas ma byas kyang myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang yod pa de ni bya bar mi rigs pas rgyu la ltos pa ma yin pa'i phyir dge mi dge'i las ma byas su zin kyang 'jig rten pa la rnam par smin pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin pas ma byas kyang myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since that which exists is not suitable to be an action, because it does not rely on a cause, the fruitional effect of virtuous and nonvirtuous karma would arise in the world even though it was not done. Therefore, one would experience the effect even though it was not done.

original: khyod kyi phyogs la yang ma skyes pa nyid kyis 'bras bu 'byin na ma byas pas myong bar ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: khyod kyi phyogs la yang ma skyes pa nyid kyis 'bras bu 'byin na ma byas pas myong bar ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If you say that even in your system, since it is not arisen, it gives rise to an effect, why would one not experience the effect even though it was not done?

original: gang gi phyir kho bos 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du las gang byas nas 'jig par 'gyur ba de la rnam par dpyad na skye ba dang 'jig pa med pas de la 'bras bu skye ba yin no zhes brjod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir kho bos 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du las gang byas nas 'jig par 'gyur ba de la rnam par dpyad na skye ba dang 'jig pa med pas de la 'bras bu skye ba yin no zhes brjod pa yin gyi /
translated: Because I say that when one analyzes the karma that is done and then disintegrates in terms of worldly convention, since it does not arise or disintegrate, the effect arises from it.

original: 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad du ma byas kyang 'bras bu myong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad du ma byas kyang 'bras bu myong ba ma yin no //
translated: But in terms of worldly convention, one does not experience the effect even though it was not done.

original: des na skyon yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na skyon yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore there is no fault.

original: don dam par las chud mi za ba la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam par las chud mi za ba la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the scriptural source for the ultimate non-expiration of karma,

original: mdo las kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mdo las kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “Also, in a sūtra…”

original: mi'i tshe'i tshad lo brgya ste zhes bya ba ni mi rnams kyi tshe lo'i tshad ni lo brgya yin la rgyu dang 'bras bu dag mi rigs pa'i phyir dus kyang ma grub pas lo brgya pa'i rang bzhin can gyi lo la phung por spungs pa yod pa ma
analyzed: mi'i tshe'i tshad lo brgya ste zhes bya ba ni mi rnams kyi tshe lo'i tshad ni lo brgya yin la rgyu dang 'bras bu dag mi rigs pa'i phyir dus kyang ma grub pas lo brgya pa'i rang bzhin can gyi lo la phung por spungs pa yod pa ma
translated: “The measure of a human life is one hundred years” means that the measure of a human life is one hundred years. Since cause and effect are not tenable, time is not established. Therefore, the collection of years that have the nature of one hundred years does not exist.

original: yin no// @164b sgrub pa 'di yang zhes bya ba ni phung po rnam pa lnga'i mtshan nyid can mi nyid kyi phung po yang de dang mtshungs te /
analyzed: yin no// @164b sgrub pa 'di yang zhes bya ba ni phung po rnam pa lnga'i mtshan nyid can mi nyid kyi phung po yang de dang mtshungs te /
translated: This proof is also similar to the collection of humans that has the characteristic of the five aggregates.

original: stong pa nyid yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: stong pa nyid yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is emptiness.

original: 'dis ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir skye ba med par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir skye ba med par bstan pa yin no //
translated: This demonstrates that because of emptiness of intrinsic reality, there is no arising.

original: zad pa med par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: zad pa med par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the non-expiration,

original: zad pa med ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zad pa med ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “Non-expiration,” and so on.

original: ngas las zad pa med pa dang zad pa gang smras pa de ni stong pa'i rnam pa las de zad pa med pa yin la /
analyzed: ngas las zad pa med pa dang zad pa gang smras pa de ni stong pa'i rnam pa las de zad pa med pa yin la /
translated: The meaning of what I have said about the non-exhaustion and exhaustion of karma is that it is non-exhaustible from the point of view of emptiness,

original: tha snyad kyi rnam pas zad par smras pa yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: tha snyad kyi rnam pas zad par smras pa yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: but I have said that it is exhausted from the conventional point of view.

original: ci skad bstan pa'i don nyid ces bya ba ni las dang / 'bras bu'i 'grel pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: ci skad bstan pa'i don nyid ces bya ba ni las dang / 'bras bu'i 'grel pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: The meaning of “just as it is taught” is that it is characterized by the connection between karma and its result.

original: sad kyang zhes bya ba ni sad pa'i gnas skabs na yang ngo //
analyzed: sad kyang zhes bya ba ni sad pa'i gnas skabs na yang ngo //
translated: “Even when awake” means even in the state of being awake.

original: rang bzhin yod mi pa'i zhes bya ba ni don dam par ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin yod mi pa'i zhes bya ba ni don dam par ro //
translated: “No intrinsic reality” means ultimately.

original: 'gags shing zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad kyis so //
analyzed: 'gags shing zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad kyis so //
translated: “Ceased” means by mundane convention.

original: don 'di nyid la mdo'i khung bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don 'di nyid la mdo'i khung bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the scriptural source for this very meaning,

original: ci skad du srid pa 'pho ba'i mdo las zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ci skad du srid pa 'pho ba'i mdo las zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “As it is said in the Sūtra on the Transference of Existence,” and so on.

original: yul gyi bud med bzang mo zhes bya ba ni yul na yod pa rnams kyi nang na mdzes pa'o //
analyzed: yul gyi bud med bzang mo zhes bya ba ni yul na yod pa rnams kyi nang na mdzes pa'o //
translated: “A beautiful woman of the land” means beautiful among those in the land.

original: ma mchis shing zhes bya ba ni ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ma mchis shing zhes bya ba ni ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: “It does not exist” means for what reason?

original: mi dmigs pa lags na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa lags na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, “because it is not perceived.”

original: rnam par dpyad na mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par dpyad na mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not perceived when analyzed.

original: phongs shing zhes bya ba ni yid mi bde ba'i rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: phongs shing zhes bya ba ni yid mi bde ba'i rang bzhin can no //
translated: “It is in distress” means it has the nature of mental dissatisfaction.

original: dub ba zhes bya ba ni lus kyi sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dub ba zhes bya ba ni lus kyi sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'o //
translated: “It is exhausted” means it is associated with physical suffering.

original: 'chi dus dang tshod nye bar gnas pa'i tshe zhes bya ba ni 'chi kha na'o //
analyzed: 'chi dus dang tshod nye bar gnas pa'i tshe zhes bya ba ni 'chi kha na'o //
translated: “At the time of death, when the end is near” means at the time of death.

original: de dang skal ba 'dra ba'i las sad nas //
analyzed: de dang skal ba 'dra ba'i las sad nas //
translated: Karma similar to that awakens.

original: zhes bya ba ni mi la sogs pa'i 'gro ba gang du skyes pa de dang skal ba mnyam pa'i las sad nas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mi la sogs pa'i 'gro ba gang du skyes pa de dang skal ba mnyam pa'i las sad nas so //
translated: Karma similar to that birth in which one is born as a human, etc. awakens.🔽For example, when one is waking up, etc.🔽For example, even though a woman seen in a dream does not exist in the waking state, it can be the cause of the arising of memory.

original: dper na nyal nyal ba las zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dper na rmi lam na mthong ba'i bud med sad pa'i gnas skabs na med du zin kyang dran pa skye ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba de bzhin du las kyang don dam pa'i dbang du byas nas 'jig
analyzed: dper na nyal nyal ba las zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dper na rmi lam na mthong ba'i bud med sad pa'i gnas skabs na med du zin kyang dran pa skye ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba de bzhin du las kyang don dam pa'i dbang du byas nas 'jig
translated: In the same way, karma, from the ultimate point of view, is destroyed.

original: pa med pa yin la /
analyzed: pa med pa yin la /
translated: and it is not nonexistent.

original: kun rdzob kyi dbang du byas nas zhig tu zin kyang yid la 'bras bu skyed pa'i don du mngon du phyogs par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi dbang du byas nas zhig tu zin kyang yid la 'bras bu skyed pa'i don du mngon du phyogs par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: And from the point of view of the conventional, even though it has ceased, it is directed toward the production of the effect in the mind. This is the meaning.

original: de dang skal ba 'dra ba'i zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba dang rjes su mthun pa'o //
analyzed: de dang skal ba 'dra ba'i zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba dang rjes su mthun pa'o //
translated: Similar to that means similar to the experience of the ripening.

original: de la chos gang yang 'jig rten 'di nas 'jig rten pha rol du 'pho ba yang med la zhes bya ba ni bdag la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: de la chos gang yang 'jig rten 'di nas 'jig rten pha rol du 'pho ba yang med la zhes bya ba ni bdag la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: Therein, no dharma at all passes from this world to the next world means having the nature of self, etc.

original: lhag ma go @165a * //
analyzed: lhag ma go @165a * //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: sla'o ; /'dis ni las 'gag tu zin kyang chud mi za bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sla'o ; /'dis ni las 'gag tu zin kyang chud mi za bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows that even though the karma has ceased, it does not perish.

original: de la gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu bar ba ba'i phyir ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu bar ba ba'i phyir ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to anticipate the doubts of others, he says, “Why is that? ” and so on.

original: rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa zhes bya ba ni las la'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa zhes bya ba ni las la'o //
translated: Naturally unarisen means in the karma.

original: rnam par smin pa byas zin pa las kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu bskyed zin pa las rnam par smin pa 'byung ba'i phyir thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa byas zin pa las kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu bskyed zin pa las rnam par smin pa 'byung ba'i phyir thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: From an action whose ripening has already been completed, and so on, means that because the ripening result arises from an action whose ripening has already been completed, the consequence of an infinite regress would follow.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de la zad pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de la zad pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It is said, Because there is no exhaustion of that.

original: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu nyams su myong yang las de la zad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu nyams su myong yang las de la zad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though the ripening result has been experienced, there is no exhaustion of that action.

original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the response to that,

original: de ni yod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ni yod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, That is not so, and so on.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni thug pa med pa'i skyon no //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni thug pa med pa'i skyon no //
translated: That refers to the error of an infinite regress.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that,

original: ci ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ci ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, For example, and so on.

original: dper na rab rib can la yul med pa nyid du mtshungs kyang skra shad la sogs pa snang ba yin te /
analyzed: dper na rab rib can la yul med pa nyid du mtshungs kyang skra shad la sogs pa snang ba yin te /
translated: For example, although the absence of an object is the same for one with eye disease, hairs and so on appear,

original: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa ni mi snang ngo //
analyzed: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa ni mi snang ngo //
translated: but the horns of a rabbit and so on do not appear.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: dngos gzhan rnam par ma yin ltar //
analyzed: dngos gzhan rnam par ma yin ltar //
translated: it is not like other entities.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de ltar dpe bstan nas don bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar dpe bstan nas don bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Having taught the example in that way, in order to teach the meaning,🔽it is said:

original: de bzhin smin nas slar smin min shes kyi //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /🔽ji ltar med pa nyid du mtshungs kyang thams cad mi snang ba bzhin du rnam par smin pa dang ma smin pa dag gi dus su las kyi rang bzhin 'jig pa med par mtshungs su zin kyang rnam par smin pa'i las las rnam par smin pa 'byung bar
analyzed: de bzhin smin nas slar smin min shes kyi // zhes bya ba gsungs te / ji ltar med pa nyid du mtshungs kyang thams cad mi snang ba bzhin du rnam par smin pa dang ma smin pa dag gi dus su las kyi rang bzhin 'jig pa med par mtshungs su zin kyang rnam par smin pa'i las las rnam par smin pa 'byung bar
translated: Likewise, having ripened, it is not known to ripen again.🔽Even though it is the same in being nonexistent, not everything appears.

original: mi 'gyur ro //🔽de nyid 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mi 'gyur ro // de nyid 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Even though the nature of karma is the same in being destroyed, whether it is ripened or not ripened, the karma that has ripened does not give rise to a ripened effect again.🔽In order to teach just that with an example, it is said:

original: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: For example,🔽it is said: “The ripened effect will definitely occur.”

original: rnam par smin pa nges par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yang rnam par smin pa'i nus pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa nges par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yang rnam par smin pa'i nus pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the potency of the ripened effect is not present again,

original: rnam par smin pa lan gcig 'byin pa la nges par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa lan gcig 'byin pa la nges par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: the ripened effect will definitely occur once.

original: dpe 'dis zhes bya ba ni rab rib can gyi dpe'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: dpe 'dis zhes bya ba ni rab rib can gyi dpe'i sgo nas so //
translated: This example means by way of the example of the one with eye disease.

original: las rnams ma nges pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa la lan gcig 'byin pa la nges pa'o //
analyzed: las rnams ma nges pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa la lan gcig 'byin pa la nges pa'o //
translated: Karma is not indeterminate means that it is definite in bringing about its ripening once.

original: rnam par smin pa yang nges pa yin no zhes bya ba ni dge ba las rnam par smin pa yid du 'ong ba'i mtshan nyid can nyid dang / mi dge ba'i las yid du mi 'ong ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi rnam par smin pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa yang nges pa yin no zhes bya ba ni dge ba las rnam par smin pa yid du 'ong ba'i mtshan nyid can nyid dang / mi dge ba'i las yid du mi 'ong ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi rnam par smin pa nyid do //
translated: Ripening is also definite means that the ripening of virtuous karma is characterized by being pleasant, and the ripening of non-virtuous karma is characterized by being unpleasant.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba na ra ba'i ba can gyi dpes so //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba na ra ba'i ba can gyi dpes so //
translated: Therefore means by the example of the one with eye disease.

original: @165b nag po las zhes bya ba ni mi dge ba'i mtshan nyid can las so //
analyzed: @165b nag po las zhes bya ba ni mi dge ba'i mtshan nyid can las so //
translated: From black means from karma characterized by non-virtue.

original: rnam smin mi dge ba zhes bya ba ni ngan 'gror yid du mi 'ong ba'i rnam par smin pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: rnam smin mi dge ba zhes bya ba ni ngan 'gror yid du mi 'ong ba'i rnam par smin pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: Unpleasant ripening means characterized by unpleasant ripening in the lower realms.

original: rnam smin dge ba nyid ces bya ba ni bde 'gror yid du 'ong ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi rnam par smin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam smin dge ba nyid ces bya ba ni bde 'gror yid du 'ong ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi rnam par smin pa'o //
translated: Pleasant ripening means characterized by pleasant ripening in the higher realms.

original: dge las zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i mtshan nyid can las so //
analyzed: dge las zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i mtshan nyid can las so //
translated: The phrase “from virtuous actions” refers to actions that have the nature of virtue.

original: mthong zhes bya ba ni lung gi sgo nas khong du chud pa'o //
analyzed: mthong zhes bya ba ni lung gi sgo nas khong du chud pa'o //
translated: The phrase “one sees” means that one understands through scripture.

original: dge mi dge med blo can thal 'gyur te //🔽zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad rang bzhin med par yongs su shes pa'i sgo nas dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge mi dge med blo can thal 'gyur te // zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad rang bzhin med par yongs su shes pa'i sgo nas dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi thar pa thob par 'gyur ba'o // las 'bras rnams la sems pa'ang dgag par mdzad //

original: ces bya ba ni gang gi phyir skra shad la sogs pa'i dpe'i sgo nas las dang 'bras bu ma nges pa de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis ci'i phyir las 'di la 'bras bu 'di skye bar 'gyur ba yin zhes bya ba'i sems pa dgag par mdzad pa yin
analyzed: ces bya ba ni gang gi phyir skra shad la sogs pa'i dpe'i sgo nas las dang 'bras bu ma nges pa de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis ci'i phyir las 'di la 'bras bu 'di skye bar 'gyur ba yin zhes bya ba'i sems pa dgag par mdzad pa yin
translated: The phrase “one who has the thought that virtue and nonvirtue do not exist” refers to the one who has the thought that virtue and nonvirtue do not exist.

original: te / nor bu dang sngags dang sman la sogs pa'i nus pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin no zhes bya ba'i rigs pas so //
analyzed: te / nor bu dang sngags dang sman la sogs pa'i nus pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin no zhes bya ba'i rigs pas so //
translated: It is like the inconceivable power of jewels, spells, medicine, and so on.

original: de nyid 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that,

original: gal te yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
