translated: he says, “Even though” and so on.

original: ci'i phyir nges she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir nges she na /
translated: Why is it certain?

original: de lta na'ang skra shad la sogs pa mthong ba nges pa de nyid kyi phyir na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de lta na'ang skra shad la sogs pa mthong ba nges pa de nyid kyi phyir na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Because of the certainty of the perception of floating hair and so on.

original: las kyi 'bras bu rnams la sems pa de bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung gang gi sgo nas dgag pa mdzad ce na /
analyzed: las kyi 'bras bu rnams la sems pa de bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung gang gi sgo nas dgag pa mdzad ce na /
translated: With regard to the fruits of karma, what is the teaching of the Bhagavat that refutes the thought of them?

original: las rnams kyi rnam par smin pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab po zhes gsungs pas so //
analyzed: las rnams kyi rnam par smin pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab po zhes gsungs pas so //
translated: It is the statement, “The ripening of karma is inconceivable.”

original: gal te dpyad par gyur na kun rdzob kyi bden pa nyams par 'gyur ro zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te dpyad par gyur na kun rdzob kyi bden pa nyams par 'gyur ro zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that if one analyzes, conventional truth is undermined,

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “For that very reason” and so on.

original: rgyu 'di las 'bras bu 'di skye'o zhes bya ba ni mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag gi khong du chud pa yin la /
analyzed: rgyu 'di las 'bras bu 'di skye'o zhes bya ba ni mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag gi khong du chud pa yin la /
translated: The statement “this effect arises from this cause” is understood through direct perception and non-apprehension.🔽If karma and its effect are never seen by one who sees only the present, then how could karma and its effect be established?🔽If one analyzes and investigates in this way, one will come to have the view of annihilation.

original: las dang 'bras bu dag ni tshu rol mthong na dus nam yang mthong ba med pa'i phyir las dang 'bras bu dag ci ltar 'grub par 'gyur zhing zhes brtag cing dpyad na chad par lta bar 'gyur bas chad ba med pa'i 'khor ba'i rgyun gyi mtshan nyid can
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu dag ni tshu rol mthong na dus nam yang mthong ba med pa'i phyir las dang 'bras bu dag ci ltar 'grub par 'gyur zhing zhes brtag cing dpyad na chad par lta bar 'gyur bas chad ba med pa'i 'khor ba'i rgyun gyi mtshan nyid can
translated: Therefore, the continuum of cyclic existence, which is characterized by the absence of annihilation,

original: gyi kun rdzob kyi bden pa 'jig par 'gyur @166a * //
analyzed: gyi kun rdzob kyi bden pa 'jig par 'gyur @166a * //
translated: would be destroyed.

original: du 'ong bas bcom ldan 'das kyis las dang las kyi rnam par smin pa la sems pa dgag par mdzad do //🔽gal te de ni sems tsam pa'i rgol ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: du 'ong bas bcom ldan 'das kyis las dang las kyi rnam par smin pa la sems pa dgag par mdzad do // gal te de ni sems tsam pa'i rgol ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, the Bhagavān refutes the idea that karma and the ripening of karma exist.🔽If one says this, in order to demonstrate the opponent’s view,

original: gal te de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsung te /
analyzed: gal te de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsung te /
translated: the root text states, “If you say that . . .”

original: las rnams kyi 'bras bu dang 'brel pa rnam par gzhag na zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med pa yin yang las rnams rang bzhin med pas kun rdzob tu las zhig tu zin kyang las 'bras bu 'byin pa'i rnam par gzhag pa byed na'o
analyzed: las rnams kyi 'bras bu dang 'brel pa rnam par gzhag na zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med pa yin yang las rnams rang bzhin med pas kun rdzob tu las zhig tu zin kyang las 'bras bu 'byin pa'i rnam par gzhag pa byed na'o
translated: Even though the action is destroyed, one can posit that the action produces a result.

original: // chos mtha' yas pa'i nus pa'i khyad par gyi gzhi zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: // chos mtha' yas pa'i nus pa'i khyad par gyi gzhi zhes bya ba la /
translated: The basis of the special potency of limitless phenomena

original: chos mtha' yas te sngon po dang ser po la sogs par snang ba'i shes pa rnams so //
analyzed: chos mtha' yas te sngon po dang ser po la sogs par snang ba'i shes pa rnams so //
translated: means that limitless phenomena are the consciousnesses that appear as blue, yellow, and so on.

original: de rnams kyi nus pa ni bag chags te /
analyzed: de rnams kyi nus pa ni bag chags te /
translated: Their potency is habitual propensities.

original: dper na til me tog dang nye ba las dri 'byung ba de bzhin du sngon po la sogs pa'i shes pa rnams kyi kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la bag chags bsgos pa'o //
analyzed: dper na til me tog dang nye ba las dri 'byung ba de bzhin du sngon po la sogs pa'i shes pa rnams kyi kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la bag chags bsgos pa'o //
translated: For example, just as smell arises from the proximity of a flower and sesame seed, so the foundation consciousness is infused with habitual propensities from the consciousnesses of blue and so on.

original: bag chags de rnams kyi gzhi ste rten no //
analyzed: bag chags de rnams kyi gzhi ste rten no //
translated: The basis of those habitual propensities is their support.

original: de'i phyir sa bon thams cad pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir sa bon thams cad pa ste /
translated: Therefore it is the seed of everything.

original: shes pa thams cad kyi rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shes pa thams cad kyi rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is the cause of all consciousnesses.

original: de la dpe bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la dpe bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate an example of that,

original: rlabs rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsung so //
analyzed: rlabs rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsung so //
translated: [the root text] states, “like waves in an ocean,” and so on.

original: dngos po thams cad skye ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni sngon por snang ba'i shes pa skye ba la sogs pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: dngos po thams cad skye ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni sngon por snang ba'i shes pa skye ba la sogs pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: The meaning of “the cause of the arising of all things” is because it is the cause of the arising of a consciousness that appears as blue, and so on.

original: /'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa la sogs pa rnams la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: /'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa la sogs pa rnams la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: [The root text] states, “in the noble Ascent onto Lanka, and so on.”

original: kun gzhi rnam shes zab cing cha phra la //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam shes zab cing cha phra la //
translated: The foundation consciousness is profound and subtle,

original: sa bon thams cad chu po'i rgyun bzhin 'bab //
analyzed: sa bon thams cad chu po'i rgyun bzhin 'bab //
translated: with all seeds flowing like a river current.

original: bdag tu yongs su rtog par 'gyur snyam nas //
analyzed: bdag tu yongs su rtog par 'gyur snyam nas //
translated: Thinking that it would be imagined to be a self,

original: byis pa rnams la bdag gis 'di ma bstan //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: byis pa rnams la bdag gis 'di ma bstan // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: I have not taught this to the childish.

original: rnam pa thams cad du med pa zhig gam zhes bya ba ni gtan med pa yin nam zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du med pa zhig gam zhes bya ba ni gtan med pa yin nam zhes pa'o //
translated: [The root text] states, “in every way, it does not exist,” meaning that it is utterly nonexistent.

original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the response to that,🔽[the root text] states, “it is not the case that it does not exist at all.”

original: de ltar ni ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar ni ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is not like that, etc.

original: de ltar ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni med pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni med pa ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not like that means it is not nonexistent.

original: 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs pa'i dbang gis yod pa nyid du gsungs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs pa'i dbang gis yod pa nyid du gsungs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: However, the Bhagavān has said that it exists by the power of intention.🔽That is taught in order to show that to disciples.

original: de skad du nye bar bstan pas gdul bya rnams la de yod pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yod par bstan pas gdul bya'i skye bo rnams la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yod pa nyid du @166b🔽bstan pas so //
analyzed: de skad du nye bar bstan pas gdul bya rnams la de yod pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yod par bstan pas gdul bya'i skye bo rnams la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yod pa nyid du @166b bstan pas so //
translated: In order to show that the foundation consciousness exists, the Bhagavān has said that the foundation consciousness exists to disciples.🔽In order to show that the foundation consciousness exists, the Bhagavān has said that the foundation consciousness exists to disciples.

original: don dam par ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba stong pa nyid kho na la brjod pa yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam par ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba stong pa nyid kho na la brjod pa yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that ultimately the so-called foundation consciousness is just emptiness,

original: dngos po thams cad kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says all things, etc.

original: dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin rjes su zhugs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin rjes su zhugs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir /
translated: Because it is the nature of all things.

original: bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pas dngos po stong pa nyid kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir stong pa nyid kho na kun gzhi yin la de nyid rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: bdag las ma yin gzhan las min // zhes bya ba la sogs pas dngos po stong pa nyid kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir stong pa nyid kho na kun gzhi yin la de nyid rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: Because of such statements as “not from itself, not from another,”🔽emptiness alone is the foundation consciousness, and it is consciousness.

original: chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i sbyor bas yongs su shes pa'i phyir des na stong pa nyid la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i sgras bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i sbyor bas yongs su shes pa'i phyir des na stong pa nyid la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i sgras bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: Because it fully knows all phenomena through the application of non-observation, therefore emptiness should be understood to be indicated by the term foundation consciousness.

original: ci ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dgongs pa'i dbang gis gsungs pa de bzhin du gang zag kyang dgongs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas yod par gsungs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ci ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dgongs pa'i dbang gis gsungs pa de bzhin du gang zag kyang dgongs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas yod par gsungs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Just as the Bhagavān spoke of foundation consciousness from the perspective of his intention, in the same way, he spoke of the person as existing from the perspective of his intention.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he said, “Foundation consciousness,” and so on.

original: des gdul bya'i skye bo la zhes bya ba ni gang zag gi sgo nas gdul bya'i skye bo rnams la'o //🔽de yod pa nyid du bstan pas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: des gdul bya'i skye bo la zhes bya ba ni gang zag gi sgo nas gdul bya'i skye bo rnams la'o // de yod pa nyid du bstan pas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “To the beings who are to be disciplined” means to the beings who are to be disciplined from the point of view of the individual.

original: gang zag yod pa nyid du bstan pas so //
analyzed: gang zag yod pa nyid du bstan pas so //
translated: “By teaching its existence” means by teaching the existence of the person.

original: rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni phyis 'chad par 'gyur ba'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni phyis 'chad par 'gyur ba'i sgo nas so //
translated: “Because they are led” means because they are led by the method that will be explained later.

original: gang zag yod pa nyid du gsungs so zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gang zag yod pa nyid du gsungs so zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the existence of the person is taught,

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽'ga' zhig la gang zag bkag nas phung po tsam zhig bstan par mdzad do zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / 'ga' zhig la gang zag bkag nas phung po tsam zhig bstan par mdzad do zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: he says, “As it is said. . . .”🔽In order to demonstrate that in some places the person is refuted and only the aggregates are taught,

original: kha cig la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽nyan thos kha cig la ni sems zhes bya ba'am /🔽yid ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: kha cig la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / nyan thos kha cig la ni sems zhes bya ba'am / yid ces bya ba'am /
translated: he says, “To some he teaches. . . .”

original: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs yin te /
translated: To some śrāvakas he teaches that “mind,” “thought,” and “consciousness” are synonyms.

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: As it is said:

original: sems dang yid dang rnam par shes //
analyzed: sems dang yid dang rnam par shes //
translated: Mind, thought, and consciousness,

original: de dag don nyid gcig pa nyid //🔽ces gsungs pas so //
analyzed: de dag don nyid gcig pa nyid // ces gsungs pas so //
translated: They have the same meaning.

original: sems tsam pa rnams na re sems ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yin la /
analyzed: sems tsam pa rnams na re sems ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yin la /
translated: The Cittamātrins say that mind is the foundation consciousness,

original: yid ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid yin la /
analyzed: yid ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid yin la /
translated: thought is the afflicted mind,

original: rnam par shes pa ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa tshogs drug ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa tshogs drug ste /
translated: and consciousness is the six collections of operative consciousnesses.

original: tha dad par 'dod la de dgag pa'i ched du don gcig ces brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: tha dad par 'dod la de dgag pa'i ched du don gcig ces brjod pa yin no //
translated: They assert that these are different, and the word “same” is used to refute that.

original: dad pa dang tshul khrims zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /🔽sogs pa'i sgras thos pa la @167a * //
analyzed: dad pa dang tshul khrims zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / sogs pa'i sgras thos pa la @167a * //
translated: Faith, morality, and so on.

original: sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The word “and so on” includes learning and so on.

original: gong du 'gro ba na zhes bya ba ni bstan pa na'o //🔽phyi ma la mtho ris su 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bshad pa ste /
analyzed: gong du 'gro ba na zhes bya ba ni bstan pa na'o // phyi ma la mtho ris su 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bshad pa ste /
translated: “Going higher” is teaching.🔽“One will go to a higher rebirth in the future” is explaining.

original: 'chi 'phos nas ma 'ongs pa'i dus su mtho ris su 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'chi 'phos nas ma 'ongs pa'i dus su mtho ris su 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means that after death one will go to a higher rebirth in the future.

original: da ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag dgongs pa can nyid du gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag dgongs pa can nyid du gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to clarify that the statements about the foundation consciousness, etc. are intentional,

original: 'di dag thams cad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “All of these,” etc.

original: 'di dag thams cad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang / gang zag dang / phung po rnams so //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang / gang zag dang / phung po rnams so //
translated: “All of these” refers to the foundation consciousness, the person, and the aggregates.

original: dgongs pa dngos bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dgongs pa dngos bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the actual intention,

original: brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “It should be stated,” etc.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Thus” refers to

original: bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //
analyzed: bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //
translated: “not from self, not from other,” etc.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgo nas rnam par shes pa tsam gyis kyang stong pa gdod ma nas skye ba med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgo nas rnam par shes pa tsam gyis kyang stong pa gdod ma nas skye ba med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that consciousness-only is also empty, primordially unborn.

original: de la'o zhes bya ba ni chos zab mo khong du chud par mi 'gyur ba las so //
analyzed: de la'o zhes bya ba ni chos zab mo khong du chud par mi 'gyur ba las so //
translated: “In that” refers to the fact that one will not understand the profound teaching.

original: 'ba' zhig nyid ces bya ba ni gang zag dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig nyid ces bya ba ni gang zag dang bral ba'o //
translated: “Only” means free from the person.

original: de nyid 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: in order to teach just that, the commentary says:

original: gdul bya gang dag ces bya ba la sog pa gsung te /
analyzed: gdul bya gang dag ces bya ba la sog pa gsung te /
translated: “Those disciples who…” and so on.

original: gdul bya gang dag ces bya ba ni mu stegs kyi lta ba la lhag par goms par bya ba'o //
analyzed: gdul bya gang dag ces bya ba ni mu stegs kyi lta ba la lhag par goms par bya ba'o //
translated: “Those disciples” refers to those who are accustomed to the tīrthika views.

original: chos nyid zab mo zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i mtha' bzhi dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: chos nyid zab mo zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i mtha' bzhi dang bral ba'o //
translated: “The profound reality” is free from the four extremes of existence, nonexistence, and so on.

original: 'jug par mi nus shing zhes bya ba ni dus yun ring por mu stegs kyi lta ba la goms par byas pas stong pa nyid lhag par mos par mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug par mi nus shing zhes bya ba ni dus yun ring por mu stegs kyi lta ba la goms par byas pas stong pa nyid lhag par mos par mi nus pa'o //
translated: “Are unable to engage” means that due to being accustomed to the tīrthika views for a long time, they are unable to have special interest in emptiness.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dus yun ring por mu stegs kyi lta ba la goms par byas pas zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dus yun ring por mu stegs kyi lta ba la goms par byas pas zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: For that very reason, it says, “due to being accustomed to the tīrthika views for a long time.”

original: bdag 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sngar bstan pa'i rnam pas chos nyid stong pa nyid thos ris chos nyid stong pa nyid de la gdod ma nas skye ba med pa'i don khong du ma chud pas thar pa thob pa'i dus na
analyzed: bdag 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sngar bstan pa'i rnam pas chos nyid stong pa nyid thos ris chos nyid stong pa nyid de la gdod ma nas skye ba med pa'i don khong du ma chud pas thar pa thob pa'i dus na
translated: The words I will not arise and so on are for those who, as previously explained, have not understood the meaning of primordial non-arising in the emptiness of reality, which is heard as the reality of emptiness.

original: thams cad med par 'gyur ro snyam nas stong pa nyid kyi don khong du chud nas bdag med par 'gyur ro zhes skrag pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: thams cad med par 'gyur ro snyam nas stong pa nyid kyi don khong du chud nas bdag med par 'gyur ro zhes skrag pa rnams la'o //
translated: Thinking that at the time of attaining liberation, everything will become non-existent, they are afraid that emptiness will become non-existent.

original: thog ma kho nar ston pa'i nye bar bstan pa la /
analyzed: thog ma kho nar ston pa'i nye bar bstan pa la /
translated: At the very beginning, regarding the teacher's instruction,

original: g-yang sa dang 'dra bar sems pa zhes bya ba ni gang zag yod pa la sogs par bstan pa'i sgo nas @167b rung ba nyid ma mdzad par dbu ma'i don bstan par 'gyur na chad pa'i lta bar ltung bas g-yang sa dang 'dra bar sems pa'o //
analyzed: g-yang sa dang 'dra bar sems pa zhes bya ba ni gang zag yod pa la sogs par bstan pa'i sgo nas @167b rung ba nyid ma mdzad par dbu ma'i don bstan par 'gyur na chad pa'i lta bar ltung bas g-yang sa dang 'dra bar sems pa'o //
translated: it says thinking of it as a precipice. If the meaning of the middle way were taught through the presentation of the existence of the person and so on, it would be like a precipice, because one would fall into the view of annihilation.

original: de la rgyab kyis phyogs pa zhes bya ba ni chos zab mo la phyir phyogs pas so //
analyzed: de la rgyab kyis phyogs pa zhes bya ba ni chos zab mo la phyir phyogs pas so //
translated: Regarding that, it says turning their backs on it, because they turn away from the profound Dharma.

original: don chen po sgrub par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid la phyin ci log tu mngon par zhen pa de rnams dmyal ba la sogs par ltung bas don chen po sangs rgyas nyid sgrub par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: don chen po sgrub par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid la phyin ci log tu mngon par zhen pa de rnams dmyal ba la sogs par ltung bas don chen po sangs rgyas nyid sgrub par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: “It would not accomplish a great purpose” means that those who are attached to emptiness in a distorted way would fall into the hells and so forth, and would not accomplish the great purpose of buddhahood.

original: don med pa kho na 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: don med pa kho na 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: The meaning is that they would only accomplish a meaningless purpose.

original: dus yun ring po nas bdag la lhag par mngon par zhen pa rnams la de dang rjes su mthun par bstan pa'i sgo nas bstan pa la gzhug par nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus yun ring po nas bdag la lhag par mngon par zhen pa rnams la de dang rjes su mthun par bstan pa'i sgo nas bstan pa la gzhug par nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those who have been attached to a self for a long time can be led to the teaching through a teaching that is in accordance with that.

original: de ltar thog mar stong pa nyid bstan pa la don med par 'gyur bar 'gyur ba yin no zhes bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar thog mar stong pa nyid bstan pa la don med par 'gyur bar 'gyur ba yin no zhes bstan nas /
translated: Thus, it is shown that at first, the teaching of emptiness would be meaningless.

original: da ni ches thog mar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa bstan na don chen po 'dren par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni ches thog mar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa bstan na don chen po 'dren par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to show that if the foundation consciousness and so forth are taught at first, a great purpose is served,

original: ches thog mar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ches thog mar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “If the foundation consciousness and so forth,” and so on.

original: ches thog mar zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid ston pa'i thog mar ro //
analyzed: ches thog mar zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid ston pa'i thog mar ro //
translated: “At the very outset” means at the very beginning of the teaching of emptiness.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa bstan pas ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni gang zag la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa bstan pas ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni gang zag la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: “By the teaching of the store-consciousness, etc.” The “etc.” includes the teaching of the person, etc.

original: mu stegs kyi lugs bsal bas zhes bya ba ni bdag la mngon par zhen pa bzlog nas so //
analyzed: mu stegs kyi lugs bsal bas zhes bya ba ni bdag la mngon par zhen pa bzlog nas so //
translated: “By the elimination of the tīrthika system” means by the elimination of the attachment to a self.

original: de dag gi don chen po 'dren par 'gyur zhing zhes bya ba ni gzung ba'i don la mngon par zhen pa la sogs pa bzlog pas chos bstan pa de 'bras bu sangs rgyas kyi rgyur 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: de dag gi don chen po 'dren par 'gyur zhing zhes bya ba ni gzung ba'i don la mngon par zhen pa la sogs pa bzlog pas chos bstan pa de 'bras bu sangs rgyas kyi rgyur 'gyur bas so //
translated: “It leads to the great goal” means that the teaching of the Dharma, by eliminating the attachment to the object of the grasping subject, etc., becomes the cause of Buddhahood, the result.

original: 'di ltar mu stegs pas 'jig rten 'di nas 'jig rten pa rol tu 'gro ba dang bcings pa grol ba'i rten du gyur pa'i bdag rtag pa khas len par byed la /
analyzed: 'di ltar mu stegs pas 'jig rten 'di nas 'jig rten pa rol tu 'gro ba dang bcings pa grol ba'i rten du gyur pa'i bdag rtag pa khas len par byed la /
translated: Thus, the tīrthikas accept a permanent self as the support for the transmigration of the world from this world to the next world and for the liberation of the bound soul.

original: de dang rjes su mthun pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gsungs pa la gang gi phyir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de yang 'jig rten 'di nas 'jig rten pha rol du 'gro ba dang bcings pa grol ba'i rten du gyur pa yin te ;
analyzed: de dang rjes su mthun pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gsungs pa la gang gi phyir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de yang 'jig rten 'di nas 'jig rten pha rol du 'gro ba dang bcings pa grol ba'i rten du gyur pa yin te ;
translated: The foundation consciousness that is consistent with that is taught to be the support for going from this world to the next world and for being bound and liberated.

original: 'di ltar ci srid du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la nyon mongs pa'i bag chags 'jug pa de srid du bcings pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar ci srid du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la nyon mongs pa'i bag chags 'jug pa de srid du bcings pa yin la /
translated: As long as the latent propensities of affliction enter the foundation consciousness, it is bound.

original: gang gi tshe lam bsgoms pas nyon mongs pa'i bag chags log pa de'i tshe rten yongs su gyur pas grol pa nyid do //🔽'on kyang khyad par ni bdag ni rtag pa yin la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe lam bsgoms pas nyon mongs pa'i bag chags log pa de'i tshe rten yongs su gyur pas grol pa nyid do // 'on kyang khyad par ni bdag ni rtag pa yin la /
translated: When the latent propensities of affliction are reversed through cultivating the path, it is liberated through the transformation of the support.
However, the difference is that the self is permanent,

original: gzhi rnam par shes pa ni mi rtag pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhi rnam par shes pa ni mi rtag pa yin no //
translated: but the foundation consciousness is impermanent.

original: de ltar na yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gsungs pas bdag la mngon par zhen pa ldog par 'gyur ba dang / kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gsungs pas phyi rol gyi don la mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir phyi rol gyi don la mngon par zhen pa yang ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gsungs pas bdag la mngon par zhen pa ldog par 'gyur ba dang / kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gsungs pas phyi rol gyi don la mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir phyi rol gyi don la mngon par zhen pa yang ldog pa yin no //
translated: Thus, by teaching the foundation consciousness, attachment to a self is eliminated, and attachment to external objects is eliminated because of the non-existence of attachment to external objects due to the teaching of the foundation consciousness.

original: des na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa bstan pas don chen po 'dren par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: des na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa bstan pas don chen po 'dren par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the teaching of the foundation consciousness leads to a great purpose.

original: phyi nas zhes bya ba 'dis ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi nas zhes bya ba 'dis ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: After that refers to the teaching of the foundation consciousness.

original: gsung rab kyi don phyin ci ma log pa rig pa rnams zhes bya ba ni bdag las ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i don yang stong pa nyid khong du chud pas so //
analyzed: gsung rab kyi don phyin ci ma log pa rig pa rnams zhes bya ba ni bdag las ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i don yang stong pa nyid khong du chud pas so //
translated: Those who know the meaning of the scriptures without error refers to those who understand the meaning of the foundation consciousness and so on through their understanding of emptiness.

original: de dag spong bar 'gyur bas zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnams kyang 'dor bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: de dag spong bar 'gyur bas zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnams kyang 'dor bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: Since those are abandoned means since the foundation consciousness and so on are also abandoned.

original: yon tan kho na 'byung gi zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gsungs pas bstan pa la 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi yon tan kho na 'byung bas skyon med do //
analyzed: yon tan kho na 'byung gi zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gsungs pas bstan pa la 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi yon tan kho na 'byung bas skyon med do //
translated: Only good qualities arise means that since only good qualities arise that are characterized by entry into the teaching, there is no fault in teaching the foundation consciousness.

original: ji skad du 'phags pa'i lhas zhes bya ba ni bzhi brgya pa las so //
analyzed: ji skad du 'phags pa'i lhas zhes bya ba ni bzhi brgya pa las so //
translated: As it is said by Āryadeva means in the Catuḥśataka.

original: gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa ni phan pa ston pa na yang gzhan gyi bsam pa sum ma phyung bar dang ba 'phel bar byed pa'i gzhan gyi bsam pa'i rjes su 'jug pa de ni bstan par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa ni phan pa ston pa na yang gzhan gyi bsam pa sum ma phyung bar dang ba 'phel bar byed pa'i gzhan gyi bsam pa'i rjes su 'jug pa de ni bstan par bya ba yin te /
translated: One who and so on means that when one teaches what is beneficial, one should teach with a mind that is clear and that increases the other's faith without revealing one's own thoughts.

original: 'di ltar ser sna can la sbyin pa gtong ba'i gtam dang / tshul khrims 'chad pa la tshul khrims kyi gtam dang / khro ba dang ldan pa la bzod pa'i gtam gyis dga' bar mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar ser sna can la sbyin pa gtong ba'i gtam dang / tshul khrims 'chad pa la tshul khrims kyi gtam dang / khro ba dang ldan pa la bzod pa'i gtam gyis dga' bar mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: Thus, a miser does not become pleased by a discourse on generosity, one who is not moral does not become pleased by a discourse on moral discipline, and one who is angry does not become pleased by a discourse on patience.

original: 'on kyang longs spyod 'dod pa la sbyin pa'i gtam dang / mtho ris 'dod pa la tshul khrims kyi gtam dang / gzugs bzang bar 'dod pa la bzod pa'i gtam gyis dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang longs spyod 'dod pa la sbyin pa'i gtam dang / mtho ris 'dod pa la tshul khrims kyi gtam dang / gzugs bzang bar 'dod pa la bzod pa'i gtam gyis dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: However, one who desires wealth becomes pleased by a discourse on generosity, one who desires high status becomes pleased by a discourse on moral discipline, and one who desires a good physical form becomes pleased by a discourse on patience.

original: de lta bu la sogs pa'i gtam dang por bstan nas /
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa'i gtam dang por bstan nas /
translated: Having first taught such discourses,

original: phyis snod du gyur par khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: phyis snod du gyur par khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: one should later make them understand that they are vessels

original: zab mo'i gtam brjod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: zab mo'i gtam brjod par bya dgos so //
translated: and one should express the profound discourses.

original: dang po nyid du mi mthun pa'i gtam gyis sun phyung nas de las phyir log cing phan pa bstan pa'i don du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dang po nyid du mi mthun pa'i gtam gyis sun phyung nas de las phyir log cing phan pa bstan pa'i don du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one first expresses discourses that are not suitable, one will be repulsed and it will not be beneficial to teach them.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bzhi brgya pa las /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bzhi brgya pa las /
translated: For this reason, Aryadeva says in the Catuhfi saka:

original: dang po bsod nams min las bzlog / bar du bdag las bzlog pa dang // phyis ni thams cad las bzlog pa //
analyzed: dang po bsod nams min las bzlog / bar du bdag las bzlog pa dang // phyis ni thams cad las bzlog pa //
translated: In the end, it is the opposite of everything.

original: gang gis @168b de shes blo ldan yin //
analyzed: gang gis @168b de shes blo ldan yin //
translated: Whoever knows this is wise.

original: dman pa rnams la sbyin pa brjod //🔽bar ma la ni tshul khrims brjod //
analyzed: dman pa rnams la sbyin pa brjod // bar ma la ni tshul khrims brjod //
translated: For the inferior, giving is taught.🔽For the middling, ethics is taught.

original: mchog tu gyur la zhi ba brjod //
analyzed: mchog tu gyur la zhi ba brjod //
translated: For the best, peace is taught.

original: de gsungs rtag tu mchog tu 'gyur //
analyzed: de gsungs rtag tu mchog tu 'gyur //
translated: That is always taught as the best.

original: zhes gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang /🔽bsod nams 'dod pas stong pa nyid //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang / bsod nams 'dod pas stong pa nyid //
translated: And also:🔽Those who desire merit

original: rnam pa kun du brjod mi bya //🔽gang phyir gnas min pa la sman //🔽byin na dug tu 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: rnam pa kun du brjod mi bya // gang phyir gnas min pa la sman // byin na dug tu 'gyur ba yin //
translated: should not speak of emptiness in any way.🔽Because if medicine is given to the wrong person,

original: zhes gsungs so //🔽gdul bya rnams gzhug pa'i don du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnams yod pa nyid du gsungs pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: zhes gsungs so // gdul bya rnams gzhug pa'i don du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnams yod pa nyid du gsungs pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: it becomes poison.🔽Not only is the foundation consciousness taught to exist for the purpose of introducing trainees, but also all things are taught to exist.

original: 'on kyang dngos po thams cad yod pa nyid du gsungs pa yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on kyang dngos po thams cad yod pa nyid du gsungs pa yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says:

original: gzhug par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhug par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The statement “in order to introduce” and so on.

original: gzhug par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mu stegs pa rnam bstan pa la gzhug pa'i ched du'o //
analyzed: gzhug par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mu stegs pa rnam bstan pa la gzhug pa'i ched du'o //
translated: “In order to introduce” means in order to introduce the tīrthikas to the teaching.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang bral yang zhes bya ba ni bdag dang bdag gir lta ba dang bral du zin kyang /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang bral yang zhes bya ba ni bdag dang bdag gir lta ba dang bral du zin kyang /
translated: “Even though they are free from the view of the transitory collection” means that they are free from the view of the self and mine.

original: nga dang nga'i bstan pa ltar zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe de'i dus na che ge mo zhig tu 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / nga mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'og tu nga'i bstan pa dus 'di srid gcig tu gnas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa bdag dang bdag gir lta ba'i sgo nas chos ci ltar bstan pa de bzhin du rang bzhin med pa'i dngos po rnams yod ces bstan par
analyzed: nga dang nga'i bstan pa ltar zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe de'i dus na che ge mo zhig tu 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / nga mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'og tu nga'i bstan pa dus 'di srid gcig tu gnas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa bdag dang bdag gir lta ba'i sgo nas chos ci ltar bstan pa de bzhin du rang bzhin med pa'i dngos po rnams yod ces bstan par
translated: “In accordance with the teaching of I and mine” means that he taught things that lack intrinsic existence to exist in accordance with the way that the self and mine are taught through the view of the self and mine, such as “At that time, at that period of time, I was known as so and so,” and “After I pass into nirvana, my teaching will remain for this length of time.”

original: mdzad pa ni drang ba'i don du ste /
analyzed: mdzad pa ni drang ba'i don du ste /
translated: He did this in order to lead them to the teaching.

original: dngos po la bden par zhen pa'i 'jig rten pa rnams dbu ma la 'jug par bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: dngos po la bden par zhen pa'i 'jig rten pa rnams dbu ma la 'jug par bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: In order to introduce worldly people who are attached to the reality of things to the Middle Way.🔽Therefore, in the Catuh-s-t

original: de nyid kyi phyir bzhi brgya pa las /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bzhi brgya pa las /
translated: , it is said:

original: de nyid tshol ba rnams la ni //
analyzed: de nyid tshol ba rnams la ni //
translated: For those who seek reality,

original: thog mar thams cad yod ces bstan //
analyzed: thog mar thams cad yod ces bstan //
translated: it is taught that everything exists in the beginning.

original: phyi nas don rnams rtogs pa la ;🔽/ som nyi med la dben pa nyid //
analyzed: phyi nas don rnams rtogs pa la ; / som nyi med la dben pa nyid //
translated: Later, when they understand the meaning,

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: they are free from doubt.

original: de nyid 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that very thing,

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said: The view of the transitory collection, etc.

original: mtha' dag ces bya ba ni bag chags dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: mtha' dag ces bya ba ni bag chags dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Everything means together with the habitual tendencies.

original: nga dang nga'i sgo nas gsungs pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: nga dang nga'i sgo nas gsungs pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it said from the point of view of I and mine?

original: nga dang nga'i zhes bsnyad pa 'jig rten gyi khong du chud pa'i thabs yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: nga dang nga'i zhes bsnyad pa 'jig rten gyi khong du chud pa'i thabs yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said: Because the expression I and mine is the means of understanding the world.

original: sngon gyi skyes rabs la sogs pa'i gtam khong du chud pa'i thabs yin no //
analyzed: sngon gyi skyes rabs la sogs pa'i gtam khong du chud pa'i thabs yin no //
translated: It is the means of understanding the stories of former lives, etc.

original: de yod pa nyid nye bar bstan pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de yod pa nyid nye bar bstan pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase “the reality of existence is revealed”

original: dngos po thams cad yod pa nyid nye bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad yod pa nyid nye bar bstan pa'o //
translated: means that the reality of all things is revealed.

original: 'jig rten gyis khong du chud pa'i thabs @169a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyis khong du chud pa'i thabs @169a * //
translated: Because it is a means of understanding for the world.

original: yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa rnams kyis stong pa nyid khong du chud pa'i thabs yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa rnams kyis stong pa nyid khong du chud pa'i thabs yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is a means of understanding emptiness for worldly people.

original: 'di ltar phung po dang khams la sogs pa bstan nas bdag tu 'dzin pa ldog pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar phung po dang khams la sogs pa bstan nas bdag tu 'dzin pa ldog pa yin te /
translated: In this way, after the aggregates, elements, etc., are taught, the grasping of a self is eliminated.

original: phung po rnams kho na yod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: phung po rnams kho na yod pa yin gyi /
translated: Only the aggregates exist.

original: 'dir bdag ni 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin no snyam du bdag tu 'dzin pa ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir bdag ni 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin no snyam du bdag tu 'dzin pa ldog pa yin no //
translated: The thought that “here, there is no self at all” eliminates the grasping of a self.

original: gang gi tshe bdag tu 'dzin pa log pa de'i tshe phyi rol gyi don la mngon par zhen pa bzlog pa'i don du kye rgyal ba'i sras dag khams gsum pa 'di dag ni sems tsam mo zhes sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis sems tsam du bka' stsal
analyzed: gang gi tshe bdag tu 'dzin pa log pa de'i tshe phyi rol gyi don la mngon par zhen pa bzlog pa'i don du kye rgyal ba'i sras dag khams gsum pa 'di dag ni sems tsam mo zhes sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis sems tsam du bka' stsal
translated: When the conception of self is reversed, then in order to reverse attachment to external objects, the Buddhas, the Transcendent Destroyers and Possessors, say, “Oh, sons of the Conqueror, these three worlds are mind only.”

original: to ; / gang gi tshe phyi rol gyi don la zhen pa log pa de'i tshe rnam par shes pa tsam yod pa'i mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i ched du /🔽gang zhig rkyen gyis skye 'gyur ba //
analyzed: to ; / gang gi tshe phyi rol gyi don la zhen pa log pa de'i tshe rnam par shes pa tsam yod pa'i mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i ched du / gang zhig rkyen gyis skye 'gyur ba //
translated: When attachment to external objects is reversed, then in order to abandon attachment to the existence of consciousness only,🔽the path of the middle way is taught, such as:

original: de ni skye ba ma yin te //🔽de la rang bzhin gyis skye ba //
analyzed: de ni skye ba ma yin te // de la rang bzhin gyis skye ba //
translated: That which arises due to conditions does not arise.

original: yod pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: It does not have the nature of arising.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dbu ma'i lam gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dbu ma'i lam gsungs pa yin no //
translated: That which depends on conditions is taught to be empty.🔽He who knows emptiness is careful.

original: de'i phyir 'jig rten gyis khong du chud pa'i thabs yin pa'i phyir thams cad yod pa nyid du bka' stsal pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig rten gyis khong du chud pa'i thabs yin pa'i phyir thams cad yod pa nyid du bka' stsal pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, because it is a means for the world to understand, it is said that everything exists. This is the meaning.

original: de nyid las mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid las mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the source of that in the sūtras,

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “As it is said…” and so on.

original: gal te 'jig rten rnam par 'dren pa rnams te /
analyzed: gal te 'jig rten rnam par 'dren pa rnams te /
translated: If the world’s guides,

original: 'jig rten la lam ston par byed pa po rnams gal te 'jig rten dang mthun par ma zhugs na sus kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das shes par mi 'gyur zhing des gsungs pa'i chos kyang shes par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'jig rten la lam ston par byed pa po rnams gal te 'jig rten dang mthun par ma zhugs na sus kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das shes par mi 'gyur zhing des gsungs pa'i chos kyang shes par mi 'gyur la /
translated: the ones who teach the path to the world, do not enter into accord with the world, no one will know the Buddha Bhagavān, and no one will know the Dharma he taught.

original: 'jig rten dang mthun par ma zhugs na gdul bya rnams kyi bsam pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyir chos nyan par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: 'jig rten dang mthun par ma zhugs na gdul bya rnams kyi bsam pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyir chos nyan par mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: If they do not enter into accord with the world, they will not listen to the Dharma because it is not in accord with the thoughts of those to be tamed.

original: sangs rgyas dang chos dag shes par mi 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang chos dag shes par mi 'gyur bas so //
translated: Since they will not know the Buddha and the Dharma,

original: da ni 'jig rten dang mthun par 'jug pa rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni 'jig rten dang mthun par 'jug pa rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to extensively teach entering into accord with the world,

original: phung po dag dang khams rnams dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: phung po dag dang khams rnams dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “The aggregates, the elements, and so on…”

original: phung po dang ; khams dang / skye mched rnams rang bzhin gcig pa nyid de /
analyzed: phung po dang ; khams dang / skye mched rnams rang bzhin gcig pa nyid de /
translated: The aggregates, elements, and sense bases have the same nature.

original: thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all are essenceless.

original: de ltar na yang phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams kyi khyad par gyi rang bzhin can 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa rnams ston par mdzad pa gang yin pa ni @169b 'jig rten dang rjes su mthun par 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na yang phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams kyi khyad par gyi rang bzhin can 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa rnams ston par mdzad pa gang yin pa ni @169b 'jig rten dang rjes su mthun par 'jug pa yin no //
translated: However, the teaching of the distinctions of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases, such as the desire realm, form realm, and formless realm, is in accordance with the world.

original: ming med pa'i chos rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rang bzhin med pa nyid kyi phyir rnam par rtog pa dang brjod pa'i spyod yul ma yin pas phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched kyi chos rnams thams cad brjod du med pa yin la /
analyzed: ming med pa'i chos rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rang bzhin med pa nyid kyi phyir rnam par rtog pa dang brjod pa'i spyod yul ma yin pas phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched kyi chos rnams thams cad brjod du med pa yin la /
translated: All phenomena of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases are inexpressible, because they are not the domain of conceptual thought and expression due to their very lack of intrinsic nature.

original: brjod du med pa'i chos rnams bsam du med pa'i ming gi tshogs kyi sgo nas sems can rnams la gang yongs su brjod pa 'di ni 'jig rten pa dang rjes su mthun par 'jug pa'o //🔽dngos med nye bar ston mdzad cing //
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i chos rnams bsam du med pa'i ming gi tshogs kyi sgo nas sems can rnams la gang yongs su brjod pa 'di ni 'jig rten pa dang rjes su mthun par 'jug pa'o // dngos med nye bar ston mdzad cing //
translated: That which is taught to sentient beings by means of the collection of names of the inconceivable Dharma, which is inexpressible, is the engagement in accordance with the world.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rang bzhin stong pa nyid la zhugs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi dngos po rnams med pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rang bzhin stong pa nyid la zhugs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi dngos po rnams med pa ste /
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, who have entered into the emptiness of intrinsic nature, teach the non-existence of things.

original: dngos po rnams skad cig ma gnyis par mi sdod pa'i mtshan nyid can mi rtag pa nyid nye bar ston par mdzad cing skad cig ma gnyis par mi sdod pa'i dngos po rnams med pa de 'ga' yang 'dir yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams skad cig ma gnyis par mi sdod pa'i mtshan nyid can mi rtag pa nyid nye bar ston par mdzad cing skad cig ma gnyis par mi sdod pa'i dngos po rnams med pa de 'ga' yang 'dir yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The non-existence of things that do not remain in the second moment, which have the characteristic of impermanence, is taught. Nothing exists here that does not remain in the second moment.

original: dngos po nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the thing itself is not established.

original: gang mi rtag pa nyid bstan pa de ni 'jig rten dang rjes su bstun pa yin no //
analyzed: gang mi rtag pa nyid bstan pa de ni 'jig rten dang rjes su bstun pa yin no //
translated: That teaching of impermanence is in accordance with the world.

original: 'gog pa de ni dam pa'i don //
analyzed: 'gog pa de ni dam pa'i don //
translated: That cessation is the ultimate.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa de mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid can yin la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa de mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid can yin la /
translated: This is cessation, which has the characteristic of nirvana.

original: dam pa'i don de mchog tu gyur pa dang // de la don zhes kyang ni gsungs ;
analyzed: dam pa'i don de mchog tu gyur pa dang // de la don zhes kyang ni gsungs ;
translated: It is the highest object, and it is also called the object.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa de yang mya ngan las 'das pa'i don du gnyer ba rnams kyis don du gnyer bar bya ba yin pas don zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa de yang mya ngan las 'das pa'i don du gnyer ba rnams kyis don du gnyer bar bya ba yin pas don zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: This is cessation, which is also called the object, since it is the object to be sought by those who seek nirvana.

original: don dang don min mi gzigs la //
analyzed: don dang don min mi gzigs la //
translated: It is not seen as an object or nonobject.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa de yang don dam ma yin pa dag tu mi gzigs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa de yang don dam ma yin pa dag tu mi gzigs pa ste /
translated: This is cessation, which is not seen as an object or nonobject,

original: de dag brtags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag brtags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because those are conceptualized.

original: de ltar yin yang 'gog pa gsungs pa ni 'jig rten dang mthun par 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yin yang 'gog pa gsungs pa ni 'jig rten dang mthun par 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Nevertheless, the teaching of cessation is in accord with the world.🔽It is not destroyed, etc.

original: zhig pa med cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'gro ba rnams skye ba yang ma yin zhing 'jig pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: zhig pa med cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'gro ba rnams skye ba yang ma yin zhing 'jig pa yang ma yin te /
translated: beings are not born and do not perish.

original: rab rib can la skra shad la sogs pa snang ba bzhin du gdod ma nas skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab rib can la skra shad la sogs pa snang ba bzhin du gdod ma nas skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because, like the appearance of floating hairs and so on to one with an eye disease, they are primordially non-arisen.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Thus,

original: chos kyi dbyings dang mnyam gyur kyang //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings dang mnyam gyur kyang //
translated: although they have become equal to the dharma-dhātu,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: and so on is stated.

original: stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that they have the nature of emptiness.

original: de ltar yin du zin kyang mes bskal pa'i mthar bsreg par ston par mdzad pa 'di ni 'jig rten dang mthun par 'jug @170a * //
analyzed: de ltar yin du zin kyang mes bskal pa'i mthar bsreg par ston par mdzad pa 'di ni 'jig rten dang mthun par 'jug @170a * //
translated: Even though that is the case, this teaching that they are burned at the end of the eon by fire is an engagement with the world.

original: pa'o ; / dus gsum dag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'das pa dang / da lta dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus su sems can rnams kyi rang bzhin ma dmigs kyang sems can gyi khams te rigs ston par mdzad pa 'di ni 'jig rten dang mthun par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: pa'o ; / dus gsum dag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'das pa dang / da lta dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus su sems can rnams kyi rang bzhin ma dmigs kyang sems can gyi khams te rigs ston par mdzad pa 'di ni 'jig rten dang mthun par 'jug pa'o //
translated: In the three times, and so on, means that although the nature of sentient beings is not observed in the past, present, and future, this teaching of the potential of sentient beings is an engagement with the world.

original: de ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gsungs pa de dgongs pa can yin no zhes bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gsungs pa de dgongs pa can yin no zhes bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught that the statement of the foundation consciousness is provisional,

original: da ni sems tsam pa'i lugs dgag par bya ba'i phyir phyogs snga ma ston pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni sems tsam pa'i lugs dgag par bya ba'i phyir phyogs snga ma ston pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, in order to refute the Cittamātra system, the counterparts’ position is presented with “Therefore, they say…”

original: dbu ma pa'i lugs ji skad bstan pa zhes bya ba ni gdod ma nas skye ba med pa gang gi bdag nyid kyis kyang yod pa ma yin pa'i lugs gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dbu ma pa'i lugs ji skad bstan pa zhes bya ba ni gdod ma nas skye ba med pa gang gi bdag nyid kyis kyang yod pa ma yin pa'i lugs gang yin pa'o //
translated: “The system of the Mādhyamikas” is the system according to which nothing exists by way of its own nature, which is primordially nonarisen.

original: mi bzod cing zhes bya ba ni mi tshugs pa'o //🔽rang gi rnam par rtog pas sbyor ba'i lugs brjod pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid du yod pa yin no zhes rang gi rnam par rtog pas brtags pa'i rnam gzhag gang yin pa des bsal bar bya ba'i sgo
analyzed: mi bzod cing zhes bya ba ni mi tshugs pa'o // rang gi rnam par rtog pas sbyor ba'i lugs brjod pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid du yod pa yin no zhes rang gi rnam par rtog pas brtags pa'i rnam gzhag gang yin pa des bsal bar bya ba'i sgo
translated: “They cannot bear” means they cannot tolerate.🔽“By means of the approach of stating their own positions” means that the Cittamātra system is to be refuted by means of the approach of stating their own positions, which is to say, by means of the approach of stating their own positions that impute the existence of all phenomena as being of the nature of consciousness.

original: nas so // don dag 'jog par byed pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i don rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid du 'jog par byed pas so //
analyzed: nas so // don dag 'jog par byed pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i don rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid du 'jog par byed pas so //
translated: “Those who posit objects” means those who posit objects such as form as being of the nature of consciousness.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i lugs gsal bar bya ba'i phyir smras pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i lugs gsal bar bya ba'i phyir smras pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In order to clarify the system that has been explained, he says:

original: mngon du phyogs pas mnyam gzhag sems gnas te //
analyzed: mngon du phyogs pas mnyam gzhag sems gnas te //
translated: The mind abides in equipoise through being directed

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas chos la mngon phyogs shing //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas chos la mngon phyogs shing //
translated: toward the qualities of perfect buddhahood.

original: 'di rten 'byung ba'i de nyid mthong ba de //
analyzed: 'di rten 'byung ba'i de nyid mthong ba de //
translated: That one who sees the suchness of dependent origination

original: shes rab gnas pas 'gog pa thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: shes rab gnas pas 'gog pa thob par 'gyur //
translated: attains cessation through abiding in wisdom.

original: zhes bya ba'i sngar rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa de bsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i sngar rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa de bsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to eliminate what was previously posited,

original: gzung ba med par zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzung ba med par zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says “without external objects,” and so on.

original: sa drug pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' srid gsum ste /
analyzed: sa drug pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' srid gsum ste /
translated: The bodhisattva abiding on the sixth ground realizes the three existences

original: khams gsum pa rnam shes tsam du ste phyi rol gyi don yod pa ma yin no zhes rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: khams gsum pa rnam shes tsam du ste phyi rol gyi don yod pa ma yin no zhes rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: as mere consciousness, that external objects do not exist.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ci lta bus she na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ci lta bus she na /
translated: What kind of bodhisattva?

original: shes rab la gnas zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: shes rab la gnas zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: He says “abiding in wisdom.”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa la gnas pas so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa la gnas pas so //
translated: By abiding in the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom.

original: yang ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: And how is that?

original: rnam shes tsam du de nyid rtogs par 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam shes tsam du de nyid rtogs par 'gyur // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: One realizes that it is just consciousness.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gis sems la gzung ba dang 'dzin par brtags @170b pas stong pa'i rang bzhin can du rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gis sems la gzung ba dang 'dzin par brtags @170b pas stong pa'i rang bzhin can du rtogs pa ste /
translated: One realizes that the dependent consciousness is empty of the imagined natures of object and subject.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba tsam du rtogs pa gang yin pa'o zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba tsam du rtogs pa gang yin pa'o zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means that one realizes that it is just consciousness and mental factors, free from object and subject.

original: de yang ci ltar rtogs she na //
analyzed: de yang ci ltar rtogs she na //
translated: And how is that realized?

original: gzung ba med par 'dzin pa ma mthong zhing //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gzung ba med par 'dzin pa ma mthong zhing // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: One does not see a subject without an object.

original: gzung bar bya ba'i don med pas shes pa gang 'dzin par byed pa nyid don tha dad par rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid can ma mthong zhing rang gsal ba tsam du khong du chud pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzung bar bya ba'i don med pas shes pa gang 'dzin par byed pa nyid don tha dad par rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid can ma mthong zhing rang gsal ba tsam du khong du chud pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Since there is no object to be grasped, one does not see any consciousness that grasps it, which has the characteristic of cognizing a different object. It means that one understands it to be just self-illumination.

original: 'di'i don ni sems tsam pa rnams na re shes pa la skur pa gdab par mi nus te /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni sems tsam pa rnams na re shes pa la skur pa gdab par mi nus te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: Cittamātra says that consciousness cannot be denied.

original: shes pa med na snang ba yang mi 'grub pas so //
analyzed: shes pa med na snang ba yang mi 'grub pas so //
translated: If consciousness did not exist, appearances would not be established.

original: des na shes pa'i bdag nyid can du gyur pa'i snang ba nyid kyi sgo nas shes pa nyid grub pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: des na shes pa'i bdag nyid can du gyur pa'i snang ba nyid kyi sgo nas shes pa nyid grub pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore consciousness is established by way of appearances that are of the nature of consciousness.

original: gnod byed kyang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gnod byed kyang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is also no fault.

original: gang gi phyir gnod par bya ba'i shes pa de la shes pa de nyid kyis gnod dam /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gnod par bya ba'i shes pa de la shes pa de nyid kyis gnod dam /
translated: This is because if that consciousness to be refuted is refuted by that consciousness itself,

original: gzhan gyis gnod /
analyzed: gzhan gyis gnod /
translated: is it refuted by another?

original: de la phyogs dang po ltar ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de la phyogs dang po ltar ni mi rigs te /
translated: In the first case, it is illogical.

original: zla ba gnyis snang gi shes pa de nyid kyis bdag nyid la gnod par mi nus te nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zla ba gnyis snang gi shes pa de nyid kyis bdag nyid la gnod par mi nus te nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That consciousness to which the appearance of two moons appears cannot be refuted by itself because it is experienced.

original: shes pa gzhan gyis kyang mi gnod de nyams su myong bas 'gags pa la gnod par mi rung ste bum pa'i shes pa 'gags pa la snam bu'i shes pas gnod par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: shes pa gzhan gyis kyang mi gnod de nyams su myong bas 'gags pa la gnod par mi rung ste bum pa'i shes pa 'gags pa la snam bu'i shes pas gnod par mi 'gyur te /
translated: It is also not refuted by another consciousness because it is not suitable for a consciousness that has ceased to be refuted by experience, just as a consciousness of a vase that has ceased is not refuted by a consciousness of a cloth.

original: rang gi dus su nyams su myong ba'i phyir dang / snam bu'i shes pa'i dus na de ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi dus su nyams su myong ba'i phyir dang / snam bu'i shes pa'i dus na de ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is experienced at its own time, and because at the time of the consciousness of the cloth, it does not exist.

original: des na sgrub byed yod pa'i phyir dang gnod byed med pa'i phyir shes pa nyid yod pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: des na sgrub byed yod pa'i phyir dang gnod byed med pa'i phyir shes pa nyid yod pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, because of the existence of the proof, and because of the absence of refutation, consciousness itself does exist.

original: 'on kyang de la byis pa rnams kyis thog ma med pa'i ma rig pa'i bag chags kyi stobs kyis gzung ba dang 'dzin par brtags pa de med par yongs su shes pas byang chub sems dpa'i sa drug par byang chub sems dpa' dngos po'i ngo bo nyid sems
analyzed: 'on kyang de la byis pa rnams kyis thog ma med pa'i ma rig pa'i bag chags kyi stobs kyis gzung ba dang 'dzin par brtags pa de med par yongs su shes pas byang chub sems dpa'i sa drug par byang chub sems dpa' dngos po'i ngo bo nyid sems
translated: However, because of the complete understanding of the absence of the imagined apprehended and apprehender through the power of beginningless ignorance, on the sixth bodhisattva ground, the bodhisattva realizes that the nature of entities is

original: tsam du mngon du byed pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: tsam du mngon du byed pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: mind only.

original: de nyid 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach just that, he says,

original: gnas zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te go sla'o //
analyzed: gnas zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te go sla'o //
translated: This word “basis” . . . and so on. It is easy to understand.

original: de kho na nyid ces bya ba ni stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: de kho na nyid ces bya ba ni stong pa nyid de /
translated: “Reality” is emptiness.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: It is free from apprehended and apprehender.

original: rnam par shes pa tsam du zhes bya ba ni stong pa de yang rnam par shes pa tsam la rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa tsam du zhes bya ba ni stong pa de yang rnam par shes pa tsam la rtogs pa'o //
translated: “Consciousness only” means that emptiness is realized in consciousness only.

original: rnam par shes pa tsam du rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan bstan pa'i sgo nas gang gi don du ston pa @171a * //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa tsam du rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan bstan pa'i sgo nas gang gi don du ston pa @171a * //
translated: The reason for teaching the realization of consciousness only is stated:

original: ni ; gzugs med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ni ; gzugs med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “The formless realm, etc.”

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i dngos po tsam zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang ngo //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i dngos po tsam zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang ngo //
translated: “The mere thing that is dependent origination” is the relative.

original: rgyu mtshan nyid rtsa ba'i tshig bshad pa'i sgo nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽yang ci ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so ;
analyzed: rgyu mtshan nyid rtsa ba'i tshig bshad pa'i sgo nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir / yang ci ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so ;
translated: In order to teach by explaining the meaning of the root text, he says,🔽“How is it that the formless realm is only conceptualization?”

original: /'chad par 'gyur ba'i rigs pas zhes bya ba ni ci ltar rlung gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: /'chad par 'gyur ba'i rigs pas zhes bya ba ni ci ltar rlung gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “By the reasoning that will be explained” refers to “How is it that the wind, etc.?”

original: rim pa 'dis zhes bya ba ni gzung ba med par 'dzin pa ma mthong zhing zhes sngar bstan pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: rim pa 'dis zhes bya ba ni gzung ba med par 'dzin pa ma mthong zhing zhes sngar bstan pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: “By this process” refers to the previously explained method, “without an object, the subject is not seen.”

original: da ni gzung ba med pa'i tshul gyis shes pa tsam skye ba bsgrub pa'i phyir phyogs snga ma 'god pa ni /
analyzed: da ni gzung ba med pa'i tshul gyis shes pa tsam skye ba bsgrub pa'i phyir phyogs snga ma 'god pa ni /
translated: Now, in order to establish the arising of mere consciousness without an object, the opponent’s position is set forth:

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //🔽de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: If, as you say, consciousness arises without an object,🔽then why doesn’t consciousness arise from the sense faculties alone?

original: smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach the reply to that, he says, “The opponent says,” and so on.

original: ci ltar rlung gis bskul bas zhes bya ba ni chu'i yan lag rlung gis bskyod pa las so //
analyzed: ci ltar rlung gis bskul bas zhes bya ba ni chu'i yan lag rlung gis bskyod pa las so //
translated: As for “just as waves in water are set into undulating motion by the force of the wind,” it is from the force of the wind that moves the parts of the water that waves arise.

original: de bzhin du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las rnam par shes pa tsam ste 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las rnam par shes pa tsam ste 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: In the same way, from the foundation consciousness, mere consciousness, such as the active consciousnesses, will arise.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ci lta bu las she na /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ci lta bu las she na /
translated: From what kind of foundation consciousness?

original: kun gyi sa bon zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: kun gyi sa bon zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: He says, “the universal seed,”

original: rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi rgyur gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi rgyur gyur pa'o //
translated: which is the cause of all consciousnesses.

original: rang gi nus pa zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rang gi nus pas so //
analyzed: rang gi nus pa zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rang gi nus pas so //
translated: “From its own potential” means from the potential of the foundation consciousness.

original: de la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos thams cad kyi bag chags rnyed nas sa bon yongs su gzung ba'i sgo nas skye ba'i rgyur gyur pa yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos thams cad kyi bag chags rnyed nas sa bon yongs su gzung ba'i sgo nas skye ba'i rgyur gyur pa yin pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of the store-consciousness is that it is the cause of rebirth through the acquisition of the latent impressions of all defiled dharmas and through the retention of the seeds.

original: 'di'i don ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs 'dod chags la sogs pa dang lhan cig tu skye ba dang 'gag pa yang dang yang du nyams su myong bar byas nas sa bon yongs su gzung ba'i sgo nas skye bar 'gyur pa de rnams kyi skye ba'i rgyur
analyzed: 'di'i don ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs 'dod chags la sogs pa dang lhan cig tu skye ba dang 'gag pa yang dang yang du nyams su myong bar byas nas sa bon yongs su gzung ba'i sgo nas skye bar 'gyur pa de rnams kyi skye ba'i rgyur
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: It is the cause of the rebirth of those who, through the experience of repeated arising and cessation together with the defiled side of passion, etc., are reborn through the retention of the seeds.

original: gyur pa'o // de yang sa bon yongs su gzung ba'i sgo nas yin te /
analyzed: gyur pa'o // de yang sa bon yongs su gzung ba'i sgo nas yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is through the retention of the seeds.

original: de la sa bon yongs su gzung ba ni gang skye ba dang lhan cig tu skye ba dang 'gag pa nyams su myong ba'o //
analyzed: de la sa bon yongs su gzung ba ni gang skye ba dang lhan cig tu skye ba dang 'gag pa nyams su myong ba'o //
translated: Therein, the retention of the seeds is the experience of arising and cessation together with the arising.

original: de lta bur gyur pa la bag chags zhes bya ba'i sa bon yongs su gzung ba nyid 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa la bag chags zhes bya ba'i sa bon yongs su gzung ba nyid 'thad pa yin no //
translated: The retention of the seeds, which is called the latent impression, is tenable in that which is so.

original: de dang ldan pa'i sgo nas de de rnams kyi rgyur gyur pa yin gyi gtso bo la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i sgo nas de de rnams kyi rgyur gyur pa yin gyi gtso bo la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: and in virtue of possessing that, it is the cause of those, but not of primal matter and so on.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i sa @171b bon yongs su 'dzin pa mi rigs pas so //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i sa @171b bon yongs su 'dzin pa mi rigs pas so //
translated: Because it is not tenable that the seed of the explanation exists.

original: de rnams rtag pa'i phyir lhan cig tu 'byung ba rnams dang skye ba 'gag pa nyams su myong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams rtag pa'i phyir lhan cig tu 'byung ba rnams dang skye ba 'gag pa nyams su myong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those are permanent, and because the simultaneous arising and cessation of experience is not possible.

original: de lta bu'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de ltar yod par cis grub ce na /
analyzed: de lta bu'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de ltar yod par cis grub ce na /
translated: If you ask, “How is that foundation consciousness established as existing?”

original: de la lan brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la lan brjod par bya ste /
translated: we reply:

original: gal te kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yod par ma gyur na gnyid stug po log pa'i sad pa'i rnam par shes pa gang las skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yod par ma gyur na gnyid stug po log pa'i sad pa'i rnam par shes pa gang las skye bar 'gyur /
translated: If the foundation consciousness did not exist, then from what would the consciousness of one who is deeply asleep and dreaming arise?

original: gnyid stug po log pa'i gnas skabs na 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa tshogs drug dang nyon mongs pa can gyi yid yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gnyid stug po log pa'i gnas skabs na 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa tshogs drug dang nyon mongs pa can gyi yid yod pa ma yin te /
translated: In the state of deep sleep, the sixfold collection of evolving consciousnesses and afflicted intellect do not exist,

original: mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not perceived.

original: des na kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yod pa yin te /
analyzed: des na kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yod pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the foundation consciousness exists.

original: gang las sad pa'i dus rnam par shes pa skye ba'o //
analyzed: gang las sad pa'i dus rnam par shes pa skye ba'o //
translated: From what does the consciousness of one who has awakened arise?

original: de bzhin du gnad du drag po bsnun pa dang / brgyal ba las langs pa'i dus dang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa las langs pa'i tshe gal te kun gzhi rnam par shes pa mi 'dod na rnam par shes pa gang las skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de bzhin du gnad du drag po bsnun pa dang / brgyal ba las langs pa'i dus dang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa las langs pa'i tshe gal te kun gzhi rnam par shes pa mi 'dod na rnam par shes pa gang las skye bar 'gyur /
translated: Similarly, from what does the consciousness arise at the time of being revived from fainting or at the time of rising from the meditative attainment of cessation if you do not accept the foundation consciousness?

original: des na gang las rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur ba'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na gang las rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur ba'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yod pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the foundation consciousness exists from which consciousness arises.

original: de nyid 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says:🔽Just as waves in the ocean

original: ci ltar rgya mtsho'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ci ltar rgya mtsho'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: are the constant motion of water,🔽so the various consciousnesses🔽are the constant motion of the foundation consciousness.

original: ji ltar rgya mtsho las rba rlabs te chu rlabs yongs su rgyug pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar rgya mtsho las rba rlabs te chu rlabs yongs su rgyug pa ste /
translated: Just as waves, which are water, move constantly in the ocean,

original: phan tshun 'gro bar rtogs pa ste nges pa'o //
analyzed: phan tshun 'gro bar rtogs pa ste nges pa'o //
translated: so the various consciousnesses are the constant motion of the foundation consciousness.

original: rba rlabs ci lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: rba rlabs ci lta bu zhe na /
translated: What are the waves like?

original: gnyid log pa lta bu'i zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gnyid log pa lta bu'i zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: He says, “Like one who is asleep. ”

original: rlung med pa'i dus na g-yo ba med pa'i phyir gnyid log pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rlung med pa'i dus na g-yo ba med pa'i phyir gnyid log pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like one who is asleep because it is motionless when there is no wind.

original: khyad par gzhan ci lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par gzhan ci lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the other difference?

original: 'gran pa'i sgo nas bdag gi lus rnyed pa ltar zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'gran pa'i sgo nas bdag gi lus rnyed pa ltar zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is said that it is like one who obtains a body through competition.

original: 'dis lang bzhin du kho bo ci'i phyir mi lang snyam du 'gran pa lta bu'i sgo nas bdag gi lus rnyed ba ltar ro //
