analyzed: 'dis lang bzhin du kho bo ci'i phyir mi lang snyam du 'gran pa lta bu'i sgo nas bdag gi lus rnyed ba ltar ro //
translated: It is like one who obtains a body through competition, thinking, “Why shouldn’t I be active like that one?”

original: ci'i phyir rnyed ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rnyed ce na /
translated: Why is it obtained?

original: rlung tsam gyi rkyen nye bar lhags pas zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rlung tsam gyi rkyen nye bar lhags pas zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It is said that it is due to the condition of the mere wind that has approached.

original: gang gi phyir lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen rlung dang phrad pas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen rlung dang phrad pas so //
translated: Because it encounters the wind that is a cooperative condition.

original: de nyid kyi phyir chu'i yan lag rlung gis bskyod pa las zhes bya bas rgya mtsho las khyad par du byas so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir chu'i yan lag rlung gis bskyod pa las zhes bya bas rgya mtsho las khyad par du byas so //
translated: For that very reason, it is distinguished from the ocean by the words “moved by the wind, which is a part of the water.”

original: 'dir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni rgya mtsho lta bu yin la /
analyzed: 'dir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni rgya mtsho lta bu yin la /
translated: Here, the store consciousness is like the ocean.

original: gnyid log pa lta bu ni bag chags yin zhing /
analyzed: gnyid log pa lta bu ni bag chags yin zhing /
translated: The state that is like sleep is the latent impressions.

original: yongs su smin pa'i rkyen ni rlung gis bskyod pa lta bu yin la /🔽'bras bur @172a * //
analyzed: yongs su smin pa'i rkyen ni rlung gis bskyod pa lta bu yin la / 'bras bur @172a * //
translated: The condition of complete ripening is like the wind.

original: gyur pa'i shes pa ni chu rlabs lta bu yin no //
analyzed: gyur pa'i shes pa ni chu rlabs lta bu yin no //
translated: The consciousness that is the result is like the waves.

original: de ltar dpe bstan nas don dang sbyar ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar dpe bstan nas don dang sbyar ba'i phyir /
translated: Having thus taught the example, in order to connect it with the meaning,

original: 'dir yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “Here also,” and so on.

original: 'dir yang zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa skye ba'i dus na yang ngo //
analyzed: 'dir yang zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa skye ba'i dus na yang ngo //
translated: “Here also” means also at the time of the arising of consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa zhes bya ba ni sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i shes pa brgyud pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa zhes bya ba ni sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i shes pa brgyud pa'o //
translated: “The succession of consciousnesses” means the succession of cognitions of blue, yellow, and so on.

original: thog ma med pa'i dus nas zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba thog ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus nas zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba thog ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Engaged since beginningless time” means since saṃsāra is beginningless.

original: de yang ci lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ci lta bu zhe na /
translated: And what is that like?

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He says, “apprehended and apprehender,” and so on.

original: 'di ni shes par bya ba 'di ni shes pa yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de la gzung ba dang 'dzin par mngon par zhen pa zhes bya la /
analyzed: 'di ni shes par bya ba 'di ni shes pa yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de la gzung ba dang 'dzin par mngon par zhen pa zhes bya la /
translated: The conceptualization that this is the object to be known and this is the knowledge is called the adherence to the apprehended and the apprehender.

original: de'i bag chags ni gzung ba dang 'dzin par rnam par rtog pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i shes pa skye ba'i nus pa'i khyar par ro //
analyzed: de'i bag chags ni gzung ba dang 'dzin par rnam par rtog pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i shes pa skye ba'i nus pa'i khyar par ro //
translated: The latent impressions of that are the special potentiality of consciousness that is in conformity with the conceptualization of the apprehended and the apprehender.

original: de yongs su smin pa ni de ma thag tu 'bras bu bskyed pa gang yin pa'o ;
analyzed: de yongs su smin pa ni de ma thag tu 'bras bu bskyed pa gang yin pa'o ;
translated: Their maturation is the potentiality that immediately generates a result.

original: / de las bdag nyid kyi dngos po yod pa thob pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: / de las bdag nyid kyi dngos po yod pa thob pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The attainment of the existence of one’s own entity is the result.

original: 'gag bzhin pas zhes bya ba ni da ltar ba'o //
analyzed: 'gag bzhin pas zhes bya ba ni da ltar ba'o //
translated: That which is in the process of cessation is present.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i rnam par shes pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pas gang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la sngon po la sogs pa'i shes pa bskyed pa'i nus pa gang gzhag pa de las so //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i rnam par shes pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pas gang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la sngon po la sogs pa'i shes pa bskyed pa'i nus pa gang gzhag pa de las so //
translated: From that which is the placement of the potentiality that generates the consciousness of blue, etc., in the store consciousness by the succession of consciousnesses of that kind.

original: de yang ci lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ci lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is that like?

original: rang gi rnam par shes pa dang rjes su 'brel pa'i zhes bya ba gsungs te /🔽sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa rang gi rnam pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi rnam par shes pa dang rjes su 'brel pa'i zhes bya ba gsungs te / sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa rang gi rnam pa ste /
translated: “ Associated with one’s own consciousness” means

original: sngon po la sogs pa dang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa dang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: that the consciousness of blue, etc., is a continuum of moments, and its own aspect is the aspect of blue, etc., and the aspect of subject and object.

original: de dang rjes su 'brel ni sngon po la sogs pa dang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang ldan pa'i shes pa gzhan skye ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de dang rjes su 'brel ni sngon po la sogs pa dang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang ldan pa'i shes pa gzhan skye ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: “ Associated with that” means that another consciousness arises that is associated with blue, etc., and subject and object.

original: de'i rgyur gyur pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyur gyur pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: “ Its cause” means the special cause.

original: de las zhes bya ba ni bag chags kyis bsgos pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las so //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni bag chags kyis bsgos pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las so //
translated: “ From that” means from the store consciousness that is perfumed by the residual impressions.

original: rim gyis zhes bya ba ni yongs su smin pa'i rkyen la rag lus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rim gyis zhes bya ba ni yongs su smin pa'i rkyen la rag lus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “ Gradually” means that it depends on the condition of full maturation.

original: yongs su smin pa'i rkyen lhags pa'i zhes bya ba ni yongs su smin pa'i rkyen lhan cig byed pa yod na'o //
analyzed: yongs su smin pa'i rkyen lhags pa'i zhes bya ba ni yongs su smin pa'i rkyen lhan cig byed pa yod na'o //
translated: “ When the condition of full maturation is present” means that the condition of full maturation is a cooperative condition.

original: dper na sgo'i rnam par shes pa yod na nang rol gyi shes pa yongs su smin pa'i rkyen yin pa dang / du ba'i shes pa mer shes pa'i yongs su smin pa'i rkyen yin pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dper na sgo'i rnam par shes pa yod na nang rol gyi shes pa yongs su smin pa'i rkyen yin pa dang / du ba'i shes pa mer shes pa'i yongs su smin pa'i rkyen yin pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: For example, the consciousness of a door is the condition for the full ripening of the inner consciousness, and the consciousness of smoke is the condition for the full ripening of the consciousness of fire.

original: @172b gang yongs su ma dag pa gzhan gyi dbang tsam zhig nye bar skye ba zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu nyid kyis yongs su ma dag pa yin la /
analyzed: @172b gang yongs su ma dag pa gzhan gyi dbang tsam zhig nye bar skye ba zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu nyid kyis yongs su ma dag pa yin la /
translated: The other-dependent pattern that is not yet pure is called “the mere arising of the dependent pattern.” It is not yet pure because it is the cause of the conceptualization of subject and object.🔽It is the mere arising of the dependent pattern, because it is empty of external objects.

original: phyi rol gyi don gyis stong pa'i phyir gzhan dbang tsam cig nye bar skye ba de nyid la byis pa rnams gzung ba dang 'dzin par kun du rtog par byed kyi /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don gyis stong pa'i phyir gzhan dbang tsam cig nye bar skye ba de nyid la byis pa rnams gzung ba dang 'dzin par kun du rtog par byed kyi /
translated: The naïve imagine that it is the conceptualization of subject and object.

original: rnam par shes pa las tha dad du gyur pa'i gzung ba ni cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa las tha dad du gyur pa'i gzung ba ni cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not that there is any object at all that is different from consciousness.

original: dper na dbang phyug la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni rang bzhin la sogs par bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: dper na dbang phyug la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni rang bzhin la sogs par bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: For example, the word “etc.” in “the creator, etc.” should be understood to include “nature, etc.”

original: 'di lta ste dbang phyug la sogs pa rgyur smra ba rnams na re 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni blo dang ldan pa'i byed pa po sngon du 'gro ba can yin te /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dbang phyug la sogs pa rgyur smra ba rnams na re 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni blo dang ldan pa'i byed pa po sngon du 'gro ba can yin te /
translated: Thus, those who propound that Īśvara, etc. are the cause say that whatever is an effect must have as its antecedent an intelligent agent,

original: dper na bum pa la sogs pa bzhin /
analyzed: dper na bum pa la sogs pa bzhin /
translated: like a pot, etc.

original: shing dang ri la sogs pa 'di dag kyang 'bras bu yin pas zhes dbang phyug rgyu nyid du 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: shing dang ri la sogs pa 'di dag kyang 'bras bu yin pas zhes dbang phyug rgyu nyid du 'dod pa yin no //
translated: Since these trees, mountains, etc. are effects, they assert that Īśvara is the cause.

original: de bzhin du sems tsam pa rnams kyis ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rgyu nyid du brjod pa yin no //🔽dbang phyug tu smra ba'i 'dod pa de nyid dpe'i sgo nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du sems tsam pa rnams kyis ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rgyu nyid du brjod pa yin no // dbang phyug tu smra ba'i 'dod pa de nyid dpe'i sgo nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Similarly, Cittamātra asserts that the foundation consciousness is the cause.

original: ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach the assertion of the proponents of Īśvara through an example, [the root text] states, “like a bird in the sky,” and so on.

original: dper na ba ni ba rgya rnams kyi rgyu yin pa dang / chu shel chu rnams kyi rgyu yin pa dang / blag sha yal ga rnams kyi rgyu yin pa de bzhin du dbang phyug ni lus can rnams kyi rgyu yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dper na ba ni ba rgya rnams kyi rgyu yin pa dang / chu shel chu rnams kyi rgyu yin pa dang / blag sha yal ga rnams kyi rgyu yin pa de bzhin du dbang phyug ni lus can rnams kyi rgyu yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: For example, just as milk is the cause of curds, water crystal is the cause of water, and the bud is the cause of the branches, in the same way, God is the cause of embodied beings.

original: dbang phyug smra ba dang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa smra ba dag mtshungs pa yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dbang phyug smra ba dang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa smra ba dag mtshungs pa yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that the proponents of God and the proponents of the foundation consciousness are similar,

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “In the same way,” and so on.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug smra ba bzhin du'o ;
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug smra ba bzhin du'o ;
translated: “In the same way” means like the proponents of God.

original: / dngos po mtha' dag gi dmigs pa'i sa bon gyi rten nyid kyi zhes bya ba ni sngon po dang ser po la sogs par dmigs pa'i bag chags kyi rten nyid kyis so //
analyzed: / dngos po mtha' dag gi dmigs pa'i sa bon gyi rten nyid kyi zhes bya ba ni sngon po dang ser po la sogs par dmigs pa'i bag chags kyi rten nyid kyis so //
translated: “The basis of the seeds of the objects of all things” means the basis of the latent propensities of the objects of observation of blue, yellow, and so on.

original: sa bon thams cad pa zhes bya ba ni thams cad kyi rgyur gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sa bon thams cad pa zhes bya ba ni thams cad kyi rgyur gyur pa'o //
translated: “Endowed with all the seeds” means it is the cause of all.

original: de ni smra ba po gnyis mtshungs su zin kyang mi 'dra ba'i cha bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽gang dbang phyug ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //🔽da ni sems tsam pa'i lugs kyi rnam gzhag bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni smra ba po gnyis mtshungs su zin kyang mi 'dra ba'i cha bstan par bya ba'i phyir / gang dbang phyug ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // da ni sems tsam pa'i lugs kyi rnam gzhag bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Although the two speakers are the same, this is stated in order to show the difference.

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach the presentation of the Cittamātra system, [the text] says, “Because . . .” and so on.

original: gang gi phyir sems tsam du smra ba rnams kyi rnam gzhag 'chad par 'gyur ba'i tshul 'di yin @173a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems tsam du smra ba rnams kyi rnam gzhag 'chad par 'gyur ba'i tshul 'di yin @173a * //
translated: Since this is the way in which the Cittamātra presentation will be explained,

original: pas des na gzhan gyi dbang yod pa yin no zhes khas len dgos so zhes pa'o //
analyzed: pas des na gzhan gyi dbang yod pa yin no zhes khas len dgos so zhes pa'o //
translated: one must accept that the dependent nature exists.

original: grag pa zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rigs pas gzhan dbang yod par ma grub pas mi 'dod pa nyid du ston pa'o //
analyzed: grag pa zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rigs pas gzhan dbang yod par ma grub pas mi 'dod pa nyid du ston pa'o //
translated: “It is said” shows that since the existence of the dependent is not established by the reasoning that will be explained, it is not accepted.

original: gang gi phyir gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo khas blang bar bya dgos so zhe na ;
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo khas blang bar bya dgos so zhe na ;
translated: If you ask, “Why must the entity of the dependent nature be accepted?”

original: de la lan ni dngos po brtags par yod pa'i rgyur gyur cing zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de la lan ni dngos po brtags par yod pa'i rgyur gyur cing zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The response to that is stated in the line, “The cause of the imputed reality of things.”

original: tha snyad tsam du yod pa don dam par yod pa ma yin pa de la dngos po brtags par yod pa zhes bya la /
analyzed: tha snyad tsam du yod pa don dam par yod pa ma yin pa de la dngos po brtags par yod pa zhes bya la /
translated: That which exists merely conventionally, but does not exist ultimately, is called the imputed reality of things.

original: sems tsam pa rnams ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i tshogs la dngos po brtags par yod pa zhes brjod la /
analyzed: sems tsam pa rnams ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i tshogs la dngos po brtags par yod pa zhes brjod la /
translated: Cittamātra calls the collection of thoughts of apprehendeds and apprehenders the imputed reality of things.

original: de rgyu ni rten te gzhan gyi dbang ngo //
analyzed: de rgyu ni rten te gzhan gyi dbang ngo //
translated: Its cause is the dependent.

original: sngon por snang ba'i mtshan nyid can med na gzung ba dang 'dzin par rnam par rtog pa'i tshogs gang la brten par 'gyur /
analyzed: sngon por snang ba'i mtshan nyid can med na gzung ba dang 'dzin par rnam par rtog pa'i tshogs gang la brten par 'gyur /
translated: If the dependent did not exist, what would the collection of thoughts of apprehendeds and apprehenders be dependent on?

original: des na gzhan gyi dbang yod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: des na gzhan gyi dbang yod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore it is said that the dependent exists.

original: 'dis ni gzhan gyi dbang yod pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni gzhan gyi dbang yod pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows that the dependent does exist.

original: phyi rol gzung ba med pa 'byung 'gyur la //
analyzed: phyi rol gzung ba med pa 'byung 'gyur la //
translated: The verse says, “The dependent arises without external apprehendeds.”

original: zhes bya ba ni gzhan dbang gi ngo bo de sngar bstan pa'i rnam pas phyi rol gyi sngon po la sogs pa med par 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzhan dbang gi ngo bo de sngar bstan pa'i rnam pas phyi rol gyi sngon po la sogs pa med par 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: This shows that the dependent nature arises without the external blue, etc., as previously explained.

original: 'dis ni gzhan dbang gi ngo bo de shes bya med kyang rang gi bag chags las skye ba nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni gzhan dbang gi ngo bo de shes bya med kyang rang gi bag chags las skye ba nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows that the dependent nature arises from its own habitual tendencies, even though the object of knowledge does not exist.

original: yod dang spros kun yul min rang bzhin yod //
analyzed: yod dang spros kun yul min rang bzhin yod //
translated: It exists, but not as the object of all conceptual elaborations.

original: ces bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang de rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyi yul gyi rang bzhin ma yin te /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang de rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyi yul gyi rang bzhin ma yin te /
translated: This shows that the dependent nature is not the object of all conceptualization, because it is the nature of nonduality.

original: gang gi phyir ji srid du rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyis gang brtags pa de srid du ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dag yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ji srid du rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyis gang brtags pa de srid du ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dag yin la /
translated: As long as there is the duality of the apprehended object and apprehending subject, which is imagined by all conceptualization,

original: gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin gyi gzhan dbang la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin dag yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin gyi gzhan dbang la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin dag yod pa ma yin no //
translated: the dependent nature, which is the nature of nonduality, does not exist as the nature of the apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: de'i phyir spros kun yul min no //
analyzed: de'i phyir spros kun yul min no //
translated: Therefore, it is not the object of all conceptual elaborations.

original: 'dis ni gzhan dbang spros pa thams cad kyi yul ma yin pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni gzhan dbang spros pa thams cad kyi yul ma yin pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows that the dependent is not the object of all elaborations.

original: de nyid 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach just that, the commentary states:

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “The dependent is not tenable without the other.”

original: de la ma ltos par zhes bya ba ni thag pa la mi ltos par ro //
analyzed: de la ma ltos par zhes bya ba ni thag pa la mi ltos par ro //
translated: Therein, “without depending on that” means without depending on the rope.

original: phyi rol gyi don med na zhes bya ba ni shes pa las tha dad du gyur pa'i sngon po la sogs pa'i don med na'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don med na zhes bya ba ni shes pa las tha dad du gyur pa'i sngon po la sogs pa'i don med na'o //
translated: “If external objects do not exist” means if objects such as blue that are different from consciousness do not exist.

original: ci'i rgyu mtshan can zhig tu 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gzhan dbang de med par gyur na sngon po la sogs pa'i rtog pa @173b de ci'i phyir rgyu mtshan du 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ci'i rgyu mtshan can zhig tu 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gzhan dbang de med par gyur na sngon po la sogs pa'i rtog pa @173b de ci'i phyir rgyu mtshan du 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: “What would be the reason for it?” means if that dependent did not exist, what would be the reason for the conception of blue, etc.?

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Because it is the cause of affliction and purification.”

original: de la rnam par rtog pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: de la rnam par rtog pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu yin la /
translated: Therein, it is the cause of affliction because it is the basis of conception.

original: rnam par rtog pa log pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir rnam par byang ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa log pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir rnam par byang ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Because it is the basis of the cessation of conceptualization, it is the cause of purification.

original: stong pa nyid kyang legs par gzung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid ni mi rtag pa nyid bzhin du chos yin pas chos la yang chos can khas len dgos pa yin la /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang legs par gzung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid ni mi rtag pa nyid bzhin du chos yin pas chos la yang chos can khas len dgos pa yin la /
translated: And emptiness is well-grasped means that since emptiness is a phenomenon, like impermanence, it is necessary to accept that a phenomenon is the basis of a phenomenon.

original: de'i phyir stong pa nyid kyi rten gzhan dbang khas len par bya dgos la /
analyzed: de'i phyir stong pa nyid kyi rten gzhan dbang khas len par bya dgos la /
translated: Therefore, it is necessary to accept that the dependent nature is the basis of emptiness.

original: des na gzhan dbang la yod pa'i stong pa nyid gang gi tshe rtog pa de'i tshe stong pa nyid chos su legs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: des na gzhan dbang la yod pa'i stong pa nyid gang gi tshe rtog pa de'i tshe stong pa nyid chos su legs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Thus, when one conceives of the emptiness that exists in the dependent nature, at that time emptiness becomes a well-grasped phenomenon. This is what it means.

original: don 'di la lung gi khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don 'di la lung gi khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the scriptural source for this meaning,

original: de ltar na gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar na gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “For these reasons…” and so on.

original: gang gi phyir gang la gang med pa de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas stong pa nyid la phyin ci ma log par 'jug par gsungs pa de'i phyir stong pa nyid kyang legs par gzung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang la gang med pa de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas stong pa nyid la phyin ci ma log par 'jug par gsungs pa de'i phyir stong pa nyid kyang legs par gzung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because it is said that “emptiness is well-grasped” by the statement “that which is absent in a certain thing,” etc., in order to engage in emptiness without error, this is the meaning of the statement “emptiness is also well-grasped.”

original: gang med pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan dbang la'o //
analyzed: gang med pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan dbang la'o //
translated: “ That which is absent” refers to the dependent nature.

original: gang med pa zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gang med pa zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: “ That which is absent” refers to the nature of grasped and grasper.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni gzhan dbang ngo //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni gzhan dbang ngo //
translated: “ That” refers to the dependent nature.

original: des zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin gyis so //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin gyis so //
translated: “ By that” refers to the nature of grasped and grasper.

original: yang dag par rjes su mthong la zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor pas so //
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su mthong la zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor pas so //
translated: “ One sees correctly” refers to the yogi.

original: gang zhig 'di ltar lhag ma lus pa de zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pas stong pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig 'di ltar lhag ma lus pa de zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pas stong pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: “ That which remains” refers to consciousness that is empty of grasped and grasper.

original: 'dir zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
translated: “ Here” refers to the ultimate.

original: 'di ni stong pa nyid la phyin ci ma log par 'jug pa'o zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi chos kyi ngo bo nyid du ji ltar gnas pa bzhin du khong du chud pas so //
analyzed: 'di ni stong pa nyid la phyin ci ma log par 'jug pa'o zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi chos kyi ngo bo nyid du ji ltar gnas pa bzhin du khong du chud pas so //
translated: This is the correct engagement with emptiness. This is the essence of the dharma of emptiness, since it is understood just as it is.

original: spros pa thams cad kyi yul ma yin pa nyid kyi rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: spros pa thams cad kyi yul ma yin pa nyid kyi rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the reason why it is not the domain of all elaborations,

original: de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says,🔽“That is not the domain of elaboration.”

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo'o //
translated: “That” refers to the dependent nature.

original: gang gi phyir mngon par brjod pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin par brtags pa'i rnam pa brjod pa yin la gzhan gyi dbang ni gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir te mngon par brjod pa'i yul ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mngon par brjod pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin par brtags pa'i rnam pa brjod pa yin la gzhan gyi dbang ni gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir te mngon par brjod pa'i yul ni ma yin no //
translated: Because verbalization is the expression of the aspects of the imagined nature, which is the imputation of apprehendeds and apprehenders, and the dependent nature is the nature of nonduality, it is not the domain of verbalization.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /🔽ji srid mngon par brjod pa la @174a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir / ji srid mngon par brjod pa la @174a * //
translated: For that very reason,🔽he says,

original: sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: “as long as there is verbalization, there is the domain of elaboration.”

original: mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the summary, he says,

original: de'i phyir mdor bsdu na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mdor bsdu na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, in brief, etc.

original: 'dir zhes bya ba ni tshigs su bcad par ro //
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba ni tshigs su bcad par ro //
translated: Here means in the verse.

original: gal te dngos por brtags par yod pa'i rgyur gyur pa nyid kyang don bzhi par gsungs pas gsum zhes ji ltar brjod ce na /
analyzed: gal te dngos por brtags par yod pa'i rgyur gyur pa nyid kyang don bzhi par gsungs pas gsum zhes ji ltar brjod ce na /
translated: If the cause of the imagined existence of things is also the fourth object, why is it said to be three?

original: de la lan ni btags su yod pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la lan ni btags su yod pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The answer to that is given by the words: The existence of the dependent is established on the basis of the imagined.

original: yod pa nyid las grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir gzhan gyi dbang yod pa de'i phyir gdags su yod pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dag gi rgyur gyur pa yin no zhes rtogs pa'i phyir logs su ma gsungs so //🔽de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yod pa nyid las grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir gzhan gyi dbang yod pa de'i phyir gdags su yod pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dag gi rgyur gyur pa yin no zhes rtogs pa'i phyir logs su ma gsungs so // de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Because the existence of the dependent is established on the basis of the imagined, the cause of the existence of the dependent is not mentioned separately, because it is understood that the cause of the imagined existence of the apprehended object and apprehending subject is the existence of the dependent.🔽In order to demonstrate the answer to that, he says:

original: 'di la bshad par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di la bshad par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Here, the answer is as follows.

original: de la khyod kyi shes pa med na snang ba mi 'grub pa'i phyir rang rig gi sgo nas shes pa grub pa yin no zhes gang smras pa de mi rigs te /
analyzed: de la khyod kyi shes pa med na snang ba mi 'grub pa'i phyir rang rig gi sgo nas shes pa grub pa yin no zhes gang smras pa de mi rigs te /
translated: But since an appearance is not established if there is no consciousness of it, it is not correct to say that consciousness is established by way of autocognition.

original: gang gi phyir don med na don du snang ba mi rigs pas phyi rol gyi don yang grub pa'i phyir sems tsam du ji ltar grub /
analyzed: gang gi phyir don med na don du snang ba mi rigs pas phyi rol gyi don yang grub pa'i phyir sems tsam du ji ltar grub /
translated: Since an object of consciousness does not exist, an appearance as an object is not correct. Therefore, since external objects are established, how can it be established that there is mind only?

original: gal te rmi lam na don med kyang don du snang ba'i sgo nas don 'grub par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rmi lam na don med kyang don du snang ba'i sgo nas don 'grub par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that although there is no object in a dream, an object is not established by way of an appearance as an object,

original: de la slob dpon nyid kyis /
analyzed: de la slob dpon nyid kyis /
translated: the master himself replies,

original: phyi rol med sems dper na gang du yod //
analyzed: phyi rol med sems dper na gang du yod //
translated: “Where is the example of a mind without external objects?”

original: ces bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par 'gyur bas lan mi brjod do //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par 'gyur bas lan mi brjod do //
translated: and so forth.

original: des na nyams su myong bas 'grub par 'dod na gnyis ka yang nyams su myong bas khas len dgos so //
analyzed: des na nyams su myong bas 'grub par 'dod na gnyis ka yang nyams su myong bas khas len dgos so //
translated: Therefore, if you assert that it is established by experience, both must be accepted as established by experience.

original: gal te de ltar mi 'dod na gnyis ka yang nyams su myong bas mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: gal te de ltar mi 'dod na gnyis ka yang nyams su myong bas mi 'grub bo //
translated: If you do not assert that, neither is established by experience.

original: khyod kyi gnod byed med pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: khyod kyi gnod byed med pa'i phyir ;
translated: Since there is no refutation of it,

original: / zhes gang brjod pa de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: / zhes gang brjod pa de yang mi rigs te /
translated: But that also is not correct.

original: gang gi phyir sngon po phyi rol gyi don du snang ba de la gang gis gnod /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sngon po phyi rol gyi don du snang ba de la gang gis gnod /
translated: For what is harmed in the appearance of external objects as blue, etc.?

original: shes pa de nyid kyis sam /
analyzed: shes pa de nyid kyis sam /
translated: Is it harmed by that cognition itself,🔽or is it harmed by another?

original: 'on te gzhan gyis gnod re zhig sngon po shes pa de nyid kyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan gyis gnod re zhig sngon po shes pa de nyid kyis ni ma yin te /
translated: First, it is not harmed by that cognition itself,

original: nyams su myong ba ma yin pa nyid du mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba ma yin pa nyid du mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not possible that it is not experienced.

original: shes pa gzhan gyis kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa gzhan gyis kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it harmed by another cognition,

original: de'i dus na de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dus na de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because at that time it does not exist.

original: des na phyi rol gyi don la sgrub byed yod pa dang / gnod byed med pa'i phyir sems bzhin du phyi rol gyi don yang 'dod dgos so //
analyzed: des na phyi rol gyi don la sgrub byed yod pa dang / gnod byed med pa'i phyir sems bzhin du phyi rol gyi don yang 'dod dgos so //
translated: Therefore, since there is no proof of external objects and no harm in denying them, external objects must be accepted as being like mind.

original: yang na gnyis ka yang ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na gnyis ka yang ma yin te /
translated: Or, neither is the case.

original: 'di nyid ces bya ba ni phyi rol gyi don med @174b pas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la bsgos pa'i bag chags kyi khyad par las don du snang ba'i shes pa skye ba yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid ces bya ba ni phyi rol gyi don med @174b pas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la bsgos pa'i bag chags kyi khyad par las don du snang ba'i shes pa skye ba yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: This means that because there are no external objects, a cognition appearing as an object arises from the special habitual tendencies perfumed in the store consciousness.

original: smras pa zhes bya ba ni sems tsam pas so //
analyzed: smras pa zhes bya ba ni sems tsam pas so //
translated: “It is said” refers to the Cittamātra.

original: rmi lam ji bzhin zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rmi lam na phyi rol gyi don med kyang don du snang ba'i shes pa skye ba de bzhin du sad pa'i gnas skabs na yang zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rmi lam ji bzhin zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rmi lam na phyi rol gyi don med kyang don du snang ba'i shes pa skye ba de bzhin du sad pa'i gnas skabs na yang zhes pa'i don to //
translated: “Like a dream” means that just as in a dream, although there are no external objects, a consciousness appearing as an object arises, in the same way, it is the meaning that in the waking state as well.

original: de'i 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that,

original: khang mig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: khang mig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says “a small room,” and so on.

original: khang mig shin tu chung ba'i nang du nyal zhing zhes bya ba ni khang pa shin tu mig chung ba'i nang du nyal nas so //
analyzed: khang mig shin tu chung ba'i nang du nyal zhing zhes bya ba ni khang pa shin tu mig chung ba'i nang du nyal nas so //
translated: “Having gone to sleep in a very small room” means having gone to sleep in a very small house.

original: cung zad gnyid kyis log pas zhes bya ba ni gnyid stug po log pa'i gnas skabs na rmi lam mthong ba mi srid pas cung zad gnyid kyis log pas zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: cung zad gnyid kyis log pas zhes bya ba ni gnyid stug po log pa'i gnas skabs na rmi lam mthong ba mi srid pas cung zad gnyid kyis log pas zhes gsungs so //
translated: “Having fallen asleep a little” means that it is impossible to have a dream in a state of deep sleep, so it says “having fallen asleep a little.”

original: glang po che myos pa'i khyu rmis pa ni ci zhig ltar yang yod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni shin tu mi srid pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: glang po che myos pa'i khyu rmis pa ni ci zhig ltar yang yod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni shin tu mi srid pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The dream of a herd of crazed elephants is not something that exists in any way at all.

original: glang po che myos pa'i khyu zhes bya ba smos pa yin no //
analyzed: glang po che myos pa'i khyu zhes bya ba smos pa yin no //
translated: The phrase “a herd of crazed elephants” is used to illustrate something that is utterly impossible.

original: des na rmi lam na phyi rol gyi yul med kyang shes pa yod pa nyid du grub pa yin no //
analyzed: des na rmi lam na phyi rol gyi yul med kyang shes pa yod pa nyid du grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, although external objects do not exist in a dream, it is established that consciousness does exist.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni don med kyang shes pa skye ba'i mtshan nyid can du 'dod pa 'di la'o //
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni don med kyang shes pa skye ba'i mtshan nyid can du 'dod pa 'di la'o //
translated: In this regard, the phrase “in this case” refers to the assertion that consciousness can arise even though no object exists.

original: snying po med pa nyid du zhes bya ba ni mi rigs pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: snying po med pa nyid du zhes bya ba ni mi rigs pa nyid du'o //
translated: The phrase “it is unreasonable” means that it is illogical.

original: de bsam bya zhes bya ba ni rmi lam na don med pa'i shes pa yod pa yin no zhes bya ba de yang bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de bsam bya zhes bya ba ni rmi lam na don med pa'i shes pa yod pa yin no zhes bya ba de yang bsam par bya'o //
translated: The phrase “that should be considered” means that the existence of consciousness that lacks an object in a dream should be considered.

original: yang de ci zhig ce na zhes bya ba ni /🔽bsam par bya ba gang zhig yin //
analyzed: yang de ci zhig ce na zhes bya ba ni / bsam par bya ba gang zhig yin //
translated: The phrase “what is that?”

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: means “what is that which should be considered?”

original: gang tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dbu ma gang gi tshe rmi lam na yang sems med pa de'i tshe rmi lam gyi dpe de ma grub pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gang tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dbu ma gang gi tshe rmi lam na yang sems med pa de'i tshe rmi lam gyi dpe de ma grub pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The passage beginning When, etc. means that when there is no mind even in a dream, then that example of the dream is not established. This is the meaning.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says:

original: de tshe khyod kyi dpe yod min //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de tshe khyod kyi dpe yod min // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Then your example does not exist.

original: sems tsam pa khyod kyi dpe de ma grub pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig yin no //🔽de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sems tsam pa khyod kyi dpe de ma grub pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig yin no // de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: This means that your example, Mind-Only, is not established.🔽In order to demonstrate that with a commentary, he says:

original: ba glang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ba glang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Ox, etc.

original: yul ltar zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi don bzhin du'o //
analyzed: yul ltar zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi don bzhin du'o //
translated: Like an object means like an external object.

original: ma skyes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bdag las ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas skye ba bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bdag las ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas skye ba bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not produced means because production is refuted by not from self, etc.

original: gnyis ka las grub pa'i dpe zhes bya ba ni sems tsam pa dang dbu ma pa dag la grub pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka las grub pa'i dpe zhes bya ba ni sems tsam pa dang dbu ma pa dag la grub pa'o //
translated: An example established for both means established for both Mind-Only and Madhyamika.

original: sems tsam @175a * //
analyzed: sems tsam @175a * //
translated: Mind-Only

original: pa'i dogs pa bsu bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: pa'i dogs pa bsu bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to anticipate the qualm,

original: ci ste rmi lam na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ci ste rmi lam na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “But if in a dream, etc.”

original: gzhan gyi bsam pa ni gnyid sad pa'i gnas skabs na rmi lam dran pa yod la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi bsam pa ni gnyid sad pa'i gnas skabs na rmi lam dran pa yod la /
translated: The thought of the opponent is this: In the state of waking, there is memory of a dream;

original: dran pa de yang nyams su myong ba med na yod par mi 'gyur bas nyams su myong ba dang / shes pa dag rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir rmi lam na rnam par shes pa yod pa nyid yin no zhe na'o //
analyzed: dran pa de yang nyams su myong ba med na yod par mi 'gyur bas nyams su myong ba dang / shes pa dag rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir rmi lam na rnam par shes pa yod pa nyid yin no zhe na'o //
translated: and since that memory would not exist if there were no experience, and since experience and consciousness are synonyms, consciousness exists in a dream.

original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the reply to that,

original: 'di yang mi rung ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di yang mi rung ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “This also is not tenable,” etc.

original: gnyid sad pa'i gnas skabs na dran pa'i sgo nas gal te rmi lam gyi gnas skabs na rnam par shes pa yod par khas len na /
analyzed: gnyid sad pa'i gnas skabs na dran pa'i sgo nas gal te rmi lam gyi gnas skabs na rnam par shes pa yod par khas len na /
translated: In the state of waking, if one accepts the existence of consciousness in the state of dreaming on the ground of memory,

original: phyi rol yul yang de bzhin 'gyur //
analyzed: phyi rol yul yang de bzhin 'gyur //
translated: then the external object also would be like that.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: He says,🔽“If, in the state of waking, one remembers a dream, then the external object also would be like that.”

original: nyams su myong ba dran pa bzhin du don yang dran pa'i phyir rmi lam na yang don yod pa nyid yin no zhes ci'i phyir khas mi len /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba dran pa bzhin du don yang dran pa'i phyir rmi lam na yang don yod pa nyid yin no zhes ci'i phyir khas mi len /
translated: Why not accept that the object exists in a dream just as the experience is remembered?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong ba bzhin du phyi rol gyi don yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong ba bzhin du phyi rol gyi don yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de ci'i phyir zhe na / de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Why? means that just as the experience is remembered, why not accept that the external object exists?

original: ci ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ci ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the answer to that, he says:🔽Just as the memory “I saw” exists for the experience,

original: ci ltar nyams su myong ba la ni ngas mthong ngo snyam pa'i dran pa yod pa de bzhin du yul yang khas blang bar bya dgos so //
analyzed: ci ltar nyams su myong ba la ni ngas mthong ngo snyam pa'i dran pa yod pa de bzhin du yul yang khas blang bar bya dgos so //
translated: so the object must be accepted.

original: yang na rnam par shes pa yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gal te yul dran du zin kyang yul khas mi len na rnam par shes pa dran yang rnam par shes pa med par khas blang pa'i phyir kho bo'i phyogs grub pa yin no
analyzed: yang na rnam par shes pa yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gal te yul dran du zin kyang yul khas mi len na rnam par shes pa dran yang rnam par shes pa med par khas blang pa'i phyir kho bo'i phyogs grub pa yin no
translated: Or, consciousness also does not exist means that if, although the object is remembered, the object is not accepted, then since consciousness is remembered but consciousness is accepted as nonexistent, my position is established.

original: // rmi lam na don med pa'i sgrub pa'i gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: // rmi lam na don med pa'i sgrub pa'i gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: To anticipate the objection that there is no object in a dream, he says:

original: 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Here it is said:

original: de gzung bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni glang po che la sogs pa rnams gzung bar bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: de gzung bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni glang po che la sogs pa rnams gzung bar bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: For the sake of apprehending them, for the sake of apprehending elephants and so on.

original: de ni yod pa yang ma yin te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ni yod pa yang ma yin te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That is not existent,

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa yod pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa yod pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: the eye consciousness is not existent.

original: de med pa'i rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de med pa'i rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: To teach the reason for its non-existence, he says:

original: gnyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gnyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: By sleep, etc.

original: gnyid log pas mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga phyir 'jug pa bkag pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga med pa'o //
analyzed: gnyid log pas mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga phyir 'jug pa bkag pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga med pa'o //
translated: By sleep, the five collections of consciousness such as eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body are blocked from engaging externally, so the five collections of consciousness do not exist.

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang gi phyir rmi lam na mig gi rnam par shes pa mi srid pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang gi phyir rmi lam na mig gi rnam par shes pa mi srid pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of that, etc. means because it is impossible for an eye consciousness to exist in a dream,

original: @175b yid kyi rnam par shes pa kho na glang po che la sogs pa'i rnam par skye ba yin la /
analyzed: @175b yid kyi rnam par shes pa kho na glang po che la sogs pa'i rnam par skye ba yin la /
translated: The mental consciousness alone arises in the aspect of an elephant and so on.

original: glang po che la sogs pa'i rnam pa de la 'jig rten pas phyi rol gyi don du mngon par zhen par byed la /
analyzed: glang po che la sogs pa'i rnam pa de la 'jig rten pas phyi rol gyi don du mngon par zhen par byed la /
translated: The world conceives the aspect of an elephant and so on to be an external object.

original: de bzhin du sad pa'i gnas skabs na yang shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi sngon po'i rnam pa nyid la phyi rol gyi don med kyang phyi rol gyi don du mngon par zhen par 'dod na'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sad pa'i gnas skabs na yang shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi sngon po'i rnam pa nyid la phyi rol gyi don med kyang phyi rol gyi don du mngon par zhen par 'dod na'o //
translated: In the same way, in the waking state, although external objects do not exist in the aspect of blue, which is the nature of consciousness, it is asserted that the world conceives it to be an external object.

original: 'di'i don ni yul du gyur pa'i gzugs la sogs pa rnams mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i yul nyid kyis khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni yul du gyur pa'i gzugs la sogs pa rnams mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i yul nyid kyis khyab pa yin la /
translated: The meaning of this is that form and so on, which are objects, are pervaded by being the objects of eye consciousness and so on.

original: de med na de la don yod pa ma yin pas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa kho na la don du zhen pa de bzhin du sad pa'i gnas skabs na yang yin pas dpe grub pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de med na de la don yod pa ma yin pas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa kho na la don du zhen pa de bzhin du sad pa'i gnas skabs na yang yin pas dpe grub pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: If they do not exist, then objects do not exist. Therefore, just as the aspect of mental consciousness is conceived to be an object, in the same way, in the waking state, the aspect of consciousness is conceived to be an external object. Therefore the example is established.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the meaning of this, the Autocommentary says:

original: rmi lam du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te go sla'o //🔽de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rmi lam du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te go sla'o // de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The statement “in a dream” and so on is easy to understand.

original: de ltar ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach the reply to that, [the opponent] says, “It is not like that” and so on.

original: de ltar ma yin te zhes bya ba ni rmi lam na yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa kho na la don du zhen pa ni ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin te zhes bya ba ni rmi lam na yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa kho na la don du zhen pa ni ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: “It is not like that” means that in a dream, one does not conceive the aspect of mental consciousness alone as an object.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: lan ni rmi lam na yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: lan ni rmi lam na yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The reply is, “Because the arising of mental consciousness in a dream is impossible.”

original: de yang bdag las ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas skye ba ma grub pa'i phyir ro //🔽de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang bdag las ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas skye ba ma grub pa'i phyir ro // de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, because arising is not established, as stated by “not from itself” and so on.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach just that, [the opponent] says, “It is like this” and so on.

original: ji ltar sems tsam du smra bar byed pa khyod kyi rmi lam du phyi rol gyi don ma skyes pa de bzhin du kho bo'i yang rmi lam na rnam par shes pa ma skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar sems tsam du smra bar byed pa khyod kyi rmi lam du phyi rol gyi don ma skyes pa de bzhin du kho bo'i yang rmi lam na rnam par shes pa ma skyes pa yin no //
translated: Just as for you, the proponent of mind-only, external objects are not produced in a dream, so for me, consciousness is not produced in a dream.

original: des na yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa kho na la phyi rol gyi don du ji ltar zhen pa yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: des na yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa kho na la phyi rol gyi don du ji ltar zhen pa yin zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, how can you cling to the mere aspect of mental consciousness as an external object?

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir yid kyi rnam par shes pa ma skyes pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir yid kyi rnam par shes pa ma skyes pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: Because mental consciousness is not produced.

original: mig dang zhes bya ba ni mig gi dbang po'o //
analyzed: mig dang zhes bya ba ni mig gi dbang po'o //
translated: “Eye” refers to the eye faculty.

original: yul dang zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yul dang zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Object” refers to blue and so on.

original: des bskyed sems zhes bya ba ni mig gi dbang pos bskyed pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: des bskyed sems zhes bya ba ni mig gi dbang pos bskyed pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: “The mind produced by that” refers to the eye consciousness produced by the eye faculty.

original: gsum po thams cad ces bya ba ni mig gi dbang po dang yul sngon po la sogs pa rnams dang mig gi rnam par shes pa rnams so //
analyzed: gsum po thams cad ces bya ba ni mig gi dbang po dang yul sngon po la sogs pa rnams dang mig gi rnam par shes pa rnams so //
translated: “All three” refers to the eye faculty, objects such as blue, and eye consciousness.

original: brdzun pa yin zhes bya ba ni bden pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: brdzun pa yin zhes bya ba ni bden pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: “False” means “not true.”

original: gsum po 'di dag ci lta bar zhes bya ba ni bstan ma thag pa rnams so //
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag ci lta bar zhes bya ba ni bstan ma thag pa rnams so //
translated: “Just like these three” refers to those just mentioned.

original: rna sogs gsum @176a * //
analyzed: rna sogs gsum @176a * //
translated: The remaining three, the ear, etc.,

original: po lhag ma la skye ba med ces bya ba ni rmi lam gyi rna ba dang sgra dang rna ba'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyang stong pa nyid yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: po lhag ma la skye ba med ces bya ba ni rmi lam gyi rna ba dang sgra dang rna ba'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyang stong pa nyid yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: are not produced. This means that the ear, sound, and ear consciousness in a dream are also empty.

original: 'di dbu ma pa gzhan dag rmi lam na yul yod pa nyid du bsten pa'i sgo nas sems tsam pa'i 'dod pa sun 'byin pa ni /
analyzed: 'di dbu ma pa gzhan dag rmi lam na yul yod pa nyid du bsten pa'i sgo nas sems tsam pa'i 'dod pa sun 'byin pa ni /
translated: This refutes the Cittamātra assertion that objects exist in a dream by way of the following statement of another Mādhyamika:

original: gang zhig chos kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang zhig chos kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Whatever is a mental object . . .”

original: chos kyi skye mched du gtogs pa'i zhes bya ba ni chos kyi skye mched kyis bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi skye mched du gtogs pa'i zhes bya ba ni chos kyi skye mched kyis bsdus pa ste /
translated: “Included within the sense base of mental objects” means subsumed within the sense base of mental objects.

original: des ni sad pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pas yul du mi byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des ni sad pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pas yul du mi byed pa'i phyir /
translated: Since it is not an object of the eye consciousness of the waking state,

original: gzugs kyi skye mched kyis bsdus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye mched kyis bsdus pa ma yin no //
translated: it is not subsumed within the sense base of form.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de ni yid kyi rnam par shes pas gzung bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de ni yid kyi rnam par shes pas gzung bar bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is to be apprehended by mental consciousness.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir rmi lam na chos kyi skye mched du gtogs pa'i gzugs yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir rmi lam na chos kyi skye mched du gtogs pa'i gzugs yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “For that reason” means because form belonging to the sense-field of mental objects exists in dreams.

original: phyogs 'di ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: phyogs 'di ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that this position is unreasonable, he says,

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin pa nyid de zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin pa nyid de zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: “That is also unreasonable.”

original: rmi lam na yul yod pa nyid du brjod pa de mi rigs pa'o //
analyzed: rmi lam na yul yod pa nyid du brjod pa de mi rigs pa'o //
translated: The statement that objects exist in dreams is unreasonable.

original: de la rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the reason for that, he says,

original: rmi lam na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rmi lam na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Even in dreams, etc.”

original: gsum po zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: gsum po zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: “The three” refers to the sense faculty, the object, and the consciousness.

original: ci ste gzhan gyi gzhung lugs gsal bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gal te gzhan dag na re kho bos rang gi phyogs rnam par gzhag pa'i don du de skad du brjod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: ci ste gzhan gyi gzhung lugs gsal bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gal te gzhan dag na re kho bos rang gi phyogs rnam par gzhag pa'i don du de skad du brjod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: “But if you say that it is in order to clarify the other’s system…” If others say, “We do not say that in order to establish our own position,

original: 'on kyang sems tsam pa'i gzhung lugs kyis rmi lam na don med pa'i rnam par shes pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i grub mtha' de dgag par bya ba'i phyir rmi lam na chos kyi skye mched du gtogs pa'i gzugs yod pa yin no zhes de🔽ltar khas len pa yin no zhe na'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang sems tsam pa'i gzhung lugs kyis rmi lam na don med pa'i rnam par shes pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i grub mtha' de dgag par bya ba'i phyir rmi lam na chos kyi skye mched du gtogs pa'i gzugs yod pa yin no zhes de ltar khas len pa yin no zhe na'o //
translated: but rather in order to refute the Cittamātra tenet that in dreams there is no consciousness without an object, we accept that in dreams there is form belonging to the phenomena base.”

original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: To explain the answer to that, it is said:

original: de'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “At that time…”

original: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi gzhung lugs dgag par bya ba'i phyir rmi lam na yul yod pa nyid du khas len na'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi gzhung lugs dgag par bya ba'i phyir rmi lam na yul yod pa nyid du khas len na'o //
translated: “At that time” refers to the time of accepting the existence of objects in dreams in order to refute the other’s system.

original: rmi lam gyi dpe don med pa nyid du 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pas chos thams cad rang bzhin med par bsgrubs pa la rmi lam gyi dpe don med par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi dpe don med pa nyid du 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pas chos thams cad rang bzhin med par bsgrubs pa la rmi lam gyi dpe don med par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The example of the dream would be meaningless means that the example of the dream would be meaningless in the Madhyamaka's proof that all phenomena lack intrinsic nature.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?🔽The answer is stated:

original: lan ni de brdzun pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: lan ni de brdzun pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: because it is not false, etc.

original: de zhes bya ba ni rmi lam mo //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni rmi lam mo //
translated: The it refers to the dream.

original: brdzun pa ma yin pa'i don can nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni rmi lam na yang chos kyi skye @176b mched kyis bsdus pa'i gzugs yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brdzun pa ma yin pa'i don can nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni rmi lam na yang chos kyi skye @176b mched kyis bsdus pa'i gzugs yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not false, etc. means that even in a dream, form included in the sense bases exists.

original: dpe las byung ba zhes bya ba ni sad pa'i dus kyi dbang po la sogs pa gsum mo //
analyzed: dpe las byung ba zhes bya ba ni sad pa'i dus kyi dbang po la sogs pa gsum mo //
translated: The arisen from the example refers to the three faculties, etc. of the waking time.

original: dngos kyi don brdzun pa'i don can du bstan pa mi srid pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de na yang gzugs yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos kyi don brdzun pa'i don can du bstan pa mi srid pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de na yang gzugs yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible to teach the actual object as having a false meaning means that form exists there as well.

original: des ni 'dir lan 'di mi rigs pa'o //
analyzed: des ni 'dir lan 'di mi rigs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, this answer here is unreasonable.

original: gang gi phyir rmi lam na gsum char yang ma skyes pa de'i tshe kho bo'i phyogs la dpe 'di rigs pa yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rmi lam na gsum char yang ma skyes pa de'i tshe kho bo'i phyogs la dpe 'di rigs pa yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that when all three are unproduced in a dream, this example is reasonable for our position,

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says “because” and so on.

original: rab tu grub pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni rmi lam gyi dpe rang bzhin med par grub pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: rab tu grub pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni rmi lam gyi dpe rang bzhin med par grub pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: “By means of the well-established” means by means of the example of the dream, which is established as lacking intrinsic nature.

original: ma grub pa zhes bya ba ni sad pa'i dus na gsum po 'di rang bzhin med par ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: ma grub pa zhes bya ba ni sad pa'i dus na gsum po 'di rang bzhin med par ma grub pa'o //
translated: “Not established” means that these three are not established as lacking intrinsic nature at the time of waking.

original: bsgrub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin med par ro //
analyzed: bsgrub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin med par ro //
translated: “In order to establish” means in order to establish them as lacking intrinsic nature.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that,

original: rmi lam ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rmi lam ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says “Just as in a dream” and so on.

original: ji ltar rmi lam na gsum char yang brdzun pa de bzhin du sad pa'i dus na yang dbang po la sogs pa gsum brdzun pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rmi lam na gsum char yang brdzun pa de bzhin du sad pa'i dus na yang dbang po la sogs pa gsum brdzun pa'o //
translated: Just as all three are false in a dream, so the three—the sense faculties and so on—are false at the time of waking.

original: mjug bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mjug bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to draw a conclusion,🔽he says “Just as in a dream” and so on.

original: sems de yod ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: sems de yod ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The mind does not exist.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that,

original: ji ltar rmi lam du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: ji ltar rmi lam du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says, “Just like in a dream…” and so on.

original: de la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the source of the sūtra,

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “Therefore…” and so on.

original: gang gi phyir rmi lam la sogs pa thams cad brdzun pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rmi lam la sogs pa thams cad brdzun pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all dreams and so on are false, therefore

original: sgyu ma'i sems can rnams dmigs pa ste snang ba yin gyi /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i sems can rnams dmigs pa ste snang ba yin gyi /
translated: the beings of the illusion are observed, that is, appear,

original: de kho na nyid du yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de kho na nyid du yod pa ma yin te /
translated: but do not exist in reality,

original: shing dang bong ba la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shing dang bong ba la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are wood, clods of earth, and so on.

original: ji ltar bde bar gshegs pas chos thams cad sgyu ma dang rmi lam dang 'dra bar gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar bde bar gshegs pas chos thams cad sgyu ma dang rmi lam dang 'dra bar gsungs pa'o //
translated: Just as the Sugata taught that all phenomena are like illusions and dreams,

original: de bzhin du srid pa'i 'gro ba rnams kyang yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du srid pa'i 'gro ba rnams kyang yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: so too, the beings of cyclic existence are like that.🔽In order to teach that,

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “Likewise…” and so on.

original: srid pa ni mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: srid pa ni mdor bsdu na /
translated: Cyclic existence, in brief,

original: 'gro ba rnam pa lnga po rnams yin la //
analyzed: 'gro ba rnam pa lnga po rnams yin la //
translated: The five types of beings.

original: de yang rmi lam lta bu yin te de'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang rmi lam lta bu yin te de'i phyir /
translated: And that is like a dream.

original: 'di la su yang mi skye 'chi ba med //
analyzed: 'di la su yang mi skye 'chi ba med //
translated: Therefore, no one is born or dies.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And so on.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos 'di rnams ni dbu ba chu shing 'dra //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: chos 'di rnams ni dbu ba chu shing 'dra // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: These phenomena are like foam and a plantain tree.

original: brtags shing dpyad na chu shing bzhin du snying po med pa'i phyir ro //🔽legs par bshad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gal te rmi lam na chos @177a * //
analyzed: brtags shing dpyad na chu shing bzhin du snying po med pa'i phyir ro // legs par bshad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gal te rmi lam na chos @177a * //
translated: When examined and analyzed, they are without essence, like a plantain tree.🔽It is well explained.🔽If one accepts that form included in the sense base of phenomena exists in a dream, it contradicts the example of a dream taught in the sutras.

original: kyi skye mched kyis bsdus pa'i gzugs yod par khas len na mdo las bstan pa'i rmi lam gyi dpe dang 'gal zhing kho bo'i phyogs ltar na ni 'gal ba yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: kyi skye mched kyis bsdus pa'i gzugs yod par khas len na mdo las bstan pa'i rmi lam gyi dpe dang 'gal zhing kho bo'i phyogs ltar na ni 'gal ba yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: But if one accepts that form does not exist in a dream, it is not contradictory for us.

original: gang rmi lam gyi dpe las gsum ma skyes par brjod pa de sad pa la ltos nas yin gyi /
analyzed: gang rmi lam gyi dpe las gsum ma skyes par brjod pa de sad pa la ltos nas yin gyi /
translated: The example of a dream states that the three are unarisen in dependence on waking.

original: rmi lam gyi dus la ltos pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rmi lam gyi dus la ltos pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate that it is not dependent on the time of the dream,

original: de'i phyir sad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir sad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says, “Therefore, when one is awake…”

original: rmi lam na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ji srid du rmi lam gyi gnas skabs las ma sad pa de bzhin du ni de la gsum po yod pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rmi lam na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ji srid du rmi lam gyi gnas skabs las ma sad pa de bzhin du ni de la gsum po yod pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: “In a dream…” and so on. As long as one has not awakened from the state of dreaming, the three exist for him.

original: 'di ci ltar na sad bzhin zhes bya ba ni ji ltar sad pa'i gnas skabs ma rig pa'i gnyid log pa na gsum po yod pa de nyid du rmi lam gyi gnas skabs na yang yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ci ltar na sad bzhin zhes bya ba ni ji ltar sad pa'i gnas skabs ma rig pa'i gnyid log pa na gsum po yod pa de nyid du rmi lam gyi gnas skabs na yang yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: “How is it like when awake?” Just as the three exist when one is in the state of being awake, so they exist in the state of dreaming, when one is asleep in the sleep of ignorance.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: To explain this,

original: ji ltar mi shes pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji ltar mi shes pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “As long as one is ignorant…”

original: so so'i skye bo thams cad la dus rtag tu ma rig pa'i gnyid stug po yod pas so //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo thams cad la dus rtag tu ma rig pa'i gnyid stug po yod pas so //
translated: Because all ordinary beings are always in the deep sleep of ignorance.

original: de las tha dad pa'i gnyid sad pa zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i gnyid dang ldan du zin kyang de las tha dad pa'i tha mal pa'i gnyid kyi mtshan nyid can gnyid gzhan gang yin pa de sad pa'o //
analyzed: de las tha dad pa'i gnyid sad pa zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i gnyid dang ldan du zin kyang de las tha dad pa'i tha mal pa'i gnyid kyi mtshan nyid can gnyid gzhan gang yin pa de sad pa'o //
translated: The so-called waking state that is different from that is the other sleep that is different from the sleep of nescience, but which has the character of ordinary sleep.

original: ma rig pa'i gnyid kyis zhes bya ba ni tha mal pa'i gnyid kyi gnas skabs las sad du zin kyang ma rig pa'i gnyid dang ma bral bas so //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i gnyid kyis zhes bya ba ni tha mal pa'i gnyid kyi gnas skabs las sad du zin kyang ma rig pa'i gnyid dang ma bral bas so //
translated: The sleep of nescience is the sleep of nescience that is not yet eliminated even though one has awakened from the state of ordinary sleep.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni tha mal pa'i gnyid sad pa'i gnas skabs bzhin du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni tha mal pa'i gnyid sad pa'i gnas skabs bzhin du'o //
translated: Just so means just as in the state of waking from ordinary sleep.

original: de lta bu'i rang bzhin can zhes bya ba ni sad pa'i gnas skabs kyi rang bzhin can dang mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rang bzhin can zhes bya ba ni sad pa'i gnas skabs kyi rang bzhin can dang mtshungs pa'o //
translated: Having such a nature means having a nature similar to that of the state of waking.

original: da ni tha mal pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi gnyid sad pa na ci ltar gnyid kyi gnas skabs na snang ba gsum po de med pa de bzhin du ma rig pa'i gnyid sad pa na yang gsum po de yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i
analyzed: da ni tha mal pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi gnyid sad pa na ci ltar gnyid kyi gnas skabs na snang ba gsum po de med pa de bzhin du ma rig pa'i gnyid sad pa na yang gsum po de yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that just as the three appearances do not exist in the state of sleep, which has the character of an ordinary state, so also they do not exist when the sleep of ignorance is awakened,

original: phyir / sad par gyur na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: phyir / sad par gyur na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “When one awakens,” and so on.

original: sad par gyur na zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpe bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: sad par gyur na zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpe bstan pa yin la /
translated: “ When one awakens,” and so on, teaches the example.

original: gti mug gnyid ces bya bas don bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gti mug gnyid ces bya bas don bstan pa'o //
translated: “ The sleep of delusion,” and so on, teaches the meaning.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that,

original: ci ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ci ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “Just as,” and so on.

original: chos kyi dbyings mngon sum du mdzad pa rnams la yang zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid mngon sum du mdzad pa rnams la yang ngo //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings mngon sum du mdzad pa rnams la yang zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid mngon sum du mdzad pa rnams la yang ngo //
translated: “ Even for those who have realized the dharmadhātu” means even for those who have realized emptiness.

original: yang sems tsam du smra ba rnams kyis phyi rol @177b gyi don med kyang shes pa yod pa nyid du bsgrub pa ni 'o na rab rib can gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //🔽de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yang sems tsam du smra ba rnams kyis phyi rol @177b gyi don med kyang shes pa yod pa nyid du bsgrub pa ni 'o na rab rib can gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: To respond to that, it is said, “Even those with diseased vision . . .”

original: de yang mi 'thad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de yang mi 'thad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: To teach the response to that, it is said, “That is also untenable . . .”

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni rab rib can gyis yod pa ma yin pa'i skra shad la sogs pa dmigs pa'i phyir yul med pa'i shes pa yod pa yin no zhes pa de yang ngo //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni rab rib can gyis yod pa ma yin pa'i skra shad la sogs pa dmigs pa'i phyir yul med pa'i shes pa yod pa yin no zhes pa de yang ngo //
translated: “That” refers to the statement, “Because those with diseased vision observe nonexistent hair and so on, consciousness can exist without objects.”

original: ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni skra shad la sogs pa med kyang shes pa yod na nyes pa ci yod snyam pa'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni skra shad la sogs pa med kyang shes pa yod na nyes pa ci yod snyam pa'o //
translated: “Why?” means, “If consciousness exists even though hair and so on do not exist, what is the problem?”

original: de la lan ni dbang po rab rib bcas pas zhas bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la lan ni dbang po rab rib bcas pas zhas bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The response to that is “Even those with diseased sense faculties . . .”

original: rab rib dang bcas pa'i mig gis rab rib kyi stobs kyis shes pa gang gis skra shad kyi rnam pa gang mthong ba de ni rab rib can gyi shes pa la ltos nas skra shad dang shes pa gnyis ka bden pa yin te /
analyzed: rab rib dang bcas pa'i mig gis rab rib kyi stobs kyis shes pa gang gis skra shad kyi rnam pa gang mthong ba de ni rab rib can gyi shes pa la ltos nas skra shad dang shes pa gnyis ka bden pa yin te /
translated: The form of the hair seen by the consciousness affected by the eye disease, by the power of the eye disease, is both true in relation to the consciousness affected by the eye disease, and the hair and the consciousness.

original: des bden pa nyid du rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des bden pa nyid du rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is realized to be true by that consciousness.

original: rab rib med par gsal bar mthong ba la ltos nas shes pa dang / skra shad la sogs pa gnyis ka yang bden pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rab rib med par gsal bar mthong ba la ltos nas shes pa dang / skra shad la sogs pa gnyis ka yang bden pa ma yin te /
translated: In relation to the clear seeing without the eye disease, both the consciousness and the hair, etc. are not true,

original: de la skra shad la sogs pa'i shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la skra shad la sogs pa'i shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no consciousness of hair, etc.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir rmi lam kho na ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir rmi lam kho na ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach that, it is said, “Just like a dream,” etc.

original: ci ltar rmi lam na gnyis ka bden zhing gnyid sad pa'i gnas skabs na gnyis ka yang ma skyes pa de bzhin du 'dir yang khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: ci ltar rmi lam na gnyis ka bden zhing gnyid sad pa'i gnas skabs na gnyis ka yang ma skyes pa de bzhin du 'dir yang khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Just as both are true in a dream, and both are not born in the state of waking, so it should be understood here.

original: de nyid rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that in detail, it is said,

original: rab rib can gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rab rib can gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: “One with eye disease” and so on.

original: rab rib can la ltos nas gnyis ka bden pa nyid kyi rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir yul med par shes pa nges par dka' ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rab rib can la ltos nas gnyis ka bden pa nyid kyi rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir yul med par shes pa nges par dka' ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
translated: In order to show that the reason for the truth of both [the object and consciousness] depends on one with eye disease, he says, “Because it is difficult to ascertain a consciousness without an object.”

original: yul med pa'i shes pa ma mthong bas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yul med pa'i shes pa ma mthong bas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because a consciousness without an object is not seen—this is what it means.

original: 'di'i don ni gdon mi za bar bya dgos te zhes bya ba ni yul med pa'i shes pa med par nges par 'dod dgos zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i don ni gdon mi za bar bya dgos te zhes bya ba ni yul med pa'i shes pa med par nges par 'dod dgos zhes pa'o //
translated: The meaning of this is that one must definitely accept that there is no consciousness without an object.
